hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּאָמַר וְלָא אַפְרֵישׁ? וְהָא נְדָבָה כְּתִיבָא, וּתְנַן: אֵי זֶהוּ נֶדֶר — הָאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה. וְאִי זוֹ הִיא נְדָבָה — הָאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זוֹ עוֹלָה.
human_translation: How can you say where one said but did not set aside Isn’t a gift-offering mentioned and we learned What is a vow- one who says: upon me a burnt-offering. what is a gift-offering? one who says, I undertake this a burnt-offering.
llm_translation: And who found you saying that he said and did not separate? And this is written as a freewill offering, and we learned: What is a vow? One who says, "Behold, upon me is a burnt offering." And what is a freewill offering? One who says, "Behold, this is a burnt offering."

hebrew_text: וּמָה בֵּין נֶדֶר לִנְדָבָה? נֶדֶר, מֵת אוֹ נִגְנַב — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ. נְדָבָה, מֵתָה אוֹ נִגְנְבָה — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָהּ.
human_translation: And what is the difference between a vow- and a gift-offering? vow- died or was stolen, is obligated restitution it. a gift-offering, died or was stolen, he is not obligated restitution it
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a vow and a freewill offering? A vow, if it dies or is stolen - one is obligated in its replacement. A freewill offering, if it dies or is stolen - one is not obligated in its replacement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר: הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵינִי חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: You find for example, where one said: upon me a burnt-offering on the condition that I will not be liable to replace it
llm_translation: Rava said: She finds, for example, that he said: "I hereby take upon myself a burnt offering, with the intention that I am not obligated in its aftermath."

hebrew_text: ״בְּפִיךְ״ — זוֹ צְדָקָה. אָמַר רָבָא: וּצְדָקָה — מִיחַיַּיב עֲלַהּ לְאַלְתַּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּהָא קָיְימִי עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: “With your mouth”; this charity. Rava said: charity, one is liable immediately What is the reason that poor people exist
llm_translation: "In your mouth" - this is charity. Rava said: And charity - one is obligated to do it immediately. What is the reason? Because the poor exist.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דִּבְעִנְיָינָא דְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת כְּתִיבָא, עַד דְּעָבְרִי עֲלַהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה רְגָלִים כְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הָתָם הוּא דִּתְלִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּרְגָלִים, אֲבָל הָכָא לָא — דְּהָא שְׁכִיחִי עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: obvious Lest you say since is written in the passage dealing with offerings, until three Festivals have passed, as offerings, teaches us there, the Merciful One made dependent upon the Festivals, However, here, not because poor people are found
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: since in the matter of sacrifices it is written, until three feet pass over like the sacrifices, it implies to us: there, the Merciful One suspended them on feet, but here not — for the poor are common here.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר עָלָיו רֶגֶל אֶחָד — עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Rava said: once one Festival has passed he violates a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Rava said: Once one has transgressed upon him one foot - he passes in the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס עַל וָלָד שְׁלָמִים שֶׁיִּקְרַב שְׁלָמִים. אָמַר רַבִּי פַּפְּיָיס: אֲנִי מֵעִיד שֶׁהָיְתָה לָנוּ פָּרָה שֶׁל זִבְחֵי שְׁלָמִים וַאֲכַלְנוּהָ בַּפֶּסַח, וְאָכַלְנוּ וְלָדָהּ שְׁלָמִים בֶּחָג.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Papeyyas testified about offspring of peace-offerings. that must be sacrificed as a peace-offering. Rabbi Papeyyas said: I testify that we had a cow that was sacrificed as a peace-offering, and we ate it on Passover [ beFesaḥ ], and we ate its offspring as a peace-offering on the Festival [ beḤag ],
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Pappayas testified concerning a case of a peace-offering brought as a peace-offering. Rabbi Pappayas said: I testify that we had a cow from the peace-offerings, and we ate it on Passover, and we ate the offspring of the peace-offerings on the festival.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּפֶסַח לָא אַקְרְבוּהּ, אֵימוֹר דִּמְחוּסָּר זְמַן הֲוָה. אֶלָּא וַלְדַּהּ בַּעֲצֶרֶת הֵיכִי מַשְׁהִי לֵהּ וְעָבְרִי עֲלֵיהּ בַּעֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: Granted, on Passover did not sacrifice say was lacking But how could they delay on Shavuot , they violate a positive mitzva
llm_translation: In peace offering on Passover not they shall bring it near, say that it was lacking time. Rather, and for it on Shavuot how is it left for it and a Hebrew shall pass over it with an action!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כְּגוֹן
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: For example,
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: "Such as..."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה חוֹלֶה בָּעֲצֶרֶת. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַאי ״וְאָכַלְנוּ וְלָדָהּ שְׁלָמִים בֶּחָג״ דְּקָתָנֵי — חַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת.
human_translation: where was sick on Shavuot , Rav Ashi said What is And we ate its offspring as a peace-offering on the Festival, teach? the festival of Shavuot .
llm_translation: The text reads: "He was ill on Shavuot. Rav Ashi said: What is the meaning of 'and we shall eat and offer peace-offerings on the festival' that is taught? — The festival of Shavuot."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּתָנֵי פֶּסַח, תָּנֵי עֲצֶרֶת.
human_translation: And the other anywhere that teaches Pesaḥ , he teaches Atzaret
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: wherever it teaches Pesach, it teaches Shavuot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבְרוּ עָלָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה רְגָלִים, בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״. מֵיתִיבִי: אֶחָד בְּכוֹר, וְאֶחָד כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבְרוּ עֲלֵיהֶם שָׁנָה בְּלֹא רְגָלִים, רְגָלִים בְּלֹא שָׁנָה — עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״.
human_translation: Rava said: Once three Festivals have passed, every day he transgresses You shall not delay. raises an objection both a firstborn and all consecrated animals, once a year has passed without Festivals three Festivals have passed without a year transgresses You shall not delay.
llm_translation: Rava said: Once three festivals have passed for him, every day he transgresses "Do not delay." The students asked: One is a firstborn, and one is all consecrated items, once a year has passed for them without festivals, festivals without a year - he transgresses "Do not delay."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאן דְּקָא מוֹתֵיב — שַׁפִּיר קָא מוֹתֵיב: מִכְּדֵי תַּנָּא אַלָּאוֵי קָא מְהַדַּר, לִיתְנֵי: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״.
human_translation: What is this objection? Rav Kahana said: He who raises an objection raises a valid objection, Since the tanna is looking for prohibitions let teach he transgresses You shall not delay, every single day.
llm_translation: And this, what is its benefit? Rav Kahana said: One who argues - he argues well; for as long as he does not retract, let him retract: every day that passes without delay.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ — תַּנָּא לְמִיקְבְּעֵיהּ בְּלָאו קָא מְהַדַּר, בְּלָאוֵי יְתֵירִי לָא קָא מְהַדַּר.
human_translation: And the other the tanna is to establish as subject to a prohibition, he is not looking for additional prohibitions.
llm_translation: And the other opinion — it was taught to establish it without a "Kah" it is repeated, without additional "Yatiri" it is not repeated.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: אֶחָד בְּכוֹר וְאֶחָד כׇּל הַקֳּדָשִׁים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבְרוּ עֲלֵיהֶם שָׁנָה בְּלֹא רְגָלִים, רְגָלִים בְּלֹא שָׁנָה — עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״. בִּשְׁלָמָא רְגָלִים בְּלֹא שָׁנָה מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, אֶלָּא שָׁנָה בְּלֹא רְגָלִים הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: the itself, both a firstborn and all consecrated animals, once a year has passed, Festivals not Festivals have passed, year not transgresses You shall not delay. Granted, Festivals without a year; you find it But a year without Festivals, what circumstances you find
llm_translation: Body: One firstborn and one all the holy things, since they passed over them a year without festivals, festivals without a year - transgresses "do not delay." But festivals without a year, how do you forget it, but a year without festivals how do you forget it?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ כְּסִדְרָן, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ כְּסִדְרָן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: This well according to the one who is of in their order. You find But according to the one who is not in their order, what circumstances you find
llm_translation: He left it for one who has it in order, she forgets it. But for one who does not have it in order, how does she forget it?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּשָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת. דְּתַנְיָא: ״שָׁנָה תְּמִימָה״, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: מוֹנֶה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יוֹם כְּמִנְיָן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה,
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi you find in a leap year, as it is taught a full year” Rabbi says: One counts 365 days like the number of the days in a solar
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, for Rabbi, she found in her a leap year. As it was taught: "a complete year," Rabbi says: count three hundred and sixty-five days according to the count of the days of the sun.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹנֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם, וְאִם נִתְעַבְּרָה שָׁנָה — נִתְעַבְּרָה לוֹ. מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְרַבִּי דְּאַקְדְּשַׁהּ בָּתַר חַג הַמַּצּוֹת, דְּכִי מְטָא שִׁילְהֵי אֲדָר בָּתְרָאָה — שָׁנָה מַלְיָא, רְגָלִים לָא מְלוּ. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: One counts twelve months from day to day, and if it is a leap year the leap for You find according to Rabbi where one consecrated after the festival of Passover, so that once he reaches the end of the second Adar the year is completed, the Festivals are not completed, But according to the Sages, what circumstances you find
llm_translation: The sages say: one counts twelve months from day to day, and if a year is intercalated - it is intercalated for him. It is found for him according to Rabbi that he betrothed her after the Festival of Matzot, for when the second Adar arrives - the year is complete, and the festivals are not yet fulfilled. But according to the Rabbis, how is it found for him?

hebrew_text: כִּדְתָנֵי רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: עֲצֶרֶת פְּעָמִים חֲמִשָּׁה, פְּעָמִים שִׁשָּׁה, פְּעָמִים שִׁבְעָה. הָא כֵּיצַד? שְׁנֵיהֶן מְלֵאִין — חֲמִשָּׁה, שְׁנֵיהֶן חֲסֵרִין — שִׁבְעָה, אֶחָד מָלֵא וְאֶחָד חָסֵר — שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: As Rav Shemaya taught Shavuot sometimes the fifth sometimes the sixth and sometimes the seventh. How so? both are full fifth both are short, seventh one is full and the other is short, the sixth
llm_translation: As taught by Rav Shemaya: An assembly of five times, six times, seven times. How so? When both are full - five, when both are lacking - seven, when one is full and one is lacking - six.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמַעְיָה — אֲחֵרִים הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין בֵּין עֲצֶרֶת לַעֲצֶרֶת, אֵין בֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים בִּלְבַד. וְאִם הָיְתָה שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And who is the tanna disagrees with Rav Shemaya It is Aḥerim , as it is taught Aḥerim say: The difference between Shavuot Shavuot between Rosh HaShana Rosh HaShana is only four days And if it were a leap year, five
llm_translation: The Tanna who disputes with Rabbi Shemaiah - it is others. As it was taught: Others say: There is no difference between one Festival and another, there is no difference between one New Year and another, except for only four days. And if the year is a leap year - five.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: יוֹרֵשׁ, מַהוּ בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״? ״כִּי תִדּוֹר נֶדֶר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לָא נְדַר, אוֹ דִלְמָא: ״וּבָאתָ שָּׁמָּה וַהֲבֵאתֶם שָׁמָּה״, וְהָא מִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asks: an heir, what is with regard to You shall not delay? the Merciful One states “When you shall vow a vow and this did not make a vow? Or perhaps “And there you shall come; and there you shall bring and this is obligated
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: Inheritance, what is the law regarding "do not delay"? "When a man vows a vow" the Merciful One said, but this is not a vow, or perhaps "and you shall come there and bring them there," and this would obligate.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא — ״מֵעִמָּךְ״, פְּרָט לְיוֹרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught from you” To the exclusion of an heir.
llm_translation: Come and hear: as taught by Rabbi Chiya - "from you", excluding an heir.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״מֵעִמָּךְ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, זֶה לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה! קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״עִמָּךְ״, וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ ״מֵעִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: But this “from you” is necessary gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and the corner He read into “You [ imakh ],” and he read into “From you [ me’imakh ],”
llm_translation: This "from you" requires it, this is gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corner of the field! It reads in it "with you," and it reads in it "from you."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִשָּׁה, מַה הִיא בְּ״בַל תְּאַחֵר״? מִי אָמְרִינַן: הָא לָא מִיחַיְּיבָא בִּרְאִיָּה, אוֹ דִלְמָא הָא אִיתַהּ בְּשִׂמְחָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asks a woman what is with regard to You shall not delay? Do we say she is not obligated to appear Or perhaps, she is in rejoicing
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: A woman, what is "Bal Te'acher"? Do we say: this is not obligated in seeing, or perhaps she is in joy?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָא אִיתַהּ בְּשִׂמְחָה. וּמִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִשָּׁה — בַּעֲלָהּ מְשַׂמְּחָהּ! לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Derive this from she is in rejoicing And did Abaye say this, But didn’t Abaye say: a woman, her husband must make her joyful stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Zeira.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And go out to him because she is with joy. And who said Abaye thus? And Abaye said: A woman - her husband makes her happy! According to the words of Rabbi Zeira is saying.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּכוֹר, מֵאֵימָתַי מוֹנִין לוֹ שָׁנָה? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד, רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁנִּרְאָה לְהַרְצָאָה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a firstborn from when does one count a year Abaye said: from the time it is born. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: from the time it is fit for appeasement,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a dilemma: regarding a firstborn, from when do we count a year for him? Abbaye said: from the moment he is born, Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: from the moment he is fit for grazing.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּתָם,
human_translation: do not disagree. This about an unblemished
llm_translation: And he did not argue: This is in the case of a tam,

hebrew_text: הָא בְּבַעַל מוּם.
human_translation: That about a blemished
llm_translation: This is in Baal Mum.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם מִי מָצֵי אָכֵיל לֵיהּ? דְּקִים לֵיהּ בֵּיהּ שֶׁכָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: Can an animal with a blemish be eaten where one is certain that its months have been completed,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Who can eat from a blemished animal? One who has it in his possession for thirty days.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לָחֳדָשִׁים, וּלְעִיבּוּרִין, וְלִתְרוּמַת שְׁקָלִים. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לִשְׂכִירוּת בָּתִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught On the first of Nisan is the New Year for the months and for leap years, and for collection of shekels and some say also for the renting of houses.
llm_translation: The sages taught: On the first of Nisan is the New Year for months, for leap years, and for the tithe of shekels. And some say: Also for the renting of houses.

hebrew_text: לָחֳדָשִׁים מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם רֹאשׁ חֳדָשִׁים רִאשׁוֹן הוּא לָכֶם לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה. דַּבְּרוּ אֶל כׇּל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה וְיִקְחוּ לָהֶם אִישׁ שֶׂה לְבֵית אָבוֹת שֶׂה לַבָּיִת. וְהָיָה לָכֶם לְמִשְׁמֶרֶת עַד אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה וְשָׁחֲטוּ אוֹתוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. וּכְתִיב: ״שָׁמוֹר אֶת חֹדֶשׁ הָאָבִיב״, אֵיזֶהוּ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אָבִיב, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר — זֶה נִיסָן, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: From where do we for months? As it is written: “This month shall be to you the beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year to you. Speak to all the congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to the house of their fathers, a lamb for a household…And you shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month: shall slaughter it And it is written: “Observe the month of ripening Which is the month in which there is a ripening You must say this is Nisan, and it is called the first
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lachodashim menalan — dikhtiv: 'HaChodesh hazeh lakhem rosh chodashim rishon hu lakhem lechodshei hashanah. Dabru el kol adat Yisrael lemor be'asor lachodesh hazeh veyikchu lahem ish seh lebeit avot seh labayit. Vehayah lakhem le'mishmeret ad arba'ah asar yom lachodesh hazeh veshachatuhu v'go.' Uchtiv: 'Shamor et chodesh ha'aviv,' eizehu chodesh sheyesh bo aviv, hevei omer — zeh Nisan, ve'karei leih rishon." English translation: "Regarding the new moons — as it is written: 'This month shall be for you the beginning of months; it shall be the first month of the year for you. Speak to the entire congregation of Israel, saying: On the tenth of this month, each man shall take for himself a lamb, according to their fathers' houses, a lamb for a household. And it shall be for you a watch until the fourteenth day of this month, and they shall slaughter it, etc.' And it is written: 'Observe the month of the Aviv,' which month has Aviv in it? One would say — this is Nisan, and it is called the first."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִיָּיר? בָּעֵינָא אָבִיב, וְלֵיכָּא. וְאֵימָא אֲדָר? בָּעֵינָא רוֹב אָבִיב, וְלֵיכָּא. מִידֵּי ״רוֹב אָבִיב״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: But say Iyyar. ripening is required, and there is no But say Adar, most of the ripening is required, and this is not is most of the ripening written
llm_translation: And why not say "Iyyar"? I require the spring, and it is not so. And why not say "Adar"? I require the majority of the spring, and it is not so. From where is it written "majority of the spring"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, מֵהָכָא: ״אַךְ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי בְּאׇסְפְּכֶם אֶת תְּבוּאַת הָאָרֶץ״, אֵיזֶהוּ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֲסִיפָה, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר — זֶה תִּשְׁרִי, וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״שְׁבִיעִי״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: from here. “Also on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the fruit of the land” Which is the month in which there is a gathering You must say this is Tishrei, and it is called the seventh
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said from here: "But on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you gather in the produce of the land," which month has a gathering in it? Say - this is Tishrei, and it is called "seventh."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מְרַחְשְׁוָן, וּמַאי ״שְׁבִיעִי״ — שְׁבִיעִי לְאִיָּיר? בָּעֵינָא אָסִיף, וְלֵיכָּא. וְאֵימָא אֱלוּל, וּמַאי ״שְׁבִיעִי״ — שְׁבִיעִי לַאֲדָר? בָּעֵינָא רוֹב אָסִיף, וְלֵיכָּא. מִידֵּי ״רוֹב אָסִיף״ כְּתִיב?
human_translation: But say Marḥeshvan, and what is seventh? seventh from Iyyar. gathering is required, and there is no But say Elul, and what is seventh? seventh from Adar. most of the gathering is required, and this is not is most of the gathering written
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And why not Merachshvan, and what is "seventh" - seventh for Iyyar? I want to add, and it is not. And why not Elul, and what is "seventh" - seventh for Adar? I want to add more, and it is not. Is it written "more to add"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא, דָּבָר זֶה מִתּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לֹא לָמַדְנוּ, מִדִּבְרֵי קַבָּלָה לָמַדְנוּ: ״בְּיוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה לְעַשְׁתֵּי עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ הוּא חֹדֶשׁ שְׁבָט״. רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וַתִּלָּקַח אֶסְתֵּר אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ אֶל בֵּית מַלְכוּתוֹ בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי הוּא חֹדֶשׁ טֵבֵת״.
human_translation: Rather, Ravina said: This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses, our teacher; we learned it from the texts of the tradition, “On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month of Shevat” Rabba bar Ulla said: from here, “So Esther was taken to the king Ahasuerus into his royal house in the tenth month, which is the month of Tevet”
llm_translation: Rather, Ravina said, this matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher, but we learned it from the words of tradition: "On the twenty-fourth day of the twelfth month, which is the month of Shevat." Rabbah bar Ulla said from here: "And Esther was taken to King Ahasuerus into his royal palace in the tenth month, which is the month of Tevet."

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״בְּאַרְבָּעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִי בְּכִסְלֵו״. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וַיִּקָּרְאוּ סוֹפְרֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ בָּעֵת הַהִיא בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁלִישִׁי הוּא חֹדֶשׁ סִיוָן״. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״הִפִּיל פּוּר הוּא הַגּוֹרָל לִפְנֵי הָמָן מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם וּמֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר הוּא חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, מֵהָכָא: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן הוּא חֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: from here: “On the fourth day of the ninth month, in Kislev” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: from here, “And the scribes of the king were called at that time in the third month, that is the month of Sivan” Rav Ashi said: from here: “He cast pur , that is, the lot, before Haman from day to day, and from month to month, to the twelfth month, that is, the month of Adar” And if you wish, say from here: “In the first month, that is, the month of Nisan”
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said from here: "In the fourth month, in the ninth month, in Kislev." Rav Acha bar Yaakov said from here: "And the king's scribes were called at that time, in the third month, which is the month of Sivan." Rav Ashe said from here: "Pur, that is the lot, was cast before Haman from day to day and from month to month, twelve, it is the month of Adar." And if you wish, say from here: "In the first month, it is the month of Nisan."

hebrew_text: וְכוּלְּהוּ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמְרִי מֵהַאי? דִּלְמָא מַאי ״רִאשׁוֹן״ — רִאשׁוֹן לְמִילְּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And all of what is the reason they did not say from here, perhaps What is first? the first to its matter,
llm_translation: And all of them, what is the reason they did not say from this? Perhaps what is "first" - first in its matters.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן — בְּשָׁנִים קָמַיְירֵי, בָּחֳדָשִׁים לָא קָמַיְירֵי.
human_translation: And the tanna our He is dealing with years, he is not dealing with months.
llm_translation: And it was taught in our Mishnah - in leap years, they do not intercalate in the months.

hebrew_text: וּלְעִיבּוּרִין לְעִיבּוּרִין מִנִּיסָן מָנִינַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין מְעַבְּרִין הַשָּׁנָה לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְאִם עִיבְּרוּהָ — אֵינָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת. אֲבָל מִפְּנֵי הַדְּחָק — מְעַבְּרִין אוֹתָהּ אַחַר רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִיָּד. וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵּן, אֵין מְעַבְּרִין אֶלָּא אֲדָר.
human_translation: And for leap years. we count leap years from Nisan? But isn’t it taught may not declare a leap year before Rosh HaShana, and if declare it is not a leap year. But due to pressing circumstances, it may be declared immediately after Rosh HaShana. Even so, added leap year can be only Adar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Eibburin, for Eibburin from Nisan, when do we establish? And it was taught: One does not intercalate the year before Rosh Hashanah, and if they intercalated it — it is not intercalated. But due to urgency — they intercalate it after Rosh Hashanah immediately. Nevertheless, one only intercalates in Adar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי עִיבּוּרִין — הַפְסָקַת עִיבּוּרִין. דִּתְנַן: הֵן הֵעִידוּ שֶׁמְּעַבְּרִין הַשָּׁנָה כׇּל אֲדָר. שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים — עַד הַפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What is leap years? the end of the leap year. as we learned They, testified that may declare a leap year all Adar, as there were who said: until Purim,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What are "Ibuvrin" - the cessation of Ibuvrin. As we learned in a Mishnah: Indeed, they testified that they would pass the year every Adar. For they used to say - until Purim.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עַד הַפּוּרִים? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: שׁוֹאֲלִין בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח קוֹדֶם לַפֶּסַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, אָתֵי לְזַלְזוֹלֵי בְּחָמֵץ.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the one who said until Purim? since the Master said: One asks the halakhot of Passover thirty days before Passover. will come to demean leavened bread
llm_translation: What is the reason for one who says until Purim? Since the Master said: One may inquire about the laws of Passover thirty days before Passover, it comes to belittle the leaven.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ — מִידָּע יְדִיעַ דְּשַׁתָּא מְעַבַּרְתָּא בְּחוּשְׁבָּנָא תַּלְיָא מִלְּתָא, וְסָבְרִי: חוּשְׁבָּנָא הוּא דְּלָא סְלֵיק לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן עַד הָאִידָּנָא.
human_translation: And the other know that a leap year is dependent on the calculation, and they assume that the Sages did not complete the calculation until now,
llm_translation: And the other one — from the knowledge of the knowledge that a woman passes through a calculation hanging from a matter, and they hold: it is the calculation that should not be brought before the Rabbis until now.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? בְּהַתְחָלָה קָמַיְירֵי, בְּהַפְסָקָה לָא קָמַיְירֵי.
human_translation: And the tanna our He is dealing with that begin he is not dealing with that end
llm_translation: Our Talmudic text: "And our Mishnaic sages taught? At the beginning they would arise, at the conclusion they would not arise."

hebrew_text: וְלִתְרוּמַת שְׁקָלִים. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״זֹאת עוֹלַת חֹדֶשׁ בְּחׇדְשׁוֹ לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״ — אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: חַדֵּשׁ וְהָבֵא קׇרְבָּן מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה. וְגָמְרִי ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִנִּיסָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״רִאשׁוֹן הוּא לָכֶם לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״.
human_translation: And for collection of shekels From where do we Rabbi Yoshiya said the verse states: “This is the burnt-offering of each month in its month throughout the months [ leḥodshei ] of the year” The Torah is saying Renew [ ḥaddesh ] and bring an offering from the new collection And it is derived “year” “year” from Nisan, as it is written “It shall be the first month of the year to you”
llm_translation: Regarding the offering of shekels. From where do we derive this? Rabbi Yoshiyah said, the verse states: "This is the burnt offering of the new moon in its month for the months of the year" - the Torah said: the new moon and the following month bring a new offering. And we complete the word "year" "year" from Nisan, as it is written: "It is the first for you of the months of the year."

hebrew_text: וְלִגְמוֹר ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִתִּשְׁרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה״! דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים, וְאֵין דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But let us learn “year” “year” from Tishrei, as it is written “From the beginning of the year” One derives “year” with which “months” from “year” with which months And one does not derive “year” with which months from “year” with which “months”
llm_translation: To complete "year" "year" from Tishrei, as it is written: "from the beginning of the year"! We evaluate a year that has new months from a year that has new months, and we do not evaluate a year that has new months from a year that does not have new months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר הַבָּאִין בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן — מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ. וְאִם הֵבִיא מִן הַיָּשָׁן — יָצָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁחִיסֵּר מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: communal offerings that are brought on the first of Nisan, a mitzva to bring from the new if one brought from the old he has fulfilled but he lacks the mitzva
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Public sacrifices that come on the first of Nisan - it is a commandment to bring from the new. And if one brought from the old - he fulfilled the obligation, except that he lacked fulfilling the commandment.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר הַבָּאִין בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן — מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ, וְאִם הֵבִיא מִן הַיָּשָׁן — יָצָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁחִיסֵּר מִצְוָה. וְיָחִיד שֶׁהִתְנַדֵּב מִשֶּׁלּוֹ — כְּשֵׁרִין, בִּלְבַד שֶׁיִּמְסְרֵם לַצִּבּוּר.
human_translation: This is also taught communal offerings that are brought on the first of Nisan, a mitzva to bring from the new if one brought from the old he has fulfilled but he lacks the mitzva If individual volunteered from his own they are fit provided that he transfers them over to the community.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Nami said: Public offerings that come on the first of Nisan — it is a commandment to bring from the new produce, and if one brought from the old produce — he has fulfilled his obligation, but he has diminished the commandment. And an individual who volunteered offerings from his own produce — they are valid, as long as he hands them over to the public.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא
human_translation: obvious Lest you say we should be concerned perhaps
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: "lest one might think"

hebrew_text: לֹא יִמְסְרֵם לַצִּבּוּר יָפֶה יָפֶה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: he will not transfer them over to the public without reservation, teaches us
llm_translation: "They should not deliver them to the public beautifully, beautifully, as it is heard for us."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? כֵּיוָן דְּקָתָנֵי: אִם הֵבִיא יָצָא — לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the tanna our Since it is taught: If one brought he has fulfilled he could not state a definite
llm_translation: And our Mishnaic teaching? Since it was taught: If he brought it out - it does not interrupt for him.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לִשְׂכִירוּת בָּתִּים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ לְשָׁנָה — מוֹנֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם. וְאִם אָמַר ״לְשָׁנָה זוֹ״, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא עָמַד אֶלָּא בְּאֶחָד בַּאֲדָר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ יוֹם אֶחָד בְּנִיסָן — עָלְתָה לוֹ שָׁנָה.
human_translation: And some say also for renting of houses. The Sages taught If one rents out a house to another for a year, he counts twelve months from day to day. But if he said for this year, even if was made only on the first of Adar, once the first of Nisan arrived it is counted as a year,
llm_translation: And some say: even for renting houses. The Rabbis taught: One who rents a house to his fellow for a year - counts twelve months from day to day. And if he said "this year", even if he only stood until the first of Adar, once one day of Nissan arrives - the year is considered complete for him.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה — שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּלָא טָרַח אִינִישׁ לְמֵיגַר בֵּיתָא לִבְצִיר מִתְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: Even according to the one who said one day in a year is considered a year, it is different here, as a person does not take the trouble to rent a house for less than thirty days.
llm_translation: Even according to the one who says one day in the year is considered a year - it is different here, for a person does not exert himself to sweep the house for thirty days.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא תִּשְׁרִי? סְתָם כִּי אָגַר אִינִישׁ בֵּיתָא — לְכוּלְּהוּ יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים אָגַר.
human_translation: But say Tishrei A person who rents a house without specification rent for all of the rainy season,
llm_translation: And why not allow the use of it? Because generally, when a person is in the house - for all of them, the days of rain are considered a wage.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּבָרַיְיתָא, וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? בְּנִיסָן נָמֵי מִישְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי קִיטְרֵי.
human_translation: And the first tanna of the baraita and the tanna our even in Nisan it is common covered with clouds
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna of the Braitah, and was taught in our Tanna? In Nisan, the markets of perfumes are common.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בֶּאֱלוּל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה. מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בְּאֶחָד בֶּאֱלוּל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: On the first of Elul is the New Year for animal tithes. Who is It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught Rabbi Meir says: On the first of Elul is the New Year for animal tithes.
llm_translation: On the first of Elul is the New Year for tithing animals. The Mishnah states: Rabbi Meir is of the opinion. As it was taught: Rabbi Meir says, "On the first of Elul is the New Year for tithing animals."

hebrew_text: וְלָרְגָלִים. מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי. רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּמְצִיעֲתָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: And the Festivals, who is It is Rabbi Shimon, Say the last clause Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: on the first of Tishrei. the first clause and the last clause Rabbi Shimon, while the middle clause Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: Regarding the festivals. From where? — Rabbi Shimon, it is. Say the latter clause, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: On the first of Tishrei. The first clause and the latter clause are both the opinions of Rabbi Shimon, and the conclusion is according to Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי הִיא, וְנָסֵיב לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּתַנָּאֵי. בִּרְגָלִים סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּבְמַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi and he takes according to tanna’im . With regard to the Festivals, he holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, while with regard to animal tithes he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi, and he married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim. Regarding pilgrimage festivals, he holds like Rabbi Shimon, and regarding tithing animals, he holds like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַרְבָּעָה? חֲמִשָּׁה הָווּ! אָמַר רָבָא: אַרְבָּעָה לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל; לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַרְבָּעָה — דַּל רְגָלִים, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַרְבָּעָה — דַּל מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: If so, four there are five Rava said: There are four according to each opinion: four according to Rabbi Meir, removes Festivals, According to Rabbi Shimon’s four removes animal tithes,
llm_translation: So is it four? They were five! Rava said: Four according to everyone; according to Rabbi Meir they are four - a poor person's feet, according to Rabbi Shimon they are four - a poor person's tithe on an animal.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: אַרְבָּעָה חֳדָשִׁים וּבָהֶן כַּמָּה רָאשֵׁי שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said four months in which there are several New Years,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Four months, and in them how many heads of years.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר בְּנִיסָן — רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לָעוֹמֶר. שִׁשָּׁה בְּסִיוָן — רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לִשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם. לְרָבָא לִיתְנֵי שִׁשָּׁה, לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לִיתְנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה?
human_translation: raises an objection The sixteenth of Nisan is the New Year for the omer The sixth of Sivan is the New Year for the two loaves, according to Rava, let teach six according to Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak let it teach five
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: A question was raised: If the sixteenth of Nisan falls on Shabbat, it is the New Year for counting the Omer. If the sixth of Sivan falls on Shabbat, it is the New Year for the Two Loaves. According to Rava, the Mishna teaches six; according to Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, does it teach five?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב — מִידֵּי דְּחָיֵיל מֵאוּרְתָּא. מִידֵּי דְּלָא חָיֵיל מֵאוּרְתָּא — לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: When counts those that begin in the evening; those that do not begin in the evening he does not count.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: When it is considered - from the side of the army of light. When it is not considered from the side of the army of light - it is not considered.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי רְגָלִים, דְּלָא חָיְילִי מֵאוּרְתָּא, וְקָחָשֵׁיב! כֵּיוָן שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מֵעִיקָּרָא, מִיחַיַּיב וְקָאֵי.
human_translation: But there is Festivals, which does not begin in the evening, and counts Since he had to bring he stands liable from the beginning
llm_translation: And behold, the legs, that do not have strength from the thigh, are considered! Once it is necessary to support from the beginning, he is liable and stands.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי יוֹבְלוֹת, דְּלָא חָיְילִי מֵאוּרְתָּא, וְקָחָשֵׁיב! רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה חָיֵיל יוֹבֵל.
human_translation: But there is the Jubilee, which does not begin in the evening and counts is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, who said the Jubilee Year begins on Rosh HaShana,
llm_translation: Behold the Jubilee years, which do not have a source, yet are considered significant! Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, said: "From the beginning of the year, the Jubilee year is significant."

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: כִּי קָא חָשֵׁיב — מִידֵּי דְּלָא תְּלֵי בְּמַעֲשֶׂה, מִידֵּי דִּתְלֵי בְּמַעֲשֶׂה — לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said When counts those that do not depend upon an action; those that depend upon an action, he does not count.
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: When it is considered - from the fact that it does not depend on action, it is not considered; from the fact that it does depend on action - it is not considered.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי רְגָלִים, מִידֵּי דִּתְלֵי בְּמַעֲשֶׂה, וְקָא חָשֵׁיב! ״בַּל תְּאַחֵר״ מִמֵּילָא חָיֵיל.
human_translation: But there is the Festivals, which depends upon an action, and counts You shall not delay, begins on its own
llm_translation: And behold, feet, from the hands of those who hang in the work, and it is considered! "Do not delay" is automatically a soldier.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי יוֹבְלוֹת! רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה הִיא.
human_translation: But the Jubilee Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka,
llm_translation: Behold the Jubilee years! Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, it is.

hebrew_text: וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אַרְבַּע רָאשֵׁי הַשָּׁנִים הֵם שֶׁהֵן בְּאַרְבַּע רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: there are four New Years that fall on four New Moons.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Four heads of the years are they, which are in four heads of months.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט — כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל, בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט — מַחְלוֹקֶת בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: the first of Shevat is Beit Shammai, this is what is saying: three all agree and the first of Shevat is a dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: On the first of Shevat - like Beit Shammai? Thus he said: Three according to everyone's opinion, on the first of Shevat - a dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן וַעֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר יִתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אֵימָתַי לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן — בִּזְמַן שֶׁעֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר. וְאֵימָתַי עֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר — בַּאֲדָר, מִתְעַבְּרוֹת בַּאֲדָר וְיוֹלְדוֹת בְּאָב, רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלָּהֶן אֱלוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: on the first of Tishrei. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them, expounded the same verse As it is stated “The flocks are clothed in the meadows, and the valleys are wrapped in grain; they shout for joy, they also sing” Rabbi Meir holds: When are the flocks clothed in the meadows, at the time when the valleys are wrapped in grain, And when are the valleys wrapped in grain? in Adar. conceive in Adar and give birth in Av, their New Year Elul,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say on the first of Tishrei. Rabbi Yochanan said: And both of them expounded one verse, as it is said: "The flocks will be clothed with lambs, and the valleys will be covered with grain; they will shout for joy, they will even sing." Rabbi Meir holds: When will the flocks be clothed with lambs? - When the valleys are covered with grain. And when will the valleys be covered with grain? - In Adar, they become pregnant in Adar and give birth in Av, their New Year is Elul.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵימָתַי ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״יִּתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ״, אֵימָתַי שִׁבֳּלִים אוֹמְרוֹת שִׁירָה — בְּנִיסָן, מִתְעַבְּרוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְיוֹלְדוֹת בֶּאֱלוּל, רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלָּהֶן תִּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: When are the flocks clothed in the meadows? At the time that “shout for joy, and also sing.” When do the stalks break out in song, in Nisan. conceive in Nisan and give birth in Elul, their New Year on Tishrei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: When do "the sheep put on wool" - when "they are bloated, they will also sing." When do the stalks say a song - in Nissan, they grow in Nissan and give birth in Elul, their New Year is in Tishrei.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״יִתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ״! הָהוּא בְּאַפְלָתָא, דְּהָוְיָין בְּנִיסָן. וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וַעֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר״! הָהוּא בְּחָרַפְיָיתָא, דְּאָתְיָין מֵאֲדָר.
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “They shout for joy, they also sing”? That late in Nisan. the other as well, isn’t it written: “And the valleys wrapped in grain,” That early which were conceived Adar.
llm_translation: The other one says, is it not written: "They shall raise a shout and sing aloud"! That was in the darkness, when it was in Nisan. And the other one says, is it not written: "And deeps shall enwrap them"! That was in the disgrace, when they come from Adar.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״עֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר״, וְאִיכָּא נָמֵי ״יִתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אִיפְּכָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״יִּתְרוֹעֲעוּ אַף יָשִׁירוּ״, וְאִיכָּא נָמֵי דַּ״עֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר״.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir, as it is written: “The flocks are clothed in the meadows” at the time when “the valleys are wrapped in grain.” But there are also “they shout for joy, they also sing.” But according to Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, it should have been in the reverse “The flocks are clothed in the meadows” at the time when “they shout for joy, they also sing,” but there are also when “the valleys are wrapped in grain.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In regards to Rabbi Meir, as it is written: "The sheep shall be clothed with lambs" — when "valleys shall be covered with grain," and there are those who say, "they shall shout, they shall also sing." Rather, in regards to Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon, the matter should be reversed for him: "The sheep shall be clothed with lambs" — when "they shall shout, they shall also sing," and there are those who say, "valleys shall be covered with grain."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁ״עֲמָקִים יַעַטְפוּ בָר״ בַּאֲדָר, וְהָכָא בְּהַאי קְרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר״ — בִּשְׁנֵי מַעַשְׂרוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר: אֶחָד מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד מַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Everyone that “the flocks are clothed in the meadows,” at the time when “the valleys are wrapped in grain,” in Adar. But here they disagree about the verse: “You shall tithe a tithe The verse speaks about two tithes, one the animal tithe and the other the grain tithe.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The entire world "clothed themselves with the wool of sheep" - when "valleys shall be covered with grain" in Adar, and here in this verse it divides: "Tithe you shall tithe" - regarding two tithes the Scripture speaks: one tithe of animals and one tithe of grain.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: מַקִּישׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן — סָמוּךְ לִגְמָרוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ, אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה — סָמוּךְ לִגְמָרוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבְרִי: מַקִּישׁ מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר דָּגָן רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלּוֹ תִּשְׁרִי — אַף מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלּוֹ תִּשְׁרִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds juxtaposes the animal tithe to the grain tithe. Just as the grain tithe is set aside close to completion, so too, the animal tithe is set aside close to its completion, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold: juxtaposes the animal tithe to the grain tithe. Just as the grain tithe, its New Year is in Tishrei, so too, the animal tithe, its New Year is in Tishrei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: He compares tithe of an animal to tithe of grain: Just as tithe of grain is dependent on its completion, so too tithe of an animal is dependent on its completion. And Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon hold: They compare tithe of an animal to tithe of grain: Just as its tithe of grain is at the beginning of the year, so too tithe of an animal is at the beginning of the year.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַשָּׁנִים. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לִשְׁטָרוֹת. דִּתְנַן: שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב הַמּוּקְדָּמִין — פְּסוּלִין, וְהַמְאוּחָרִין — כְּשֵׁירִין.
human_translation: On the first of Tishrei is the New Year for years. With regard to which halakha Rav Pappa said: for documents, as we learned Antedated promissory notes, are invalid. But postdated promissory notes, are valid.
llm_translation: On the first of Tishrei, Rosh Hashanah for years. For what halakha? Rav Papa said: For documents. As we learned: Pre-dated promissory notes are invalid, and post-dated ones are valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַמְּלָכִים, וְאָמְרִינַן: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא — וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא לִשְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn On the first of Nisan is the New Year for kings; and we say For what halakha And Rav Ḥisda said: for documents.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: On the first of Nisan is the New Year for kings, and we say: For what Halakha? - And Rav Ḥisda said to the scribes.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לְמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּאן לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: not difficult; here, the Jewish kings, there, the kings of the nations of the world,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here for the kings of Israel, here for the kings of the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל לְמַלְכֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מִתִּשְׁרִי מָנִינַן — רַב חִסְדָּא מַתְנִיתִין אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן?!
human_translation: But that which Rav Ḥisda said they taught only with regard to the Jewish kings, but as for the kings of the nations of the world we count from Tishrei, Rav Ḥisda come to teach us the mishna
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Ḥisdah said: They only taught this regarding the kings of Israel, but for the kings of the nations of the world, from where do we derive it? Rav Ḥisdah comes to teach us from the Mishnah?!

hebrew_text: לָא, רַב חִסְדָּא קְרָאֵי אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן.
human_translation: No, Rav Ḥisda came to teach us verses,
llm_translation: No, Rav Ḥisda would come to hear.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב חִסְדָּא כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא מַתְנֵי לַהּ. דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: לַתְּקוּפָה, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר בְּתִשְׁרִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav Ḥisda teaches as Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira said: with regard to cycles And this is Rabbi Eliezer, who said: The world was created in Tishrei,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav Ḥisda is like Rabbi Zeira teaches it. For Rabbi Zeira said: "Regarding the equinox," and Rabbi Eliezer is the one who said, "In Tishrei the world was created."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לַדִּין, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה וְעַד אַחֲרִית שָׁנָה״, מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה נִידּוֹן מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹפָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: with regard to judgment, as it is written: from the beginning of the year until the end of the year” from the beginning of the year judgment is passed as to what will happen at the end
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: In terms of judgment, as it is written: "From the beginning of the year until the end of the year," at the beginning of the year, one is judged what will be at its end.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּתִשְׁרִי הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר בַּכֵּסֶה לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ״, אֵיזֶהוּ חַג
human_translation: From where that Tishrei? As it is written: “Blow a shofar at the New Moon, at the covered time for our Festival day” Which is the Festival day
llm_translation: From what is it derived that it is permissible? As it is written: "Blow the shofar at the new moon, at the covering for our feast day." Which is the feast day.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַחֹדֶשׁ מִתְכַּסֶּה בּוֹ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: on which the moon is covered, You must say this is Rosh HaShana, And it is written “For this is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob”
llm_translation: The new moon is covered in it - say this is Rosh Hashanah. And it is written: "For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַעְלָה נִכְנָסִין לַדִּין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קִידְּשׁוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל מַטָּה אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: the Sages taught “For this is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob”; this teaches that the heavenly court does not assemble for judgment until the earthly court has sanctified the month,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment for the God of Jacob" — this teaches that the heavenly court does not enter into judgment unless the earthly court below sanctifies the new moon.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, לְאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל נִכְנָסִין תְּחִילָּה לַדִּין.
human_translation: is taught another “For this is a statute for Israel.” I have only for the Jewish people; from where for the nations of the world? the verse states: “A judgment for the God of Jacob,” If so, what the verse states: “A statute for Israel”? This teaches that the Jewish people enter for judgment first.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "For it is a statute for Israel" - I have only learned this regarding Israel, how do we know this applies to the nations of the world? The Torah teaches us, saying: "A judgment for the God of Jacob." If so, what is the purpose of the Torah teaching us: "For it is a statute for Israel"? It teaches that Israel are brought first to judgment.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מֶלֶךְ וְצִיבּוּר — מֶלֶךְ נִכְנָס תְּחִילָּה לַדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשְׁפַּט עַבְדּוֹ וּמִשְׁפַּט עַמּוֹ״.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: a king and a community king is brought in for judgment first, as it is stated: the judgment of His servant and the judgment of His people
llm_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said: A king and the community - the king enters first for judgment, as it is stated: "The judgment of his servant and the judgment of his people."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵיקַם מַלְכָּא אַבָּרַאי, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיפּוֹשׁ חֲרוֹן אַף.
human_translation: What is the reason If you wish, say not proper conduct for the king to stand outside And if you wish, say before anger intensifies
llm_translation: What is the reason? If you wish, say: "It is not the way of the land to establish kings through the power of creatures," and if you wish, say: "Before one provokes anger, even."

hebrew_text: וְלַשְּׁמִיטִּין. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַשָּׁנָה הַשְּׁבִיעִית שַׁבַּת שַׁבָּתוֹן יִהְיֶה לָאָרֶץ״, וְגָמַר ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִתִּשְׁרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה״.
human_translation: for Sabbatical Years. From where do we As it is written: “But in the seventh year shall be a Shabbat of solemn rest for the land” and learn “year” “year” from Tishrei, as it is written: “From the beginning of the year”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for the Sabbatical years. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And in the seventh year, there shall be a complete rest for the land," and it concludes "year" "year" from the month of Tishri, as it is written: "From the beginning of the year."

hebrew_text: וְלִגְמוֹר ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִנִּיסָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״רִאשׁוֹן הוּא לָכֶם לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״! דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים, וְאֵין דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But let us learn “year” “year” from Nisan, as it is written: “It shall be the first month of the year to you” derive “year” months are not with it, from “year” months not with it. And do not derive “year” months are not with it from “year” months are with it,
llm_translation: And to complete "year" "year" from Nisan, as it is written: "It is the first for you of the months of the year"! We evaluate a year that does not have new moons with it from a year that does not have new moons with it, and we do not evaluate a year that does not have new moons with it from a year that has new moons with it.

hebrew_text: וְלַיּוֹבְלוֹת. יוֹבְלוֹת בְּאֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי הוּא? יוֹבְלוֹת בַּעֲשָׂרָה בְּתִשְׁרִי הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים תַּעֲבִירוּ שׁוֹפָר״!
human_translation: for Jubilee Years. Is Jubilee Years on the first of Tishrei? Jubilee Years on the tenth of Tishrei, As it is written: on Yom Kippur shall you sound the shofar
llm_translation: "And for the Jubilee years. Jubilee years on the first of Tishrei it is? Jubilee years on the tenth of Tishrei it is, as it is written: 'On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the shofar!'"

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים שָׁנָה״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״ — יָכוֹל לֹא תְּהֵא מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת אֶלָּא מִיּוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וְאֵילָךְ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמִּתְקַדֶּשֶׁת וְהוֹלֶכֶת מִתְּחִילָּתָהּ.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, as it is taught What the verse states: “And you shall hallow the fiftieth year”? Since it is stated “on Yom Kippur,” might is sanctified only from Yom Kippur and onward. Therefore, the verse states: “And you shall hallow the fiftieth year,” which teaches that is sanctified from its beginning onward,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ha mani — Rabbi Yishmael b'no shel Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka hi. D'tanya: "V'kidash'tem et sh'nat hachamishim shanah," mah tal'mud lomar? L'fi she'ne'emar "b'yom hakippurim" — yakhol lo tehei mitkadesh'tet ela miyom hakippurim v'eilakh, tal'mud lomar: "V'kidash'tem et sh'nat hachamishim," melamed she'mitkadesh'tet v'holekhet mit'chilatah. English translation: This is the teaching — Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka. It was taught: "And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year," what does the teaching come to say? Since it is stated "on the day of Atonement" — one might think it can only be sanctified from the day of Atonement onwards, therefore the teaching comes to say: "And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year," teaching that it can be sanctified and continue from its beginning.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא: מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה עַד יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לֹא הָיוּ עֲבָדִים נִפְטָרִין לְבָתֵּיהֶן, וְלֹא מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִין לַאֲדוֹנֵיהֶם — אֶלָּא אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין וּשְׂמֵחִין, וְעַטְרוֹתֵיהֶן בְּרָאשֵׁיהֶן. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, תָּקְעוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּשׁוֹפָר, נִפְטְרוּ עֲבָדִים לְבָתֵּיהֶן וְשָׂדוֹת חוֹזְרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: From here, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, said: From Rosh HaShana until Yom Kippur slaves were not released to their homes And they were not enslaved to their masters, Rather, they would eat, drink, and rejoice, and their crowns on their heads Once Yom Kippur arrived, the court sound the shofar , slaves released to their houses, and fields returned to their owners.
llm_translation: From here Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, said: From Rosh Hashanah until Yom Kippur, the slaves are not released to their homes, nor do they return to their masters—rather, they eat, drink, and rejoice, with their crowns on their heads. Once Yom Kippur arrives, the court blows the shofar, the slaves are released to their homes, and the fields return to their owners.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן — שָׁנִים אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: And the Rabbis you sanctify years, but you do not sanctify months.
llm_translation: The Sages - two you sanctify, and if you do not sanctify new moons.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ — מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים״, יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּתְקַדֶּשֶׁת וְהוֹלֶכֶת מִתְּחִילָּתָהּ, כָּךְ מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת וְהוֹלֶכֶת בְּסוֹפָהּ. וְאַל תִּתְמַהּ, שֶׁהֲרֵי מוֹסִיפִין מֵחוֹל עַל קֹדֶשׁ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים״ — שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים וְאַחַת.
human_translation: It is taught another What the verse states: “It shall be a Jubilee Year” Since it is stated: “And you shall hallow the fiftieth year,” might just as is sanctified from its beginning onward, so too, it is sanctified at its end onward, And do not wonder as don’t we add from the profane to the sacred, Therefore, the verse states: “It shall be a Jubilee Year, the fiftieth year,” you sanctify the fiftieth year, but you do not sanctify the fifty-first year,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "It is the Jubilee" - What is the Talmud coming to teach us? Because it is stated: "And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year." One might think, just as it begins and ends, so too it should sanctify and end. And do not wonder, for we add from the weekday to the holy day - the Talmud comes to teach us: "It is the Jubilee, the fiftieth year" - you shall sanctify the fiftieth year, and not sanctify the fiftieth year and one.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? שְׁנַת חֲמִשִּׁים אַתָּה מוֹנֶה, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹנֶה שְׁנַת חֲמִשִּׁים וְאַחַת — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: שְׁנַת חֲמִשִּׁים עוֹלָה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, You count the fiftieth year but you do not count the fiftieth year and first to exclude of Rabbi Yehuda, who said the fiftieth year is counted for here and for there, therefore, the verse teaches us that not
llm_translation: The sages? Fifty years you count, and if you do not count fifty-one years - to oppose Rabbi Yehuda, for he said: Fifty years go here and there, it is heard to us that it is not so.

hebrew_text: וּדְמוֹסִיפִין מֵחוֹל עַל קֹדֶשׁ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: From where do we that extends adding from the profane to the sacred
llm_translation: And we add from the weekday onto the holy - from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״בֶּחָרִישׁ וּבַקָּצִיר תִּשְׁבּוֹת״, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר חָרִישׁ וְקָצִיר שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״שָׂדְךָ לֹא תִזְרָע וְגוֹ׳״. אֶלָּא חָרִישׁ שֶׁל עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית הַנִּכְנָס לִשְׁבִיעִית, וְקָצִיר שֶׁל שְׁבִיעִית הַיּוֹצֵא לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: As it is taught “In plowing and in harvest you shall rest” Rabbi Akiva says: It is unnecessary to state about plowing and harvesting during the Sabbatical Year, as it is already stated: you shall neither sow your field, Rather, plowing in the year preceding the Sabbatical Year going into the Sabbatical Year, and harvesting of the Sabbatical Year going into the year that follows the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "In plowing and in harvesting you shall rest." Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary to say plowing and harvesting of the Sabbatical year, for it is already stated, "You shall not sow your field, etc." Rather, plowing refers to the eve of the Sabbatical year that enters the Sabbatical year, and harvesting refers to the Sabbatical year that goes out to the end of the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: מָה חָרִישׁ רְשׁוּת — אַף קָצִיר רְשׁוּת, יָצָא קְצִיר הָעוֹמֶר שֶׁהוּא מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says just as plowing is voluntary so too, harvesting is voluntary to exclude the harvesting of the omer as it is a mitzva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: Just as the silence of permission (reshut) allows for action, so too the harvesting of permission is permitted. The harvesting of the Omer offering, which is a commandment, exempts from punishment.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מוֹסִיפִין מֵחוֹל עַל קֹדֶשׁ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּתַנְיָא: ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם בְּתִשְׁעָה״. יָכוֹל בְּתִשְׁעָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בָּעֶרֶב״, אִי ״בָּעֶרֶב״ יָכוֹל מִשֶּׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּתִשְׁעָה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַתְחִיל וּמִתְעַנֶּה מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין מֵחוֹל עַל קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: from where does Rabbi Yishmael that extends adding from the profane to the sacred He derives it from which is taught “And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth of the month might on the ninth Therefore, the verse states: “In the evening.” if in the evening, might from when it is dark, Therefore, the verse states: “On the ninth.” How so; One begins to fast while it is still day. This teaches that one adding from the profane to the sacred.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael: Do we add from a weekday onto a holy day? He derived it from a teaching: "And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth." Could it be on the ninth? The verse teaches: "In the evening." If "in the evening," could it be from when it gets dark? The verse teaches: "On the ninth." How so? One begins and afflicts oneself from the afternoon - teaching that we add from a weekday onto a holy day.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, בִּיצִיאָתוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵעֶרֶב עַד עֶרֶב״.
human_translation: I have only at the beginning from where at the end of The verse states: “From evening to evening
llm_translation: I have only in his entering, in his exiting, from where? The Scripture teaches: "From evening until evening."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שַׁבָּתוֹת מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּשְׁבְּתוּ״. יָמִים טוֹבִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שַׁבַּתְּכֶם״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שְׁבוּת — מוֹסִיפִין מֵחוֹל עַל קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: I have only Yom Kippur. From where Shabbat? The verse states: “You shall rest [ tishbetu ],” From where Festivals? The verse states: “Your Shabbat [ shabbatkhem ],” How so? Wherever there is resting, one adds from the profane to the sacred,
llm_translation: I have only Yom Kippur, how do we know about Shabbatot - it is derived from the verse "You shall rest." How do we know about festivals - it is derived from the verse "Your Sabbaths." How so? In any place where there is a cessation, we add from a weekday to a holy day.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם בְּתִשְׁעָה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ! מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּפְתִּי. דְּתָנֵי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּפְתִּי: ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם בְּתִשְׁעָה״ וְכִי בְּתִשְׁעָה מִתְעַנִּין? וַהֲלֹא בַּעֲשִׂירִי מִתְעַנִּין! אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: כָּל הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה בִּתְשִׁיעִי, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, what does he do with “And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth He requires it for which was taught by Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti, as Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti taught “And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth Is the fasting on the ninth? But isn’t the fasting on the tenth Rather, to teach you: Whoever eats and drinks on the ninth, the verse ascribes him
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva: This "And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth" - what does he do with it? He requires it for what Rabbi Hiyya bar Rav taught from Pumbedita. For Rabbi Hiyya bar Rav taught from Pumbedita: "And you shall afflict your souls on the ninth" - and do they afflict themselves on the ninth? Is it not on the tenth that they afflict themselves? Rather, to tell you: Anyone who eats and drinks on the ninth, the Scripture accounts it against him.

hebrew_text: כְּאִילּוּ הִתְעַנָּה תְּשִׁיעִי וַעֲשִׂירִי.
human_translation: as though he fasted on ninth and the tenth.
llm_translation: As if he fasted on the ninth and tenth days.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמְטוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא תָּקְעוּ. יָכוֹל אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁלְּחוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הִיא״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “it shall be a Jubilee” although they did not release although they did not sound might although they did not send Therefore, the verse states: “It shall be,” the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "It is a Jubilee" — even though they did not release the slaves, even though they did not blow the shofar. One might think they are still obligated even though they did not dispatch the slaves. The Torah teaches the word "it," according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמְטוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁלְּחוּ. יָכוֹל אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא תָּקְעוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הִיא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: “It shall be a Jubilee although they did not release although they did not send might although they did not sound Therefore, the verse states: “It shall be.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "It is a Jubilee." Even though they did not release the land, even though they did not send away the slaves. You might think it applies even though they did not blow the shofar - the Torah teaches otherwise by saying: "It is."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁמִּקְרָא אֶחָד מְרַבֶּה, וּמִקְרָא אֶחָד מְמַעֵיט, מִפְּנֵי מָה אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: ״יוֹבֵל הִיא״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁלְּחוּ, וְאֵין יוֹבֵל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן תָּקְעוּ? לְפִי שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא שִׁילּוּחַ עֲבָדִים, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא תְּקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: Since one verse includes and another verse excludes for what do I say it is a Jubilee Year although they did not send but it is a Jubilee Year only if they sounded since it is possible that there would be no sending but it is impossible that there would be no sounding of the shofar ,
llm_translation: And when one verse increases and one verse decreases, why do I say, "It is a Jubilee"? Even though they did not send the slaves away, and there is no Jubilee unless they sounded the shofar? Because it is possible for the world to exist without sending away the slaves, but it is not possible for the world to exist without the sounding of the shofar.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: זוֹ מְסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ מְסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Alternatively: This, is given over to the court, But that, is not given over to the court
llm_translation: Another matter: this is entrusted to the court, and this is not entrusted to the court.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלֵיכָּא חַד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם דְּלָא מְשַׁלַּח — זוֹ מְסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין, וְזוֹ אֵינָהּ מְסוּרָה לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: What is Alternatively? as, if you say it is impossible that there should not be one at the end of the world, no set free, this, is given over to the court, but that, is not given over to the court.
llm_translation: What is "another matter"? And if you say: If it is impossible that there is not one at the end of the world who does not send - this one is entrusted to the court, and this one is not entrusted to the court.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — כִּדְקָאָמַר טַעְמֵיהּ, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּקְרָאתֶם דְּרוֹר בָּאָרֶץ״, וְקָסָבַר: מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ לְפָנָיו, וְלֹא לִפְנֵי פָנָיו.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yosei, as he has stated his reasoning. But according to Rabbi Yehuda, what is the reason The verse states: “And you shall proclaim liberty [ deror ] throughout all the land And holds a verse may be expounded in reference to the preceding clause, but not in reference to the clause before that.
llm_translation: In truth, regarding Rabbi Yosei — as he said his reasoning, but regarding Rabbi Yehuda — what is the reasoning? The verse says: "And you shall proclaim release throughout the land," and he holds: the verse is interpreted in front of Him, not in front of Him.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא — ״דְּרוֹר״ לְשׁוֹן חֵירוּת, מַאי מַשְׁמַע? דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין ״דְּרוֹר״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן חֵירוּת. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מָה לְשׁוֹן דְּרוֹר — כִּמְדַיַּיר בֵּי דַיָּירָא, וּמוֹבִיל סְחוֹרָה בְּכׇל מְדִינָה.
human_translation: according to everyone “ deror ” meaning liberty. From where be inferred? As it is taught deror is meaning only liberty. Rabbi Yehuda said: What is the meaning of the word deror ? like a man who dwells [ medayyer ] in any dwelling [ dayyara ] and moves merchandise around the entire country,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Dekhulei olma — "d'ror" leshon heirut, mai mashma? D'tanya: ein "d'ror" ela leshon heirut. Amar Rabbi Yehuda: mah leshon d'ror — kimdayir bei dayyara, u'movil sechora b'kol medina. English translation: The customs of the world — "freedom" is a language of liberation, what does this imply? As it was taught: "freedom" is only a language of liberation. Rabbi Yehuda said: What is the language of freedom? Like one who resides in a city, and conducts business throughout the entire country.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלָשְׁתָּן מְעַכְּבוֹת בּוֹ. קָסָבְרִי: מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ לְפָנָיו, וְלִפְנֵי פָנָיו, וּלְאַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei, but the Rabbis say: three of them are indispensable for They hold a verse may be interpreted in reference to the preceding clause, in reference to the clause before that, and in reference to the clause following it,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yosei. But the sages say: All three of them are essential. They hold: A verse is interpreted before him, and before his face, and after him.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״יוֹבֵל״! הַהוּא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. וְהָכְתִיב: ״בָּאָרֶץ״! הָהוּא, בִּזְמַן שֶׁנּוֹהֵג דְּרוֹר בָּאָרֶץ — נוֹהֵג בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בָּאָרֶץ — אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: But isn’t it written “Jubilee That even outside of Eretz But isn’t it written: “Throughout the land,” That when liberation applies in Eretz it applies outside of Eretz when does not apply in Eretz it does not apply outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "Yovel"! That one, even outside the land. And it is written: "In the land"! That one, when freedom is practiced in the land - practices it outside the land; when freedom is not practiced in the land - does not practice it outside the land.

hebrew_text: וְלִנְטִיעָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים עֲרֵלִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבַשָּׁנָה הָרְבִיעִית״, וְיָלֵיף ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִתִּשְׁרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה״:
human_translation: And for planting. From where do we As it is written: “Three years prohibited [ arelim ] and it is written “And in the fourth year And derived “year” “year” from Tishrei, as it is written “From the beginning of the year”
llm_translation: Regarding planting. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "Three years uncircumcised," and it is also written: "And in the fourth year," and it deduces "year" from "year" from the month of Tishri, as it is written: "From the beginning of the year."

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר ״שָׁנָה״ ״שָׁנָה״ מִנִּיסָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״רִאשׁוֹן הוּא לָכֶם לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״?! דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים, וְאֵין דָּנִין שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים מִשָּׁנָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But let us derive “year” “year” from Nisan, as it is written “It shall be the first month of the year to you” derive “year” months are not with it, from “year” months are not with it. And do not derive “year” months are not with it from “year” months are with it,
llm_translation: And to conclude "year" "year" from Nisan, as it is written: "It is the first for you of the months of the year"?! We evaluate a year that does not have new months from a year that does not have new months, and we do not evaluate a year that does not have new months from a year that has new months.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הַנּוֹטֵעַ אֶחָד הַמַּבְרִיךְ, וְאֶחָד הַמַּרְכִּיב עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית, שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — עָלְתָה לוֹ שָׁנָה, וּמוּתָּר לְקַיְּימָן בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — לֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ שָׁנָה, וְאָסוּר לְקַיְּימָן בַּשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught If one plants layers or grafts on the eve of the Sabbatical Year thirty days before Rosh HaShana, a year is counted for him. and it is permitted to preserve during the Sabbatical Year, less than thirty days before Rosh HaShana, a year is not counted for him and it is prohibited to preserve during the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who plants, one who blesses, and one who combines the Eruv on the eve of the seventh year, thirty days before Rosh Hashanah - the year counts for him, and he is permitted to fulfill the requirements in the seventh year. Less than thirty days before Rosh Hashanah - the year does not count for him, and it is forbidden to fulfill the requirements in the seventh year.

hebrew_text: וּפֵירוֹת נְטִיעָה זוֹ אֲסוּרִין עַד חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט, אִם לְעׇרְלָה — עׇרְלָה, וְאִם לִרְבָעִי — רְבָעִי.
human_translation: And the fruit of this planting is prohibited until the fifteenth of Shevat both for orla during orla , and for fourth-year produce during fourth-year produce,
llm_translation: Fruits of a newly planted tree are forbidden until the fifteenth of Shevat, if for uncircumcision — uncircumcision, and if for the fourth year — the fourth year.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבַשָּׁנָה הָרְבִיעִית וּבַשָּׁנָה הַחֲמִישִׁית״.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and determined it in the name of Rabbi Yannai: The verse states: And in the fourth year And in the fifth year
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "What are these words?" Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and they brought a proof from the name of Rabbi Yannai, who said a verse: "And in the fourth year and in the fifth year."

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁבָּרְבִיעִית וַעֲדַיִין אֲסוּרָה מִשּׁוּם עׇרְלָה, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁבַּחֲמִישִׁית וַעֲדַיִין אֲסוּרָה מִשּׁוּם רְבָעִי.
human_translation: there are times that in its fourth and yet is forbidden as orla , and there are times that in its fifth and yet is forbidden as fourth-year produce,
llm_translation: Instances in the fourth generation and still forbidden due to uncircumcision, and instances in the fifth generation and still forbidden due to being a quarter descendant.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר — הָא אָמַר: יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה. דְּתַנְיָא: פַּר הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם — בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ וְיוֹם אֶחָד. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Let us say that is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as, if Rabbi Meir, didn’t Rabbi Meir say one day in a year is considered a year? As it is taught bullock [ par ] mentioned in the Torah without specification is twenty-four months and one day old, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Let us say that it is not like Rabbi Meir, for if it were like Rabbi Meir — behold, he said: "One day in the year is considered a year." As it was taught: "A bull that is mentioned in the Torah without specification — must be twenty-four months and one day." These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר עֵגֶל בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם — בֶּן שָׁנָה, ״בֶּן בָּקָר״ — בֶּן שְׁתַּיִם, ״פַּר״ — בֶּן שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: twenty-four months and thirty days old. As Rabbi Meir would say: Wherever a calf [ egel ] is stated in the Torah without specification, one year old; a young ox [ ben bakar ] two years old; a bullock three years old.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: twenty-four months and thirty days. Rabbi Meir used to say: wherever it says "calf" in the Torah without specification - one year old, "bull" - two years old, "ox" - three years old.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה — בְּסוֹף שָׁנָה, אֲבָל בִּתְחִלַּת שָׁנָה — לָא.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Meir, When Rabbi Meir said one day in a year is considered year, at the end of the year; But at the beginning of the year, not
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, when Rabbi Meir says one day in the year is considered a year - at the end of the year, but at the beginning of the year - no.
