hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? וּמָה נִדָּה, שֶׁאֵין תְּחִילַּת הַיּוֹם עוֹלָה לָהּ בְּסוֹפָהּ — סוֹף הַיּוֹם עוֹלֶה לָהּ בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ. שָׁנָה, שֶׁיּוֹם אֶחָד עוֹלֶה לָהּ בְּסוֹפָהּ —
human_translation: Rava said: But not a fortiori argument Whereas a menstruating woman, where the beginning of the day is not counted at the end the end of the day is counted at the beginning a year, where one day is counted at the end
llm_translation: Rava said: And is it not a fortiori reasoning? And what is the case of Niddah, that the beginning of the day does not render her impure, but its end does — the end of the day renders her impure at its beginning. A year, for one day renders her impure at its end —

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיּוֹם אֶחָד עוֹלֶה בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ?
human_translation: is it not right that one day should count at the beginning
llm_translation: It is not the law that one day rises at its beginning?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁלֹשִׁים בָּעֵי! דִּתְנַן: אֵין נוֹטְעִין וְאֵין מַבְרִיכִין וְאֵין מַרְכִּיבִין עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְאִם נָטַע וְהִבְרִיךְ וְהִרְכִּיב — יַעֲקוֹר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַרְכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, what Rabbi Elazar, thirty and thirty days are required: As we learned One may not plant, layer, or graft eve of the Sabbatical Year less than thirty days before Rosh HaShana, and if one planted, layered, or grafted, he must uproot the statement of Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any grafting that does not take root within three days will never take root. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Two weeks
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what? — Rabbi Elazar? Thirty and thirty require! For we learned: One may not plant, nor irrigate, nor arrange an irrigation channel less than thirty days before Rosh Hashanah, and if one planted, irrigated, and arranged — it shall be uprooted, the words of Rabbi Elazar. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any irrigation channel that does not absorb within three days — will not absorb again. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Two Sabbaths.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשִׁים — צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת — צָרִיךְ שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת וּשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִי נָמֵי, כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ — שְׁלֹשָׁה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים בָּעֵי!
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: According to the statement of the one who says thirty it requires thirty and thirty And according to the statement of the one who says three days, it requires thirty-three days. And according to the statement of the one who says two weeks, it requires two weeks and thirty days if holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda it requires three and thirty
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: According to the one who says thirty - he requires thirty and thirty, according to the one who says three - he requires three and thirty, according to the one who says two Sabbaths - he requires two Sabbaths and thirty days. And if you wish, according to Rabbi Yehuda he requires three and thirty!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְכִי קָאָמַר שְׁלֹשִׁים — לִקְלִיטָה.
human_translation: Rather, actually Rabbi Meir, and when it says thirty to take root.
llm_translation: Rather, always it is attributed to Rabbi Meir, and when he said thirty — it is for acceptance.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד בָּעֵי! קָא סָבַר: יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים עוֹלֶה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן.
human_translation: If so, it requires thirty-one he holds the thirtieth day is counted for here and for there,
llm_translation: If so, thirty and one are needed! He thought: The day of thirty goes up here and there.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וַיְהִי בְּאַחַת וְשֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן בְּאֶחָד לְחֹדֶשׁ״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: מִדְּאַכַּתִּי יוֹם אֶחָד הוּא דְּעָיֵיל בַּשָּׁנָה וְקָא קָרֵי לַהּ שָׁנָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them, expounded the same verse. “And it came to pass in the one and six hundredth year, in the first month on the first day of the month, Rabbi Meir holds: From the fact that it was one day into the year, and it is called the year, learn from here one day in a year is considered a year.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, and both of them expounded one verse: "And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month," Rabbi Meir holds: Since one day is included in the year, it is considered a year. Learn from it: One day in the year is accounted as a year.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: אִי כְּתִיב בְּ״שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת וְאַחַת שָׁנָה״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״בְּאַחַת וְשֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה״, ״שָׁנָה״ אַ״שֵּׁשׁ מֵאוֹת״ קָאֵי. וּמַאי ״אַחַת״ — אַתְחַלְתָּא דְּאַחַת קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And the other If it had written: In the six hundred and first year, as you said. now that it is written: “In the one and six hundredth year," “year” relates to “six hundredth,” what is “one”? the beginning of one
llm_translation: The other opinion is: If it is written "six hundred and one years" - as you said. Now, when it is written "one and six hundred years," "years" stands for "six hundred." And what is "one" - it is the first one that is meant.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּרִאשׁוֹן בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ״, מִדְּאַכַּתִּי יוֹם אֶחָד הוּא דְּעָיֵיל בַּחֹדֶשׁ וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ חֹדֶשׁ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יוֹם אֶחָד בַּחֹדֶשׁ חָשׁוּב חֹדֶשׁ, וּמִדְּיוֹם אֶחָד בַּחֹדֶשׁ חָשׁוּב חֹדֶשׁ — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם בַּשָּׁנָה חֲשׁוּבִין שָׁנָה. וְחֹדֶשׁ לִמְנוּיָיו, וְשָׁנָה לִמְנוּיֶיהָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, what is the rationale As it is written: “In the first month on the first day of the month.” Since it was one day into the month, and it is called a month, learn from here one day in a month is considered a month. And since one day in a month is a month, thirty days in a year are considered a year, as a month to its unit, and a year to its unit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, what is the reason? As it is written: "In the first month, on the first day of the month," since it says one day, it brings it into the month, and it calls it a month - learn from it: one day in the month is considered a month, and from one day in the month is considered a month - thirty days in the year are considered a year. And a month for its appointments, and a year for its reckonings.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלַל דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ בְּנִיסָן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: By inference, both of them, hold the world was created in Nisan
llm_translation: From the general principle of both, it seems to them that the world was created in Nisan.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בְּתִשְׁרִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, בְּתִשְׁרִי נוֹלְדוּ אָבוֹת, בְּתִשְׁרִי מֵתוּ אָבוֹת, בַּפֶּסַח נוֹלַד יִצְחָק, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נִפְקְדָה שָׂרָה רָחֵל וְחַנָּה, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה יָצָא יוֹסֵף מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: In Tishrei the world was created; in Tishrei the Patriarchs were born; in Tishrei the Patriarchs died; on Passover Isaac was born; on Rosh HaShana Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered on Rosh HaShana Joseph came out from prison;
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: In Tishrei the world was created, in Tishrei the patriarchs were born, in Tishrei the patriarchs died, on Passover Isaac was born, on Rosh Hashanah Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered, on Rosh Hashanah Joseph was released from prison.

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה בָּטְלָה עֲבוֹדָה מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּמִצְרַיִם, בְּנִיסָן נִגְאֲלוּ, בְּתִשְׁרִי עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל.
human_translation: on Rosh HaShana our forefathers’ slavery in Egypt ceased; in Nisan were redeemed in Tishrei in the future will be redeemed
llm_translation: In the beginning of the year, work ceased from our forefathers in Egypt, in Nissan they were redeemed, in Tishrei they are destined to be redeemed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: בְּנִיסָן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, בְּנִיסָן נוֹלְדוּ אָבוֹת, בְּנִיסָן מֵתוּ אָבוֹת, בְּפֶסַח נוֹלַד יִצְחָק, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נִפְקְדָה שָׂרָה רָחֵל וְחַנָּה, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה יָצָא יוֹסֵף מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה בָּטְלָה עֲבוֹדָה מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּמִצְרַיִם, בְּנִיסָן נִגְאֲלוּ בְּנִיסָן עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: In Nisan the world was created; in Nisan the Patriarchs were born; in Nisan the Patriarchs died; on Passover Isaac was born; on Rosh HaShana Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered on Rosh HaShana Joseph came out from prison; on Rosh HaShana our forefathers’ slavery in Egypt ceased; in Nisan were redeemed and in Nisan in the future will be redeemed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: In Nisan the world was created, in Nisan the patriarchs were born, in Nisan the patriarchs died, on Passover Isaac was born, on Rosh Hashanah Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were visited, on Rosh Hashanah Joseph was released from prison, on Rosh Hashanah the service ceased from our forefathers in Egypt, in Nisan they were redeemed, and in Nisan they will be destined to be redeemed.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּתִשְׁרִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים תַּדְשֵׁא הָאָרֶץ דֶּשֶׁא עֵשֶׂב מַזְרִיעַ זֶרַע עֵץ פְּרִי״. אֵיזֶהוּ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁהָאָרֶץ מוֹצִיאָה דְּשָׁאִים וְאִילָן מָלֵא פֵּירוֹת — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה תִּשְׁרִי. וְאוֹתוֹ הַפֶּרֶק זְמַן רְבִיעָה הָיְתָה, וְיָרְדוּ גְּשָׁמִים וְצִימֵּחוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵד יַעֲלֶה מִן הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: From where that the world was created in Tishrei? As it is stated: “And God said: Let the earth bring forth grass, herb yielding seed, and fruit tree yielding fruit after its kind” Which is the month in which the earth brings forth grass and the trees are full of fruit? You must say this is Tishrei. and the period is a time of rain, and rain fell and grew, as it is stated: “But there went up a mist from the earth,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: From where do we know that the world was created in Tishrei? Because it is stated: "And God said, 'Let the earth bring forth grass, herb yielding seed, and fruit tree yielding fruit.'" Which month is it that the earth brings forth vegetation and the trees are full of fruit? You must say this is Tishrei. And that period was the time of the fourth season, and the rains descended and they sprouted, as it is stated: "And a mist ascended from the earth."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּנִיסָן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתּוֹצֵא הָאָרֶץ דֶּשֶׁא עֵשֶׂב מַזְרִיעַ זֶרַע וְעֵץ עוֹשֶׂה פְּרִי״. אֵיזֶהוּ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁהָאָרֶץ מְלֵיאָה דְּשָׁאִים וְאִילָן מוֹצִיא פֵּירוֹת — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר, זֶה נִיסָן. וְאוֹתוֹ הַפֶּרֶק, זְמַן בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה וָעוֹף שֶׁמִּזְדַּוְּוגִין זֶה אֵצֶל זֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָבְשׁוּ כָרִים הַצֹּאן וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: From where that the world was created in Nisan? As it is stated: “And the earth brought forth grass, herb yielding seed and tree yielding fruit” Which is the month in which the earth is full of grass and the trees bring forth fruit? You must say this is Nisan. and the period is a time when cattle, and beasts, and birds mate with one another, as it is stated: “The flocks are clothed in the meadows,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: From where do we know that the world was created in Nisan? As it is stated: "And the earth brought forth grass, herb yielding seed after its kind, and tree yielding fruit" (Genesis 1:12). Which month is it that the earth is filled with vegetation and trees bear fruit? One must say, this is Nisan. And that same chapter, the time when domestic animals, wild animals, and birds mate with one another, as it is stated: "The flocks are clothed with the sheep" (Psalms 65:14).

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״עֵץ עוֹשֶׂה פְּרִי״! הָהוּא לִבְרָכָה לְדוֹרוֹת הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: And the other isn’t it written: “And tree yielding fruit,” That is written as a blessing for generations,
llm_translation: And the other one says, is it not written: "A tree that produces fruit"! That one is for a blessing for generations, as it is written.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״עֵץ פְּרִי״? הָהוּא כִּדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית לְקוֹמָתָן נִבְרְאוּ, לְדַעְתָּן נִבְרְאוּ, לְצִבְיוֹנָן נִבְרְאוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְכֻלּוּ הַשָּׁמַיִם וְהָאָרֶץ וְכׇל צְבָאָם״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״צְבָאָם״, אֶלָּא ״צִבְיוֹנָם״.
human_translation: And the other isn’t it written: “Fruit tree,” That in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All acts of Creation with their stature, they were created with their capacities; they were created with their form. As it is stated: “And the heavens and the earth were finished, and all their host” Do not read “their host [ tzeva’am ]”; rather, their form [ tzivyonam ],
llm_translation: And the other one says, is it not written: "a tree bearing fruit"? That is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All the works of creation were created for their stature, for their knowledge, for their beauty, as it is said: "And the heavens and the earth and all their hosts were finished," do not read "their hosts," but "their beauty."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּתִשְׁרִי נוֹלְדוּ אָבוֹת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקָּהֲלוּ אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה כׇּל אִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיֶרַח הָאֵיתָנִים בֶּחָג״, יֶרַח שֶׁנּוֹלְדוּ בּוֹ אֵיתָנֵי עוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From where that in Tishrei the Patriarchs were born? As it is stated: “And all the men of Israel assembled themselves before King Solomon at the feast in the month of the mighty [ eitanim ], the month in which the mighty ones of the world, were born.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From where do we know that the Patriarchs were born in Tishrei? As it is stated: "And they assembled to King Solomon all the men of Israel in the month of Ethanim at the feast," the month in which the eternal pillars were born.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״אֵיתָן״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּתַקִּיפֵי הוּא — כְּדִכְתִיב: ״אֵיתָן מוֹשָׁבֶךָ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״שִׁמְעוּ הָרִים אֶת רִיב ה׳ וְהָאֵיתָנִים מוֹסְדֵי אָרֶץ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״קוֹל דּוֹדִי הִנֵּה זֶה בָּא מְדַלֵּג עַל הֶהָרִים מְקַפֵּץ עַל הַגְּבָעוֹת״. ״מְדַלֵּג עַל הֶהָרִים״ — בִּזְכוּת אָבוֹת. ״מְקַפֵּץ עַל הַגְּבָעוֹת״ — בִּזְכוּת אִמָּהוֹת.
human_translation: From where be inferred that eitan denotes mighty? As it is written: “Strong [ eitan ] is Your dwelling place, And it says: “Hear, O mountains, the Lord’s controversy, and you strong [ eitanim ] foundations of the earth” And it says: “The voice of my beloved; behold, he comes leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills” “Leaping upon the mountains” in the merit of the Patriarchs, “skipping upon the hills” in the merit of the Matriarchs.
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "strong" is mentioned in the context of the firmament? — As it is written: "Your abode is firm," and it says: "Listen, O mountains, to the plea of the Lord, and you enduring foundations of the earth," and it says: "The voice of my beloved! Behold, he comes, leaping over the mountains, bounding over the hills." "Leaping over the mountains" — in the merit of the fathers. "Bounding over the hills" — in the merit of the mothers.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּנִיסָן נוֹלְדוּ אָבוֹת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בִשְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה לְצֵאת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם בַּשָּׁנָה הָרְבִיעִית בְּחֹדֶשׁ זִיו״ — בְּיֶרַח שֶׁנּוֹלְדוּ בּוֹ זִיוְתָנֵי עוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: From where that in Nisan the Patriarchs were born? As it is stated: “And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year, in the month of Ziv” in the month in which the radiant ones [ zivtanei ] of the world, were born.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: From where do we know that the Patriarchs were born in Nisan? As it is stated: "And it was at the end of four hundred and thirty years, and it was on that very day, all the hosts of the Lord went out from the land of Egypt" (Exodus 12:41) - in the month they were born, the eternal luminaries.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״בְּיֶרַח הָאֵיתָנִים״! הָתָם, דְּתַקִּיפֵי בְּמִצְוֹת.
human_translation: And the other isn’t it written: “In the month of the mighty,” There, that is mighty in mitzvot,
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written: "In the month of Ethanim"! There, where they are stringent in commandments.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״בְּחֹדֶשׁ זִיו״? הַהוּא, דְּאִית בֵּיהּ זִיוָא לְאִילָנֵי. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַאי מַאן דִּנְפַק בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן וְחָזֵי אִילָנֵי דִּמְלַבְלְבִי, אוֹמֵר: בָּרוּךְ שֶׁלֹּא חִיסֵּר מֵעוֹלָמוֹ כְּלוּם, וּבָרָא בּוֹ בְּרִיּוֹת טוֹבוֹת וְאִילָנוֹת טוֹבוֹת לְהִתְנָאוֹת בָּהֶן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And the other isn’t it written: “In the month of Ziv”? in which there is radiance [ ziv ] for the trees. As Rav Yehuda said: One who goes out during the days of Nisan and sees trees that are blossoming recites: Blessed…Who has withheld nothing from His world and has created in it beautiful creatures and beautiful trees for human beings to enjoy.
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written: "In the month of Ziv"? That one, which has radiance for the trees. As Rav Yehudah said: One who goes out in the days of Nisan and sees the trees blossoming, he says: Blessed is He who has not omitted anything from His world, and created within it good creatures and good trees for people to enjoy.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּנִיסָן נוֹלְדוּ — בְּנִיסָן מֵתוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּתִשְׁרִי נוֹלְדוּ — בְּתִשְׁרִי מֵתוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם בֶּן מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה אָנֹכִי הַיּוֹם״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הַיּוֹם״ — הַיּוֹם מָלְאוּ יָמַי וּשְׁנוֹתַי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא יוֹשֵׁב וּמְמַלֵּא שְׁנוֹתֵיהֶם שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם מֵחֹדֶשׁ לְחֹדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״.
human_translation: The one who said in Nisan were born in Nisan they died. The one who says in Tishrei they were born in Tishrei they died, as it is stated “And he said to them: I am one hundred and twenty years old today” As no the verse to state “today,” what the verse states “today”? Today my days and years are filled to teach you that the Holy One, Blessed be He, sits and fills the years of the righteous from day to day from month to month, as it is stated: “The number of your days I will fulfill”
llm_translation: One who says they were born in Nisan - they died in Nisan. One who says they were born in Tishrei - they died in Tishrei, as it is said: "And he said to them, 'I am a hundred and twenty years old today,'" (Deuteronomy 31:2) for the verse does not need to say "today," and what does it teach by saying "today" - that their days and years were completed. To teach you that the Holy One, blessed be He, sits and fills the years of the righteous from day to day, from month to month, as it is said: "I will fulfill the number of your days."

hebrew_text: בְּפֶסַח נוֹלַד יִצְחָק, מְנָלַן — כְּדִכְתִיב: ״לַמּוֹעֵד אָשׁוּב אֵלֶיךָ״. אֵימַת קָאֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּפֶסַח וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ בַּעֲצֶרֶת — בְּחַמְשִׁין יוֹמִין מִי קָא יָלְדָה? אֶלָּא דְּקָאֵי בַּעֲצֶרֶת וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ בְּתִשְׁרִי — אַכַּתִּי בְּחַמְשָׁה יַרְחֵי מִי קָא יָלְדָה? אֶלָּא דְּקָאֵי בְּחַג וְקָאָמַר לַהּ בְּנִיסָן.
human_translation: On Passover Isaac was born. From where do we As it is written “At the appointed time [ mo’ed ] I will return to you, When did If we say on Passover and he said to him on Shavuot , can give birth after fifty days? Rather, that it was Shavuot and he said in Tishrei, still, can she give birth after five months? Rather, that it was Sukkot , and he spoke about in Nisan,
llm_translation: In Pesach Isaac was born, whence do we derive this? As it is written: "At the appointed time I will return to you" (Genesis 18:14). When is this appointed time? If you say it is in Pesach, and he said to her Sarah at Shavuot - in fifty days was she Sarah pregnant? Rather, it is the appointed time in Shavuot, and he said to her in Tishrei - in five months was she Sarah pregnant? Rather, it is the appointed time in Sukkot, and he said to her in Nissan.

hebrew_text: אַכַּתִּי, בְּשִׁיתָּא יַרְחֵי מִי קָא יָלְדָה? תָּנָא: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת הָיְתָה. סוֹף סוֹף, כִּי מַדְלֵי מָר יוֹמֵי טוּמְאָה — בָּצְרִי לְהוּ!
human_translation: still, can give birth after six months? taught That year was a leap year, Ultimately, if one deducts days of ritual impurity, there are less
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Akkati, beshitta yarḥei mi ka yaldah? Tanah: otah shanah me'ubberet haytah. Sof sof, ki madlei mar yomei tum'ah - batsri lehu!" English translation: "Akkati, in the sixth month who gave birth? It was taught: she was pregnant that year. Ultimately, when the days of impurity are completed - let them be strict!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יוֹלֶדֶת לְתִשְׁעָה — אֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, יוֹלֶדֶת לְשִׁבְעָה — יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי לִתְקוּפוֹת הַיָּמִים״, מִיעוּט תְּקוּפוֹת — שְׁתַּיִם, וּמִיעוּט יָמִים — שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: Even according to the one who said gives birth in ninth she cannot give birth prematurely, if gives birth in seventh she may give birth early, As it is stated “And it came to pass after cycles of days The minimum of “cycles,” is two, and the minimum of “days” is two.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: Even according to the one who says a woman gives birth after nine months - she does not give birth to premature babies after seven months, she gives birth to premature babies after seven months, as it is stated: "And it was at the end of days," implying a few days - two, and a few days - two.

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נִפְקְדָה שָׂרָה רָחֵל וְחַנָּה. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״פְּקִידָה״ ״פְּקִידָה״, אָתְיָא ״זְכִירָה״ ״זְכִירָה״. כְּתִיב בְּרָחֵל: ״וַיִּזְכּוֹר אֱלֹהִים אֶת רָחֵל״, וּכְתִיב בְּחַנָּה: ״וַיִּזְכְּרֶהָ ה׳״, וְאָתְיָא ״זְכִירָה״ ״זְכִירָה״ מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״.
human_translation: On Rosh HaShana, Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were revisited From where do we Rabbi Elazar said: is derived revisiting [ pekida ] revisiting, remembering [ zekhira ] remembering. It is written about Rachel: “And God remembered Rachel” and it is written about Hannah: “And the Lord remembered her” And remembering derived remembering, with regard to Rosh HaShana, as it is written: “A solemn rest, memorial proclaimed with the blast
llm_translation: In the beginning of the year, Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered. Whence do we derive this? Rabbi Elazar said: It is written "remembered, remembered" for Sarah, "remembered, remembered" for Rachel. It is written for Rachel: "And God remembered Rachel," and it is written for Hannah: "And Hashem remembered her." And whence do we derive "remembered, remembered" from the beginning of the year? As it is written: "A Sabbath, a remembrance of blowing."

hebrew_text: ״פְּקִידָה״ ״פְּקִידָה״, כְּתִיב בְּחַנָּה: ״כִּי פָקַד ה׳ אֶת חַנָּה״, וּכְתִיב בְּשָׂרָה: ״וַה׳ פָּקַד אֶת שָׂרָה״.
human_translation: revisiting revisiting.
llm_translation: "Pekidah" "pekidah," it is written in Chanah: "For the Lord had remembered Chanah," and it is written in Sarah: "And the Lord had remembered Sarah."

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה יָצָא יוֹסֵף מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר בַּכֵּסֶא לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ. כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: On Rosh HaShana Joseph came out of prison. From where do we As it is written: “Sound a shofar at the New Moon, at the covered time of our Festival day. For this is a statute for Israel,
llm_translation: On Rosh Hashanah, Joseph was released from prison. Where did he go? As it is written: "Blow the shofar at the new moon, at the appointed time for our feast day. For it is a statute for Israel, etc."

hebrew_text: עֵדוּת בִּיהוֹסֵף שָׂמוֹ בְּצֵאתוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “This He ordained in Joseph for testimony, when he went out
llm_translation: Testimony of Joseph he placed in his going out, and so forth.

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה בָּטְלָה עֲבוֹדָה מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ בְּמִצְרַיִם — כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְהוֹצֵאתִי אֶתְכֶם מִתַּחַת סִבְלוֹת מִצְרַיִם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הֲסִירוֹתִי מִסֵּבֶל שִׁכְמוֹ״.
human_translation: On Rosh HaShana our forefathers’ slavery in Egypt ceased. It is written here: “And I will bring you out from under the burdens of Egypt” and it is written there, “I removed his shoulder from the burden”
llm_translation: In the beginning of the year, work ceased from our forefathers in Egypt - as it is written here: "And I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians," and it is written there: "I removed his shoulder from the burden."

hebrew_text: בְּנִיסָן נִגְאֲלוּ — כִּדְאִיתָא. בְּתִשְׁרִי עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל — אָתְיָא ״שׁוֹפָר״ ״שׁוֹפָר״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״בְּיוֹם הַהוּא יִתָּקַע בְּשׁוֹפָר גָּדוֹל״.
human_translation: In Nisan were redeemed as it is In Tishrei in the future will be redeemed This is derived shofar shofar . It is written here, “Sound a shofar at the New Moon” and it is written there, on that day, that a great shofar shall be blown”
llm_translation: In Nisan they were redeemed - as it is stated. In Tishrei they are destined to be redeemed - it is written "shofar" "shofar." It is written here: "Blow the shofar in the month," and it is written there: "On that day a great shofar shall be blown."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: בְּנִיסָן נִגְאֲלוּ, בְּנִיסָן עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל — מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֵיל שִׁמּוּרִים״ — לַיִל הַמְשׁוּמָּר וּבָא מִשֵּׁשֶׁת יְמֵי בְּרֵאשִׁית.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: In Nisan were redeemed and in Nisan in the future will be redeemed From where do we The verse states: “It is a night of watching a night that has been continuously watched, from the six days of Creation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: In Nissan they were redeemed, in Nissan they are destined to be redeemed - from where? The verse says: "The night of watchings" - the night that is guarded, and it comes from the six days of creation.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: לַיְלָה הַמְּשׁוּמָּר וּבָא מִן הַמַּזִּיקִין.
human_translation: And the other a night that is continuously watched from demons,
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: the night that is guarded and the harmful spirits come.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״בִּשְׁנַת שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה לְחַיֵּי נֹחַ בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם לַחֹדֶשׁ״, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּאִיָּיר הָיָה, יוֹם שֶׁמַּזַּל כִּימָה שׁוֹקֵעַ בַּיּוֹם וּמַעְיָנוֹת מִתְמַעֲטִין. וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁשִּׁינּוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶן, שִׁינָּה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עֲלֵיהֶם מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וְהֶעֱלָה מַזַּל כִּימָה בַּיּוֹם, וְנָטַל שְׁנֵי כּוֹכָבִים מִכִּימָה וְהֵבִיא מַבּוּל לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And follow their reasoning, As it is taught “In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, Rabbi Yehoshua says: That day was the seventeenth of Iyyar, the day that the constellation of Kima sets during the day and the springs diminish But because changed their actions the Holy One, Blessed be He, changed for them the acts of Creation, and He caused the constellation of Kima to rise during the day and He removed two stars from Kima , and He brought a flood to the world.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, as it is taught: "In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month," Rabbi Yehoshua says: That day was the seventeenth of Iyyar, a day when the constellation of Kimah sinks in the day and the springs diminish. And because they perverted their deeds, the Holy One, blessed be He, changed their work to resemble the work of Creation, and He brought down the constellation of Kimah in the day, and He took two stars from Kimah and brought the Flood upon the world.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּמַרְחֶשְׁוָן הָיָה, יוֹם שֶׁמַּזַּל כִּימָה עוֹלֶה בַּיּוֹם וּמַעְיָנוֹת מִתְגַּבְּרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: That day was the seventeenth of Marḥeshvan, the day that the constellation of Kima rises during the day and the springs increase.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: That day, the seventeenth of Marḥeshvan, was the day when the constellation of Scorpio rises by day, and the springs strengthen.

hebrew_text: וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁשִּׁינּוּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם, שִׁינָּה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עֲלֵיהֶם מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וְהֶעֱלָה מַזַּל כִּימָה בַּיּוֹם, וְנָטַל שְׁנֵי כּוֹכָבִים וְהֵבִיא מַבּוּל לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: But because changed their actions the Holy One, Blessed be He, changed for them the acts of Creation and He caused the constellation of Kima to rise during the day, and He removed two stars and He brought a flood to the world.
llm_translation: And from that they sinned, the Holy One, blessed be He, changed their deed, He changed the work of creation, and He brought forth the constellation of Pleiades in the day, and He took two stars and brought the Flood upon the world.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״שֵׁנִי״. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, מַאי ״שֵׁנִי״? שֵׁנִי לְדִין.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehoshua, this is as it is written: second But according to Rabbi Eliezer, what is second second to judgment,
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yehoshua, that is what is written: "second." Rather, to Rabbi Eliezer, what is "second"? Second for judgment.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הַיְינוּ דְּשִׁינָּה. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, מַאי שִׁינָּה?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehoshua, this is He changed But according to Rabbi Eliezer, what did He change?
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Yehoshua, that is what she changed. Rather, to Rabbi Eliezer, what is "shinah"?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּרוֹתְחִין קִלְקְלוּ וּבְרוֹתְחִין נִידּוֹנוּ. בְּרוֹתְחִין קִלְקְלוּ — בַּעֲבֵירָה, וּבְרוֹתְחִין נִידּוֹנוּ — כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיָּשֹׁכּוּ הַמָּיִם״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַחֲמַת הַמֶּלֶךְ שָׁכָכָה״.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: They sinned with boiling and they were punished with boiling they sinned with the boiling of the sin and they were punished with the boiling It is written here, “And the waters abated” and it is written elsewhere, “And the heated of the king abated”
llm_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said: With boiling waters they were corrupted, and with boiling waters they will be judged. They were corrupted with boiling waters - through transgression, and they will be judged with boiling waters - as it is written here: "And the waters became corrupted," and it is written there: "And the king's wrath was kindled."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹנִין לַמַּבּוּל כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְלַתְּקוּפָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. חַכְמֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מוֹנִין אַף לַמַּבּוּל כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught The Jewish Sages count from the flood in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, the cycles in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, The sages of the nations of the world, count both from the flood in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: The sages taught: The sages of Israel reckon the Flood like Rabbi Eliezer, and the solar cycle like Rabbi Yehoshua. The sages of the nations of the world also reckon the Flood like Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: וְלַיְּרָקוֹת. תָּנָא: לַיְּרָקוֹת וְלַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת וְלַנְּדָרִים. לַיְּרָקוֹת מַאי נִינְהוּ? מַעֲשֵׂר יָרָק.
human_translation: And for vegetables. is taught for vegetables, and for tithes, and for vows. What is For vegetables? for vegetable tithe,
llm_translation: And for vegetables. It was taught: for vegetables and for tithes and for vows. For vegetables, what are they? Tithes of vegetables.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ מַעַשְׂרוֹת? תְּנָא דְּרַבָּנַן וְקָתָנֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: this is the same as for tithes, taught by rabbinic and it teaches by Torah
llm_translation: This is referring to tithes? It was taught by the Sages and it was taught in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בְּרֵישָׁא! אַיְּידֵי דַּחֲבִיבָא לֵיהּ — אַקְדְּמַהּ. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? תְּנָא דְּרַבָּנַן, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: let teach by Torah in the first clause. Since was dear to him, he mentioned it first. And the tanna our He taught by rabbinic decree, and all the more so
llm_translation: And let it be taught from the Torah at the outset! Since it is beloved to Him — I will precede it. And our Mishnaic teacher? A teacher of the Rabbis, all the more so from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״מַעֲשֵׂר״! אֶחָד מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן. וְלִיתְנֵי ״יָרָק״! תְּרֵי גַּוְונֵי יָרָק, דִּתְנַן: יָרָק הַנֶּאֱגָד — מִשֶּׁיֵּאָגֵד, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶאֱגָד — מִשֶּׁיְּמַלֵּא אֶת הַכְּלִי.
human_translation: But let teach: Tithe, both animal tithe and grain tithe. But let him teach: Vegetable, two categories of vegetables, as we learned a vegetable that is made into bundles from when it is bundled; and that is not made into bundles, from when one fills a vessel
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it should have taught "ma'aser"! One tithe of animals and one tithe of grain. And it should have taught "yarek"! Two types of vegetables, as we learned: Vegetables that are bound - from when they are bound, and those that are not bound - from when they fill the vessel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לִיקֵּט יָרָק עֶרֶב רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה עַד שֶׁלֹּא תָּבֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, וְחָזַר וְלִיקֵּט
human_translation: The Sages taught one picked vegetables on the eve of Rosh HaShana before the sun had set, and he returned and he picked
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may gather vegetables on the eve of Rosh Hashanah until the sun sets, and one may then go back and gather.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁתָּבֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ — אֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין, לֹא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ עַל הַיָּשָׁן, וְלֹא מִן הַיָּשָׁן עַל הֶחָדָשׁ. אִם הָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה נִכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁלִישִׁית — שְׁנִיָּה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, שְׁלִישִׁית — מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי.
human_translation: after sunset, one may not set aside teruma and tithe from the one to the other, as one may not set aside teruma and tithe from the new for the old nor from the old for the new. If it was the second going into the third the second first tithe, and second tithe, the third first tithe and poor man’s tithe,
llm_translation: When the sun enters — we do not tithe and separate tithes from one upon the other, because we do not tithe and separate tithes, neither from the new onto the old, nor from the old onto the new. If the second year enters the third year — the second year tithes the first tithe and the second tithe, the third year — the first tithe and the poor tithe.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: ״כִּי תְכַלֶּה לַעְשֵׂר אֶת כׇּל מַעְשַׂר תְּבוּאָתְךָ בַּשָּׁנָה הַשְּׁלִישִׁית שְׁנַת הַמַּעֲשֵׂר״, שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר אֶחָד. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי יִבְטַל.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: “When you have made an end of tithing all the tithes of your produce in the third year, which is the year of the tithe” a year when there is only one tithes How so? first tithe and poor man’s tithe, and second tithe is nullified
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: 'Ki techalleh la'aser et kol ma'aser tevu'atecha bashanah hashlishit shenat hama'aser', shanah she'ein bah ela ma'aser echad. Ha eitzad? Ma'aser rishon u'ma'aser ani, u'ma'aser sheni yivtal." English translation: "What are these words? Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: 'When you finish tithing all the tithes of your produce in the third year, the year of tithing, a year that contains only one tithe. How so? The first tithe and the poor tithe, and the second tithe shall be nullified.'"

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי יִבְטַל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶל הַלְוִיִּם תְּדַבֵּר וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם כִּי תִקְחוּ מֵאֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֲשֶׁר נָתַתִּי לָכֶם מֵאִתָּם בְּנַחֲלַתְכֶם״, הִקִּישׁוֹ הַכָּתוּב לְנַחֲלָה: מָה נַחֲלָה אֵין לָהּ הֶפְסֵק — אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אֵין לוֹ הֶפְסֵק.
human_translation: Or it is not but even first tithe is nullified the verse states: “Thus speak to the Levites, and say to them: When you take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance” The verse juxtaposes to an inheritance Just as an inheritance there is no interruption, so too, first tithe there is no interruption,
llm_translation: Or if not, even the tithe of the firstborn will be annulled - the Talmud teaches: "And to the Levites you shall speak and say to them: 'When you take from the children of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them as your inheritance,'" the Scripture equated it to inheritance: just as inheritance has no interruption, so too the tithe of the firstborn has no interruption.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״כִּי תְכַלֶּה לַעְשֵׂר וְגוֹ׳״, שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר אֶחָד. הָא כֵּיצַד? מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי, וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי יִבְטַל. יָכוֹל אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי יִבְטַל? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבָא הַלֵּוִי״, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבָּא — תֵּן לוֹ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: is taught another “When you have made an end of tithing the year when there is only one tithes How so? first tithe and poor man’s tithe, and second tithe is canceled. might that even first tithe is canceled the verse states: “And the Levite, shall come, Whenever comes, give him; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "When you finish tithing, etc." - a year that contains only one tithe. How so? The first tithe and the poor tithe, and the second tithe will be nullified. Can it be said that even the first tithe will be nullified? The Talmud teaches: "And the Levite shall come," as long as he comes - give it to him. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶל הַלְוִיִּם תְּדַבֵּר וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם כִּי תִקְחוּ מֵאֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אֲשֶׁר נָתַתִּי לָכֶם מֵאִתָּם בְּנַחֲלַתְכֶם״, הִקִּישׁוֹ הַכָּתוּב לְנַחֲלָה: מָה נַחֲלָה אֵין לָהּ הֶפְסֵק — אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אֵין לוֹ הֶפְסֵק.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: One need not it says: “Thus speak to the Levites, and say to them: When you take of the children of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them for your inheritance.” The verse juxtaposes to an inheritance Just as inheritance there is no interruption, so too, first tithe there is no interruption.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: It is not necessary, as it says: "And to the Levites you shall speak, and you shall say to them: 'When you take from the children of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them as your inheritance.'" The verse equated it to inheritance: just as inheritance has no interruption, so too the first tithe has no interruption.

hebrew_text: וְלַנְּדָרִים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לְשָׁנָה — מוֹנֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם. וְאִם אָמַר לְשָׁנָה זוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא עָמַד אֶלָּא בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה בֶּאֱלוּל, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ יוֹם אֶחָד בְּתִשְׁרִי — עָלְתָה לוֹ שָׁנָה.
human_translation: And for vows. The Sages taught One prohibited by a vow deriving benefit from another for a year counts twelve months from day to day, But if, he said: For this year, even if he took only on the twenty-ninth of Elul, once the first day of Tishrei, has arrived, it is counted as a year,
llm_translation: Regarding vows, etc. The Rabbis taught: One who vows to abstain from deriving benefit from his fellow for a year - he counts twelve months from day to day. And if he said "this year," even if he only stood until the twenty-ninth of Elul, once one day of Tishrei arrives - the year is considered completed for him.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יוֹם אֶחָד בַּשָּׁנָה אֵינוֹ חָשׁוּב שָׁנָה, לְצַעוֹרֵיהּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ — וְהָא אִצְטַעַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: even according to the one who said one day in a year is not considered a year, accepted upon himself to suffer affliction, and he has suffered affliction,
llm_translation: Even according to the one who says one day in the year is not considered a year, he would accept upon himself to fast for it - and he would be distressed.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא נִיסָן? בִּנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: But say Nisan. with regard to vows, follow the language of people.
llm_translation: And why is the month of Nisan called by that name? It follows the language of human beings in vows.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַתִּלְתָּן — מִשֶּׁתִּצְמַח, הַתְּבוּאָה וְהַזֵּיתִים — מִשֶּׁיָּבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: We learned there Fenugreek from when it sprouts. Grain and olives from when they have reached one-third
llm_translation: We learned there: the three - from when they sprout, grain and olives - from when they bring a third.

hebrew_text: מַאי מִשֶּׁתִּצְמַח — מִשֶּׁתִּצְמַח לִזְרָעִים.
human_translation: What is From when it sprouts? from when it sprouts for seed,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "when it sprouts"? - When it sprouts for seeds.

hebrew_text: הַתְּבוּאָה וְהַזֵּיתִים מִשֶּׁיָּבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּמָטוּ בָּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִקֵּץ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים בְּמוֹעֵד שְׁנַת הַשְּׁמִטָּה בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת״, שְׁנַת הַשְּׁמִטָּה מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ בְּחַג הַסּוּכּוֹת? שְׁמִינִית הִיא!
human_translation: Grain and olives from when they have reached one-third From where are these matters Rav Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and determined in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: The verse states: “At the end of every seven years, in the time of the year of release, in the festival of Sukkot ” What is the purpose of the Sabbatical Year with the festival of Sukkot ? the eighth
llm_translation: The produce and the olives they bring a third. From where are these matters? Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and they brought proof from the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, as the verse says: "At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the Feast of Tabernacles," what does the year of release do at the Feast of Tabernacles? It is the eighth year!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל תְּבוּאָה שֶׁהֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — אַתָּה נוֹהֵג בּוֹ מִנְהַג שְׁבִיעִית בַּשְּׁמִינִית.
human_translation: Rather, to tell you you must treat all produce that reached one-third in the Sabbatical Year before Rosh HaShana with the sanctity of the Sabbatical Year, in the eighth
llm_translation: Rather, to say to you: Any produce that a third party brought in the seventh year before Rosh Hashanah - you treat it according to the custom of the seventh year in the eighth year.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַב אַסִּי:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi:
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Zeira to Rav Assi:

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לָא עָיֵיל כְּלָל, וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא תְּשַׁמֵּט וְתֵיזִיל עַד חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת!
human_translation: But perhaps did not grow at all and the Merciful One states continue to apply until the festival of Sukkot
llm_translation: Perhaps it does not include at all, and the Merciful One said, "You shall pour out and go until the Feast of Sukkot!"

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחַג הָאָסִיף בְּצֵאת הַשָּׁנָה״, מַאי ״אָסִיף״? אִילֵּימָא: חַג הַבָּא בִּזְמַן אֲסִיפָה — הָכְתִיב: ״בְּאׇסְפְּךָ״.
human_translation: It should not enter your mind as it is written: “And the festival of gathering, which is at the end of the year, What is “gathering”? If we say A Festival that comes at the time of gathering isn’t it written: “When you have gathered
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "La sakla datach, dikhtiv: 'vechag ha'asif betze'et hashanah', mai 'asif'? Ileima: chag haba bizman asifah - hakhtiv: 'be'ospecha'." English translation: "Not according to your opinion, as it is written: 'And the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year,' what is 'ingathering'? Perhaps: a festival that comes at the time of gathering - it is written: 'when you gather in.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי ״אָסִיף״ — קָצִיר. וְקִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּכׇל תְּבוּאָה שֶׁנִּקְצְרָה בֶּחָג, בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהֵבִיאָה שְׁלִישׁ לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְקָא קָרֵי לַהּ ״בְּצֵאת הַשָּׁנָה״.
human_translation: Rather, what is “gathering”? harvesting. And the Sages have tradition that any grain that is harvested on the festival is known have reached one-third before Rosh HaShana, and calls “at the end of the year,”
llm_translation: Rather, what is "אָסִיף" — a harvest. And it stands for the Rabbis who hold that all produce that was harvested during the festival, provided that a third of it was brought before Rosh Hashanah, is called "at the end of the year."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: וְקִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בֵּין שְׁלִישׁ לְפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלִישׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמֵינָא לָךְ לָא תַּפֵּיק נַפְשָׁךְ לְבַר מֵהִלְכְתָא? כׇּל מִדּוֹת חֲכָמִים — כֵּן הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: And are the Sages discern between one-third and less than one-third said to him: Do I not tell you that you must not take yourself out the halakha ? All the measures of the Sages are like this;
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: "And is it established for the Rabbis whether a third is considered less than a third?" He said to him: "I do not say to you, do not you take out your soul for a matter of Halakha? All the measures of the sages - so it is."

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה הוּא טוֹבֵל, בְּאַרְבָּעִים סְאָה חָסֵר קוּרְטוֹב — אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִטְבּוֹל בָּהֶן. כְּבֵיצָה מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין, כְּבֵיצָה חָסֵר שׁוּמְשׁוּם — אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין.
human_translation: one who immerses himself in forty se’a in forty se’a less a kortov , cannot immerse in them. an egg-bulk can render food ritually impure, an egg-bulk less a sesame does not render food ritually impure.
llm_translation: Forty se'ah is the minimum required for immersion; with less than forty se'ah, it is insufficient for immersion. Like an egg that imparts ritual impurity to food, an incomplete egg does not impart ritual impurity to food.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה — מִטַּמֵּא מִדְרָס, שְׁלֹשָׁה עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה חָסֵר נִימָא אַחַת — אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא מִדְרָס.
human_translation: three by three is susceptible to ritual impurity treading, three by three less one hair [ nima ] is not susceptible to ritual impurity treading.
llm_translation: Three on three - defiles a bed, three on three lacking one - does not defile a bed.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי. דִּבְעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ חַבְרַיָּיא מֵרַב כָּהֲנָא: עוֹמֶר שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּכְנִיסָתָן לָאָרֶץ, מֵהֵיכָן הִקְרִיבוּהוּ? אִם תֹּאמַר דְּעָיֵיל בְּיַד גּוֹי, ״קְצִירְכֶם״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — וְלֹא קְצִיר גּוֹי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya then said: What I said is nothing, As Rav Kahana was asked by the colleagues the omer that the Jewish people brought when they entered Eretz Yisrael from where did they bring it? If you say that grew in the possession of a gentile, the Merciful One states your harvest and not the harvest of a gentile.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar said Rabbi Yirmeya: It is not a matter that they said. His colleagues asked him from Rav Kahana: The Omer offering that the Israelites brought when entering the land, from where did they bring it? If you say they brought it in the hands of a non-Jew, 'your harvest' the Merciful One said — and not the harvest of a non-Jew."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּאַקְרִיבוּ, דִּלְמָא לָא אַקְרִיבוּ! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאכְלוּ מֵעֲבוּר הָאָרֶץ מִמׇּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח״. מִמָּחֳרַת הַפֶּסַח — אֲכוּל, מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא אֲכוּל. דְּאַקְרִיבוּ עוֹמֶר וַהֲדַר אָכְלִי. מֵהֵיכָן הִקְרִיבוּ?
human_translation: From where that brought Perhaps they did not offer It should not enter your mind as it is written: “And they did eat of the produce of the land on the next day after Passover” on the next day after Passover did they eat initially they did not eat because they brought the omer and afterward did they eat From where did they bring
llm_translation: From what did they bring close, perhaps they did not bring close! It is not in your mind, as it is written: "And they ate from the produce of the land on the day after the Passover." On the day after the Passover — one may eat, from the outset — one may not eat. They brought close the Omer offering and then they ate. From where did they bring close?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ בְּיַד גּוֹי.
human_translation: said to them: Anything that did not reach one-third in the possession of a gentile
llm_translation: He said to them: Anyone who did not bring a third of the produce in the hand of a non-Jew.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא עָיֵיל וְלָא קִים לְהוּ? אֶלָּא קִים לְהוּ — הָכָא נָמֵי קִים לְהוּ.
human_translation: Perhaps had reached but they could not discern Rather, they were able to discern Here, too, can discern
llm_translation: Perhaps he will come and not establish for them? Rather, he establishes for them - here he establishes for them.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לָא עָיֵיל כְּלָל, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּעָיֵיל רִיבְעָא — בֵּין שְׁלִישׁ לְפָחוֹת מִשְּׁלִישׁ לָא קִים לְהוּ!
human_translation: as perhaps did not grow at all But where reached one quarter cannot discern between one-third and less than one-third.
llm_translation: Perhaps it does not come at all, but where it does come a quarter — whether less than a third or not less than a third, it does not establish for them!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעָם עָלוּ מִן הַיַּרְדֵּן בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ״, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלָא עָיֵיל כְּלָל — בְּחַמְשָׁה יוֹמֵי מִי קָא מָלְיָא?
human_translation: It should not enter your mind as it is written: “And the people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the month” And if enters your mind that had not grown at all could it have reached full growth in five days?
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעָם עָלוּ מִן הַיַּרְדֵּן בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ״, וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלָא עָיֵיל כְּלָל — בְּחַמְשָׁה יוֹמֵי מִי קָא מָלְיָא?" English translation: "Not according to your opinion, as it is written: 'And the people went up from the Jordan on the tenth of the month,' and if not according to your opinion that it does not include at all — in five days, who is speaking?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, דְּעָיֵיל רִבְעָא אוֹ דַנְקָא? אַכַּתִּי בְּחַמְשָׁה יוֹמֵי מִי קָא מָלְיָא! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר: ״אֶרֶץ צְבִי״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ — הָכָא נָמֵי: ״אֶרֶץ צְבִי״ כְּתִיב בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what That had reached one quarter or one-sixth [ danka ] still Could have reached full growth in five days? Rather, what have you to say? it is written: “The land of the deer” Here, too, “the land of the deer” is written
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason that it requires a quarter or a half? For in five days who would fill it up! Rather, what can you say: "A land of beauty" is written in it — here too: "A land of beauty" is written in it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּהַאי ״אָסִיף״ קָצִיר הוּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״בְּאׇסְפְּךָ מִגׇּרְנְךָ וּמִיִּקְבֶךָ״, וְאָמַר מָר: בִּפְסוֹלֶת גּוֹרֶן וְיֶקֶב הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina strongly objects to How can you say this “gathering” means harvesting? But isn’t it written: after you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress” and the Master said The verse speaks of the waste of the threshing floor and the winepress,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Chanina raised an objection: Did you find that this term "asif" refers to a harvest? But it is written: "When you gather in your harvest from your threshing floor and your winepress," and the Master said: The Scripture speaks of the produce of the threshing floor and winepress!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָא מִילְּתָא הֲוַאי בִּידַן, וַאֲתָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא שְׁדָא בַּיהּ נַרְגָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said This matter was in our hands, but Rabbi Ḥanina came and cast an axe upon it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: This matter was in our hands, and then Rabbi Chanina came and threw a light upon it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מְנָלַן? כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר: ״וְעָשָׂת אֶת הַתְּבוּאָה לִשְׁלֹשׁ הַשָּׁנִים״,
human_translation: Rather, from where do we As it is taught Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says: “And it shall bring forth fruit for the three years”
llm_translation: Rather, from where do we derive this? As it was taught: Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says, "And you shall make the produce for three years,"

hebrew_text: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״לִשְׁלֹשׁ״, אֶלָּא ״לִשְׁלִישׁ״.
human_translation: do not read “for three [ lishelosh ]” but For one-third [ lishelish ].
llm_translation: Do not read "lishlosh," rather "lishlish."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״וּזְרַעְתֶּם אֵת הַשָּׁנָה הַשְּׁמִינִית וַאֲכַלְתֶּם מִן הַתְּבוּאָה יָשָׁן עַד הַשָּׁנָה הַתְּשִׁיעִית״.
human_translation: But is necessary for itself, It is written in another verse: “And you shall sow the eighth year, and eat yet of old produce until the ninth year”
llm_translation: And this requires for itself! It is written in another verse: "And you shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the old produce until the ninth year."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הָאוֹרֶז וְהַדּוֹחַן וְהַפְּרָגִין וְהַשּׁוּמְשְׁמִין שֶׁהִשְׁרִישׁוּ לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשֶׁעָבַר, וּמוּתָּרִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. וְאִם לָאו — אֲסוּרִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: We learned there: Rice, millet, poppy, and sesame that took root before Rosh HaShana are tithed in accordance with the outgoing and they are permitted a Sabbatical Year. If not they are prohibited the Sabbatical Year, and they are tithed in accordance with the incoming year.
llm_translation: We learned there: Rice, millet, lentils, and sesame seeds that were planted before Rosh Hashanah are tithed for the previous year, and are permitted in the seventh year. And if not — they are forbidden in the seventh year, and are tithed for the following year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: אִילָן בָּתַר חֲנָטָה, תְּבוּאָה וְזֵיתִים בָּתַר שְׁלִישׁ, יָרָק בָּתַר לְקִיטָה. הָנֵי כְּמַאן שַׁוִּינְהוּ רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Rabba said: the Sages said a tree follows the formation grain and olives follows one-third vegetables follows picking. these to what did the Sages equate them?
llm_translation: Rabah said, the Sages say: A tree after a fence, grain and olives after a third year, vegetables after gathering. Who are these Sages who established this?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַבָּה: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁעֲשׂוּיִין פְּרָכִין פְּרָכִין, אָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר הַשְׁרָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabba then said: since they ripen little by little the Sages follows taking root,
llm_translation: Rabah said: Because they are made as partitions, the Rabbis went after the root.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְיִצְבּוֹר גּוֹרְנוֹ לְתוֹכוֹ, וְנִמְצָא תּוֹרֵם מִן הֶחָדָשׁ שֶׁבּוֹ עַל הֶחָדָשׁ שֶׁבּוֹ, מִן הַיָּשָׁן שֶׁבּוֹ עַל הַיָּשָׁן שֶׁבּוֹ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Let one pile his threshing floor, into it, and it will turn out that he has set aside teruma from the new in for the new in it, from the old in for the old in it.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: and a pit his threshing floor to within it, and it is found a kernel from the new that is upon the new that is upon it, from the old that is upon the old that is upon it!

hebrew_text: מִי לָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי: פּוֹל הַמִּצְרִי שֶׁזְּרָעוֹ לְזֶרַע, מִקְצָתוֹ הִשְׁרִישׁ לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּמִקְצָתוֹ הִשְׁרִישׁ לְאַחַר רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — אֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין לֹא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ עַל הַיָּשָׁן וְלֹא מִן הַיָּשָׁן עַל הֶחָדָשׁ.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri: cowpea was planted for seed, some took HaShana, one may not set aside teruma or tithes from this for that, as one may not set aside teruma or tithes from the new for the old or from the old for the new.
llm_translation: Who taught this? Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri: "If an Egyptian seed was sown for seed, some of it took root before Rosh Hashanah, and some of it took root after Rosh Hashanah - we do not tithe and separate tithes from one upon the other, because we do not tithe and separate tithes neither from the new upon the old nor from the old upon the new."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — צוֹבֵר גּוֹרְנוֹ לְתוֹכוֹ, וְנִמְצָא תּוֹרֵם וּמְעַשֵּׂר מִן הֶחָדָשׁ שֶׁבּוֹ עַל הֶחָדָשׁ שֶׁבּוֹ, וּמִן הַיָּשָׁן שֶׁבּוֹ עַל הַיָּשָׁן שֶׁבּוֹ.
human_translation: How, should one act He should pile his threshing floor, into it, and it will turn out that he has set aside teruma and tithes from the new in for the new in it, and from the old for the old in it.
llm_translation: How does one do it? He forms a silo and finds it full, and separates and tithes from the new grain in it on the new grain in it, and from the old grain in it on the old grain in it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי קָאָמְרַתְּ? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי סָבַר יֵשׁ בִּילָּה.
human_translation: said to You are speaking of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? Rabbi Shimon Shezuri holds there is mixing.
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, are you saying? Rabbi Shimon Shezuri holds that there is bila.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי אֵין בִּילָּה.
human_translation: But the Sages hold there is no mixing;
llm_translation: And the Rabbis hold: There is no Bilah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לַכֹּל אֵין בִּילָּה, חוּץ מִיַּיִן וָשֶׁמֶן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani said Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar that he said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri. Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this: And did Shmuel say this? But didn’t Shmuel say: There is no mixing for anything except for wine, oil,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani said Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri. Rabbi Zeira objected to him: Did Shmuel really say this? But Shmuel said: For everything there is no mixing, except for wine and oil!

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר גְּמַר פֶּרִי.
human_translation: forgot that which Shmuel said: In all follows the full ripening of the produce.
llm_translation: His wife, this that Samuel said: everything goes after the completion of the fruit.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר יֵשׁ בִּילָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: לַכֹּל אֵין בִּילָּה.
human_translation: necessary as had taught us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, I would have said due to that he holds there is mixing he teaches us there is no mixing for anything
llm_translation: The question is: if we were to hear a halakha according to Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, I would say: because he holds that there is bila, he is teaching us: for everyone there is no bila.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן לַכֹּל אֵין בִּילָּה — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי.
human_translation: And had taught us there is no mixing for anything I would have said he holds like the Sages he teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear for everyone, there is no night - I would say: Like the Rabbis, he holds, it is heard for us: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon Shezuri.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: קַשְׁיָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר גְּמַר פֶּרִי.
human_translation: And had taught us these two I would have said difficult of Shmuel with of Shmuel. he teaches us in all follows the full ripening of the produce,
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two - I would say: the difficulty of Shmuel is the difficulty, he is teaching us: everything follows the completion of the fruit.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הַכֹּל הוֹלֵךְ אַחַר גְּמַר פֶּרִי — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ תְּבוּאָה וְזֵיתִים נָמֵי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֵׁזוּרִי בְּמַאי דִּפְלִיג.
human_translation: And had taught us in all follows the full ripening of the produce, I would have said even grain and olives. he teaches us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri with regard to his dispute
llm_translation: And if we were to hear that everything follows the completion of the fruit - I would say: even grain and olives also - it teaches us: the halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon Shezuri in the matter in which he disputes.

hebrew_text: וְלַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, לַכֹּל אֵין בִּילָּה לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דִּלְיַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן יֵשׁ בִּילָּה.
human_translation: But let him teach us these two Why do I there is no mixing for anything? This teach us that there is mixing for wine, oil,
llm_translation: And to hear those two, for all there is no need for me? This is what it implies to us, that wine and oil have a need.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּאׇסְפְּךָ מִגׇּרְנְךָ וּמִיִּקְבֶךָ״, מָה גּוֹרֶן וָיֶקֶב מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל מֵי שָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה, וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה, אַף כֹּל שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל מֵי שָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה — מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה. יָצְאוּ יְרָקוֹת שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל מֵי שָׁנָה הַבָּאָה, וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: “After you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress” just as threshing floor and winepress are special in that they grow on the outgoing year’s water, and they are tithed in accordance with the outgoing year, so too, anything that grows on the outgoing year’s water is tithed in accordance with the outgoing year. exclude vegetables, which grow on the incoming year’s water, they are tithed in accordance with the incoming year.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says, "When you gather from your threshing floor and winepress," just as a threshing floor and winepress are distinct in that they separate from the previous year's produce and are tithed for the previous year, so too, all produce that separates from the previous year's produce is tithed for the previous year. Vegetables that grow from the water of the coming year, however, are tithed for the coming year.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״בְּאׇסְפְּךָ מִגׇּרְנְךָ וּמִיִּקְבֶךָ״, מָה גּוֹרֶן וְיֶקֶב מְיוּחָדִין שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל רוֹב מַיִם, וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה, אַף כֹּל שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל רוֹב מַיִם — מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה. יָצְאוּ יְרָקוֹת שֶׁגְּדֵילִין עַל כׇּל מַיִם, וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “After you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your winepress”; just as threshing floor and winepress are special in that they grow on most water, and they are tithed in accordance with the outgoing year, so too, anything that grows on most water is tithed in accordance with the outgoing year. exclude vegetables, which grow on all water, are tithed in accordance with the incoming year.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "When you gather in from your threshing floor and from your winepress," just as a threshing floor and a winepress are distinct in that they are elevated above most of the water, and are tithed for the past year, so too, anything that is elevated above most of the water - is tithed for the past year. Vegetables that are elevated above all water, are tithed for the coming year.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בְּצָלִים הַסָּרִיסִין וּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. דִּתְנַן: בְּצָלִים הַסָּרִיסִין וּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי שֶׁמָּנַע מֵהֶן מַיִם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשֶׁעָבַר וּמוּתָּרִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וְאִם לָאו — אֲסוּרִין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית וּמִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: What is between Rabbi Abbahu said: There is between them seedless onions and cowpeas, as we learned Seedless onions, and cowpea from which one withheld water for thirty days before Rosh HaShana, are tithed in accordance with the outgoing year, and they are permitted the Sabbatical Year. And if not, they are prohibited the Sabbatical Year, and they are tithed in accordance with the incoming year.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Avahu said: In the case of Egyptian onions and Egyptian garlic, there is a difference between them. For we learned in a Mishnah: Egyptian onions and Egyptian garlic, if one withholds water from them for thirty days before Rosh Hashanah, they are tithed for the previous year and permitted in the seventh year. But if not, they are forbidden in the seventh year and tithed for the following year.

hebrew_text: בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לָאִילָן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הוֹאִיל וְיָצְאוּ רוֹב גִּשְׁמֵי שָׁנָה, וַעֲדַיִין רוֹב תְּקוּפָה מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: On the first of Shevat is the new year for trees, What is the reason Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: since most of the year’s rains have fallen, and most of the season, is yet to come,
llm_translation: On the first of Shevat is the New Year for the tree. What is the reason? Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Oshaya: Since most of the rainy season has passed, yet most of the solar year is still outside.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרוֹב תְּקוּפָה מִבַּחוּץ, הוֹאִיל וְיָצְאוּ רוֹב גִּשְׁמֵי שָׁנָה.
human_translation: What is he saying? This is what he said: Even though most of the season is yet to come, since most of year’s rains have fallen,
llm_translation: What is he saying? This is what he is saying: Even though most of the equinox is from the outside, since most of the rains of the year have already fallen.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁלִּיקֵּט אֶתְרוֹג בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט וְנָהַג בּוֹ שְׁנֵי עִישּׂוּרִין,
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving Rabbi Akiva, who picked an etrog on the first of Shevat and set aside two tithes.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving Rabbi Akiva, who picked an etrog on the first of Shevat and used it for two weeks.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְאֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: One in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai and one in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel
llm_translation: One like the words of Beit Shammai, and one like the words of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִנְהַג בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָהַג בָּהּ, אֶלָּא מִנְהַג רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָהַג בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: He did not act with the practices of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. Rather, he acted with the practices of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Not the custom of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel practiced in it, rather the custom of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer practiced in it.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים, וְלַיָּרָק בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד. שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּרָכִים: לְעׇרְלָה וְלִרְבָעִי וְלִשְׁבִיעִית וּלְיָרָק בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶחָד — שֶׁבִּשְׁעַת לְקִיטָתוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: As we learned etrog is like tree in three ways and like a vegetable in one way. It is like tree in three ways: With regard to orla , with regard to fourth-year produce, and with regard to the Sabbatical Year, And a vegetable in one way, that its tithe the time of the picking the statement of Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: An etrog is comparable to a tree in three ways, and to a vegetable in one way. Comparable to a tree in three ways: for the laws of orlah (prohibition against eating the fruit of a newly planted tree for the first three years), revai (the fourth-year fruit), and shemittah (the seventh-year produce), and to a vegetable in one way - that at the time of its picking, its growth has ceased. These are the words of Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶתְרוֹג שָׁוֶה לָאִילָן לְכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The etrog is like a tree with regard to all matters,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: An etrog is comparable to a tree in every way.

hebrew_text: וּמִי עָבְדִינַן כִּתְרֵי חוּמְרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: לְעוֹלָם הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, וְהָרוֹצֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — עוֹשֶׂה. כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל — עוֹשֶׂה. מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית הִלֵּל — רָשָׁע. מֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַכְּסִיל בַּחֹשֶׁךְ הוֹלֵךְ״. אֶלָּא: אִי כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — בְּקוּלֵּיהוֹן וּבְחוּמְרֵיהוֹן. אִי כְּבֵית הִלֵּל — בְּקוּלֵּיהוֹן וּבְחוּמְרֵיהוֹן.
human_translation: But do we adopt the stringencies of two Isn’t it taught halakha is always in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, but one who wishes to act in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai may do so, in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel may do so. the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the leniencies of Beit Hillel, a wicked person. the stringencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, with regard to him the verse states: “The fool walks in darkness” Rather, either in accordance with Beit Shammai, their leniencies and their stringencies, or in accordance with Beit Hillel, their leniencies and their stringencies.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who do we follow, the leniencies of the House of Hillel or the stringencies? And it was taught: Always the halakha is according to the words of the House of Hillel, and one who wants to act according to the words of the House of Shammai may do so. According to the words of the House of Hillel, one may act. From the leniencies of the House of Shammai and the leniencies of the House of Hillel - he is wicked. From the stringencies of the House of Shammai and the stringencies of the House of Hillel - the verse says about him: "And the fool walks in darkness." Rather, if like the House of Shammai - in their leniencies and their stringencies. If like the House of Hillel - in their leniencies and their stringencies.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא גְּמָרֵיהּ אִסְתַּפַּק לֵיהּ, וְלָא יְדַע אִי בֵּית הִלֵּל בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט אוֹמֵר, אִי בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva was in doubt about his tradition and did not know whether Beit Hillel said on the first of Shevat or said on the fifteenth of Shevat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva concluded his learning, and he did not know whether Beit Hillel says on the first of Shevat or on the fifteenth of Shevat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִנְהַג בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָהַג בָּהּ, אֶלָּא מִנְהַג רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָהַג בָּהּ. בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט — כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי נָהַג בָּהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: He did not act with the practices of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel; rather, he acted with the practices of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer. on the first of Shevat, he acted in accordance with Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Not the custom of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel was practiced in it, rather the custom of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer was practiced in it. On the first of Shevat - Beit Shammai practiced in it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא: הָכָא בְּאֶתְרוֹג שֶׁחָנְטוּ פֵּירוֹתָיו קוֹדֶם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר דְּאִידַּךְ שְׁבָט עָסְקִינַן. וּבְדִין הוּא אֲפִילּוּ קוֹדֶם לָכֵן, וּמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה כָּךְ הָיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said, and some say Rabbi Ḥananya Here we are dealing with an etrog whose fruit was formed prior to the fifteenth of the other, Shevat, And by right it even earlier, but the incident that took place, took place in this way,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina, and some say Rabbi Chananya: Here, in the case of an etrog whose fruits were plucked before the fifteenth of the month of Tishrei, whereas in the other case we are dealing with a staff. And it is a valid ruling even if it was before that time, and the incident was as follows, it was so.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר, כְּרוֹךְ וּתְנִי: לֹא אֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט הָיָה — אֶלָּא חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט הָיָה, וְלֹא מִנְהַג בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָהַג בָּהּ — אֶלָּא מִנְהַג רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָהַג בָּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Combine and teach It was not on the first of Shevat but on the fifteenth of Shevat, and he did not act with the practices Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel, but rather, he acted with the practices Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Ravinah said, "Tie it and teach: Not one tribe was there - rather fifteen tribes were there, and it was not the custom of Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel to practice it - rather the custom of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Eliezer practiced it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֶתְרוֹג אַחַר לְקִיטָתוֹ עִישּׂוּרוֹ כְּיָרָק, רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלּוֹ תִּשְׁרִי.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Now that Rabban Gamliel has said the tithe of an etrog the time of the picking like a vegetable, its new year is Tishrei,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Now that Rabban Gamliel said, "An etrog after its plucking is as bitter as a vegetable," his Rosh Hashanah is in Tishrei.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לִיקֵּט אֶתְרוֹג עֶרֶב חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט עַד שֶׁלֹּא תָּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ, וְחָזַר וְלִיקֵּט מִשֶּׁתָּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ — אֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין מִזֶּה עַל זֶה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תּוֹרְמִין וּמְעַשְּׂרִין לֹא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ עַל הַיָּשָׁן וְלֹא מִן הַיָּשָׁן עַל הֶחָדָשׁ. הָיְתָה שְׁלִישִׁית נִכְנֶסֶת לִרְבִיעִית — שְׁלִישִׁית מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי, רְבִיעִית מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: one picked an etrog on the eve of the fifteenth of Shevat before the sun had set, and he picked more after sunset, one may not set aside teruma and tithes from the one for the other, as one may not set aside teruma and tithes from the new for the old or from the old for the new. was the third going into the fourth the third first tithe and poor man’s tithe, the fourth year first tithe and second tithe.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One may pick an etrog on the eve of the fifteenth of Shevat before sunset, and if he goes back and picks it after sunset, one may not tithe and separate tithes from one upon the other, because one may not tithe and separate tithes neither from the new produce onto the old nor from the old onto the new. If a third of the fruit entered the fourth year, the third is tithed as the first tithe and the fourth is tithed as the second tithe.

hebrew_text: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר לְקִיטָה — רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְקָתָנֵי שְׁבָט!
human_translation: Whom did you hear that follows picking Rabban Gamliel. And is teaching Shevat,
llm_translation: One who heard that he went after gathering - Rabban Gamliel, and the verses of the staff!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֶתְרוֹג אַחַר לְקִיטָה כְּיָרָק — רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלּוֹ שְׁבָט.
human_translation: Rather, if this was said, it was said as follows: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Even though Rabban Gamliel said an etrog follows picking like a vegetable, its new year is Shevat,
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Even though Rabban Gamliel said, "One may take another etrog after picking it like a vegetable," his Rosh Hashanah is the first of Shevat.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּקָתָנֵי ״אִם הָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה נִכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁלִישִׁית״ וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״אִם הָיְתָה שְׁלִישִׁית נִכְנֶסֶת לִרְבִיעִית״?
human_translation: What is different there, that it teaches it was the second going into the third and what is different here, that it teaches it was the third going into the fourth
llm_translation: What is the difference there, that it teaches "if the second entered into the third," and what is the difference here, that it teaches "if the third entered into the fourth"?

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא אַגַּב אוֹרְחֵיהּ קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאֶתְרוֹג קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ יְדָא וְאַיְּידֵי דִּמְמַשְׁמְשִׁי בֵּיהּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בִּשְׁבִיעִית, לָא טָעֵין פֵּרֵי עַד תְּלָת שְׁנִין.
human_translation: It teaches us a matter in passing, that it is damaging etrog is handled, and since everyone handles it in the Sabbatical Year, does not bear fruit for three years.
