llm_translation: The matter, due to his way, is heard by us, that a hard radish is given to him in hand, and since all the world makes use of it on the seventh day, they do not taste the fruit until three years.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵרַבִּי יַנַּאי: אֶתְרוֹג, רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁלּוֹ אֵימָתַי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁבָט. שְׁבָט דָּחֳדָשִׁים, אוֹ שְׁבָט דִּתְקוּפָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּחֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan inquired of Rabbi Yannai: an etrog , when is its new year? said to him: Shevat. the lunar month of Shevat or the Shevat season, said to him: the lunar month
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yochanan from Rabbi Yannai: His etrog, when is its head of the year? He said to him: Shevat. Shevat of the new moons, or Shevat of the equinox? He said to him: Of the new moons.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵרַבִּי יַנַּאי: הָיְתָה שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Rava inquired of Rav Naḥman, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan of Rabbi Yannai: If it was a leap year, what is He said to him: Follow the majority of years.
llm_translation: Requested from him Rava from Rav Nachman, and some say to him Rabbi Yochanan from Rabbi Yannai: "If a year was pregnant, what is the law?" He said to him: "Follow the majority of years."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: אֶתְרוֹג בַּת שִׁשִּׁית שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִשְׁבִיעִית — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַבִּיעוּר. וּבַת שְׁבִיעִית שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִשְׁמִינִית — פְּטוּרָה בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר וְחַיֶּיבֶת בַּבִּיעוּר.
human_translation: Rabba said: An etrog from the sixth that entered into, the Sabbatical Year is exempt from tithes, and is exempt from elimination A Sabbatical Year that entered into, the eighth is exempt from tithes but is subject to elimination
llm_translation: Rabah said: An etrog from the sixth year that entered the seventh year - exempt from tithing and exempt from biur. And a daughter of the seventh year that entered the eighth year - exempt from tithing and obligated in biur.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא סֵיפָא — לְחוּמְרָא, אֶלָּא רֵישָׁא פְּטוּרָה מִן הַבִּיעוּר — אַמַּאי? דְּאָמְרִינַן זִיל בָּתַר חֲנָטָה, אִי הָכִי תִּיחַיַּיב בְּמַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Granted, the latter clause stringent the first clause, is exempt from elimination, why that we say follow the formation if so, it should be subject to tithes.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: In truth, the latter part - for stringency, but the former part is exempt from bi'ur - why? For we say, "Go after the majority," if so, he should be liable for tithing!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יַד הַכֹּל מְמַשְׁמְשִׁין בָּהּ, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ תִּיחַיַּיב בְּמַעֲשֵׂר?!
human_translation: said to him: Everyone’s hand is touching it, and you say that it should be subject to tithes?
llm_translation: He said to him: "The hand of all benefits from it, and you say you are obligated in tithing?!"

hebrew_text: וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: בַּת שִׁשִּׁית שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁבִיעִית — לְעוֹלָם שִׁשִּׁית, וּבַת שְׁבִיעִית הַנִּכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁמִינִית — לְעוֹלָם שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: from the sixth that entered into, the Sabbatical Year is always sixth-year And from the Sabbatical Year that entered into, the eighth is always Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: A daughter of the sixth year who enters the seventh year - she remains forever considered sixth, and a daughter of the seventh year who enters the eighth year - she remains forever considered seventh.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֶתְרוֹג בַּת שִׁשִּׁית שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁבִיעִית — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַבִּיעוּר, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּמַעֲשֵׂר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גָּדַל בְּחִיּוּב וְנִלְקַט בְּחִיּוּב. וּבַת שְׁבִיעִית שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת לִשְׁמִינִית — פְּטוּרָה מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַבִּיעוּר, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּבִיעוּר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גָּדַל בִּשְׁבִיעִית וְנִלְקַט בִּשְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: An etrog from the sixth that entered into, the Sabbatical Year is exempt from tithes, and it is exempt from elimination as there is nothing that is subject to tithes unless it grew at obligation and was picked obligation. from the Sabbatical Year that entered into, the eighth is exempt from tithes, and it is exempt from elimination, as nothing is subject to elimination unless it grew in the Sabbatical Year and was picked in the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: A citron that enters the seventh year while still attached to the sixth year is exempt from tithing and exempt from the removal of the second tithe, for you have nothing that is obligated in tithing unless it grew in the obligation and was harvested in the obligation. And a citron that enters the eighth year while still attached to the seventh year is exempt from tithing and exempt from the removal of the second tithe, for you have nothing that is obligated in the removal of the second tithe unless it grew in the seventh year and was harvested in the seventh year.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא קַשְׁיָא לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, סֵיפָא קַשְׁיָא בֵּין לְרַבָּה בֵּין לְרַב הַמְנוּנָא!
human_translation: The first clause a difficulty to Rav Hamnuna, the latter clause a difficulty to both Rabba and Rav Hamnuna,
llm_translation: The beginning is difficult for Rav Hamnuna, the end is difficult both for Rabba and for Rav Hamnuna!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אַבְטוּלְמוֹס הֵעִיד מִשּׁוּם חֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים: אֶתְרוֹג — אַחַר לְקִיטָתוֹ לְמַעֲשֵׂר, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ נִמְנוּ בְּאוּשָׁא, וְאָמְרוּ: אַחַר לְקִיטָתוֹ, בֵּין לְמַעֲשֵׂר בֵּין לִשְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: Avtolemos testified in the name of five Elders: An etrog follows its picking in tithes. But our Sages voted in Usha and said follows its picking, both in tithes and in the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said, Avtulmos testified on behalf of five elders: the etrog - after its picking for tithing, and our Rabbis were counted in the fire, and they said: after its picking, whether for tithing or for the seventh year.

hebrew_text: שְׁבִיעִית מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמֵיהּ?
human_translation: Who mentioned anything about the Sabbatical Year?
llm_translation: Seventh, who remembers his name?

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֶתְרוֹג — אַחַר לְקִיטָתוֹ לְמַעֲשֵׂר וְאַחַר חֲנָטָה לִשְׁבִיעִית. וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ נִמְנוּ בְּאוּשָׁא: אַחַר לְקִיטָתוֹ, בֵּין לְמַעֲשֵׂר בֵּין לִשְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching the following: An etrog follows its picking in tithes and the formation in the Sabbatical Year. But our Sages voted in Usha follows its picking, both tithes and in the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasra ve'hachi katanei: Etrog — achar le'kitato le'maaser ve'achar chanatah lishvi'it. Ve'raboteinu nimnu be'usha: achar le'kitato, bein le'maaser bein lishvi'it." Translation: "The citrons that are lacking, and thus it was taught: An etrog — after its picking for tithing, and after its tying for the seventh year. And our Rabbis counted them in Usha: after its picking, whether for tithing or for the seventh year."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֶתְרוֹג בַּת שִׁשִּׁית שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִשְׁבִיעִית — לְעוֹלָם שִׁשִּׁית. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֶתְרוֹג בַּת שִׁשִּׁית שֶׁנִּכְנְסָה לִשְׁבִיעִית, אֲפִילּוּ כְּזַיִת וְנַעֲשֵׂית כִּכָּר — חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם טֶבֶל.
human_translation: It was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: An etrog from the sixth that entered into, the Sabbatical Year is always sixth-year When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A sixth-year etrog that entered into, the Sabbatical Year, an olive-bulk and it grew to the size of a loaf he is liable for untithed produce.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: If an etrog from the sixth year enters the seventh year - it is always considered as from the sixth year. When Ravin came, he said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If an etrog from the sixth year enters the seventh year, even if it grows to the size of a kor - one is obligated regarding it due to the laws of tithing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִילָן שֶׁחָנְטוּ פֵּירוֹתָיו קוֹדֶם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט — מִתְעַשֵּׂר לְשָׁנָה שֶׁעָבְרָה, אַחַר חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט — מִתְעַשֵּׂר לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה. אָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּאִילָן שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה שְׁתֵּי בְרִיכוֹת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught A tree whose fruits were formed before the fifteenth of Shevat is tithed in accordance with the previous year, after the fifteenth of Shevat is tithed in accordance with the coming year. Rabbi Neḥemya said: In what is this statement said? with regard to a tree that produces two broods, in a year.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A tree whose fruits ripened before the fifteenth of Shevat - one tithes for the past year; after the fifteenth of Shevat - one tithes for the coming year. Rabbi Nechemiah said: In what case are these words said? In the case of a tree that produces two crops in a year.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּי בְרִיכוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּעֵין שְׁתֵּי בְרִיכוֹת.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind two broods? Rather, say: Like two broods,
llm_translation: Two pools, what is your opinion? Rather say: Like two pools.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִילָן הָעוֹשֶׂה בְּרִיכָה אַחַת, כְּגוֹן דְּקָלִים וְזֵיתִים וְחָרוּבִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָנְטוּ פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן קוֹדֶם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט — מִתְעַשְּׂרִין לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: But trees that produce one brood for example, palm and olive and carob although their fruit took form before the fifteenth of Shevat, they are tithed in accordance with the coming year,
llm_translation: But a tree that produces one pool, such as palm trees, olive trees, and carob trees, even though their fruits ripened before the fifteenth of Shevat - one tithes for the following year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נָהֲגוּ הָעָם בֶּחָרוּבִין כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The people were accustomed with regard to carobs in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: The people have accustomed themselves with carobs like Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּנוֹת שׁוּחַ — שְׁבִיעִית שֶׁלָּהֶן שְׁנִיָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעוֹשׂוֹת לִשְׁלֹשׁ הַשָּׁנִים!
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan white fig Sabbatical Year for them second due to grows for three years,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: The daughters of Shuach - their seventh year is their second, because they engage in marital relations for three years!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא הַכֹּהֵן לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן: אַמַּאי אִישְׁתִּיק? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי רַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: was silent Rabbi Abba the priest said to Rabbi Yosei the priest: Why was silent? He should have said to I am speaking to you of Rabbi Neḥemya, and you say to me the Rabbis?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ishtik." Rabbi Abba the Kohen said to Rabbi Yosei the Kohen: Why did he remain silent? Let him say to him: I believe you, Rabbi Nechemyah, and you call me a Rabbi?!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁבְקַתְּ רַבָּנַן וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה?!
human_translation: because would have said to him: Do you abandon the Rabbis, and act in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya,
llm_translation: Because he said to her: "You have abandoned the Rabbis and acted like Rabbi Nechemiah?!"

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ ״נָהֲגוּ״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי אִיסּוּרָא?! דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּמְקוֹם אִיסּוּרָא, כִּי נָהֲגוּ שָׁבְקִינַן לְהוּ?!
human_translation: should have said to him: I am speaking to you practice and you say to me prohibition? because would have said to him: Where there is a prohibition, if they were accustomed to act would we leave them
llm_translation: And say to him: I am saying to you "they have accustomed," and you are saying to me prohibition?! For he said to him: In a place of prohibition, when they have accustomed, do we leave them?!

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: כִּי אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא — מַעֲשֵׂר חָרוּבִין דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי שְׁבִיעִית דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא?!
human_translation: should have said to I am speaking to you about the tithe of carobs, which is rabbinic and you speak to me the Sabbatical Year, by Torah law?
llm_translation: And say to him: If I believe you - a tithe of carobs of the Rabbis, and you say to me the seventh year of the Torah?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא הַכֹּהֵן: תְּמֵיהַנִי אִם הֱשִׁיבָהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לִתְשׁוּבָה זוֹ. אִם הֱשִׁיבָהּ? הָא אוֹתְבַהּ! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אִם קִיבְּלָהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אִם לָא קִיבְּלָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba the priest said: I wonder whether Reish Lakish raised this original objection Whether he asked it? But he did ask it, Rather, say: if Rabbi Yoḥanan accepted or he did not accept it
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba the Kohen said: It amazes me if Reish Lakish responded to this repentance. If he responded? But he was stubborn! Rather, I say: If Rabbi Yochanan accepted it, if not, he did not accept it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים הָעוֹלָם נִידּוֹן: בַּפֶּסַח — עַל הַתְּבוּאָה, בַּעֲצֶרֶת — עַל פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — כׇּל בָּאֵי עוֹלָם עוֹבְרִין לְפָנָיו כִּבְנֵי מָרוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַיּוֹצֵר יַחַד לִבָּם הַמֵּבִין אֶל כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם״, וּבֶחָג נִידּוֹנִין עַל הַמַּיִם.
human_translation: At four times the world is judged: On Passover concerning grain; on Shavuot concerning fruits a tree; on Rosh HaShana all creatures pass before Him like sheep [ benei maron ], as it is stated: “He Who fashions their hearts alike, Who considers all their deeds” and on the festival they are judged concerning water,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: In four periods the world is judged: On Passover - regarding the produce, on Shavuot - regarding the fruits of the tree, on Rosh Hashanah - all who come into the world pass before Him like bnei Maron, as it is stated: "He who fashions their hearts alike, He who understands all their deeds." And on Sukkot, judgment is passed regarding water.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵי תְּבוּאָה? אִילֵּימָא הָא תְּבוּאָה דְּקָיְימָא, כׇּל הָנֵי הַרְפַּתְקֵי דַּעֲדוֹ עֲלַהּ אֵימַת אִיתְּדוּן? אֶלָּא תְּבוּאָה דְּמִזְדַּרְעָא.
human_translation: Which grain If we say the grain that is standing when was judgment passed with regard to all those events [ harpatkei ] Rather, grain that will be sown
llm_translation: Gemara: Is there such a thing as "tevua"? If you say that the tevua that is mentioned, all these difficulties that were said about it, when will they come about? Rather, it is the tevua of Mizdar'a.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּחַד דִּינָא מִתַּדְנָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: תְּבוּאָה שֶׁאֵירַע בָּהּ קֶרִי אוֹ אוֹנֶס, קוֹדֶם הַפֶּסַח — נִידּוֹנֶית לְשֶׁעָבַר, לְאַחַר הַפֶּסַח — נִידּוֹנֶית לְהַבָּא. אָדָם שֶׁאֵירַע בּוֹ קֶרִי אוֹ אוֹנֶס, קוֹדֶם יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — נִידּוֹן לְשֶׁעָבַר, לְאַחַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — נִידּוֹן לְהַבָּא.
human_translation: Is this to say that one judgment is passed But isn’t it taught grain suffers an incident or accident before Passover, it was judged in the past, after Passover, it was judged for the future. a person suffered an incident or accident before Yom Kippur, he was judged in the past, after Yom Kippur, he was judged for the future.
llm_translation: In the matter of one judgment is established? And it was taught: If a seminal emission occurred due to a nocturnal emission or coercion, before Passover — he is judged for the past; after Passover — he is judged for the future. If a man had a seminal emission due to a nocturnal emission or coercion, before Yom Kippur — he is judged for the past; after Yom Kippur — he is judged for the future.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּרֵי דִינֵי מִתַּדְנָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, כִּי חָזֵי אִינָשׁ דְּמַצְלַח זַרְעָא אַפְלָא — לִיקַדֵּים וְלִיזְרַע חָרְפָא. דְּעַד דְּמָטֵי לְמֵדַיְינֵיהּ — קָדֵים סָלֵיק.
human_translation: Rava said: Learn from here two judgments are passed Abaye said: Therefore, if a person sees that slow-growing crops, are doing well, he should quickly sow fast-growing crops, as before it is brought to judgment it will already have grown,
llm_translation: Rava said: Learn from it, two laws from Midna. Abaye said: Therefore, when one sees that his seed is successful, let him sow and let him plant disgrace. Until his enemies fall - he should rise early.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבִּי נָתָן.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? not Rabbi Meir, and not Rabbi Yehuda, and not Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabbi Natan.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of this Mishnah? Not Rabbi Meir, and not Rabbi Yehuda, and not Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַכֹּל נִידּוֹנִים בָּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁלָּהֶם נֶחְתָּם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַכֹּל נִידּוֹנִין בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁלָּהֶם נֶחְתָּם כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד בִּזְמַנּוֹ: בַּפֶּסַח — עַל הַתְּבוּאָה, בַּעֲצֶרֶת — עַל פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן, בֶּחָג נִידּוֹנִין עַל הַמַּיִם. וְאָדָם נִידּוֹן בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁלּוֹ נֶחְתָּם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: As it is taught All are judged on Rosh HaShana, and their sentence is sealed on Yom Kippur; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: All are judged on Rosh HaShana, and their sentence is sealed each in its time: On Passover concerning grain; on Shavuot concerning fruits a tree; on the festival they are judged concerning water; and mankind is judged on Rosh HaShana, and the sentence is sealed on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All are judged on Rosh Hashanah, and their fate is sealed on Yom Kippur, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: All are judged on Rosh Hashanah, and each one's fate is sealed at its proper time: On Passover - concerning produce, on Shavuot - concerning the fruit of the tree, on Sukkot - concerning water. And a person is judged on Rosh Hashanah, and his fate is sealed on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אָדָם נִידּוֹן בְּכׇל יוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּפְקְדֶנּוּ לִבְקָרִים״. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אָדָם נִידּוֹן בְּכׇל שָׁעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִרְגָעִים תִּבְחָנֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A person is judged every day, as it is stated: “You visit him every morning” Rabbi Natan says: A person is judged every hour, as it is stated: “You try him every moment”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A person is judged every day, as it is stated: "And You visit him every morning." Rabbi Natan says: A person is judged every hour, as it is stated: "You examine him every moment."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְכִי קָתָנֵי מַתְנִיתִין — אַגְּזַר דִּין, אִי הָכִי — קַשְׁיָא אָדָם!
human_translation: And lest you say actually, is Rabbi Yehuda, and when the mishna is taught, the sentence, if so, difficult mankind,
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Indeed, it is always Rabbi Yehuda," but if the Mishnah teaches - it is a decree of law, if so - it is difficult for a person!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, בְּאַרְבָּעָה פְּרָקִים הָעוֹלָם נִידּוֹן: בַּפֶּסַח — עַל הַתְּבוּאָה, בַּעֲצֶרֶת — עַל פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן, בְּחָג נִידּוֹנִין עַל הַמַּיִם. וְאָדָם נִידּוֹן בָּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁלּוֹ נֶחְתָּם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְכִי קָתָנֵי מַתְנִיתִין — אַתְּחִלַּת דִּין.
human_translation: Rava said: The tanna is from the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as from the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: At four times the world is judged: On Passover concerning grain; on Shavuot concerning fruits a tree; on the festival they are judged concerning water; and mankind is judged on Rosh HaShana and the sentence is sealed on Yom Kippur. And when the mishna is taught, the beginning of the judgment
llm_translation: Rava said: This Mishna from the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The world is judged in four periods: On Passover - for the produce of the land, on Shavuot - for the fruits of the tree, on Sukkot - they are judged for water. And man is judged on Rosh Hashanah, and his decree is sealed on Yom Kippur. And when the Mishna teaches - the beginning of judgment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? כִּדְקָאָמַר טַעְמֵיהּ: ״וַתִּפְקְדֶנּוּ לִבְקָרִים״! אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי נָתָן? בְּחִינָה — עַיּוֹנֵי בְּעָלְמָא הִיא. פְּקִידָה נָמֵי עַיּוֹנֵי בְּעָלְמָא הִיא?!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei? He stated his reason, “You visit him every morning.” This is what we are saying: what is the reason that he did not state in accordance with Rabbi Natan trying merely examination visiting merely examination.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's opinion? As his reasoning is stated: "And You have appointed him over the cattle" (Psalms 8:7)! We thus say: What is the reason that he did not say like Rabbi Natan? In truth, it is a matter of the world's supervision. Is appointment also a matter of the world's supervision?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מֵהָכָא: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפַּט עַבְדּוֹ וּמִשְׁפַּט עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּבַר יוֹם בְּיוֹמוֹ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Yosei’s reason is from here, “To make the judgment of His servant and the judgment of His people Israel at all times, as each day may require”
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said: The reason for Rabbi Yosei is from here: "To do justice for his servant and for his people Israel, each day's matter in its day."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מֶלֶךְ וְצִבּוּר — מֶלֶךְ נִכְנָס תְּחִלָּה לַדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפַּט עַבְדּוֹ וּמִשְׁפַּט עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל״. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵיתַב מַלְכָּא אַבָּרַאי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיפּוֹשׁ חֲרוֹן אַף.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: a king and a community the king is brought in for judgment first, as it is stated: “To make the judgment of His servant,” “And the judgment of His people Israel.” What is the reason If you wish, say not proper conduct for the king to stand outside if you wish, say before anger intensifies
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisdah said: A king and the community - the king enters first for judgment, as it is stated: "To execute the judgment of His servants, and the judgment of His people Israel." What is the reason? If you wish, say: Is it not the way of the world for the king to sit first? And if you wish, say: Before one appeases the king's anger.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּמַאן מְצַלִּינַן הָאִידָּנָא אַקְּצִירֵי וְאַמְּרִיעֵי, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבָּנַן, וְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יָפָה צְעָקָה לָאָדָם בֵּין קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין בֵּין לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: In accordance with whose do we pray nowadays for the sick and afflicted? In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, And if you wish, say actually, in accordance with the Rabbis, also in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak. As Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Crying is beneficial for a person both before sentence and after sentence
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: In whose name do we pray for rain nowadays? For the cutting of crops and for the fruit trees, in whose name? In the name of Rabbi Yosei. And if you wish, say: We should always mention both the Rabbis and Rabbi Yitzchak. For Rabbi Yitzchak said: It is good for a person to cry out, whether before the decree is issued or after the decree is issued.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבִיאוּ עוֹמֶר בַּפֶּסַח — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַפֶּסַח זְמַן תְּבוּאָה הוּא, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הָבִיאוּ לְפָנַי עוֹמֶר בַּפֶּסַח, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּתְבָּרֵךְ לָכֶם תְּבוּאָה שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה הָבִיאוּ שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם בָּעֲצֶרֶת — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֲצֶרֶת זְמַן פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן הוּא, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הָבִיאוּ לְפָנַי שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם בַּעֲצֶרֶת, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ לָכֶם פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: For what the Torah say: Bring the omer on Passover? because Passover is the time of grain, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Bring the omer before Me on Passover so that the grain in the fields will be blessed for you. And for what the Torah say: Bring the two loaves on Shavuot ? because Shavuot is the time of fruits a tree, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Bring the two loaves before Me on Shavuot so that the fruits a tree will be blessed for you.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: For what reason did the Torah say to bring the Omer offering on Passover? Because Passover is the time of the grain harvest. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Bring the Omer offering before Me on Passover, so that the grain in the fields will be blessed for you. And for what reason did the Torah say to bring two loaves on Shavuot? Because Shavuot is the time of the fruit harvest. The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Bring the two loaves before Me on Shavuot, so that the fruit of the tree will be blessed for you.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה נַסְּכוּ מַיִם בֶּחָג — אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: נַסְּכוּ לְפָנַי מַיִם בֶּחָג, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְבָּרְכוּ לָכֶם גִּשְׁמֵי שָׁנָה. וְאִמְרוּ לְפָנַי בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מַלְכִיּוֹת זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת. מַלְכִיּוֹת — כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּמְלִיכוּנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, זִכְרוֹנוֹת — כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה זִכְרוֹנְיכֶם לְפָנַי לְטוֹבָה, וּבַמֶּה — בְּשׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: And for what the Torah say: Pour water on the festival The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Pour water before Me on the festival so that the rains of the year, will be blessed for you. And recite before Me on Rosh HaShana Kingships, Remembrances, and Shofarot : Kingships so that you will crown Me as King over you; Remembrances so that your remembrance will rise before Me for good; and with what with the shofar .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for what reason did the Torah say to pour water on the festival? — The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Pour water before Me on the festival, so that the rains of the year will be blessed for you. And say before Me on Rosh Hashanah kingship, remembrances, and shofars. Kingship — so that you will coronate Me over you, remembrances — so that your remembrances will come up before Me for good, and with what? — with the shofar." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לָמָה תּוֹקְעִין בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל אַיִל? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: תִּקְעוּ לְפָנַי בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל אַיִל, כְּדֵי שֶׁאֶזְכּוֹר לָכֶם עֲקֵידַת יִצְחָק בֶּן אַבְרָהָם, וּמַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם כְּאִילּוּ עֲקַדְתֶּם עַצְמְכֶם לְפָנַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Why does one sound with a shofar from a ram’s The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Sound before Me with a shofar from a ram’s so that I will remember for you the binding of Isaac, son of Abraham, and I will ascribe it to you as if you had bound yourselves before Me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Why do you blow the shofar of a ram? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Blow before Me with the shofar of a ram, so that I may remember for you the binding of Isaac, son of Abraham, and I will account it to you as if you had bound yourselves before Me.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לָמָּה תּוֹקְעִין בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה? לָמָּה תּוֹקְעִין?! רַחֲמָנָא אָמַר תִּקְעוּ! אֶלָּא: לָמָּה מְרִיעִין? מְרִיעִין?! רַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״! אֶלָּא: לָמָּה תּוֹקְעִין וּמְרִיעִין כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹשְׁבִין,
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Why does one sound tokin on Rosh HaShana? Why do we sound The Merciful One states “Sound [ tiku ] Rather, Why does one sound blasts [ terua ] Sound a terua ? The Merciful One states: a memorial proclaimed with the blast of horns [ terua ]” Rather, Why does one sound blast [ tekia ] and blasts [ terua ] sitting
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Why do we blow the shofar on Rosh Hashanah? Why do we blow?! The Merciful One said "Sound the shofar"! Rather: Why do we shout? Shout?! The Merciful One said "A remembrance of blowing"! Rather: Why do we blow and shout when they are sitting.

hebrew_text: וְתוֹקְעִין וּמְרִיעִין כְּשֶׁהֵן עוֹמְדִין — כְּדֵי לְעַרְבֵּב הַשָּׂטָן.
human_translation: and sound a tekia and a terua while they are standing In order to confuse the Satan,
llm_translation: And they blow and they shout when they are standing - in order to confuse the Satan.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵין תּוֹקְעִין לָהּ בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ — מְרִיעִין לָהּ בְּסוֹפָהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּלָא אִיעַרְבַּב שָׂטָן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said, Any year during which, the shofar was not sounded at its beginning will suffer evil at its end. What is the reason? Because Satan was not confused,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Every year that they do not blow for it at its beginning - they blow for it at its end. What is the reason? - So that the Satan will not mix in.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל שָׁנָה שֶׁרָשָׁה בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ — מִתְעַשֶּׁרֶת בְּסוֹפָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֵרֵאשִׁית הַשָּׁנָה״ — ״מֵרֵשִׁית״ כְּתִיב. ״וְעַד אַחֲרִית״ — סוֹפָהּ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ אַחֲרִית.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Any year that is poor [ rasha ] at its beginning will be made rich at its end, for it is stated: “From the beginning [ mereishit ] of the year” meireishit is written “And until the end [ aḥarit ] that the end will have in the end [ aḥarit ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Every year that begins - at its start - becomes wealthy at its end, as it is stated: "From the beginning of the year" - "from the beginning" is written. "And until the end" - its end that has an end.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין דָּנִין אֶת הָאָדָם אֶלָּא לְפִי מַעֲשָׂיו שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי שָׁמַע אֱלֹהִים אֶל קוֹל הַנַּעַר בַּאֲשֶׁר הוּא שָׁם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A man is judged only according to his deeds at the time as it is stated “For God has heard the voice of the lad where he is”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: One judges a person only according to his actions at that moment, as it is stated: "For God has heard the voice of the lad where he is."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים מַזְכִּירִין עֲוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: קִיר נָטוּי, וְעִיּוּן תְּפִלָּה, וּמוֹסֵר דִּין עַל חֲבֵירוֹ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: כָּל הַמּוֹסֵר דִּין עַל חֲבֵירוֹ — הוּא נֶעֱנָשׁ תְּחִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֹּאמֶר שָׂרַי אֶל אַבְרָם חֲמָסִי עָלֶיךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא אַבְרָהָם לִסְפּוֹד לְשָׂרָה וְלִבְכּוֹתָהּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Three matters evoke a person’s sins, they are: an inclined wall expecting prayer and passing a case against another for Rabbi Avin said: Anyone who passes a case against another is punished first. as it is stated: “And Sarai said to Abram: My anger be upon you; and it is written “And Abraham came to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Three things remind a person of his sins, they are: a leaning wall, an interrupted prayer, and a person who brings a case against his fellow. As Rabbi Avin said: Anyone who brings a case against his fellow is punished first, as it is said: "And Sarai said to Avram, 'My wrong be upon you,'" and it is written: "And Avraham came to eulogize Sarah and to weep for her."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים מְקָרְעִין גְּזַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: צְדָקָה, צְעָקָה, שִׁינּוּי הַשֵּׁם, וְשִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה. צְדָקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּצְדָקָה תַּצִּיל מִמָּוֶת״. צְעָקָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּצְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ בַּצַּר לָהֶם וּמִמְּצוּקוֹתֵיהֶם יוֹצִיאֵם״. שִׁינּוּי הַשֵּׁם, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׂרַי אִשְׁתְּךָ לֹא תִקְרָא אֶת שְׁמָהּ שָׂרָי כִּי שָׂרָה שְׁמָהּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבֵרַכְתִּי אוֹתָהּ וְגַם נָתַתִּי מִמֶּנָּה לְךָ בֵּן״. שִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא הָאֱלֹהִים אֶת מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּנָּחֶם הָאֱלֹהִים עַל הָרָעָה אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם וְלֹא עָשָׂה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A person’s sentence is torn up on four actions. These are: charity, crying out a change of name, and a change of deeds charity, as it is written: “And charity delivers from death” crying out as it is written: “Then they cry to the Lord in their trouble, and He brings them out of their distresses” a change of name, as it is written: Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be” and it is written “And I will bless her, and I will also give you a son from her” a change of deeds as it is written: “And God saw their deeds” and it is written “And God repented of the evil, which He had said He would do to them, and He did not do
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Four things tear up the decree of a person, they are: charity, crying out, changing one's name, and changing one's actions. Charity, as it is written: "And charity will save from death." Crying out, as it is written: "And they cried out to the Lord in their distress, and He brought them out of their straits." Changing one's name, as it is written: "Your wife Sarai shall not be called Sarai, for Sarah is her name," and it is written: "And I will bless her, and also give you a son from her." Changing one's actions, as it is written: "And God saw their actions," and it is written: "And God regretted the evil that He said He would do to them, and He did not do it."

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף שִׁינּוּי מָקוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל אַבְרָם לֶךְ לְךָ מֵאַרְצְךָ״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְאֶעֶשְׂךָ לְגוֹי גָּדוֹל״. וְאִידַּךְ: הָהוּא זְכוּתָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא דְּאַהַנְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And some say: Also, a change of place as it is written: “And the Lord said to Abram: Go you out of your county” and afterward “And I will make of you a great nation” And the other it was the merit of Eretz Yisrael that helped him
llm_translation: And some say: Even a change of place, as it is written: "And the Lord said to Abram, 'Go forth from your land,'" and further: "And I will make you into a great nation." And the other opinion: That merit of the Land of Israel is what benefits him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְהַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי רַבּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מַדּוּעַ אַתְּ הוֹלֶכֶת אֵלָיו הַיּוֹם לֹא חֹדֶשׁ וְלֹא שַׁבָּת״, מִכְּלָל דִּבְחֹדֶשׁ וְשַׁבָּת אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְמֵיזַל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A person is obligated to greet his teacher on a Festival, as it is stated “Why will you go to him today; it is neither the New Moon nor Shabbat” By inference, that on the New Moon and on Shabbat, she was required to go.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: A person is obligated to greet the face of his teacher with his foot, as it is stated: "Why are you going to him today? It is neither a new moon nor a Sabbath." From the fact that new moon and Sabbath are mentioned, it is necessary to infer to exclude.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְטַהֵר אֶת עַצְמוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְנִבְלָתָם לֹא תִגָּעוּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: A person is obligated to purify himself on a Festival, as it is stated: “And their carcasses you shall not touch;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: A person is obligated to purify himself by foot, as it is stated: "And you shall not touch their carcasses."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״וּבִנְבָלָתָם לֹא תִגָּעוּ״, יָכוֹל יְהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מוּזְהָרִין עַל מַגַּע נְבֵילָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֱמוֹר אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״, בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן מוּזְהָרִין, בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין מוּזְהָרִין.
human_translation: This is also taught “And their carcass you shall not touch.” might that Jews are prohibited from touching an animal carcass. the verse states: “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, the sons of Aaron are prohibited the children of Israel, are not prohibited
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And do not touch their carcasses." One might have thought that the children of Israel should be cautious regarding touching a carcass. The Torah teaches us to say: "Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron." The sons of Aaron should be cautious, the children of Israel need not be cautious.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה טוּמְאָה חֲמוּרָה — כֹּהֲנִים מוּזְהָרִין, יִשְׂרְאֵלִים אֵינָן מוּזְהָרִין. טוּמְאָה קַלָּה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן? אֶלָּא, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וּבְנִבְלָתָם לֹא תִגָּעוּ״ — בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: But are matters not an a fortiori If, severe impurity, priests are prohibited Israelites are not prohibited light impurity, not all the more so Rather, what the verse states: “And their carcass you shall not touch?” on a Festival
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And are these not logical arguments: And how severe is a major impurity - priests are warned, Israelites are not warned. A minor impurity - is it not all the more so? Rather, what does the Torah teach us by saying, "And you shall not touch their carcasses" - with the foot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי כְּרוּסְפָּדַאי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה סְפָרִים נִפְתָּחִין בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, אֶחָד שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין, וְאֶחָד שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין, וְאֶחָד שֶׁל בֵּינוֹנִיִּים. צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין — נִכְתָּבִין וְנֶחְתָּמִין לְאַלְתַּר לְחַיִּים, רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין — נִכְתָּבִין וְנֶחְתָּמִין לְאַלְתַּר לְמִיתָה, בֵּינוֹנִיִּים — תְּלוּיִין וְעוֹמְדִין מֵרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְעַד יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, זָכוּ — נִכְתָּבִין לְחַיִּים, לֹא זָכוּ — נִכְתָּבִין לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Kruspedai said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Three books are opened on Rosh HaShana One of wholly wicked and one of wholly righteous and one of middling Wholly righteous are immediately written and sealed for life; wholly wicked are immediately written and sealed for death; middling are left suspended from Rosh HaShana until Yom Kippur, they merit, they are written for life; they do not merit, they are written for death.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Kruspedai, said Rabbi Yochanan: Three books are opened on Rosh Hashanah, one of the completely wicked, and one of the completely righteous, and one of the intermediate. The completely righteous are immediately inscribed and sealed for life, the completely wicked are immediately inscribed and sealed for death, the intermediate are left hanging from Rosh Hashanah until Yom Kippur; if they merit, they are written for life, if not, they are written for death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין, מַאי קְרָא: ״יִמָּחוּ מִסֵּפֶר חַיִּים וְעִם צַדִּיקִים אַל יִכָּתֵבוּ״. ״יִמָּחוּ מִסֵּפֶר״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין, ״חַיִּים״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים, ״וְעִם צַדִּיקִים אַל יִכָּתֵבוּ״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל בֵּינוֹנִיִּים.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin said: What is the verse “Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, but not be written with the righteous” “Let them be blotted out of the book”; this is the book of wholly wicked “Of the living”; this is the book of righteous “But not be written with the righteous”; this is the book of middling
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said, what is the verse: "Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and let them not be written with the righteous." "Let them be blotted out of the book" - this is the book of the completely wicked. "Of life" - this is the book of the righteous. "And let them not be written with the righteous" - this is the book of the intermediate.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִם אַיִן מְחֵנִי נָא מִסִּפְרְךָ אֲשֶׁר כָּתָבְתָּ״, ״מְחֵנִי נָא״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים, ״מִסִּפְרְךָ״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים, ״אֲשֶׁר כָּתָבְתָּ״ — זֶה סִפְרָן שֶׁל בֵּינוֹנִיִּים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here: “And if not, blot me, I pray You, out of Your book which you have written” “Blot me, I pray You”; this is the book of wicked “Out of Your book”; this is the book of righteous “Which You have written”; this is the book of middling
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, from here: "And if you will not forgive me now from your book that you have written," "forgive me now" - this is the book of the wicked, "from your book" - this is the book of the righteous, "that you have written" - this is the book of the intermediates.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ כִּתּוֹת הֵן לְיוֹם הַדִּין: אַחַת שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין, וְאַחַת שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין, וְאַחַת שֶׁל בֵּינוֹנִיִּים. צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין — נִכְתָּבִין וְנֶחְתָּמִין לְאַלְתַּר לְחַיֵּי עוֹלָם, רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין — נִכְתָּבִין וְנֶחְתָּמִין לְאַלְתַּר לְגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרַבִּים מִיְּשֵׁנֵי אַדְמַת עָפָר יָקִיצוּ אֵלֶּה לְחַיֵּי עוֹלָם וְאֵלֶּה לַחֲרָפוֹת לְדִרְאוֹן עוֹלָם״, בֵּינוֹנִיִּים — יוֹרְדִין לְגֵיהִנָּם,
human_translation: It is taught Beit Shammai say: There will be three groups on the Day of Judgment One of wholly righteous one of wholly wicked and one of middling righteous will immediately be written and sealed for eternal life. Wholly wicked will immediately be written and sealed for Gehenna, as it is stated: “And many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall wake, some to eternal life and some to shame and everlasting contempt” Middling will descend to Gehenna
llm_translation: It was taught: Beit Shammai say: There are three groups on the Day of Judgment: one of completely righteous individuals, one of completely wicked individuals, and one of intermediate individuals. Completely righteous individuals are immediately written and sealed for eternal life, completely wicked individuals are immediately written and sealed for Gehenna, as it is stated: "And many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awaken, some to eternal life, and some to shame, to eternal contempt." Intermediate individuals descend to Gehenna.

hebrew_text: וּמְצַפְצְפִין וְעוֹלִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶת הַשְּׁלִישִׁית בָּאֵשׁ וּצְרַפְתִּים כִּצְרוֹף אֶת הַכֶּסֶף וּבְחַנְתִּים כִּבְחוֹן אֶת הַזָּהָב הוּא יִקְרָא בִשְׁמִי וַאֲנִי אֶעֱנֶה אוֹתוֹ״, וַעֲלֵיהֶם אָמְרָה חַנָּה: ״ה׳ מֵמִית וּמְחַיֶּה מוֹרִיד שְׁאוֹל וַיָּעַל״.
human_translation: and they will cry out and ascend as it is stated: “And I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will try them as gold is tried; they shall call on My name, and I will answer them” And about them, Hannah said: “The Lord kills, and gives life; he brings down to the grave, and brings up”
llm_translation: They sizzle and ascend, as it is stated: "And I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will try them as gold is tried; they shall call on My name, and I will answer them." And concerning them, Hannah said: "The Lord kills and brings to life; He brings down to Sheol and raises up."

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״ — מַטֶּה כְּלַפֵּי חֶסֶד. וַעֲלֵיהֶם אָמַר דָּוִד: ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳ אֶת קוֹלִי״, וַעֲלֵיהֶם אָמַר דָּוִד כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ — ״דַּלּוֹתִי וְלִי יְהוֹשִׁיעַ״.
human_translation: Beit Hillel say: “and abundant in kindness” tilts in favor of kindness, And about them, David said: “I love the Lord, Who hears my voice And about them, David said the entire passage: “I was brought low [ daloti ] and He saved me”
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: "And abundant in kindness" — one who acts with kindness. And concerning them David said: "I love, for the Lord hears my voice." And concerning them David said the entire portion in its entirety — "He will deliver the needy who cries out."

hebrew_text: פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוּפָן, וּפוֹשְׁעֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם בְּגוּפָן — יוֹרְדִין לְגֵיהִנָּם וְנִידּוֹנִין בָּהּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — גּוּפָן כָּלֶה, וְנִשְׁמָתָן נִשְׂרֶפֶת, וְרוּחַ מְפַזַּרְתָּן תַּחַת כַּפּוֹת רַגְלֵי צַדִּיקִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַסּוֹתֶם רְשָׁעִים כִּי יִהְיוּ אֵפֶר תַּחַת כַּפּוֹת רַגְלֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: The rebellious Jews with their bodies and the rebellious of the nations of the world with their bodies descend to Gehenna and are judged there for twelve months. After twelve months, their bodies are consumed, their souls are burned, and a wind scatters them under the soles of the feet of the righteous, as it is stated: “And you shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet”
llm_translation: Translators of Israel in their bodies, and translators of the nations of the world in their bodies — descend to Gehenna and are judged there for twelve months. After twelve months — their bodies are consumed, and their souls are burnt, and the wind scatters them under the feet of the righteous, as it is said: "And you shall tread down the wicked, for they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַמִּינִין וְהַמָּסוֹרוֹת וְהָאֶפִּיקוֹרְסִים שֶׁכָּפְרוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, וְשֶׁכָּפְרוּ בִּתְחִיַּית הַמֵּתִים, וְשֶׁפֵּירְשׁוּ מִדַּרְכֵי צִבּוּר, וְשֶׁנָּתְנוּ חִיתִּיתָם בְּאֶרֶץ חַיִּים, וְשֶׁחָטְאוּ וְהֶחְטִיאוּ אֶת הָרַבִּים, כְּגוֹן יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט וַחֲבֵירָיו — יוֹרְדִין לְגֵיהִנָּם וְנִידּוֹנִין בָּהּ לְדוֹרֵי דּוֹרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָצְאוּ וְרָאוּ בְּפִגְרֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הַפּוֹשְׁעִים בִּי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: But the heretics; and the informers; and the apostates [ apikorsim ]; who denied the Torah; and denied the resurrection of the dead; and separated from the ways of community and who cast their fear over the land of the living; and sinned and caused the masses to sin, for example, Jeroboam, son of Nebat, and his company; descend to Gehenna and are judged there for generations and generations, as it is stated: “And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the men that have rebelled against Me;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But the heretics, the apostates, and the Epicureans who denied the Torah, and denied the resurrection of the dead, and separated from the ways of the community, and placed their portion in the World to Come, and sinned and caused the public to sin, like Jeroboam the son of Nebat and his colleagues — they descend to Gehenna and are judged there for generations, as it is stated: "And they shall go forth and look upon the carcasses of the men that have rebelled against Me, etc."

hebrew_text: גֵּיהִנָּם כָּלֶה וְהֵן אֵינָן כָּלִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְצוּרָם לְבַלּוֹת שְׁאוֹל מִזְּבוּל לוֹ״. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁפָּשְׁטוּ יְדֵיהֶם בִּזְבוּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִזְּבוּל לוֹ״, וְאֵין ״זְבוּל״ אֶלָּא בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּנֹה בָנִיתִי בֵּית זְבוּל לָךְ״, וַעֲלֵיהֶם אָמְרָה חַנָּה: ״ה׳ יֵחַתּוּ מְרִיבָיו״.
human_translation: Gehenna will terminate, but they will not terminate, as it is stated: “And their form shall wear away the netherworld, so that there be no dwelling for Him” And why so severely? Because they stretched out their hands against dwelling, as it is stated: “So that there be no dwelling [ zevul ] for Him.” Dwelling [ zevul ] is referring only to the Temple, as it is stated: “I have built You a house for dwelling [ zevul ] in” And about them Hannah said: “The adversaries of the Lord shall be broken in pieces”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gehinnam kalleh vehein einan kallin, shene'emar: "Vetzuram levalot she'ol mizevul lo." Ve'kol kach lamah — mipeinei shepashetu yedeihem bizvul, shene'emar: "Mizevul lo," ve'ein "zevul" ela beit hamikdash, shene'emar: "Banah baniti beit zevul lakh," va'aleihem amra Hannah: "Hashem yechattu merivav." English translation: Gehinnam is completed and they do not complete, as it is stated: "And their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges" (Deuteronomy 32:31). And why all this? Because they stretched out their hands to Zevul, as it is stated: "From Zevul to him." And "Zevul" refers only to the Temple, as it is stated: "I have surely built Thee a house of habitation, a place for Thee to dwell in forever" (1 Kings 8:13), and concerning them Hannah said: "The Lord will judge the ends of the earth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אָבִין: וּפְנֵיהֶם דּוֹמִין לְשׁוּלֵי קְדֵירָה. וְאָמַר רָבָא: וְאִינְהוּ מִשַּׁפִּירֵי שַׁפִּירֵי בְּנֵי מָחוֹזָא, וּמִקַּרְיִין ״בְּנֵי גֵיהִנָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avin said: And their faces will be like the bottom of a pot. And Rava said: And they shall include the most handsome, of the people of Meḥoza, and they shall be called the people of Gehenna.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avin said: "And their faces resemble the gates of a cauldron." And Rava said: "And they are as beautiful as the beautiful ones of the people of Mahoza, and they are called 'the sons of Gehinnom'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״ — מַטֶּה כְּלַפֵּי חֶסֶד, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶת הַשְּׁלִישִׁית בָּאֵשׁ״! הָתָם, בְּפוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוּפָן.
human_translation: The Master said Beit Hillel say: “and abundant in kindness” tilts in favor of kindness, But isn’t it written: “And I will bring the third part through the fire” There, the rebellious Jews with their bodies.
llm_translation: Master said, Beit Hillel say: "And abundant in kindness" - reward according to kindness, and it is written: "And I will bring the third part through the fire!" There, in the case of the transgressors of Israel in their own bodies.

hebrew_text: פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוּפָן — וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ לֵית לְהוּ תַּקַּנְתָּא?! כִּי לֵית לְהוּ תַּקָּנָה — בְּרוֹב עֲוֹנוֹת. הָכָא — מֶחֱצָה עֲוֹנוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה זְכִיּוֹת, וְאִית בְּהוּ נָמֵי עָוֹן דְּפוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוּפָן, לָא סַגְיָא לֵיהּ דְּלָאו ״וְהֵבֵאתִי אֶת הַשְּׁלִישִׁית בָּאֵשׁ״. וְאִם לָאו, ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״ — מַטֶּה כְּלַפֵּי חֶסֶד. וַעֲלֵיהֶן אָמַר דָּוִד: ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳״.
human_translation: the rebellious Jews with their bodies? But didn’t you say that they have no rectification? When do they have no rectification? When majority sins. here, half sins and half meritorious deeds, and include the sin of the rebellious Jews with their bodies. It is not sufficient that they not be “And I will bring the third part through the fire.” However, if not “abundant in kindness” tilts in favor of kindness. And about them, David said: “I love the Lord, Who hears
llm_translation: Translators: Israel sin in their body - but you said there is no remedy for them?! If there is no remedy for them - due to the multitude of their sins. Here - half sins and half merits, and there is also a portion of sin for the sinners of Israel in their body, it is not sufficient for them that "And I will bring the third part through the fire." And if not, "and abundant in kindness" - leaning towards kindness. And concerning them, David said: "I love because the Lord hears."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָהַבְתִּי כִּי יִשְׁמַע ה׳״ — אָמְרָה כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אֵימָתַי אֲנִי אֲהוּבָה לְפָנֶיךָ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ קוֹל תַּחֲנוּנַי. ״דַּלּוֹתִי וְלִי יְהוֹשִׁיעַ״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁדַּלָּה אֲנִי מִן הַמִּצְוֹת — לִי נָאֶה לְהוֹשִׁיעַ.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “I love the Lord, Who hears The Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, when I am loved by You? When You hear the voice of my supplications, “I was brought low [ daloti ], and He saved me” Although I am poor [ dala ] in mitzvot, it is fitting to save me.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "I have loved because the Lord will hear"? — The Congregation of Israel said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, when will I be beloved before You? — When You hear the voice of my supplication. "Though I am poor and destitute, the Lord will think of me," even though I am poor in the performance of commandments — it is fitting for me to be saved.

hebrew_text: פּוֹשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוּפָן, מַאי נִיהוּ? אָמַר רַב: קַרְקַפְתָּא דְּלָא מַנַּח תְּפִלִּין. פּוֹשְׁעֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם בְּגוּפָן — אָמַר רַב: בַּעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: The rebellious Jews with their bodies, who are they? Rav said: the skull that did not don phylacteries. The rebellious of the nations of the world with their bodies, Rav said: in the sin,
llm_translation: Translators of Israel in their body, what is it? Rav said: the skullcap of not placing tefillin. Translators of the nations of the world in their body - Rav said: through sin.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁנָּתְנוּ חִיתִּיתָם בְּאֶרֶץ חַיִּים — אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֶה פַּרְנָס הַמַּטִּיל אֵימָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַצִּבּוּר שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל פַּרְנָס הַמַּטִּיל אֵימָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַצִּבּוּר שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם שָׁמַיִם אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה בֵּן תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן יְרֵאוּהוּ אֲנָשִׁים לֹא יִרְאֶה כׇּל חַכְמֵי לֵב״.
human_translation: And those who cast their fear over the land of the living, Rav Ḥisda said: This is referring to leader [ parnas ] who casts excessive fear on the community not for the sake of Heaven. Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: Any leader who casts excessive fear on the community not for the sake of Heaven will not see any Torah scholar among his sons, as it is stated: “Men do therefore fear him; he sees not any who are wise of heart”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And when they placed their detestable things in the land of the living" - Rav Ḥisdah said: This refers to a provider who imposes excessive fear upon the community not for the sake of Heaven. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any provider who imposes excessive fear upon the community not for the sake of Heaven does not see a wise disciple, as it is stated: "Therefore men fear Him; He does not see any who are wise of heart."

hebrew_text: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״ — מַטֶּה כְּלַפֵּי חֶסֶד. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כּוֹבְשׁוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָשׁוּב יְרַחֲמֵנוּ יִכְבּוֹשׁ עֲוֹנוֹתֵינוּ״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: נוֹשֵׂא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וְעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע״.
human_translation: Beit Hillel say: “and abundant in kindness” tilts in favor of kindness, How does He do Rabbi Eliezer says: He pushes down as it is stated: “He will again have compassion upon us; He will push down our iniquities” Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: He bears, as it is stated: “He bears [ noseh ] sin and forgives transgression”
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: "And abundant in kindness" - one who is inclined towards kindness. How does he do it? Rabbi Eliezer says: He should subdue it, as it is said: "He will return, He will have compassion upon us; He will subdue our iniquities." Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina says: He should bear it, as it is said: "bearing iniquity and passing over transgression."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מַעֲבִיר רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן, וְכֵן הִיא הַמִּדָּה. אָמַר רָבָא: וְעָוֹן עַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ נִמְחָק. דְּאִי אִיכָּא רוּבָּא עֲוֹנוֹת — מִחֲשִׁיב בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: from the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught He overlooks first and that is the attribute Rava said: But sin itself, is not erased; if mostly sins, counts with them
llm_translation: The Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael taught: One removes the first sin first, and so is the measure. Rava said: And the sin itself is not erased. For if there are many sins, his sins are taken into account together.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כׇּל הַמַּעֲבִיר עַל מִדּוֹתָיו — מַעֲבִירִין לוֹ עַל כׇּל פְּשָׁעָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וְעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע״. לְמִי נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן — לְמִי שֶׁעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע.
human_translation: Rava said: whoever forgoes his reckonings forgoes for all his sins, as it is stated: “He bears sin and forgives transgression” Whose sins does He bear? of one who forgoes his reckonings
llm_translation: Rava said: Anyone who overlooks his own faults, they overlook all his transgressions, as it is stated: "He who bears iniquity and passes over transgression." To whom does "He who bears iniquity" refer? To one who passes over transgression.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חֲלַשׁ, עָל רַב פָּפָּא לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּחֲלִישׁ לֵיהּ עָלְמָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: צְבִיתוּ לֵיהּ זְוַודְתָּא. לְסוֹף אִיתְּפַח, הֲוָה מִיכְּסִיף רַב פָּפָּא לְמִיחְזְיֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי חֲזֵית? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין, הָכִי הֲוָה, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: הוֹאִיל וְלָא מוֹקֵים בְּמִילֵּיהּ — לָא תְּקוּמוּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וְעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע״, לְמִי נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן — לְעוֹבֵר פֶּשַׁע.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, became sick, Rav Pappa went into inquire about his He saw that the world was growing weak for said to Prepare his provisions [ zavdata ], In the end, recovered. Rav Pappa was embarrassed to see him, said to him: What did you see He said to them: Yes, it was so, but the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Since he does not stand on his rights, you should not be exacting as it is stated: “He bears [ noseh ] sin and forgives transgression.” Whose sins does He bear? of one who forgoes his reckonings
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, fell ill. Rav Papa came to inquire about his welfare. When he saw that he was weak, he said to them: "Prepare for him a potion." In the end, when Rav Papa came to visit him again, they asked him: "What did you see?" He replied: "Nothing, that's how it was." And he said to them, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: "Since you did not fulfill His word, do not rise in His presence, as it is stated: 'He who bears sin and passes over transgression,' to whom does 'he who bears sin' refer? To 'he who passes over transgression.'"

hebrew_text: ״לִשְׁאֵרִית נַחֲלָתוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: אַלְיָה — וְקוֹץ בָּהּ: ״לִשְׁאֵרִית נַחֲלָתוֹ״ — וְלֹא לְכׇל נַחֲלָתוֹ,
human_translation: for the remnant of His inheritance” Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: fat tail that has a thorn in it, “for the remnant of His inheritance,” but not for all His inheritance.
llm_translation: "To the remnant of his inheritance," Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: 'Elijah - and a thorn in it: "to the remnant of his inheritance" - and not to all his inheritance."

hebrew_text: לְמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּשִׁירַיִם.
human_translation: for one who regards himself as a remainder,
llm_translation: To whom they compare himself as barley.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״צַדִּיק ה׳ בְּכׇל דְּרָכָיו״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְחָסִיד בְּכׇל מַעֲשָׂיו״! בַּתְּחִלָּה — צַדִּיק, וּלְבַסּוֹף — חָסִיד.
human_translation: Rav Huna raised a contradiction It is written: “The Lord is righteous [ tzaddik ] in all His ways” and it is written “And kind [ ḥasid ] in all His works,” Initially, He is righteous, but in the end, He is gracious.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, as it is written: "The Lord is righteous in all His ways," and it is written: "and kind in all His deeds"! Initially - righteous, and ultimately - kind.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וּלְךָ ה׳ חָסֶד״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אַתָּה תְשַׁלֵּם לְאִישׁ כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ״. בַּתְּחִלָּה — ״כִּי אַתָּה תְּשַׁלֵּם כְּמַעֲשֵׂהוּ״, וּלְבַסּוֹף — ״וּלְךָ ה׳ חָסֶד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised a contradiction: It is written: “But to you, O Lord, belongs kindness” and it is written “For You render to a man according to his deeds,” Initially, “For You render to a man according to his deeds”; but in the end, “But to You, O Lord, belongs kindness.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a contradiction: It is written, "And to You, Hashem, is kindness," and it is written, "For You will repay each man according to his deeds." Initially - "For You will repay each man according to his deeds," and ultimately - "And to You, Hashem, is kindness."

hebrew_text: אִילְפַי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אִילְפָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״, וּכְתִיב: ״וֶאֱמֶת״. בַּתְּחִלָּה — ״וֶאֱמֶת״, וּלְבַסּוֹף — ״וְרַב חֶסֶד״.
human_translation: Ilfai, and some say Ilfa, raised a contradiction: It is written “And abundant in kindness” and it is written “And truth,” Initially, “And truth,” but in the end, “And abundant in kindness,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ilfai, ve'amri lah ilfa ramei, k'tiv: "ve-rav chesed," u'k'tiv: "ve-emet." Ba-tekheilah - "ve-emet," u'levasof - "ve-rav chesed." English translation: Ilfai, and some say Ilfa the tall, it is written: "and abundant in kindness," and it is written: "and truth." At the beginning - "and truth," and in the end - "and abundant in kindness."

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּעֲבוֹר ה׳ עַל פָּנָיו וַיִּקְרָא״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִלְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְעַטֵּף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כִּשְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר, וְהֶרְאָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה סֵדֶר תְּפִלָּה. אָמַר לוֹ: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל חוֹטְאִין — יַעֲשׂוּ לְפָנַי כַּסֵּדֶר הַזֶּה וַאֲנִי מוֹחֵל לָהֶם.
human_translation: “And the Lord passed by before him, and proclaimed” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Were it not written in the verse, it would be impossible to say this, teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, wrapped Himself like a prayer leader and showed Moses order of prayer. He said to him: Whenever the Jewish people sin, let them act before Me in accordance with this order. and I will forgive them.
llm_translation: "And Hashem passed before him and proclaimed." Rabbi Yochanan said: If the verse were not written, it would be impossible to say it. This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, wrapped Himself like a prayer leader and showed Moses the order of prayer. He said to him: As long as the Israelites sin, let them perform before Me according to this order, and I will forgive them.

hebrew_text: ״ה׳ ה׳״ — אֲנִי הוּא קוֹדֶם שֶׁיֶּחְטָא הָאָדָם, וַאֲנִי הוּא לְאַחַר שֶׁיֶּחְטָא הָאָדָם וְיַעֲשֶׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — ״אֵל רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן״.
human_translation: “The Lord, the Lord,” I am He before a person sins, and I am He after a person sins and performs repentance, “God, merciful and gracious”
llm_translation: "The Lord, the Lord" - I am He before a person sins, and I am He after a person sins and repents - "God, merciful and gracious."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּרִית כְּרוּתָה לִשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִדּוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן חוֹזְרוֹת רֵיקָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי כּוֹרֵת בְּרִית״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: A covenant was made with the thirteen attributes that they will not return empty-handed, as it is stated “Behold, I make a covenant”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A covenant is made for thirteen attributes that do not return empty, as it is stated: "Behold, I am making a covenant."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁמְּקָרַעַת גְּזַר דִּינוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשְׁמֵן לֵב הָעָם הַזֶּה וְאׇזְנָיו הַכְבֵּד וְעֵינָיו הָשַׁע פֶּן יִרְאֶה בְעֵינָיו וּבְאׇזְנָיו יִשְׁמָע וּלְבָבוֹ יָבִין וָשָׁב וְרָפָא לוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Great is repentance, for it tears up the sentence against a person, as it is stated: “Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and smear over their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and they will return, and be healed”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Great is repentance, for it tears up the decree of a person, as it is stated: "Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and return, and be healed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא לִפְנֵי גְּזַר דִּין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְרָפָא לוֹ״ כְּתִיב, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁצָּרִיךְ רְפוּאָה — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה גְּזַר דִּין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But perhaps before the sentence said to him: It is written and be healed” What requires healing? you must say a sentence
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: "But perhaps it is before a decree of judgment?" He said to him: "And 'he shall provide for him' is written, what is a matter that requires healing - say this is a decree of judgment."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַשָּׁב בֵּינְתַיִם — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, לֹא שָׁב בֵּינְתַיִם — אֲפִילּוּ הֵבִיא כׇּל אֵילֵי נְבָיוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם אֵין מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּיָחִיד, הָא — בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: raises an objection one repents in the meantime, he is forgiven; he does not repent in the meantime, even if he brings all the rams of Nebaioth in the world, they do not forgive him This not difficult: Here, of an individual; there, communal
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: Meitivi: Ha'shav bein'tayim - mokhalin lo, lo shav bein'tayim - afilu hevi kol eilei nevayot sheba'olam ein mokhalin lo! La kashya: Ha - be'yachid, ha - be'tzibur. Translation: It was raised in objection: If one repented in between, we forgive him; if he did not repent in between, even if he brought all the rams of the world, we do not forgive him! This is not difficult: here - in the case of an individual, here - in the case of a community.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״עֵינֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בָּהּ״ — עִתִּים לְטוֹבָה עִתִּים לְרָעָה. עִתִּים לְטוֹבָה כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִין בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וּפָסְקוּ לָהֶם גְּשָׁמִים מוּעָטִים, לְסוֹף חָזְרוּ בָּהֶן. לְהוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן אִי אֶפְשָׁר — שֶׁכְּבָר נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵרָה, אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹרִידָן בִּזְמַנָּן, עַל הָאָרֶץ הַצְּרִיכָה לָהֶן — הַכֹּל לְפִי הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: raises an objection the eyes of the Lord your God are upon it” sometimes for good sometimes for bad. Sometimes for good; how so? If the Jews were wholly wicked on Rosh HaShana, so that a meager rain was decreed for them in the end they repented, To add is impossible, as the decree was already issued. Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, causes to fall at the times on land that needs it, all according to the land,
llm_translation: The question was raised: "The eyes of the Lord your God are upon it" - sometimes for good, sometimes for evil. Sometimes for good, how so? Behold, when the Israelites were completely wicked at the beginning of the year, and there was a shortage of rain for them, ultimately rain fell for them. To add more upon them is impossible - for the decree has already been decreed. Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, brings them down in their proper time, for the land requires it - everything according to the needs of the land.

hebrew_text: עִתִּים לְרָעָה כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל צַדִּיקִים גְּמוּרִין בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וּפָסְקוּ עֲלֵיהֶן גְּשָׁמִים מְרוּבִּין, לְסוֹף חָזְרוּ בָּהֶן. לִפְחוֹת מֵהֶן אִי אֶפְשָׁר — שֶׁכְּבָר נִגְזְרָה גְּזֵרָה, אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מוֹרִידָן שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּן, עַל הָאָרֶץ שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לָהֶן.
human_translation: Sometimes for bad; how so? If the Jewish people were wholly righteous on Rosh HaShana, so that much rain was decreed for them in the end they regressed To reduce is impossible, as the decree was already issued. Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, causes to fall not at the time, on land that does not need it,
llm_translation: At times for evil, how so? Behold, when the people of Israel were completely righteous on Rosh Hashanah and abundant rains fell upon them, in the end they turned against them. Less than them is impossible - for the decree has already been sealed. Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, brings them down out of their time, upon a land that does not need them.

hebrew_text: לְטוֹבָה מִיהָא, לִיקְרְעֵיהּ לִגְזַר דִּינַיְיהוּ וְלוֹסֵיף לְהוּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּהָכִי.
human_translation: for good, however, let Him tear up their sentence and add It is different there, because it is possible in this
llm_translation: For good from it, to uproot its decrees and to add to it! Different there, for it is possible in this way.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״יוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם בׇּאֳנִיּוֹת עוֹשֵׂי מְלָאכָה בְּמַיִם רַבִּים. הֵמָּה רָאוּ מַעֲשֵׂי ה׳ וְגוֹ׳ וַיֹּאמֶר וַיַּעֲמֵד רוּחַ סְעָרָה וַתְּרוֹמֵם גַּלָּיו. יָחוֹגּוּ וְיָנוּעוּ כַּשִּׁכּוֹר וְגוֹ׳ וַיִּצְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ בַּצַּר לָהֶם וְגוֹ׳ יוֹדוּ לַה׳ חַסְדּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Come hear “They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters; these saw the works of the Lord, “For He commanded, and raised the stormy wind, which lifted up the waves thereof…They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, “Then they cry to the Lord in their trouble, “Let them give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in great waters. They saw the deeds of the Lord, etc." And He said, "He caused the stormy wind to rise, which lifted up the waves thereof. They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, etc." And they cried out to the Lord in their distress, etc. Let them give thanks to the Lord for His mercy, etc."

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה לָהֶן סִימָנִיּוֹת כְּאַכִּין וְרַקִּין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, לוֹמַר לָךְ: צָעֲקוּ קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין — נַעֲנִין, צָעֲקוּ לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין — אֵינָן נַעֲנִין!
human_translation: Markers were inserted here are similar to the but and only in the Torah, tells you they cried out before the sentence they are answered, they cried out after the sentence they are not answered.
llm_translation: He made for them signs like Akin and Rakkin in the Torah, to say to you: if they cried out before the decree of judgment - they are answered, if they cried out after the decree of judgment - they are not answered!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי נָמֵי כִּיחִידִין דָּמוּ.
human_translation: those are also considered like individuals.
llm_translation: These are like individuals, for their blood.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁאֲלָה בְּלוֹרְיָא הַגִּיּוֹרֶת אֶת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, כְּתִיב בְּתוֹרַתְכֶם: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִשָּׂא פָנִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״יִשָּׂא ה׳ פָּנָיו אֵלֶיךָ״?
human_translation: Come hear: Beloreya the convert asked Rabban Gamliel: It is written in your Torah: who favors no one” and it is written: “The Lord shall show favor to you
llm_translation: Come and hear: A certain convert woman asked Rabban Gamliel, "It is written in your Torah: 'He shall not show partiality,' and it is also written: 'May the Lord lift up His countenance toward you'?"

hebrew_text: נִטְפַּל לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַכֹּהֵן. אָמַר לָהּ: אֶמְשׁוֹל לָךָ מָשָׁל, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְאָדָם שֶׁנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה וְקָבַע לוֹ זְמַן בִּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְנִשְׁבַּע לוֹ בְּחַיֵּי הַמֶּלֶךְ, הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא פְּרָעוֹ. בָּא לְפַיֵּיס אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: עֶלְבּוֹנִי מָחוּל לָךְ, לֵךְ וּפַיֵּיס אֶת חֲבֵירְךָ. הָכָא נָמֵי, כָּאן בַּעֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לְמָקוֹם — כָּאן בַּעֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei the priest joined her and said: I will tell you a parable. To what is this matter comparable? To a person who lent his friend one hundred and fixed a time before the king, and took an oath by the life of the king The time arrived, and he did not repay came to appease the king and said to him: my insult I forgive you, you must go and appease your friend. Here also Here, sins between man and God, there, sins between a person and another,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It happened with Rabbi Yosei the Priest. He said to her: I will give you a parable, to what is this matter similar? — To a man who borrowed money from his friend and fixed a time before the king, and he swore to him by the life of the king, the time arrived and he did not repay. He came to appease the king, and said to him: My disgrace is upon you, go and appease your friend. Here too, in matters between man and place — here in matters between man and his friend."

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְלִימֵּד:
human_translation: until Rabbi Akiva came and taught
llm_translation: Until Rabbi Akiva came and taught:

hebrew_text: כָּאן קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין, כָּאן לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין! הָכָא נָמֵי בְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: Here before sentence there after sentence Here too an individual,
llm_translation: Here before the decree of judgment, here after the decree of judgment! Here it is stated in the singular.

hebrew_text: וּגְזַר דִּין דְּיָחִיד תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁעָלוּ לַמִּטָּה וְחוֹלְיָין שָׁוֶה, וְכֵן שְׁנַיִם שֶׁעָלוּ לַגַּרְדּוֹם לִידּוֹן וְדִינָן שָׁוֶה. זֶה יָרַד וְזֶה לֹא יָרַד, זֶה נִיצַּל וְזֶה לֹא נִיצַּל.
human_translation: an individual’s sentence is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Meir would say: Two take to beds, and their illness is the same, or two ascend to the tribunal [ gardom ] for judgment, and their sentence is the same; this comes down while that does not come down from his bed, and this is saved while that is not saved.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the decree of an individual is in accordance with the opinion of the Tanna. As it was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "If two went down to the bed and their illnesses are equal, and likewise if two went down to the pit for judgment and their judgments are equal, one descended and one did not descend, one was saved and one was not saved."

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי מָה זֶה יָרַד וְזֶה לֹא יָרַד, זֶה נִיצַּל וְזֶה לֹא נִיצַּל? זֶה הִתְפַּלֵּל וְנַעֲנָה, וְזֶה הִתְפַּלֵּל וְלֹא נַעֲנָה. מִפְּנֵי מָה זֶה נַעֲנָה וְזֶה לֹא נַעֲנָה? זֶה הִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה שְׁלֵימָה — נַעֲנָה, וְזֶה לֹא הִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה שְׁלֵימָה — לֹא נַעֲנָה
human_translation: For what did this come down while that did not come down from his bed; was this one saved while that one was not saved? this prayed and was answered, while that prayed, but was not answered. And for what was this answered and that not answered? This prayed a prayer whole was answered, while that did not pray a prayer whole was not answered.
llm_translation: Because of what did this one descend and this one did not descend, this one was saved and this one was not saved? This one prayed and was answered, and this one prayed and was not answered. Because of what was this one answered and this one not answered? This one prayed a complete prayer - was answered, and this one did not pray a complete prayer - was not answered.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: כָּאן קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין, כָּאן לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: יָפָה צְעָקָה לָאָדָם בֵּין קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין בֵּין לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: here before sentence there after sentence Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Crying out is effective for a person, both before sentence and after sentence
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Here before decree judgment, here after decree judgment. Rabbi Yitzchak said: Beautiful is the cry of a person, whether before decree judgment or after decree judgment.

hebrew_text: וּגְזַר דִּין דְּצִבּוּר מִי מִיקְּרַע? וְהָא כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״כַּבְּסִי מֵרָעָה לִבֵּךְ״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אִם תְּכַבְּסִי בַּנֶּתֶר וְתַרְבִּי לָךְ בּוֹרִית נִכְתָּם עֲוֹנֵךְ לְפָנַי״, מַאי לָאו: כָּאן קוֹדֶם גְּזַר דִּין, כָּאן לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין!
human_translation: Can a sentence of a community be torn up But one verse says: wash your heart from wickedness, and it is written: “For though you wash yourself with lye, and use much soap, yet the stain of your iniquity is before Me, What, is it not here before the sentence, there after the sentence,
llm_translation: And the decree of the community, who will annul it? But it is written, one verse says: "Wash yourself from evil, cleanse your heart," and it is written: "Though you wash with lye and use much soap, the stain of your guilt is still before Me," what is the reason? Here, before the decree of the community, here, after the decree of the community!

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לְאַחַר גְּזַר דִּין, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, כָּאן בִּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁאֵין עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: No, this and that after the sentence and not difficult: Here a sentence accompanied by an oath there a sentence that is not accompanied by oath
llm_translation: Not so, for both are after a decree of judgment, and it is not difficult: here in a decree of judgment where there is an oath with it, here in a decree of judgment where there is no oath with it.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי. דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַב יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִן לִגְזַר דִּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִקְרָע — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״[וְ]לָכֵן נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי לְבֵית עֵלִי אִם יִתְכַּפֵּר עֲוֹן בֵּית עֵלִי בְּזֶבַח וּבְמִנְחָה״.
human_translation: like Rav Shmuel bar Ami as Rav Shmuel bar Ami and some say Rav Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: From where that a sentence accompanied by oath cannot be torn up As it is stated: “And therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli’s house will not be purged with sacrifice nor offering forever”
llm_translation: As Rav Shmuel bar Ammi said, for Rav Shmuel bar Ammi said, and some say he said it, Rav Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rav Yonatan: From where do we derive the decree of a judgment that has an accompanying oath that cannot be annulled? As it is stated: "Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli that the iniquity of the house of Eli shall not be atoned for by sacrifice or offering."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּזֶבַח וּבַמִּנְחָה אֵינוֹ מִתְכַּפֵּר — אֲבָל מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּתוֹרָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּזֶבַח וּמִנְחָה אֵינוֹ מִתְכַּפֵּר — אֲבָל מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים. רַבָּה וְאַבָּיֵי מִדְּבֵית עֵלִי קָאָתוּ. רַבָּה דַּעֲסַק בַּתּוֹרָה — חֲיָה אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין, אַבָּיֵי דַּעֲסַק בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — חֲיָה שִׁיתִּין שְׁנִין.
human_translation: Rava said: With sacrifice or offering is not atoned, but it can be atoned through Torah Abaye said: With sacrifice or offering is not atoned, but it is atoned through Torah and acts of kindness. Rabba and Abaye came from the house of Eli, Rabba, who engaged in Torah lived for forty years, Abaye, who engaged in Torah and in acts of kindness lived for sixty years.
llm_translation: Rava said: In sacrifice and meal-offering, atonement is not achieved - but atonement is achieved through Torah. Abaye said: In sacrifice and meal-offering, atonement is not achieved - but atonement is achieved through Torah and acts of loving-kindness. Rava and Abaye were both disciples of the school of Eli. Rava, who engaged in Torah study, lived forty years; Abaye, who engaged in Torah study and acts of loving-kindness, lived sixty-two years.
