hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִשְׁפָּחָה אַחַת הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ מֵתֶיהָ מֵתִין בְּנֵי שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. בָּאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּ אֶת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת עֵלִי אַתֶּם, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וְכׇל מַרְבִּית בֵּיתְךָ יָמוּתוּ אֲנָשִׁים״ — לְכוּ וְעִסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה וִחְיוּ. הָלְכוּ וְעָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה וְחָיוּ. וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ מִשְׁפַּחַת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן עַל שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught There was a certain family in Jerusalem whose members used to die at the age of eighteen, They came and told Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai He said to them: Perhaps you from the family of Eli, as it is written about them: “And all the increase of your house shall die young men” Go and engage in Torah you will live. They went and engaged in Torah and lived. And would call that family by the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was one family in Jerusalem whose members would die at the age of eighteen years. They came and informed Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai. He said to them: Perhaps you are from the family of Eli, as it is written: "And all the increase of your house shall die as men" (1 Samuel 2:32) — Go and engage in Torah study and live. They went, engaged in Torah study, and lived. And they would recite the family of Rabban Yochanan in their name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: מִנַּיִין לִגְזַר דִּין שֶׁל צִבּוּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶחְתָּם. אֵינוֹ נֶחְתָּם?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״נִכְתַּם עֲוֹנֵךְ לְפָנַי״! אֶלָּא: אַף עַל גַּב שֶׁנֶּחְתָּם — נִקְרָע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ בְּכׇל קׇרְאֵנוּ אֵלָיו״.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: From where that the sentence of a community is never sealed [ neḥtam ]? Is never sealed? But isn’t it written: “Yet the stain [ nikhtam ] of your iniquity is before Me” Rather, although it is sealed, it can be torn up? As it is stated: “As is the Lord our God whenever we call out to Him”
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive the decree of the community that is not sealed? Not sealed?! But it is written: "Your iniquity is sealed up before Me"! Rather, even though it is sealed, it is torn, as it is stated: "So the Lord our God, whenever we call upon Him."

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״דִּרְשׁוּ ה׳ בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ״! הָתָם בְּיָחִיד, הָכָא בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “Seek the Lord while He may be found; call upon Him when He is near” There an individual, here a community,
llm_translation: And it is written: "Seek the Lord when He can be found"! There, in an individual case; here, in a communal setting.

hebrew_text: בְּיָחִיד, אֵימַת? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁבֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. ״וַיְהִי כַּעֲשֶׂרֶת הַיָּמִים וַיִּגֹּף ה׳ אֶת נָבָל״ — עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כְּנֶגֶד עֶשֶׂר לְגִימוֹת שֶׁנָּתַן נָבָל לְעַבְדֵי דָּוִד. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁבֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: an individual, when Rabba bar Avuh said: These are the ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur. “And it came to pass about ten days after that the Lord smote Nabal, and he died” ten days, what are they doing here, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: They correspond to the ten meals that Nabal gave the servants of David Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: These are the ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: In a private case, when is it permitted? Rabba bar Avuh said: These are the ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur. "And it was after ten days that the Lord struck Nabal" - what did they do for ten days? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Corresponding to the ten measures that Nabal gave to David's servants. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: These are the ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה כׇּל בָּאֵי הָעוֹלָם עוֹבְרִין לְפָנָיו כִּבְנֵי מָרוֹן. מַאי ״כִּבְנֵי מָרוֹן״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: כִּבְנֵי אִמְּרָנָא. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כְּמַעֲלוֹת בֵּית מָרוֹן. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כַּחֲיָילוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית דָּוִד.
human_translation: On Rosh HaShana all creatures pass before Him like benei maron . What is benei maron ? Here they interpreted it Like a flock of sheep [ kivnei imarna ]. Reish Lakish said: Like the ascent of Beit Maron, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said Like the soldiers of the house of David,
llm_translation: In the beginning of the year, all the inhabitants of the world pass before Him like bnei Maron. What is "like bnei Maron"? Here it was interpreted: like bnei Imrana. Resh Lakish said: like the steps of Beit Maron. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: like the soldiers of the house of David.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכוּלָּן נִסְקָרִין בִּסְקִירָה אַחַת. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״הַיּוֹצֵר יַחַד לִבָּם הַמֵּבִין אֶל כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם״. מַאי קָאָמַר? אִילֵּימָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: דִּבְרַנְהוּ לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא וּמְיַיחֵד לִבַּיְיהוּ כַּהֲדָדָי — וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּלָאו הָכִי הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַיּוֹצֵר רוֹאֶה יַחַד לִבָּם וּמֵבִין אֶל כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And they are all scanned in a single scan. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, too, learn “He who fashions their hearts alike, who considers all their deeds” What is this saying? If we say this is what it is saying: That He created everyone and unites their hearts together, since don’t we see that it is not so, Rather, is this not what it is saying: The Creator sees their hearts together and considers all their deeds
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: And all of them are examined in one examination. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said, we also learned: "He who forms their hearts together, He who understands all their works." What is he saying? If you wish, say he is saying this: He speaks to all the people of the world and unites their hearts like Hadadim - but we do not see that it is so! Rather, is he not saying this: He who forms sees their hearts together and understands all their works.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַל שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים הַשְּׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין: עַל נִיסָן מִפְּנֵי הַפֶּסַח, עַל אָב מִפְּנֵי הַתַּעֲנִית, עַל אֱלוּל מִפְּנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, עַל תִּשְׁרֵי מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת, עַל כִּסְלֵיו מִפְּנֵי חֲנוּכָּה, וְעַל אֲדָר מִפְּנֵי הַפּוּרִים.
human_translation: In six months the messengers go out in Nisan, due to Passover, in Av, due to the fast in Elul, due to Rosh HaShana, in Tishrei, due to the correct the Festivals in Kislev, due to Hanukkah; and in Adar, due to Purim.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On six months the messengers may be sent out: On Nisan because of Passover, on Av because of the fast, on Elul because of Rosh Hashanah, on Tishrei because of the fixing of the festivals, on Kislev because of Hanukkah, and on Adar because of Purim.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהָיָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — יוֹצְאִין אַף עַל אִיָּיר מִפְּנֵי פֶּסַח קָטָן.
human_translation: And when the Temple was standing, would also go out in Iyyar due to small Passover,
llm_translation: When the Temple stood - they would go out even on Shabbat because of the Korban Pesach.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלִיפְּקוּ נָמֵי אַתַּמּוּז וְטֵבֵת!
human_translation: And let them go out also Tammuz and Tevet,
llm_translation: "Gema' and they went out to the city of Atamuz and Tevet!"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ צְבָאוֹת צוֹם הָרְבִיעִי וְצוֹם הַחֲמִישִׁי וְצוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי וְצוֹם הָעֲשִׂירִי יִהְיֶה לְבֵית יְהוּדָה לְשָׂשׂוֹן וּלְשִׂמְחָה״. קָרֵי לְהוּ ״צוֹם״, וְקָרֵי לְהוּ ״שָׂשׂוֹן וְשִׂמְחָה״! בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם — יִהְיוּ לְשָׂשׂוֹן וּלְשִׂמְחָה, אֵין שָׁלוֹם — צוֹם.
human_translation: As Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said: What is which is written: “Thus said the Lord of hosts: The fast of the fourth month, and the fast of the fifth, and fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth, shall become times of joy and gladness, to the house of Judah” It calls them “fast” and it calls them joy and gladness.” When there is peace they will be joy and gladness, there is no peace, fasting.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Rav Ḥanah bar Bizna amar Rabbi Shim'on Ḥasida, mai dikhtiv: 'Ko amar Hashem Tzeva'ot tzom ha-revi'i ve-tzom ha-ḥamishi ve-tzom ha-shevi'i ve-tzom ha-asiri yihyeh le-veit Yehudah le-sason ule-simḥa.' Karei lehu 'tzom,' ve-karei lehu 'sason ule-simḥa'! Bizman she-yesh shalom — yihyu le-sason ule-simḥa, ein shalom — tzom." English translation: "As Rav Ḥanah bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shim'on Ḥasida, what is the meaning of what is written: 'So said the Lord of Hosts: The fast of the fourth month, the fast of the fifth month, the fast of the seventh month, and the fast of the tenth month shall be for the house of Judah for joy and gladness.' It calls them 'fasts,' and it calls them 'joy and gladness'! When there is peace — they shall be for joy and gladness, when there is no peace — they shall be a fast."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם — יִהְיוּ לְשָׂשׂוֹן וּלְשִׂמְחָה, יֵשׁ שְׁמָד — צוֹם, אֵין שְׁמָד וְאֵין שָׁלוֹם — רָצוּ מִתְעַנִּין, רָצוּ אֵין מִתְעַנִּין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said this is what it is saying: When there is peace will be joy and gladness; there is persecution fasting; there is no persecution but no peace, wish, they fast, they wish, they do not fast.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, thus he said: When there is peace - let there be joy and happiness, when there is destruction - fast, when there is neither destruction nor peace - they wanted to fast but did not fast.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב נָמֵי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שָׁאנֵי תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב, הוֹאִיל וְהוּכְפְּלוּ בּוֹ צָרוֹת. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב חָרַב הַבַּיִת בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבַשְּׁנִיָּה, וְנִלְכְּדָה בֵּיתָר, וְנֶחֶרְשָׁה הָעִיר.
human_translation: If so, the Ninth of Av also Rav Pappa said: The Ninth of Av is different, since the calamities were multiplied. As the Master said: On the Ninth of Av the Temple was destroyed, the first and the second Beitar was captured; the city was plowed
llm_translation: So, is it that the ninth of Av is a day of mourning? Rav Papa said: The ninth of Av is different, as multiple calamities occurred on that day. As Mar said: On the ninth of Av, the Temple was destroyed both in the first and second instances, and Betar was captured, and the city was plowed under.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים הָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דּוֹרֵשׁ, וַאֲנִי אֵין דּוֹרֵשׁ כְּמוֹתוֹ: ״צוֹם הָרְבִיעִי״ — זֶה תִּשְׁעָה בְּתַמּוּז שֶׁבּוֹ הוּבְקְעָה הָעִיר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּרְבִיעִי בְּתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ וַיֶּחֱזַק הָרָעָב בָּעִיר וְלֹא הָיָה לֶחֶם לְעַם הָאָרֶץ וַתִּבָּקַע הָעִיר״. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״רְבִיעִי״ — רְבִיעִי לֶחֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Akiva would expound four verses, but I would not expound as he did. “The fast of the fourth,” this is the ninth of Tammuz, on which the city was breached, as it is stated: “And in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land. Then the city was breached” And why does call it fourth? the fourth of the months
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: Rabbi Akiva used to expound four things, and I do not expound like him: "The fast of the fourth month" - this is the ninth of Tammuz, on which the city was breached, as it is stated: "In the fourth month, on the ninth of the month, the famine became severe in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land, and the city was breached." And why is it called "the fourth"? - It is the fourth of the months.

hebrew_text: ״צוֹם הַחֲמִישִׁי״ — זֶה תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב, שֶׁבּוֹ נִשְׂרַף בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״חֲמִישִׁי״ — חֲמִישִׁי לֶחֳדָשִׁים. צוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי — זֶה שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּתִשְׁרִי, שֶׁבּוֹ נֶהֱרַג גְּדַלְיָה בֶּן אֲחִיקָם. וּמִי הֲרָגוֹ — יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן נְתַנְיָה הֲרָגוֹ, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁשְּׁקוּלָה מִיתָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים כִּשְׂרֵיפַת בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״שְׁבִיעִי״ — שְׁבִיעִי לֶחֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: “The fast of the fifth,” this is the Ninth of Av, on which the Temple of our Lord was burnt. And why does he call it fifth? fifth of the months. “The fast of the seventh,” this is the third of Tishrei, on which Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, was killed. And who killed him? Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, killed him to teach you that the death of the righteous is equivalent to the burning of the Temple of our Lord. And why did call it seventh? seventh of the months.
llm_translation: "Fifth fast" — this is the ninth of Av, on which our Temple was burned. And why is it called "fifth" — fifth of the months. Seventh fast — this is the third of Tishrei, on which Gedaliah son of Ahikam was killed. And who killed him — Ishmael son of Nethaniah killed him, to teach you that the death of the righteous is as severe as the burning of our Temple. And why is it called "seventh" — seventh of the months.

hebrew_text: ״צוֹם הָעֲשִׂירִי״ — זֶה עֲשָׂרָה בְּטֵבֵת, שֶׁבּוֹ סָמַךְ מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי דְבַר ה׳ אֵלַי בַּשָּׁנָה הַתְּשִׁיעִית בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ לֵאמֹר. בֶּן אָדָם כְּתׇב לְךָ אֶת שֵׁם הַיּוֹם אֶת עֶצֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה סָמַךְ מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל אֶל יְרוּשָׁלִַים״. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״עֲשִׂירִי״ — עֲשִׂירִי לֶחֳדָשִׁים. וַהֲלֹא הָיָה רָאוּי זֶה לִכְתּוֹב רִאשׁוֹן? וְלָמָּה נִכְתַּב כָּאן — כְּדֵי לְהַסְדִּיר חֳדָשִׁים כְּתִיקְנָן.
human_translation: “The fast of the tenth,” This is the tenth of Tevet, on which the king of Babylonia laid siege to Jerusalem, as it is stated: “And in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying: Son of man, write the name of the day, of this same day: The king of Babylonia has laid siege to Jerusalem on this very day” And why did he call it tenth? the tenth of the months. Wouldn’t it have been fitting to write first, Why was written here in order to list the months in proper
llm_translation: "Tzom ha'asiri" - this is the tenth of Tevet, when the king of Babylon laid siege to Jerusalem, as it is stated: "And it was in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, on the tenth of the month, that the word of the Lord came to me, saying: Son of man, write down for yourself the name of this day, this very day. The king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem." And why is it called "asiri" - tenth of the months? Wasn't it fitting to write this first? Why was it written here - in order to establish the months as they were ordained.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנִי אֵינִי אוֹמֵר כֵּן, אֶלָּא: ״צוֹם הָעֲשִׂירִי״ — זֶה חֲמִשָּׁה בְּטֵבֵת, שֶׁבּוֹ בָּאת שְׁמוּעָה לַגּוֹלָה שֶׁהוּכְּתָה הָעִיר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בִּשְׁתֵּי עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה בָּעֲשִׂירִי בַּחֲמִשָּׁה לַחֹדֶשׁ לְגָלוּתֵנוּ בָּא אֵלַי הַפָּלִיט מִירוּשָׁלִַם לֵאמֹר הוּכְּתָה הָעִיר״, וְעָשׂוּ יוֹם שְׁמוּעָה כְּיוֹם שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: I do not say this, but rather “The fast of the tenth,” this is the fifth of Tevet, on which the report reached the Diaspora that the city had been smitten, as it is stated: “And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came to me, saying: The city is smitten” and they made the day of the report like the day of the burning
llm_translation: And I do not say so, but: "The fast of the tenth" - this is the fifth of Tevet, on which the report came to the exile that the city had been smitten, as it is said: "And it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying, 'The city is smitten,'" and they made the day of the report like the day of the burning.

hebrew_text: וְנִרְאִין דְּבָרַי מִדְּבָרָיו, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר עַל רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן וְעַל אַחֲרוֹן אַחֲרוֹן, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר עַל רִאשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן וְעַל אַחֲרוֹן רִאשׁוֹן. אֶלָּא שֶׁהוּא מוֹנֶה לְסֵדֶר חֳדָשִׁים, וַאֲנִי מוֹנֶה לְסֵדֶר פּוּרְעָנִיּוֹת.
human_translation: And my statement seems than his statement, as I say about the first first, and about the last last. But he, says about the first last, and about the last first, only that he lists in the order of the months, whereas I list in the order of the calamities
llm_translation: And his words appear from his words, for I say about the first, first, and about the last, last, and he says about the first, last, and about the last, first. Rather, he counts for arranging months, and I count for arranging intercalations.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמְרִי: בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמְרִי: לֹא בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית.
human_translation: It was stated Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina say: Megillat Ta’anit , has been nullified, Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: Megillat Ta’anit has not been nullified.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Rabbi Chanina said: The Scroll of Fasting was nullified. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The Scroll of Fasting was not nullified.

hebrew_text: רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמְרִי בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית, הָכִי קָאָמַר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם — יִהְיוּ לְשָׂשׂוֹן וּלְשִׂמְחָה, אֵין שָׁלוֹם — צוֹם. וְהָנָךְ נָמֵי כִּי הָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina say Megillat Ta’anit has been nullified. This is what is saying: At a time when there is peace will be joy and gladness, there is no peace, fasting. And those are also like these
llm_translation: Rav and Rabbi Chanina said: The Scroll of Fasting is nullified. This is what he is saying: When there is peace - they shall be for joy and gladness, when there is no peace - fast. And there are those who say: when there are these.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמְרִי: לֹא בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית — הָנֵי הוּא דִּתְלִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא בְּבִנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל הָנָךְ — כִּדְקָיְימִי קָיְימִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say Megillat Ta’anit has not been nullified, It was those that the Merciful One makes contingent on the building of the Temple, but these remain as they were
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The Scroll of Fasting has not been annulled, for those are the ones upon whom the Merciful One relied for the construction of the Temple, but here, they are established as they were established.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וְגָזְרוּ תַּעֲנִית בַּחֲנוּכָּה בְּלוֹד, וְיָרַד רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרָחַץ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְסִיפֵּר. וְאָמְרוּ לָהֶם: צְאוּ וְהִתְעַנּוּ עַל מַה שֶּׁהִתְעַנִּיתֶם.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raised an objection There was an incident and decreed a fast on Hanukkah in Lod, and Rabbi Eliezer went down and bathed and Rabbi Yehoshua went down and cut said to Go out and fast for what you have fasted,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: It was related that they decreed a fast on Chanukah in Lod, and Rabbi Eliezer descended and bathed, and Rabbi Yehoshua told a story. And they said to them: Go out and fast for that for which you have already fasted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: שָׁאנֵי חֲנוּכָּה דְּאִיכָּא מִצְוָה. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְתִיבְטַיל אִיהִי וְתִיבְטַל מִצְוָתָהּ!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Hanukkah is different, as there is the mitzva Abaye said to him: Let itself be nullified, and let its mitzva be nullified
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: The difference of Chanukah is that there is a mitzvah. Abaye said to him: And let her be nullified, and let her mitzvah be nullified!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, שָׁאנֵי חֲנוּכָּה דְּמִיפַּרְסַם נִיסָּא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Hanukkah is different, as its miracle is well known,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said, the difference is regarding Chanukah, for the miracle was publicized.

hebrew_text: מוֹתֵיב רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא: בִּתְלָתָא בְּתִשְׁרִי בְּטֵילַת אַדְכָּרְתָּא מִן שְׁטָרַיָּיא. שֶׁגָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת יָוָן גְּזֵרָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַזְכִּיר שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם עַל פִּיהֶם, וּכְשֶׁגָּבְרָה מַלְכוּת חַשְׁמוֹנַאי וְנִצְּחוּם הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַזְכִּירִין שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁטָרוֹת. וְכָךְ הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִים: בִּשְׁנַת כָּךְ וְכָךְ לְיוֹחָנָן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְאֵל עֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Huna raised an objection: On the third of Tishrei the mention in documents was abolished, For the kingdom of Greece had issued a decree forbidding them to mention the name of Heaven on their lips. When the Hasmonean kingdom became strong and defeated they instituted that people should mention the name of Heaven even in their documents. And therefore they would write: In year such and such of Yoḥanan the High Priest of the God Most High.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Huna raises an objection: On the third of Tishrei, the decree of the Greeks to abolish the mention of the Name of Heaven from their documents was enacted. But when the Hasmonean kingdom prevailed and defeated them, they instituted that the Name of Heaven should be mentioned even in their documents. And this is how they would write: "In such and such year to Yoḥanan the High Priest, to the Most High God."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: לְמָחָר זֶה פּוֹרֵעַ אֶת חוֹבוֹ וְנִמְצָא שְׁטָר מוּטָּל בָּאַשְׁפָּה, וּבִיטְּלוּם, וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֲשָׂאוּהוּ יוֹם טוֹב. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית — קַמָּיָיתָא בְּטוּל, אַחְרָנְיָיתָא מוֹסִיפִין?!
human_translation: And when the Sages heard about this they said: Tomorrow this one, will repay his debt, the document will be cast on a dunghill, And they annulled and they made that day into a Festival. And if it enters your mind Megillat Ta’anit has been nullified, the first they annulled, and later were added?
llm_translation: And when the sages heard about this matter, they said: "Tomorrow this one will pay his debt, and a promissory note will be found in the garbage, and they annulled it, and that day they made it a festival. And if, God forbid, you nullified the Scroll of Fasting, you have annulled the first and added the last?!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? when the Temple was standing
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? When the Temple is standing.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹם שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג בּוֹ גְּדַלְיָה בֶּן אֲחִיקָם! אָמַר רַב: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר אֶת שֶׁלְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: derive it is the day that Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, was killed. Rav said: It was only necessary in order to prohibit the preceding
llm_translation: And it should be derived for him that it was the day on which Gedaliah the son of Ahikam was killed! Rav said: It was only necessary to prohibit what was before him.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלְּפָנָיו נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹם שֶׁלְּאַחַר רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ! רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא בָּעֵי חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: the preceding day, also derive it because it is day after New Moon, New Moon is by Torah law, by Torah law do not require reinforcement.
llm_translation: Before him stand, let him go out that it will be for him a day after Rosh Chodesh! Rosh Chodesh is from the Torah, and from the Torah does not require strengthening.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה הַכְּתוּבִין בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית אֲסוּרִין, בֵּין לִפְנֵיהֶם בֵּין לְאַחֲרֵיהֶם. שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים — הֵם אֲסוּרִים, לִפְנֵיהֶן וּלְאַחֲרֵיהֶן מוּתָּרִין. מָה הֶפְרֵשׁ בֵּין זֶה לָזֶה? הַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְאֵין דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק. הַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, וְדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק.
human_translation: As it is taught These days that are written in Megillat Ta’anit are prohibited, both before them and after them. Shabbatot and Festivals, them is forbidden, before them and after them is permitted. What is the difference between this and that These are Torah law, and Torah laws do not need reinforcement, those are rabbinic law, and rabbinic laws need reinforcement,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: These days that are written in the Scroll of Fasting are forbidden, whether before them or after them. Shabbatot and festivals - they are forbidden, both before them and after them they are permitted. What is the difference between these and those? These are the words of the Torah, and the words of the Torah do not require reinforcement. Those are the words of the Scribes, and the words of the Scribes require reinforcement.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ יוֹם שֶׁלִּפְנֵי יוֹם שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג בּוֹ גְּדַלְיָה בֶּן אֲחִיקָם! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: גְּדַלְיָה בֶּן אֲחִיקָם דִּבְרֵי קַבָּלָה הוּא, וְדִבְרֵי קַבָּלָה כְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה דָּמוּ.
human_translation: derive it it is the day before the day that Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, was killed, Rav Ashi said: Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, is the texts of the tradition, and the texts of the tradition are like Torah statements
llm_translation: And it shall come to pass that he will be for him a day before the day that Gedaliah the son of Ahikam was killed in it! Rav Ashi said: Gedaliah the son of Ahikam is words of tradition, and words of tradition are like words of Torah.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב טוֹבִי בַּר מַתְנָה: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּתְמָנְיָא בֵּיהּ אֲתָת בְּשׂוֹרְתָּא טָבְתָּא לִיהוּדָאֵי דְּלָא יְעִידוֹן מֵאוֹרָיְיתָא. שֶׁגָּזְרָה מַלְכוּת הָרְשָׁעָה גְּזֵרָה שֶׁלֹּא יַעַסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא יָמוּלוּ אֶת בְּנֵיהֶם, וְשֶׁיְּחַלְּלוּ שַׁבָּתוֹת. מָה עָשָׂה יְהוּדָה בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ וַחֲבֵירָיו? הָלְכוּ וְנָטְלוּ עֵצָה מִמַּטְרוֹנִיתָא אַחַת שֶׁכׇּל גְּדוֹלֵי רוֹמִי מְצוּיִין אֶצְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Tovi bar Mattana raised an objection On the twenty-eighth of good tidings came to the Jews that they should not turn away from the Torah, For the wicked kingdom issued a decree against Israel that they should not occupy themselves with Torah and that they should not circumcise their sons, and that they should desecrate Shabbat. What did Yehuda ben Shammua and his colleagues do? They went and took advice from matron [ matronita ] whom all the prominent men of Rome would visit regularly,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Tovi bar Matna asked: On the twenty-eighth day of it, the fifteenth of Av, the daughters of Jerusalem would go out and dance in the vineyards. And what would they say? "Young man, lift up your eyes and see what you choose for yourself. Do not set your eyes on beauty, set your eyes on family. For 'Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain, but a woman who fears the Lord, she shall be praised.'" (Proverbs 31:30)

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לָהֶם: בּוֹאוּ וְהַפְגִּינוּ בַּלַּיְלָה. הָלְכוּ וְהִפְגִּינוּ בַּלַּיְלָה, אָמְרוּ: אֵי שָׁמַיִם! לֹא אֲחֵיכֶם אֲנַחְנוּ, וְלֹא בְּנֵי אָב אֶחָד אֲנַחְנוּ, וְלֹא בְּנֵי אֵם אַחַת אֲנַחְנוּ? מָה נִשְׁתַּנֵּינוּ מִכׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן שֶׁאַתֶּם גּוֹזְרִין עָלֵינוּ גְּזֵירוֹת קָשׁוֹת? וּבִיטְּלוּם. וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֲשָׂאוּהוּ יוֹם טוֹב. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בָּטְלָה מְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית — קַמָּיָיתָא בְּטוּל, אַחְרָנְיָיתָא מוֹסִיפִין?!
human_translation: She said to them Come and cry out [ hafgginu ] at night They went and cried out at night, saying: O Heavens! Are we not your brothers; are we not children of one father; are we not children of one mother? How are we different from every nation and tongue that you issue harsh decrees against us? And were annulled, and made that day a festive day. And if it enters your mind Megillat Ta’anit has been nullified, the first they annulled, and later were added?
llm_translation: She said to them: "Come and protest at night." They went and protested at night. They said: "Heaven forbid! Are we not your brothers, and are we not the sons of one father, and are we not the sons of one mother? How are we different from all other nations and languages that you decree harsh decrees upon us? And they annulled them. And that day they made it a holiday. And if it enters your mind that they annulled the Scroll of Fasting - you have nullified the first and added the last?!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — וְהָא יְהוּדָה בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בָּתַר הָכִי הֲוָה! דִּתְנַן: כְּלֵי זְכוּכִית שֶׁנִּיקְּבוּ וְהִטִּיף לְתוֹכָן אֲבָר, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: יְהוּדָה בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ מְטַמֵּא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר,
human_translation: And if you say that here too the time when the Temple was standing, as Yehuda ben Shammua was a student of Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Meir was after as we learned glass vessels that had holes were filled in with lead, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Yehuda ben Shammua becomes impure, in the name of Rabbi Meir;
llm_translation: And if you will say, here it is different because when the Temple was standing - but wasn't Yehudah ben Shamua a disciple of Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Meir was after that! As we learned: Glass vessels that were punctured and had blood dripped into them, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Yehudah ben Shamua renders them impure in the name of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים מְטַהֲרִין.
human_translation: whereas the Sages declare it pure.
llm_translation: And the sages purify.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַיָּמִים הָאֵלּוּ הַכְּתוּבִין בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית, בֵּין בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים בֵּין בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — אֲסוּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — אֲסוּרִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחָה הִיא לָהֶם. אֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מוּתָּרִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵבֶל הוּא לָהֶם.
human_translation: tanna’im , as it is taught These days, which are written in Megillat Ta’anit , both when the Temple is standing and when the Temple is not standing, are prohibited; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: When the Temple is standing, are prohibited because are joy for the Temple is not standing, are permitted because these are mourning for them.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: These days that are written in the Scroll of Fasts, whether the Temple is standing or not standing - they are forbidden, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: When the Temple is standing - they are forbidden, because it is a joy for them. When the Temple is not standing - they are permitted, because it is a time of mourning for them.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא בָּטְלוּ, וְהִלְכְתָא לֹא בָּטְלוּ. קַשְׁיָא הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּחֲנוּכָּה וּפוּרִים, כָּאן בִּשְׁאָר יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: And the halakha is were nullified, and the halakha is they were not nullified. is difficult, halakha the halakha . It not difficult. Here, Hanukkah and Purim. There, the rest of the days
llm_translation: The halakha of Batlu, and the halakha did not become Batlu. The difficulty of the halakha is the halakha! It is not difficult: here regarding Chanukah and Purim, here regarding other days.

hebrew_text: עַל אֱלוּל מִפְּנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת. כֵּיוָן דְּנָפְקִי לְהוּ אַאֱלוּל, אַתִּשְׁרִי לְמָה לְהוּ?
human_translation: in Elul, due to Rosh HaShana, and in Tishrei, due to the correct the Festivals Once have gone out in Elul why do they in Tishrei,
llm_translation: On Elul because of Rosh Hashanah, and on Tishri because of the establishment of the festivals. Since Elul has gone out, why Tishri for them?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דִּלְמָא עַבְּרוּהּ לֶאֱלוּל, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִינָּנָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: מִימוֹת עֶזְרָא וְאֵילָךְ לֹא מָצִינוּ אֱלוּל מְעוּבָּר!
human_translation: And if you say perhaps the added Elul, Didn’t Rabbi Ḥinnana bar Kahana say Rav said: From the days of Ezra and onward, we have never found that Elul an additional
llm_translation: And if you say perhaps it passed into Elul, but Rabbi Chinana bar Kahana said in the name of Rav: From the days of Ezra and onwards, we have not found Elul as a leap year!

hebrew_text: לֹא מָצִינוּ — דְּלָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ, הָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ — מְעַבְּרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: We have not because it was not necessary But necessary, they would an additional
llm_translation: We did not find - for it is not necessary, if it is necessary - we may pass it over to him.

hebrew_text: הָא מִיקַּלְקַל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה! מוּטָב תִּיקַּלְקֵל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְלֹא יִתְקַלְקְלוּ כּוּלְּהוּ מוֹעֲדוֹת.
human_translation: But Rosh HaShana will be ruined, Better that Rosh HaShana be ruined, and all the Festivals, not be ruined.
llm_translation: The Mishnah states: "If one must choose between the head of the year being confused or all the festivals being confused, it is better for the head of the year to be confused and not all the festivals."

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: עַל תִּשְׁרִי מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: in Tishrei due to the correct the Festivals conclude from here
llm_translation: Precisely it was stated, as it was taught: "On the twenty-ninth day of the month due to the fixing of the festivals, one should listen from it."

hebrew_text: וְעַל כִּסְלֵיו מִפְּנֵי חֲנוּכָּה, וְעַל אֲדָר מִפְּנֵי הַפּוּרִים. וְאִילּוּ נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה יוֹצְאִין אַף עַל אֲדָר שֵׁנִי מִפְּנֵי הַפּוּרִים — לָא קָתָנֵי. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִם נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה — יוֹצְאִין אַף עַל אֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי מִפְּנֵי הַפּוּרִים.
human_translation: in Kislev, due to Hanukkah, and in Adar, due to Purim. Whereas, it is not taught: If the year was a leap year, go out also in the second Adar due to Purim, the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi as it is taught Rabbi says: If the year was a leap year, go out also in the second Adar, due to Purim.
llm_translation: And on Kislev because of Chanukah, and on Adar because of Purim. And if the year was intercalated, they also go out on Adar II because of Purim - this is not taught. Mishna that is not like Rabbi. As it was taught: Rabbi says: If the year was intercalated - they also go out on Adar II because of Purim.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי — נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּמָר סָבַר: כׇּל מִצְוֹת הַנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי — אֵין נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this. Sage, holds all the mitzvot observed in the second are observed in the first And Sage, holds all the mitzvot observed in the second are not observed in the first.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case, where Mar disagrees: "All commandments that are observed in the second Temple period are observed in the first Temple period," and Mar holds: "All commandments that are observed in the second Temple period are not observed in the first Temple period."

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִצְוֹת הַנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי — אֵין נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וְהָכָא בְּעִיבּוּר שָׁנָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּתַנְיָא: כַּמָּה עִיבּוּר שָׁנָה — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: No, everyone agrees that the mitzvot observed in the second are not observed on the first, and here they disagree about leap year, as it is taught How long is a leap year? Thirty days. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A month.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "No, for all the mitzvot that are practiced in the second month are not practiced in the first month, and here in the matter of intercalating the year they disagree. For it was taught: How long is the intercalation of the year? Thirty days. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It is a month."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא שְׁלֹשִׁים — דְּיָדְעִי? חֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי יָדְעִי! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאן דְּאָמַר חֹדֶשׁ, רָצָה — חֹדֶשׁ, רָצָה — שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: What is different about thirty days? because know A month also, know Rav Pappa said: The one who said a month if wish, a month if it wishes, thirty
llm_translation: What is the difference of thirty - that he knows? A month he knows! Rav Papa said: Whoever says a month, if he wants - a month, if he wants - thirty.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא דִּירוּשָׁלַיִם עַל שְׁנֵי אֲדָרִים שֶׁמְּקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתָם בְּיוֹם עִיבּוּרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi testified in the name of the holy community of Jerusalem about the two Adar, that they are sanctified on the day that a full
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi testified in the name of the holy community of Jerusalem concerning two Adars, that they sanctify them on their intercalation day.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּחֲסֵרִין עָבְדִינַן, מְלֵאִין לָא עָבְדִינַן! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּדָרֵשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר חִסְדָּא. הֵעִיד רַבִּי סִימַאי מִשּׁוּם חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי עַל שְׁנֵי אֲדָרִים, שֶׁאִם רָצוּ לַעֲשׂוֹתָן שְׁנֵיהֶן מְלֵאִין — עוֹשִׂין, שְׁנֵיהֶן חֲסֵרִין — עוֹשִׂין, אֶחָד מָלֵא וְאֶחָד חָסֵר — עוֹשִׂין, וְכָךְ הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין בַּגּוֹלָה. וּמִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ: לְעוֹלָם אֶחָד מָלֵא וְאֶחָד חָסֵר, עַד שֶׁיִּוּוֹדַע לָךְ שֶׁהוּקְבַּע רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בִּזְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: That is to say they make short they do not make them full to the exclusion of what Rav Naḥman bar Ḥisda taught, Rabbi Simai testified in the name of Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi about two Adar that if wish to make them both full, they may do short, they may do make one full and one short, they may do And this is what they would do in the Diaspora, And in the name of our teacher, they said: always one full and one short, unless it is known to you that New Moon was fixed in its time,
llm_translation: In the matter of lacking, we require a full measure, we do not require a lacking measure! When Rav Nahman bar Hisda would go out to the study hall, Rabbi Simai testified in the name of Haggai and Malachi concerning the two Adars, that if they wanted to make both full - they would make them full, if both lacking - they would make them lacking, one full and one lacking - they would make them so, and this was the practice in the exile. And in the name of our Rabbis they said: Always one full and one lacking, until it is known to you that the new moon was established in its time.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לְמָר עוּקְבָא: אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לְנִיסָן — לְעוֹלָם חָסֵר.
human_translation: was sent to Mar Ukva, The Adar that precedes Nisan is always short,
llm_translation: Send to the master, Uqva: The month adjacent to Nissan - always lacking.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב נַחְמָן: עַל שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים מְחַלְּלִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת — עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא זִמְנִין מָלֵא זִמְנִין חָסֵר — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְחַלְּלִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman raised an objection may desecrate Shabbat for two months, for Nisan and for Tishrei, Granted, if you say sometimes full and sometimes short, due to that may desecrate
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Nachman raised an objection: On two months we desecrate the Sabbath - on Nissan and on Tishrei. If you say: When the time is complete, we desecrate; when the time is incomplete, we do not desecrate - for this reason we desecrate.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְעוֹלָם חָסֵר, אַמַּאי מְחַלְּלִינַן? מִשּׁוּם דְּמִצְוָה לְקַדֵּשׁ עַל הָרְאִיָּיה.
human_translation: But if you say always short, why should they desecrate Because it is a mitzva to sanctify on the basis of saw
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is always lacking, why do we desecrate? Because it is a commandment to sanctify based on what is seen.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: עַל שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים מְחַלְּלִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת — עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְעוֹלָם חָסֵר — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְחַלְּלִינַן, דְּמִצְוָה לְקַדֵּשׁ עַל הָרְאִיָּיה.
human_translation: Some say Rav Naḥman said: We, too, learn may desecrate Shabbat two months, for Nisan and for Tishrei. Granted, if you say always short, due to that may desecrate because it is a mitzva to sanctify on the basis of saw
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Nachman said, we also learned: On two months we desecrate the Sabbath - on Nissan and on Tishrei. If you say, it is always lacking - therefore we desecrate, for it is a commandment to sanctify based on the sighting.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ זִמְנִין מָלֵא זִמְנִין חָסֵר — אַמַּאי מְחַלְּלִינַן? נְעַבְּרֵיהּ הָאִידָּנָא, וּנְקַדְּשֵׁיהּ לִמְחַר.
human_translation: But if you say is sometimes full sometimes short, why should desecrate add now, and sanctify the next day
llm_translation: Rather, if you say, "full times full times lacking," why do we desecrate it? Let us pass it over now, and sanctify it for tomorrow.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאִקְּלַע יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים בְּשַׁבָּת — הָכִי נָמֵי. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן: דְּאִקְּלַע יוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֶחָד בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּמִצְוָה לְקַדֵּשׁ עַל הָרְאִיָּיה.
human_translation: If the thirtieth falls on Shabbat, this indeed Here we are dealing with thirty-first falls on Shabbat, because it is a mitzva to sanctify on saw
llm_translation: If one encountered the new moon on the thirtieth day on Shabbat - thus we say. Here, what are we dealing with: if the new moon was encountered on the thirtieth day and the first day on Shabbat, it is a mitzvah to sanctify based on observation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: כְּשֶׁהַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים מְחַלְּלִין אַף עַל כּוּלָּן, מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raised an objection When the Temple was standing, would desecrate for even all in order to rectify the offering
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Kahana asks, "When the Temple is standing, we desecrate Shabbat for all sacrificial offerings, due to the requirement of the offering."

hebrew_text: מִדְּכוּלְּהוּ לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּמִצְוָה לְקַדֵּשׁ עַל הָרְאִיָּיה — נִיסָן וְתִשְׁרִי נָמֵי לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּמִצְוָה לְקַדֵּשׁ עַל הָרְאִיָּיה.
human_translation: From all not because it is a mitzva to sanctify on saw Nisan and Tishrei as well, not because it is a mitzva to sanctify on saw
llm_translation: From among them, it is not considered a mitzvah to sanctify based on sighting the new moon - Nisan and Tishrei are not considered a mitzvah to sanctify based on sighting the new moon.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא זִמְנִין מָלֵא וְזִמְנִין חָסֵר, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְחַלְּלִינַן. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְעוֹלָם חָסֵר, אַמַּאי מְחַלְּלִינַן? תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say is sometimes full and sometimes short, due to that may desecrate But if you say is always short, why should they desecrate a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: If you say sometimes full and sometimes lacking, therefore we desecrate. Rather, if you say always lacking, why do we desecrate? A contradiction.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא עוּלָּא, אָמַר: עַבְּרוּהּ לֶאֱלוּל. אָמַר עוּלָּא: יָדְעִי חַבְרִין בַּבְלָאֵי מַאי טֵיבוּתָא עָבְדִינַן בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: when Ulla came he said: they added Elul. Ulla said: Do our Babylonian colleagues understand what benefit we did for them?
llm_translation: When Ulla came, he said: "Pass it to Elul." Ulla said: "I know the colleagues in Babylon, what benefit do we have with them!"

hebrew_text: מַאי טֵיבוּתָא? עוּלָּא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם יַרְקַיָּא. רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם מִתַיָּא.
human_translation: What benefit Ulla said: Due to the vegetables Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: Due to the dead
llm_translation: What is the benefit? Ulla said: Because of vegetables. Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: Because of dates.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. מַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם מִתַיָּא — מְעַבְּרִינַן. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יַרְקַיָּא, לְאֵימַת קָא בָּעֵי לְהוּ — לְאוּרְתָּא, לְאוּרְתָּא טָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי.
human_translation: What is between between them Yom Kippur occurs after Shabbat. the one who said due to the dead adds But the one who said due to the vegetables When would he require in the evening in the evening and bring
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: Yom Kippur that falls after Shabbat. One who says it is due to the vegetables - we pass over. And one who says it is due to the lamp - when does he need it? For the light, for the light he exerts effort and brings it.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יַרְקַיָּא, לְעַבְּרֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם מִתַיָּא! אֶלָּא: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ יוֹם טוֹב הַסָּמוּךְ לַשַּׁבָּת בֵּין מִלְּפָנֶיהָ בֵּין מִלְּאַחֲרֶיהָ. מַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יַרְקַיָּא — מְעַבְּרִינַן, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם מִתַיָּא — אֶפְשָׁר בְּעַמְמֵי.
human_translation: But according to the one who says due to vegetables, should make full due to the dead, Rather, between them the Festival occurs adjacent to Shabbat, either before it or after it. the one who said due to the vegetables adds But the one who said due to the dead it is possible by gentiles.
llm_translation: And for the one who says in the name of Yarkaya, for the sake of the vegetables, we pass over it! Rather, there is a distinction between them: a festival day that is adjacent to the Sabbath, whether before it or after it. The one who says in the name of Yarkaya - we pass over it, and the one who says for the sake of the dead - it is possible in populous areas.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם מִתַיָּא, לְעַבְּרֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם יַרְקַיָּא! אֶפְשָׁר בְּחַמִּימֵי.
human_translation: But according to the one who said due to the dead, should add due to the vegetables. because it is possible in hot water
llm_translation: And for the one who says in the name of Mitayya, for his colleagues in the name of Yarkaya! It is possible in hot water.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: מַאי שְׁנָא לְדִידַן, אֲפִילּוּ לְדִידְהוּ נָמֵי! לְדִידַן חֲבִיל לַן עָלְמָא, לְדִידְהוּ לָא חֲבִיל לְהוּ עָלְמָא.
human_translation: If so, what is different to us, to them as well. For us is hot, for them is not hot,
llm_translation: So it is: What is different for us, even for them also! For us, the world is precious, for them, the world is not precious.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָתָנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה לְצוֹרֶךְ, כָּךְ מְעַבְּרִין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ לְצוֹרֶךְ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם רֹאשׁ חֳדָשִׁים״ — כָּזֶה רְאֵה וְקַדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabba bar Shmuel teach might that just as adds a year for need, so too, adds a month for need. the verse states: “This month shall be to you the beginning of months” like this, see and sanctify
llm_translation: I?! And it was taught by Rabba bar Shmuel: Can we infer that just as we pass over the year for the sake of the new moon, so too do we pass over the month for the sake of the new moon? The verse teaches: "This month shall be for you the beginning of months" — in this manner, see and sanctify.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן לְעַבְּרוֹ, כָּאן לְקַדְּשׁוֹ. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּעַבְּרִין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה וְאֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ לְצוֹרֶךְ, כָּךְ מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ לְצוֹרֶךְ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״ — כָּזֶה רְאֵה וְקַדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rava said: This not difficult: Here adding there sanctifying And this is what is saying: might that just as adds to a year or a month for need, so too, a month can be sanctified the verse states: “This month shall be to you the beginning of months,” like this, see and sanctify
llm_translation: Rava said, it is not difficult: here for its crossing, here for its sanctification. And thus he said: one might think just as we pass over the year and the month for a purpose, so too we sanctify the month for a purpose - the Talmud teaches: "This month is for you" - in this way, see and sanctify.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מְאַיְּימִין עַל הָעֵדִים עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנִּרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לְעַבְּרוֹ, וְאֵין מְאַיְּימִין עַל הָעֵדִים עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לְקַדְּשׁוֹ.
human_translation: like that which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: may intimidate witnesses about the moon that was seen at its time, can add it, But may not intimidate witnesses about the new moon that was not seen on its time, in order to sanctify
llm_translation: And when this that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What do they threaten the witnesses regarding the month that was seen in its time? — To make it pass, and they do not threaten the witnesses regarding the month that was not seen in its time? — To sanctify it.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: הֱווּ יוֹדְעִין שֶׁכׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָיָה מְלַמְּדֵנוּ: מְאַיְּימִין עַל הָעֵדִים עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לְקַדְּשׁוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּהוּ, יֹאמְרוּ ״רָאִינוּ״!
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yehuda Nesia, send to Rabbi Ami: Be aware that all the days of Rabbi Yoḥanan he would teach us witnesses may be intimidated about the moon that was not seen in its time. in order that may be sanctified Although did not see they may say: We saw it.
llm_translation: I?! And this, he sent to him Rabbi Yehudah the Prince to Rabbi Ammi: Be aware that all the days of Rabbi Yochanan he was teaching us: What do they threaten the witnesses regarding the new moon that was not seen in its time? — To sanctify it, even though they did not see it, they should say "We have seen"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּנִיסָן וְתִשְׁרִי, הָא בִּשְׁאָר יַרְחֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: This not difficult: This is referring to Nisan and Tishrei, that the other months,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, it is not difficult: this is referring to in Nisan and Tishrei, this is referring to in the other months.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָא דְּתָנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל — אֲחֵרִים הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין בֵּין עֲצֶרֶת לַעֲצֶרֶת וְאֵין בֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לָרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אֶלָּא אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים בִּלְבַד. וְאִם הָיְתָה שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rava said: That which Rabba bar Shmuel taught, Aḥerim , as it is taught Aḥerim say: The between Shavuot Shavuot and between Rosh HaShana Rosh HaShana is only four days And if it was a leap year, five
llm_translation: Rava said: This that Rabbah bar Shmuel taught — it is according to others. As it was taught: Others say, there is no difference between one festival and another festival, and there is no difference between one New Year and another New Year except for four days only. And if the year was a leap year — five days.

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא מַתְנֵי אִיפְּכָא: מְאַיְּימִין עַל הָעֵדִים עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לְקַדְּשׁוֹ, וְאֵין מְאַיְּימִין עַל הָעֵדִים עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנִּרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לְעַבְּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Dimi from Neharde’a taught the opposite may intimidate the witnesses about the new moon that was not seen in its time in order that may be sanctified But may not intimidate witnesses about the moon that was seen in its time, to add
llm_translation: Rav Dimi from Nehardea teaches a contradiction: What do they threaten the witnesses regarding the new moon that was not seen in its time? — to sanctify it. And what do they not threaten the witnesses regarding the new moon that was seen in its time? — to desecrate it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא —
human_translation: What is the reason
llm_translation: What is the reason —

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיחֲזֵי כְּשִׁקְרָא, הַאי לָא מִיחֲזֵי כְּשִׁקְרָא.
human_translation: this looks like a lie, that does not look like a lie,
llm_translation: This one resembles like Scripture, this one does not resemble like Scripture.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יָכֵילְנָא לְתַקּוֹנֵי לְכוּלַּהּ גּוֹלָה.
human_translation: Shmuel said: I am able to fix for the entire Diaspora
llm_translation: Shmuel said: We are able to establish for everything an exile.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי לִשְׁמוּאֵל: יָדַע מָר הַאי מִילְּתָא דְּתַנְיָא בְּסוֹד הָעִיבּוּר: נוֹלַד קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת אוֹ נוֹלַד אַחַר חֲצוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּהָא לָא יָדַע מָר — אִיכָּא מִילֵּי אַחְרָנְיָיתָא דְּלָא יָדַע מָר.
human_translation: Abba, the father of Rabbi Simlai, said to Shmuel: Does the Master know this statement, as it is taught the secret of addition, the molad occurred before midday and the molad occurred after midday? He said to him: No, He said to him: Since the Master does not know this, there are other matters that the Master does not know,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abba, the father of Rabbi Shmuel: Does Master know this matter that is taught in the secret of pregnancy: Is a child conceived before midnight or is a child conceived after midnight? He said to him: No. He said to him: Since Master does not know, are there other matters that Master does not know.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רַבִּי זֵירָא, שְׁלַח לְהוּ: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא לַיְלָה וָיוֹם מִן הֶחָדָשׁ.
human_translation: when Rabbi Zeira went up he sent it is necessary that the night and the day be of the new
llm_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended, he sent to them: "It is necessary that there should be night and day from the new moon."

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ שֶׁאָמַר אַבָּא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי: מְחַשְּׁבִין אֶת תּוֹלַדְתּוֹ. נוֹלַד קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנִּרְאָה סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. לֹא נוֹלַד קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: And this is what Abba, the father of Rabbi Simlai, said: They calculate the molad ; the molad occurred before midday, it is known that will be visible close to sunset. the molad did not occur before midday, it is known that will not be visible close to sunset.
llm_translation: And this is what Abba, the father of Rabbi Simlai, said: One calculates his conception. If he was born before midnight - it is known that he appears close to the setting of the sun. If he was not born before midnight - it is known that he does not appear close to the setting of the sun.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְאַכְחוֹשֵׁי סָהֲדֵי.
human_translation: What is the practical difference Rav Ashi said: to refute the witnesses,
llm_translation: Regarding what does this matter emerge? Rav Ashi said: For the purpose of discrediting the witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה שָׁעֵי מִכַּסֵּי סֵיהֲרָא. לְדִידַן — שֵׁית מֵעַתִּיקָא וְתַמְנֵי סְרֵי מֵחַדְתָּא, לְדִידְהוּ — שֵׁית מֵחַדְתָּא וְתַמְנֵי סְרֵי מֵעַתִּיקָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Naḥman said: twenty-four hours the moon is covered, For us, six of the old and eighteen of the new; for them, six of the new and eighteen of the old.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Nachman: Twenty-four rows cover the sky. According to us - six from the east and eighteen from the west; according to them - six from the west and eighteen from the east.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְאַכְחוֹשֵׁי סָהֲדֵי.
human_translation: What is the practical difference Rav Ashi said: to refute the witnesses,
llm_translation: For what does it come out? Rav Ashi said: For the credibility of the witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא לַיְלָה וָיוֹם מִן הֶחָדָשׁ. מְנָלַן? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״מֵעֶרֶב עַד עֶרֶב״.
human_translation: The Master said it is necessary that the night and the day be of the new From where do we Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “From evening to evening
llm_translation: The Master said: It is necessary that there should be night and day from the new moon. Whence do we derive this? Rabbi Yochanan said: "From evening until evening."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״עַד יוֹם הָאֶחָד וְעֶשְׂרִים לַחֹדֶשׁ בָּעָרֶב״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: until the twenty-first day of the month at the evening”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Until the first day and twentieth of the month in the evening."

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is between Abaye said: The interpretation of the meaning is between them.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: There is a difference in the interpretation they seek.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: חֲצוֹת לַיְלָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: between them midnight.
llm_translation: Rava said: midnight there is between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כֹּל סְפֵיקָא לְקַמֵּיהּ שָׁדֵינַן. לְמֵימְרָא דַּחֲמֵיסַר וְשִׁיתְּסַר עָבְדִינַן, אַרְבֵּיסַר לָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Naḥman said: Any uncertainty we cast it forward, That is to say, we observe the fifteenth and the sixteenth not the fourteenth.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Nachman: "We permit all cases of doubt before him." In the case of thirteen and fourteen, we act, but not in the case of twelve.

hebrew_text: וְלֶיעְבַּד נָמֵי אַרְבֵּיסַר? דִּלְמָא חַסְּרוּהּ לְאָב וְחַסְּרוּהּ לֶאֱלוּל!
human_translation: But observe also on the fourteenth, perhaps Av and Elul were made short?
llm_translation: And to serve before the twelve? Perhaps it is lacking for the father and lacking for the evening!

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי יַרְחֵי חַסִּירֵי קָלָא אִית לְהוּ.
human_translation: two months are made short, would generate publicity,
llm_translation: Two months deficient a voice they have.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אִקְּלַע לְבָבֶל בְּחַדְסַר בְּתִשְׁרִי. אֲמַר: בְּסִים תַּבְשִׁילָא דְבַבְלָאֵי בְּיוֹמָא רַבָּה דְּמַעְרְבָא. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַסְהֵיד! אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״.
human_translation: Levi arrived in Babylonia on the eleventh of Tishrei. He said: How tasty is the dish of the Babylonians on the great day in the West, They said to him: Testify He said to them: I did not hear the court It is sanctified.
llm_translation: Levi arrived in Babylon on the twenty-third of Tishrei. He said: "With the fine dishes of the Babylonians on a great day of the evening." They said to him: "Witness!" He said to them: "I did not hear from the mouth of the court 'sanctified.'"

hebrew_text: מַכְרִיז רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי נִיסָן, וְלָא מָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי תִּשְׁרֵי — לִיעְבְּדוּ תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי. גְּזֵירָה נִיסָן אַטּוּ תִּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan proclaim: Anywhere that can be reached messengers in Nisan but cannot be reached by the messengers in Tishrei, let them observe for two days. Nisan as decree due to Tishrei,
llm_translation: Announced Rabbi Yochanan: Wherever emissaries of Nisan arrived, and emissaries of Tishrei did not arrive - they should observe two days. The decree of Nisan is stringent, Tishrei is lenient.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַיְיבוּ בַּר נַגָּרֵי וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא דַּהֲוָה מָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי נִיסָן וְלָא מָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי תִּשְׁרֵי, וְעָבְדִי חַד יוֹמָא, וְלָא אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. שְׁמַע רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְאִיקְּפַד. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָאו אֲמַרִי לְכוּ הֵיכָא דְּמָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי נִיסָן וְלָא מָטוּ שְׁלוּחֵי תִּשְׁרֵי לִיעְבְּדוּ תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, גְּזֵירָה נִיסָן אַטּוּ תִּשְׁרֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi Aivu bar Naggarei and Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, arrived in a certain place that could be reached by the messengers in Nisan, but could not be reached by the messengers in Tishrei. And observed one day They said nothing to them Rabbi Yoḥanan heard and he became angry He said to them: Did I not say to you anywhere that can be reached by the messengers in Nisan but not by those in Tishrei must observe two days decree in Nisan due to Tishrei?
llm_translation: Rabbi Ayyivu bar Nagarei and Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba happened upon that place where the messengers of Nisan had arrived but the messengers of Tishrei had not arrived. They waited one day, but they did not say anything to them. Rabbi Yochanan heard and became upset. He said to them: Did I not tell you that where the messengers of Nisan arrive but the messengers of Tishrei do not arrive, they should wait two days, a decree of Nisan is now in effect until Tishrei!

hebrew_text: רָבָא הֲוָה רְגִיל דַּהֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי. זִימְנָא חֲדָא אִשְׁתְּכַח כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava would regularly sit in the fast for two days, It once happened in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rava used to regularly sit in fasting for two days. One time, his wife found him lying on his back.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן יְתֵיב בְּתַעֲנִיתָא כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמֵי דְּכִיפּוּרֵי. לְאוּרְתָּא אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִמְחַר יוֹמָא רַבָּה בְּמַעְרְבָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman had fasted the entire Yom Kippur In the evening, a certain man came said to him: Tomorrow is the great day, in the West,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman sat in a fast all the days of Yom Kippur. A certain man came and said to him: Tomorrow is a great day in the west.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵהֵיכָא אַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדִּמְהַרְיָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּם תְּהֵא אַחֲרִיתוֹ. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״קַלִּים הָיוּ רוֹדְפֵינוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to him: From where do you He said to him: From Damihareya. He said to him, Blood will be his end, He read about him: “Our pursuers were swifter
llm_translation: He said to him: From where are you? He said to him: From Dimharya. He said to him: His blood shall be upon his own head. He recited regarding him: "They were swift to pursue us."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין לְרָבָא: כַּד חָזֵית דְּמָשְׁכָה תְּקוּפַת טֵבֵת עַד שִׁיתְּסַר בְּנִיסָן — עַבְּרַהּ לְהַהִיא שַׁתָּא וְלָא תְּחוּשׁ לַהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׁמוֹר אֶת חֹדֶשׁ הָאָבִיב״, שְׁמוֹר אָבִיב שֶׁל תְּקוּפָה שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּחֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Avin sent to Rava: When you see that, the season of Tevet, extend to the sixteenth of Nisan, add to that year, And do not worry as it is written: “Observe the month of spring” see to it that the spring of the season, is in the new part of Nisan,
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Huna son of Avin to Rava: As you see that the winter solstice extends until the sixteenth of Nisan - it has passed that hour and it should not be taken into account, as it is written: "Observe the month of the Aviv," observe the Aviv of the equinox, that it should be in the month of Nisan.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן לְהָנְהוּ נָחוֹתֵי יַמָּא: אַתּוּן דְּלָא יָדְעִיתוּ בִּקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא, כִּי חָזֵיתוּ סֵיהֲרָא דְּמַשְׁלֵים לְיוֹמָא — בַּעִירוּ חֲמִירָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to those setting out to sea you will not know the determination of the month, When you see that the moon sets at daybreak, burn leaven.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Nachman to those sailors of the sea: "You who do not know the fixing of the month, when you see the moon in the form of a bow, recite the blessing 'Blessed is He who renews the months'."

hebrew_text: אֵימַת מַשְׁלֵים — בַּחֲמֵיסַר. וְהָא אֲנַן מֵאַרְבֵּיסַר מְבַעֲרִינַן! לְדִידְהוּ דִּמְגַלּוּ לְהוּ עָלְמָא, מֵאַרְבֵּיסַר מַשְׁלֵים.
human_translation: When does set On the fifteenth But on the fourteenth we burn For to whom the world is revealed, completes on the fourteenth
llm_translation: "When do we repay? — On the fifteenth. But we repay on the fourteenth! According to their calculation of the world, we repay on the fifteenth."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַל שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים מְחַלְּלִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת — עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי, שֶׁבָּהֶן שְׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין לְסוּרְיָא, וּבָהֶן מְתַקְּנִין אֶת הַמּוֹעֲדוֹת. וּכְשֶׁהָיָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מְחַלְּלִין אַף עַל כּוּלָּן, מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: for two months may desecrate Shabbat, For Nisan and for Tishrei, for in these messengers are sent out to Syria, and by them, the Festivals are set: And when the Temple was standing, desecrated for all due to fixing offering
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: On two months we desecrate the Sabbath - on Nissan and on Tishrei, because in them emissaries go out to determine the new moon, and in them they establish the festivals. And when the Temple stood, they would desecrate even all of them, because of the preparation of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עַל שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים וְתוּ לָא?! וּרְמִינְהוּ: עַל שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים הַשְּׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין!
human_translation: For two months and no more? And raises a contradiction For six months messengers go out,
llm_translation: Gemara: "Is it on two months and not on six months?! And we raised a dilemma: On six months the emissaries may go out!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: עַל כּוּלָּן שְׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין מִבָּעֶרֶב — עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is what is saying: For all the messengers go out in the evening, for Nisan and for Tishrei until they hear from the court sanctified,
llm_translation: Abaye said, thus he said: Regarding all of them, emissaries may depart from the evening - regarding Nisan and regarding Tishrei, until they hear from the court: "Sanctified."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עַל כּוּלָּן יוֹצְאִין מִבָּעֶרֶב — עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי בֵּית דִּין: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״.
human_translation: This is also taught For all go out in the evening, for Nisan and for Tishrei until they have heard the court sanctified.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: On all of them they may go out from evening - on Nisan and on Tishrei, until they hear from the court: "Sanctified."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמְּחַלְּלִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵלֶּה מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרְאוּ אוֹתָם בְּמוֹעֲדָם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that may desecrate Shabbat The verse states: “These are the Festivals of the Lord, which you shall declare in their seasons”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that we desecrate the Sabbath for them? The verse states: "These are the appointed times of the Lord, which you shall proclaim them as holy convocations."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּחַלְּלִין עַד שֶׁיִּתְקַדְּשׁוּ, כָּךְ מְחַלְּלִין עַד שֶׁיִּתְקַיְּימוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרְאוּ אוֹתָם״, עַל קְרִיאָתָם אַתָּה מְחַלֵּל, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַלֵּל עַל קִיּוּמָן.
human_translation: might that just as may be desecrated so that may be sanctified so too, may be desecrated so that may be observed the verse states: “Which you shall declare,” for the declaration you may desecrate but you may not desecrate for the observance
llm_translation: One might have thought that just as they desecrate until they become sanctified, so too they desecrate until they are established — the Talmud teaches: "When you proclaim them," you desecrate them by their proclamation, and if you do not desecrate them by their fulfillment.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהָיָה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מְחַלְּלִין אַף עַל כּוּלָּן, מִפְּנֵי תַּקָּנַת הַקׇּרְבָּן. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְחַלְּלִין אַף עַל כּוּלָּן. מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: וְכִי יֵשׁ קׇרְבָּן? הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְחַלְּלִין אֶלָּא עַל נִיסָן וְעַל תִּשְׁרִי בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And when the Temple was standing, desecrated for all due to fixing offering The Sages taught At first, they would desecrate for all When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said to Is there offering they instituted that may desecrate only for Nisan and Tishrei.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When the Temple was standing - they would desecrate even on all of them, because of the need of the sacrifice. The Rabbis taught: Initially, they would desecrate even on all of them. Once the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai said to them: Is there still a sacrifice? They instituted that they should only desecrate on Nissan and Tishrei alone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּין שֶׁנִּרְאָה בַּעֲלִיל, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה בַּעֲלִיל — מְחַלְּלִין עָלָיו אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם נִרְאָה בַּעֲלִיל — אֵין מְחַלְּלִין עָלָיו אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Whether was seen clearly [ ba’alil ] or whether it was not clearly seen, one may desecrate Shabbat Rabbi Yosei says: If was clearly seen, they may not desecrate Shabbat for it,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Whether he was seen intentionally or not intentionally - they desecrate the Sabbath for him. Rabbi Yosei says: If he was seen intentionally - they do not desecrate the Sabbath for him.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁעָבְרוּ יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבָּעִים זוּג, וְעִיכְּבָם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּלוֹד. שָׁלַח לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אִם מְעַכֵּב אַתָּה אֶת הָרַבִּים — נִמְצֵאתָ מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: an incident where more than forty pairs were passing and Rabbi Akiva detained them in Lod, Rabban Gamliel sent to him: If you detain the many you will cause them to stumble in the future.
llm_translation: The incident that occurred with more than forty pairs, and Rabbi Akiva was among them. Rabban Gamliel sent to him: If you delay the majority, you are found to be causing them to stumble in the future.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״עֲלִיל״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּמִיגַּלֵּי הוּא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִמְרוֹת ה׳ אֲמָרוֹת טְהוֹרוֹת כֶּסֶף צָרוּף בַּעֲלִיל לָאָרֶץ מְזוּקָּק שִׁבְעָתָיִם״.
human_translation: From where be inferred alil revealed? Rabbi Abbahu said: The verse states: “The words of the Lord are pure words; silver refined in the clear sight [ ba’alil ] of the earth, purified seven times”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the implication that this "Alil" is from the Megillah? Rabbi Avahu said, the verse says: "The sayings of the Lord are pure sayings, like silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified seven times."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. חַד אָמַר: חֲמִשִּׁים שַׁעֲרֵי בִינָה נִבְרְאוּ בָּעוֹלָם, וְכוּלָּן נִיתְּנוּ לְמֹשֶׁה, חָסֵר אֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתְּחַסְּרֵהוּ מְעַט מֵאֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel One said: Fifty gates of understanding were created in the world, and all of them were given to Moses, except for one it is stated: “And You have made him a little less than God”
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel. One said: Fifty gates of understanding were created in the world, and all of them were given to Moses, lacking one, as it is said: "And you have lacked a little from God."

hebrew_text: ״בִּקֵּשׁ קֹהֶלֶת לִמְצוֹא דִּבְרֵי חֵפֶץ״ — בִּקֵּשׁ קֹהֶלֶת לִהְיוֹת כְּמֹשֶׁה, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: ״וְכָתוּב יוֹשֶׁר דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת״ — ״וְלֹא קָם נָבִיא עוֹד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּמֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: “Kohelet sought to find out words of delight” Kohelet, sought to be like Moses, a Divine Voice issued forth and said to him: “And that which was written uprightly, even words of truth” “And there has not arisen a prophet since in Israel like Moses,
llm_translation: "The Preacher sought to find words of delight" - The Preacher sought to be like Moses, a Bat Kol went forth and said to him: "And it is written upright words of truth" - "And there did not arise a prophet again in Israel like Moses."

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: בַּנְּבִיאִים לֹא קָם, בִּמְלָכִים קָם. אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״בִּקֵּשׁ קֹהֶלֶת לִמְצוֹא דִּבְרֵי חֵפֶץ״ — בִּקֵּשׁ קֹהֶלֶת לָדוּן דִּינִין שֶׁבַּלֵּב, שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּהַתְרָאָה. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: ״וְכָתוּב יוֹשֶׁר דִּבְרֵי אֱמֶת״ — ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And one said: Among the prophets there has not arisen one among the kings, one did arise, How do I uphold “Kohelet sought to find words of delight”? Kohelet, sought to issue judgments of the heart, without witnesses and without warning. a Divine Voice issued forth and said to him: “And that which was written uprightly, even words of truth.” “At the mouth of two witnesses,
llm_translation: One said: In the Prophets he did not arise, in the Kings he arose. Rather, how do I fulfill "Kohelet sought to find words of delight" - Kohelet sought to judge matters of the heart, not with witnesses and not with observation. A Heavenly Voice emerged and said to him: "And it is written upright words of truth" - "By the mouth of two witnesses, etc."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁעָבְרוּ יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבָּעִים זוּג וְעִיכְּבָן רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עִיכְּבָן. אֶלָּא שַׁזְפַּר רֹאשָׁהּ שֶׁל גֶּדֶר עִיכְּבָן, וְשִׁלַּח רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְהוֹרִידוּהוּ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: an incident where more than forty pairs were passing and Rabbi Akiva detained them It is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Heaven forbid that Rabbi Akiva detained them, Rather, that Zefer, the head of Geder, detained them. And Rabban Gamliel sent and they removed him from his high
llm_translation: The incident occurred that more than forty pairs of students of Rabbi Akiva died. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said, "God forbid that Rabbi Akiva was an 'akivah.' Rather, the top of the fence was 'akivah,' and Rabban Gamliel sent and removed him from his position of greatness."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָב וּבְנוֹ שֶׁרָאוּ אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ — יֵלְכוּ. לֹא שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה, אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם יִפָּסֵל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — יִצְטָרֵף הַשֵּׁנִי עִם אַחֵר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אָב וּבְנוֹ וְכׇל הַקְּרוֹבִין כְּשֵׁרִין לְעֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: a father and his son saw the new they should go not that join together but so that if one of them is disqualified, the second may join together with another Rabbi Shimon says: A father and his son and all relatives are fit for testimony the month.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A father and his son who saw the new moon - may go. They do not combine with each other, but if one of them becomes disqualified, the other may combine with another. Rabbi Shimon says: A father, his son, and all close relatives are valid for testifying about the new moon."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּטוֹבִיָּה הָרוֹפֵא שֶׁרָאָה אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, הוּא וּבְנוֹ וְעַבְדּוֹ מְשׁוּחְרָר, וְקִבְּלוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ וּפָסְלוּ אֶת עַבְדּוֹ. וּכְשֶׁבָּאוּ לִפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין — קִבְּלוּ אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת עַבְדּוֹ, וּפָסְלוּ אֶת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: an incident with Toviyya the doctor. When he saw the moon in Jerusalem, he and his son and his freed slave The priests accepted him and his son and disqualified his slave, And when they came before the court, they accepted him and his slave and disqualified his son,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident with Tobiah the doctor who saw the new moon in Jerusalem, he and his son and his freed slave, and the priests accepted him and his son and disqualified his slave. And when they came before the court - they accepted him and his slave, and disqualified his son.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה וְאֶל אַהֲרֹן בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם לֵאמֹר. הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״ — עֵדוּת זוֹ תְּהֵא כְּשֵׁרָה בָּכֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: What is the reason Rabbi Shimon’s as it is written: “And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying: This month shall be to you this testimony will be valid by you
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Levi: What reason of Rabbi Shimon, as it is written: "And Hashem said to Moshe and to Aharon in the land of Egypt, saying, 'This month is for you'" - this testimony shall be valid for you. English translation: Gemara said Rabbi Levi: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon, as it is written: "And Hashem said to Moshe and to Aharon in the land of Egypt, saying, 'This month is for you'" - this testimony shall be valid for you.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? עֵדוּת זוֹ תְּהֵא מְסוּרָה לָכֶם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, This testimony is given over to you
llm_translation: And the Rabbis? This testimony shall be entrusted to you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַעֲשֶׂה בְּטוֹבִיָּה הָרוֹפֵא כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וּמַעֲשֶׂה, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: an incident with Toviyya the doctor. Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Rav Huna said to Rav Ḥanan bar Rava: Rabbi Yosei, and an incident and you say the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident with Toviyah the doctor. Rav Hanan bar Rava said: The halakha follows Rabbi Shimon. Rav Huna said to Rav Hanan bar Rava: Rabbi Yosei and the incident, and you say the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: וְהָא זִמְנִין סַגִּיאִין אֲמַרִית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְלָא אֲמַר לִי וְלָא מִידֵּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי תָּנֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִפְּכָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא אֲמַר לָךְ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אָמַר טָבִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּמָרִי טָבִי אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: said to him: But many times I said before Rav the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon and never did he say anything to me said to him: How did you teach said to him: the opposite said to him: Due to that he never said anything to you, Tavi, son of Mari Tavi, said Mar Ukva said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: He said to him: But this is a significant time, you said before Rav the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon, and he did not say to me, nor from his own! He said to him: How did you teach it? He said to him: In reverse. He said to him: Therefore, he did not say to you, nor from his own. Tavi, son of Mar Tavi, said Mar Ukva said Samuel: the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ הֵן הַפְּסוּלִין: הַמְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, וּמַלְוֵי בְּרִבִּית, וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, וְסוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית, וַעֲבָדִים. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל עֵדוּת שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁירָה לָהּ, אַף הֵן אֵינָן כְּשֵׁירִין לָהּ.
human_translation: The following are unfit One who plays with dice [ kubbiyya ] and those who lend with interest; and those who race pigeons merchants the Sabbatical Year, and slaves. This is the principle: Any testimony for which a woman is unfit, these too are unfit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the disqualified witnesses: one who plays with dice, and one who lends with interest, and pigeon breeders, and traders of the Sabbatical year produce, and slaves. This is the principle: any testimony that a woman is not fit to give, they too are not fit to give.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא אִשָּׁה כְּשֵׁירָה לָהּ — אַף הֵן כְּשֵׁירִין לָהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, גַּזְלָן דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם כְּשֵׁירִין לְעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: This for which a woman is fit, these too are fit. Rav Ashi said: That is to say, a robber by rabbinic law, they are fit testimony a woman
llm_translation: Gemara: If a woman is fit for herself - then they (the witnesses) are also fit for her. Rav Ashe said: This means, their thefts are fit for the testimony of a woman.
