hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁרָאָה אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַלֵּךְ — מוֹלִיכִים אוֹתוֹ עַל הַחֲמוֹר, אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִטָּה. וְאִם צוֹדֶה לָהֶם, — לוֹקְחִין בְּיָדָן מַקְלוֹת.
human_translation: one who saw the moon but is unable to go may bring him on a donkey or even in a bed, And if lying in wait for them they may take clubs in their hands,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sees the new moon but is unable to walk to the court to testify—they lead him on a donkey, even on a litter. And if he is elderly, they take staffs in their hands.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה — לוֹקְחִין בְּיָדָם מְזוֹנוֹת. שֶׁעַל מַהֲלַךְ לַיְלָה וָיוֹם, מְחַלְּלִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְיוֹצְאִין לְעֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵלֶּה מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרְאוּ אוֹתָם בְּמוֹעֲדָם״.
human_translation: And if it was a long journey they may take sustenance with them, since for a walk of a night and a day, may desecrate Shabbat and go out to testimony the month. as it is stated: “These are the Festivals of the Lord, which you shall declare in their seasons”
llm_translation: If it was a far distance - they take provisions in their hands. For how long does one travel day and night, they desecrate the Sabbath and go out to testify about the new moon, as it is stated: "These are the appointed times of the Lord, which you shall proclaim as holy convocations."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַרְבָּעָה רָאשֵׁי שָׁנִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, four heads of years.

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינָן מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ — מְשַׁלְּחִין עִמּוֹ אַחֵר לְהַעִידוֹ. בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ מִכׇּל אָדָם. מִשֶּׁקִּלְקְלוּ הַבַּיְיתּוֹסִים, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְקַבְּלִין אֶלָּא מִן הַמַּכִּירִין.
human_translation: If are not familiar with that send another with him to testify him. Initially, would accept testimony of the month from any person, when the Boethusians, corrupted instituted that they would accept only from those familiar
llm_translation: If they do not recognize him - they send another with him to testify. Initially, they would accept testimony of the new moon from anyone. Once the Boethusians corrupted, they decreed that they should only accept from those who are recognized.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אַחֵר? חַד,
human_translation: What another one
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Acher"? One.

hebrew_text: וְחַד מִי מְהֵימַן?! וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּא הוּא וְעֵדָיו עִמּוֹ לְהָעִיד עָלָיו! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי ״אַחֵר״ — זוּג אַחֵר.
human_translation: but is one deemed credible? Isn’t it taught an incident in came and his witnesses with him, to testify about him? Rav Pappa said: What is Another? another pair
llm_translation: "And who is trustworthy?! And it was taught: A case came where he and his witnesses came with him to testify about him! Rav Papa said: What is 'another' - this is a different pair."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי — ״אִם אֵינָן מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ״, מַאי ״אוֹתוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא ״אוֹתוֹ״ חַד — וְחַד מִי מְהֵימַן? ״מִשְׁפָּט״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא מַאי ״אוֹתוֹ״ — אוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג, הָכִי נָמֵי: מַאי ״אַחֵר״ — זוּג אַחֵר.
human_translation: This too stands to reason, for if you do not say so, If are not familiar with that What is That If we say that one is one deemed credible? Judgment, is written with regard to Rather, what is That That pair So too what is Another? Another pair
llm_translation: So it was explained: for if you do not say this, "if they do not recognize him," what is "him"? If you say "him" is one - and who is reliable? "Judgment" is written in it. Rather, what is "him" - that pair, so it was explained: what is "another" - another pair.

hebrew_text: וְחַד לָא מְהֵימַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי שֶׁהָלַךְ אֵצֶל הָעֵד לְהָעִיד עָלָיו בְּשַׁבָּת בְּאוּשָׁא!
human_translation: And is one not deemed credible Isn’t it taught an incident involving Rabbi Nehorai, who went with the witness to testify about him on Shabbat in Usha?
llm_translation: "And is there not one trustworthy witness? And it was taught: There was an incident with Rabbi Nehorai, that he went to the witness to testify about him on Shabbat in a fire!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי סָהֲדָא אַחֲרִינָא הֲוָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְהָא דְּלָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי סָהֲדָא אַחֲרִינָא הֲוָה בְּאוּשָׁא, וַאֲזַל רַבִּי נְהוֹרַאי לְאִצְטְרוֹפֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: say Rabbi Nehorai there was another witness with him. And that he was not mentioned is due to the honor of Rabbi Nehorai, Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Nehorai, there was another witness in Usha and Rabbi Nehorai went to join him.
llm_translation: They said: Rabbi Nehorai was once in the presence of another witness, and the one who was not considered a valid witness — it was out of respect for Rabbi Nehorai. Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Nehorai was once in a market, and Rabbi Nehorai went to join him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִסְּפֵיקָא לָא מְחַלְּלִינַן שַׁבְּתָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, what of stating Lest you say uncertainty one does not desecrate Shabbat, teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say? What you might say: From doubt we do not desecrate the Sabbath, this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא עוּלָּא, אָמַר: קַדְּשׁוּהּ לְיַרְחָא בְּמַעְרְבָא. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא עוּלָּא, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא, דִּמְהֵימַן. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא נָמֵי מְהֵימַן. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִגַּלּוֹיֵי — לָא מְשַׁקְּרִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בָּא אֶחָד בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְאָמַר קִדְּשׁוּ בֵּית דִּין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ — נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: When Ulla came he said: They sanctified the Moon in the West, Rav Kahana said: It is not necessary to say Ulla, who is a great man, is deemed credible Rather, even an ordinary person is deemed credible What is the reason any matter that is likely to be revealed, people do not lie about it. this is also taught one comes from the end of the world and says: The court sanctified the month, he is deemed credible.
llm_translation: When Ulla came, he said: "Sanctify the new moon in the west." Rav Kahana said: Ulla did not need to come, for he is a great man, trustworthy. Rather, even an ordinary person from the world can be trusted. What is the reason? Any matter that is done openly, people do not lie about it. It was also taught: If one comes at the end of the world and says, "The court has sanctified the month," he is believed.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ מִכׇּל אָדָם וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה קִלְקוּל קִלְקְלוּ הַבַּיְיתּוֹסִין? פַּעַם אַחַת בִּקְּשׁוּ בַּיְיתּוֹסִין לְהַטְעוֹת אֶת חֲכָמִים, שָׂכְרוּ שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם בְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, אֶחָד מִשֶּׁלָּנוּ, וְאֶחָד מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: Initially, they would accept testimony month from any person, The Sages taught What the corruption the Boethusians engaged? Once, the Boethusians tried to mislead the Sages They hired two people for four hundred dinars One from our own, and one of theirs.
llm_translation: In the beginning, they would accept testimony regarding the new moon from anyone, etc. The Rabbis taught: What was the negligence that the Boethusians committed? Once the Boethusians sought to mislead the sages, they hired two men for four hundred zuz, one from us and one from them.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלָּהֶם — הֵעִיד עֵדוּתוֹ וְיָצָא. שֶׁלָּנוּ, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֱמוֹר כֵּיצַד רָאִיתָ אֶת הַלְּבָנָה! אָמַר לָהֶם: עוֹלֶה הָיִיתִי בְּמַעֲלֵה אֲדוּמִּים, וּרְאִיתִיו שֶׁהוּא רָבוּץ בֵּין שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, רֹאשׁוֹ דּוֹמֶה לְעֵגֶל, אׇזְנָיו דּוֹמִין לִגְדִי, קַרְנָיו דּוֹמוֹת לִצְבִי, וּזְנָבוֹ מוּנַּחַת לוֹ בֵּין יַרְכוֹתָיו, וְהֵצַצְתִּי בּוֹ וְנִרְתַּעְתִּי וְנָפַלְתִּי לַאֲחוֹרַי. וְאִם אֵין אַתֶּם מַאֲמִינִים לִי — הֲרֵי מָאתַיִם זוּז צְרוּרִין לִי בִּסְדִינִי.
human_translation: their submitted his testimony and left. our they said to him, Say how you saw the moon. He said to them: I was ascending in Ma’ale Adumim and I saw that was crouched between two rocks. Its head was like of a calf, its ears were like of a kid, its horns were like of a deer, and its tail was lying between its thighs. And I looked at it and was frightened and I fell backward. And if you do not believe me two hundred dinars wrapped in my cloak
llm_translation: Their — he testified his testimony and left. Ours, they said to him: Say, how did you see the moon? He said to them: I was ascending in Maale Adumim, and I saw it crouching between two rocks, its head resembling a calf, its ears resembling a kid, its horns resembling a deer, and its tail was placed between its hind legs, and I gazed at it, and I was uprooted and fell backward. And if you do not believe me — behold, two hundred zuzim are bound in my scarf.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִי הִזְקִיקְךָ לְכָךְ? אָמַר לָהֶם: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁבִּקְּשׁוּ בַּיְיתּוֹסִים לְהַטְעוֹת אֶת חֲכָמִים, אָמַרְתִּי: אֵלֵךְ אֲנִי וְאוֹדִיעַ לָהֶם, שֶׁמָּא יָבוֹאוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאֵינָם מְהוּגָּנִין וְיַטְעוּ אֶת חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: said to him: Who persuaded you to this He said to them: I heard that the Boethusians were seeking to mislead the Sages, I said I will go and I will inform lest unworthy people come and mislead the Sages.
llm_translation: They said to him: Who has influenced you to do this? He said to them: I heard that the Boethusians sought to mislead the sages, so I said: I will go and inform them, lest unscrupulous people come and mislead the sages.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָאתַיִם זוּז — נְתוּנִין לְךָ בְּמַתָּנָה, וְהַשּׂוֹכֶרְךָ יִמָּתַח עַל הָעַמּוּד. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְקַבְּלִין אֶלָּא מִן הַמַּכִּירִין.
human_translation: said to him: The two hundred dinars are given to you as a gift. And the one who hired you shall be stretched out on the post At that time instituted that they would accept only from those who were familiar
llm_translation: They said to him: "Two hundred zuz - are given to you as a gift, and the one who hires you shall lean on the pillar. At that moment, they decreed that one should only accept from known individuals."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת. מִשֶּׁקִּלְקְלוּ הַכּוּתִים, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁלוּחִין יוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: Initially, they would light torches After the Samaritans [ Kutim ] corrupted instituted that messengers should go out
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Initially, they would lift the heave-offerings. When the Kutim corrupted the process, they instituted that they should be sent out instead.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת? מְבִיאִין כְּלוֹנְסָאוֹת שֶׁל אֶרֶז אֲרוּכִּין, וְקָנִים, וַעֲצֵי שֶׁמֶן, וּנְעוֹרֶת שֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן. וְכוֹרֵךְ בִּמְשִׁיחָה וְעוֹלֶה לְרֹאשׁ הָהָר וּמַצִּית בָּהֶן אֶת הָאוּר. וּמוֹלִיךְ וּמֵבִיא וּמַעֲלֶה וּמוֹרִיד, עַד שֶׁהוּא רוֹאֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה כֵּן בְּרֹאשׁ הָהָר הַשֵּׁנִי, וְכֵן בְּרֹאשׁ הָהָר הַשְּׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: How would they light torches They would bring long poles of cedar, reeds, pinewood, and beaten flax, and tie with a string. And ascend to the top of the mountain and light on fire with them, and wave it back and forth and up and down, until he would see his colleague doing likewise on the top of the second mountain. And similarly, on the top of the third mountain,
llm_translation: How did they lift the torches? They would bring long cedar poles, reeds, olive wood, and flax fibers. They would tie them together with a wick, ascend to the top of the mountain, and kindle the fire with them. They would signal and bring and ascend and descend until one could see his fellow doing the same on the top of the second mountain, and likewise on the top of the third mountain.

hebrew_text: וּמֵאַיִן הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת? מֵהַר הַמִּשְׁחָה לְסַרְטְבָא, וּמִסַּרְטְבָא לִגְרוֹפִינָא, וּמִגְּרוֹפִינָא לְחַוְורָן, וּמֵחַוְורָן לְבֵית בִּלְתִּין, וּמִבֵּית בִּלְתִּין לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם, אֶלָּא מוֹלִיךְ וּמֵבִיא וּמַעֲלֶה וּמוֹרִיד עַד שֶׁהָיָה רוֹאֶה כׇּל הַגּוֹלָה לְפָנָיו כִּמְדוּרַת הָאֵשׁ.
human_translation: And from which would they light the torches? from the Mount of Olives to Sartava, and from Sartava to Gerofina, and from Gerofina to Ḥavran, and from Ḥavran to Beit Baltin. And from Beit Baltin they would not move Rather, would wave back and forth and up and down, until he would see the entire Diaspora before him like bonfire,
llm_translation: From where did they bring the firewood? From the Mount of the Anointing to Seretva, and from Seretva to Gropina, and from Gropina to Havran, and from Havran to Beit Baltin, and from Beit Baltin they did not move from there, but they would bring and take and raise and lower until he saw all the exile before him like the arrangement of fire.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּ״מַשִּׂיאִין״ לִישָּׁנָא דִּיקוֹד הוּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשָּׂאֵם דָּוִד וַאֲנָשָׁיו״, וּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן: וְאוֹקְדִינֻן דָּוִד.
human_translation: From where be inferred that masi’in is an expression of burning? As it is written: “ Vayisa’em David and his men” and we translate And David burned them.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the implication that they "lifted" for the matter of the woodpile? As it is written: "And David and his men lifted them up," and we interpret: and we gathered wood for David.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת אֶלָּא עַל הַחֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנִּרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ לְקַדְּשׁוֹ. וְאֵימָתַי מַשִּׂיאִין — לְאוֹר עִיבּוּרוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Torches were lit only for month whose was seen at its time, to sanctify And when would they light on the eve of its additional day,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may only declare the new month based on the sighting of the new moon at its proper time for sanctification. And when do they declare it? At the time of its clarification.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּאַחָסֵר עָבְדִינַן, אַמָּלֵא לָא עָבְדִינַן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ חָסֵר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. אֵימַת עָבְדִי — בְּאַפּוֹקֵי שַׁבְּתָא. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ נַעֲבֵיד נָמֵי אֲמַלֵּא — אָתוּ
human_translation: Is this to say that for a deficient one performs for a full one does not perform What is the reason Rabbi Zeira said: decree due to a New Moon a deficient, that occurs on Shabbat eve. when do they perform At the conclusion of Shabbat, that if you say that one performs for a full, as well, come
llm_translation: In the matter of Achasrei, we require it, otherwise we do not. What is the reason? Rabbi Zeira said: It is a decree due to the deficiency of Rosh Chodesh that falls on Erev Shabbat. When do we enact it? On Friday afternoon. For if you say we should do it otherwise, they will come.

hebrew_text: לְמִיטְעֵי, אָמְרִי: הַאי חָסֵר הוּא, וְהַאי דְּלָא עֲבִיד מֵאֶתְמוֹל, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. אוֹ דִלְמָא מָלֵא הוּא, וּבִזְמַנּוֹ עֲבַדוּ.
human_translation: to err. they will say: this is deficient, and that was not performed yesterday, is due to it was impossible Or perhaps it is full, and they are performing at its time.
llm_translation: Regarding the buyers, they said: this one is lacking, and this one did not do from yesterday, because it is impossible. Or perhaps it is full, and they did it at its proper time.

hebrew_text: וְלֶיעְבֵּיד בֵּין אַמָּלֵא בֵּין אַחָסֵר, וְכִי מִקְּלַע רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת לָא לֶיעְבֵּיד כְּלָל. וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא עָבְדִינַן מוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת וְעָבְדִינַן אַמָּלֵא — מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּחָסֵר הוּא!
human_translation: And let them perform both for a full, and for a deficient and when the New Moon occurs on Shabbat eve, not perform at all. And since are not lit at the conclusion of Shabbat, and one for a full month, will know that is deficient.
llm_translation: To inquire whether one may carry out an action, whether in excess or in deficiency, and if one were to cut the head of the month on Friday evening, one may not carry out any action at all. And since we do not perform the conclusion of Shabbat and perform the beginning of the new week, we immediately know that it is deficient!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָתוּ לְמִיטְעֵי, אָמְרִי: הַאי מָלֵא הוּא, וְהַאי דְּלָא עָבְדִי — אִיתְּנוֹסֵי הוּא דְּאִיתְּנוּסי.
human_translation: Even so, come to err, they will say: This is full, and that they are not performing is they were circumstances beyond their control.
llm_translation: Even so, when they came to plant, they said: This is full, and this we did not do - it is the one that is elusive that is elusive.

hebrew_text: וְלֶיעְבֵּיד אַמָּלֵא, וְלָא לֶיעְבֵּיד אַחָסֵר כְּלָל! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל מְלָאכָה לָעָם שְׁנֵי יָמִים.
human_translation: And let them perform for a full, and not perform it for a deficient at all, Abaye said: because a two-day suspension of work for the people,
llm_translation: And to do, but not to do is lacking entirely! Abaye said: Because of the nullification of work for the people for two days.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת — מְבִיאִין כְּלוֹנְסוֹת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אַרְבָּעָה מִינֵי אֲרָזִים הֵן: אֶרֶז, קַתְרוֹם, עֵץ שֶׁמֶן, וּבְרוֹשׁ. קַתְרוֹם, אָמַר רַב: אַדְרָא. דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: מַבְלִיגָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ זוֹ גּוּלְמֵישׁ.
human_translation: How would they light torches? They would bring long poles [ kelonsot ] Rav Yehuda said there are four types of cedar: Cedar, katrom , pinewood, and cypress. katrom , Rav said: addera the school of Rabbi Sheila, they say: mavliga And some say gulmish
llm_translation: How did they lift the burdens? They would bring poles of kerosene wood. Rav Yehudah said: There are four types of cedars: cedar, kathrom, oil tree, and brosh. Kathrom, Rav said: Adra. The house of Rabbi Sheilah said: Mavliga, and they said to it, this is Gulmesh.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: עֲשָׂרָה מִינֵי אֲרָזִים הֵם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶתֵּן בַּמִּדְבָּר אֶרֶז שִׁטָּה וַהֲדַס וְעֵץ שָׁמֶן אָשִׂים בָּעֲרָבָה בְּרוֹשׁ תִּדְהָר וּתְאַשּׁוּר יַחְדָּו״. אֶרֶז — אַרְזָא, שִׁטָּה — תּוּרְנִיתָא, הֲדַס — אַסָּא, עֵץ שֶׁמֶן — אֲפַרְסְמָא, בְּרוֹשׁ — בְּרָתָא, תִּדְהָר — שָׁאגָא, תְּאַשּׁוּר — שׁוּרִיבְנָא.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rabba bar Rav Huna. As Rabba bar Rav Huna said they say in the school of Rav: There are ten species of cedar, as it is stated: “I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia tree and myrtle and the pine tree; I will set in the desert cypress, the plane tree, and the larch together” Cedar is arza , acacia is tornita , myrtle is asa , pine tree is afarsema , cypress is berata , maple is shaga , box tree is shorivna .
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabba bar Rav Huna. For Rabba bar Rav Huna said, the students of Rav said: There are ten types of cedars, as it is stated: "I will place in the desert the cedar, the acacia, the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the wilderness the cypress, the plane tree, and the box tree together." Cedar - arza, acacia - turunita, myrtle - asa, oil tree - afarasma, cypress - brata, plane tree - shaga, box tree - shurivna.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שִׁבְעָה הָווּ! כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶם אַלּוֹנִים, אַלְמוֹנִים, אַלְמוּגִּין. אַלּוֹנִים — בּוּטְמֵי, אַלְמוֹנִים — בָּלוּטֵי, אַלְמוּגִּין — כְּסִיתָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַרוּנִּים, עַרְמוֹנִים, אַלְמוּגִּין. אַרוּנִּים — עָרֵי, עַרְמוֹנִים — דּוּלְבֵי, אַלְמוּגִּין — כְּסִיתָא.
human_translation: these are seven, When Rav Dimi came he said: They added to them Terebinth, oak, coral wood. Terebinth butmei , oak is balutei , coral wood is kasita . There are who say Bay tree, plane tree, coral wood. Bay tree arei , plane dulvei , coral wood kasita .
llm_translation: These are the seven! When Rav Dimi came, he said: Add to them Alonim, Almonim, Almuggin. Alonim - Butmei, Almonim - Balutei, Almuggin - Ksitah. Some say: Arunim, Armonim, Almuggin. Arunim - Arei, Armonim - Dulvei, Almuggin - Ksitah.

hebrew_text: ״וְצִי אַדִּיר לֹא יַעַבְרֶנּוּ״ — אָמַר רַב: זוֹ בּוּרְנִי גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: “Neither shall a tzi adir be able to cross it” Rav said: This is a great ship [ burnei ]
llm_translation: "And a mighty hunter before the Lord" — Rav said: This refers to Nimrod the great hunter.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עָבְדִי? מַיְיתוּ שֵׁית אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי בִּתְרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי בְּשִׁיתָּא יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, וְטָעֲנִי לַהּ חָלָא עַד דְּשָׁכְנָא. וְנָחֵית בַּר אָמוֹרַאי וְקָטַר אֲטוּנֵי דְכִיתָּנָא בִּכְסִיתָא, וְקָטַר לְהוּ בִּסְפִינְתָּא. וְנָטְלִי חָלָא וְשָׁדוּ לְבָרַאי, וְכַמָּה דְּמִדַּלְיָא — עָקְרָא וּמַתְיָא.
human_translation: How do they perform They bring six thousand men for twelve months the year, and some say twelve thousand men for six months the year. And they load with sand until it sinks A diver descends and ties flax ropes around the coral and ties to the boat. And they take the sand and cast it overboard, And as it rises, it uproots and brings
llm_translation: How did they do it? They brought six thousand men for twelve months, and they said to her, "Twelve thousand men for six months." And they loaded her with oil until she became smooth. Bar Amorai descended and brought fine linen garments in a chest, and he brought them on a ship. They took the oil and anointed the bride, and as much as they removed - the skin became soft and delicate.

hebrew_text: וּמַחְלֵיף עַל חַד תְּרֵין בְּכַסְפָּא. תְּלָת פַּרְווֹתָא הָוְיָין: תַּרְתֵּי בֵּי רוֹמָאֵי וַחֲדָא דְּבֵי פָרְסָאֵי. דְּבֵי רוֹמָאֵי מַסְּקָן כְּסִיתָא, דְּבֵי פָרְסָאֵי מַסְּקָן מַרְגָּנְיָיתָא, וּמִקַּרְיָיא: פַּרְווֹתָא דְמַשְׁמְהִיג.
human_translation: And it is exchanged for twice its weight in silver. There are three ports Two to the Romans [ Armai ], and one to the Persians. to the Romans, they raise up coral, to the Persians, they raise up pearls. And are called royal ports.
llm_translation: He exchanges one for two with money. There are three types: two from the Romans and one from the Persians. The Romans use a cloak, the Persians use a scarf, and it is called: the scarf of Meshmehig.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל שִׁיטָּה וְשִׁיטָּה שֶׁנָּטְלוּ גּוֹיִם מִירוּשָׁלַיִם, עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחֲזִירָן לָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶתֵּן בַּמִּדְבָּר אֶרֶז שִׁטָּה״, וְאֵין מִדְבָּר אֶלָּא יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִיּוֹן מִדְבָּר הָיְתָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Each and every acacia tree that the gentiles took from Jerusalem will be returned to by the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia tree And wilderness nothing other Jerusalem, as it is stated: “Zion is become a wilderness,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Every acacia tree that the nations took from Jerusalem, the Holy One, blessed be He, will return them to her, as it is stated: "I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the acacia tree," and the wilderness refers only to Jerusalem, as it is stated: "Zion shall be plowed as a field."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וְאֵינוֹ מְלַמְּדָהּ, דּוֹמֶה לַהֲדַס בַּמִּדְבָּר. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: כׇּל הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה וּמְלַמְּדָהּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים — דּוֹמֶה לַהֲדַס בַּמִּדְבָּר, דְּחַבִּיב.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who studies Torah but does not teach it is likened to a myrtle in the wilderness. There are who say Anyone who studies Torah and teaches it in a place where there are no Torah scholars is likened to a myrtle in the wilderness, which is precious
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who learns Torah but does not teach it, is like a myrtle in the desert. Some say: Anyone who learns Torah and teaches it in a place where there are no students of the sages, is like a myrtle in the desert, which is precious.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹי לָהֶם לַגּוֹיִם, שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם תַּקָּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תַּחַת הַנְּחֹשֶׁת אָבִיא זָהָב וְתַחַת הַבַּרְזֶל אָבִיא כֶסֶף וְתַחַת הָעֵצִים נְחֹשֶׁת וְתַחַת הָאֲבָנִים בַּרְזֶל״. תַּחַת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וַחֲבֵירָיו מַאי מְבִיאִין! וַעֲלֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְנִקֵּיתִי דָּמָם לֹא נִקֵּיתִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Woe to the nations as they have no remedy as it is stated: “For brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver, and for wood brass, and for stones iron” for Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues, what can one bring And with regard to them it is stated: And I will hold as innocent, but for their blood I will not hold innocent
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Woe to the nations, for they have no merit, as it is stated: "For under the brass I will bring gold, and under the iron I will bring silver, and under the wood brass, and under the stones iron." Under Rabbi Akiva and his colleagues, what do they bring? And regarding them it is said: "And I will cleanse their blood that I have not cleansed."

hebrew_text: וּמֵאַיִן הָיוּ מַשִּׂיאִין מַשּׂוּאוֹת כּוּ׳ וּמִבֵּית בִּלְתִּין. מַאי בֵּית בִּלְתִּין? אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: And from would they light torches? And from Beit Baltin What is Beit Baltin? Rav said:
llm_translation: From where did they bring the raised offerings? And from the house of Bilatin. What is the house of Bilatin? Rav said:

hebrew_text: זוֹ בֵּירָם.
human_translation: This is Biram.
llm_translation: This is Beiram.

hebrew_text: מַאי גּוֹלָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: זוֹ פּוּמְבְּדִיתָא. מַאי כִּמְדוּרַת הָאֵשׁ? תָּנָא: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נוֹטֵל אֲבוּקָה בְּיָדוֹ וְעוֹלֶה לְרֹאשׁ גַּגּוֹ.
human_translation: What is Diaspora, Rav Yosef said: This Pumbedita What is Like bonfire? taught Each and every take a torch in his hand and ascend to the top of his roof
llm_translation: What is "Golah"? Rav Yosef said: This is a furnace. What is "Kimdurat Ha'esh"? It was taught: Each and every one takes a bundle in his hand and ascends to the top of his roof.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף חָרִים וּכְיָיר וּגְדֹר וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְהָךְ גִּיסָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל הֲווֹ קָיְימִי. מָר חָשֵׁיב דְּהַאי גִּיסָא, וּמָר חָשֵׁיב דְּהַאי גִּיסָא.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: also Ḥarim, and Kayar and Geder, and its neighboring places. There are who say are located between there are who say they are located on the other side of Eretz Yisrael, The Sage enumerates on one side whereas the Sage enumerates on the other side.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Also Charim and K'yar and Gedur and its companions. Some say: Between them and them they were established. Some say: To strike the measure of the land of Israel they were established. One Master considers this measure important, and one Master considers that measure important.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֵּין כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת שְׁמוֹנֶה פַּרְסָאוֹת. כַּמָּה הָווּ לְהוּ? תְּלָתִין וְתַרְתֵּין, וְהָא הָאִידָּנָא טוּבָא הָווּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִסְתַּתּוֹמֵי אִסְתַּתּוּם לְהוּ דַּרְכֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Between each and every one there was eight parasangs. How many are these Thirty-two Isn’t now greater Abaye said: routes have become blocked,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Between each and every one, eight parsas. How much were they? Thirty-two, and now they were even better! Abaye said: Their end was their perfection.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״לָכֵן הִנְנִי שָׂךְ אֶת דַּרְכֵּךְ בַּסִּירִים״, רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר מֵהָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״נְתִיבוֹתַי עִוָּה״.
human_translation: As it is written: “Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here, as it is written: “He has made my paths crooked”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "Therefore, behold, I will hedge up your way with thorns," Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here, as it is written: "Crooked are my paths."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָצֵר גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם וּבֵית יַעְזֵק הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת, וּלְשָׁם כׇּל הָעֵדִים מִתְכַּנְּסִין. וּבֵית דִּין בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתָם שָׁם. וּסְעוּדוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת עוֹשִׂין לָהֶם, בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיְּהוּ רְגִילִין לָבֹא.
human_translation: There was a large courtyard in Jerusalem, which was called Beit Ya’zek. And there all the witnesses gather, and the court examine them there. And they prepare great feasts for them, so that they would be accustomed to coming
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: There was a large courtyard in Jerusalem called Beit Ya'azek, and there all the witnesses would gather. The court would examine them there, and they would make grand feasts for them so that they would be accustomed to come.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה לֹא הָיוּ זָזִין מִשָּׁם כׇּל הַיּוֹם. הִתְקִין רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁיְּהוּ מְהַלְּכִין אַלְפַּיִם אַמָּה לְכׇל רוּחַ.
human_translation: Initially, they would not move from there all day, Rabban Gamliel the Elder instituted that be walk two thousand cubits in each direction.
llm_translation: In the first place, they did not move from there the entire day. Rabban Gamliel the Elder decreed that they should walk two thousand cubits in every direction.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא אַף חֲכָמָה הַבָּאָה לְיַילֵּד, וְהַבָּא לְהַצִּיל מִן הַדְּלֵיקָה וּמִן הַגַּיִיס וּמִן הַנָּהָר וּמִן הַמַּפּוֹלֶת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ כְּאַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, וְיֵשׁ לָהֶם אַלְפַּיִם לְכׇל רוּחַ.
human_translation: And not only these but also a midwife who comes to deliver and one who comes to rescue from a fire, from troops, from river, or from collapse these are like the inhabitants of the city and they have two thousand cubits in each direction.
llm_translation: "And not only these, but even wisdom that comes to give birth, and one who comes to save from fire, and from a collapsing building, and from drowning, and from a bandit - these are like the people of the city, and they have two thousand for every wind."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״בֵּית יַעְזֵק״ תְּנַן, אוֹ ״בֵּית יָזֵק״ תְּנַן? ״בֵּית יַעְזֵק״ תְּנַן — לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְעַזְּקֵהוּ וַיְסַקְּלֵהוּ״, אוֹ דִלְמָא ״בֵּית יָזֵק״ תְּנַן — לִישָּׁנָא דְצַעֲרָא הוּא, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וְהוּא אָסוּר בָּאזִיקִּים״?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before we learn: Beit Ya’zek, or we learn: Beit Yazek? Did we learn: Beit Ya’zek, an lofty term, as it is written: “And he dug it [ vaye’azzekehu ] and cleared it of stones” Or perhaps we learned: Beit Yazek, is a term of distress, as it is written: “And he was bound with chains [ bazikim ]”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: "Did we learn 'Beit Ya'zek' or 'Beit Ya'zek'?" "We learned 'Beit Ya'zek' - it is a higher level of excellence, as it is written: 'And he strengthened him and stoned him.' Or perhaps we learned 'Beit Ya'zek' - it is a place of suffering, as it is written: 'And he was bound with chains'?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: סְעוּדוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין לָהֶם שָׁם, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהוּ רְגִילִים לָבוֹא. דִּלְמָא תַּרְתֵּי הֲווֹ עָבְדִי בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear They would prepare great feasts for them there, so that they would be accustomed to come Perhaps they performed two for them,
llm_translation: Abaye said, "Come and hear: They used to make large feasts for them there, so that they would be accustomed to come. Perhaps they were serving two meals there."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֵּיצַד בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הָעֵדִים? זוּג שֶׁבָּא רִאשׁוֹן — בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ רִאשׁוֹן. וּמַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶן, וְאוֹמְרִין לוֹ, אֱמוֹר כֵּיצַד רָאִיתָ אֶת הַלְּבָנָה: לִפְנֵי הַחַמָּה, אוֹ לְאַחַר הַחַמָּה? לִצְפוֹנָהּ, אוֹ לִדְרוֹמָהּ? כַּמָּה הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ, וּלְאַיִן הָיָה נוֹטֶה, וְכַמָּה הָיָה רָחָב. אִם אָמַר לִפְנֵי הַחַמָּה — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: How do they examine the witnesses the pair that arrives first they examine first. They bring in the greater of and they say to him: Say how you saw the moon. in front of the sun or behind the sun? To its north or to its south? How high was and in which direction did it tilt? And how wide was If, he said in front of the sun, he has not said anything
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: How do we examine the witnesses? If the first pair came — we examine the first one. And we bring in the eldest among them, and say to him, "Declare, how did you see the moon: to the north of the sun, or to the south of the sun? How high was it, and in which direction was it inclined, and how wide was it? If he says 'to the north of the sun' — he has said nothing.

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ הָיוּ מַכְנִיסִין אֶת הַשֵּׁנִי וּבוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ. אִם נִמְצְאוּ דִּבְרֵיהֶם מְכֻוּוֹנִים — עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַזּוּגוֹת, שׁוֹאֲלִין אוֹתָן רָאשֵׁי דְבָרִים. לֹא שֶׁהָיוּ צְרִיכִים לָהֶם, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֵצְאוּ בְּפַחֵי נֶפֶשׁ, בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁיְּהוּ רְגִילִים לָבוֹא.
human_translation: And after they would bring in the second witness and examine him If their statements match, their testimony is accepted And asks all the other pairs general matters, not they require but so that should not leave disappointed, so that the witnesses should be accustomed to coming
llm_translation: And after that they would bring in the second and examine it. If their words were found consistent - their testimony stands. And all other pairs, they ask them the beginning of their words. Not that they needed them, but in order that they should not come out in danger of life, so that they would be accustomed to come in.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַיְינוּ לִפְנֵי הַחַמָּה, הַיְינוּ לִצְפוֹנָהּ; הַיְינוּ לְאַחַר הַחַמָּה, הַיְינוּ לִדְרוֹמָהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פְּגִימָתָהּ — לִפְנֵי הַחַמָּה, אוֹ לְאַחַר הַחַמָּה? אִם אָמַר לִפְנֵי הַחַמָּה — לָא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: In front of the sun is to its north, behind the sun is to its south. Abaye said: the concave side before the sun, or behind the sun, If he said before the sun, he has said nothing.
llm_translation: Gemara: This is what it means "before the sun," it means to its north; this is what it means "after the sun," it means to its south! Abaye said: Is its blemish before the sun, or after the sun? If he said before the sun, he did not say anything.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״הַמְשֵׁל וָפַחַד עִמּוֹ עוֹשֶׂה שָׁלוֹם בִּמְרוֹמָיו״, מֵעוֹלָם לֹא רָאֲתָה חַמָּה פְּגִימָתָהּ שֶׁל לְבָנָה, וְלֹא פְּגִימָתָהּ שֶׁל קֶשֶׁת. פְּגִימָתָהּ שֶׁל לְבָנָה — דְּחָלְשָׁה דַּעְתַּהּ. פְּגִימָתָהּ שֶׁל קֶשֶׁת — דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ עוֹבְדֵי הַחַמָּה
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is which is written: “Dominion and fear are with Him, He makes peace in His high places” the sun has never seen the concave of the moon, nor the concave of a rainbow, the concave of the moon, as distressed the concave of a rainbow, so that the worshippers of the sun not say,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said, what is the meaning of what is written: "The ruler and fear are with him; he makes peace in his high places"? The sun has never seen its blemish, nor the blemish of its bow. The blemish of the sun - its weakness of understanding. The blemish of its bow - that the servants of the sun do not say.

hebrew_text: גִּירֵי קָא מְשַׁדְּיָיא.
human_translation: is shooting arrows
llm_translation: "Geirei ka meshadeya."

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ, וּלְאַיִן הָיָה נוֹטֶה כּוּ׳. תָּנָא חֲדָא: לִצְפוֹנָהּ — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין, לִדְרוֹמָהּ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא: לִדְרוֹמָהּ — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין, לִצְפוֹנָהּ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: How high was and in which did it tilt? It was taught one to the north his statement is valid. to its south, he has not said anything Isn’t the opposite taught to the south his statement is valid. to its north, he has not said anything.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "How high was it, and to where was it inclined? It was taught: One sage said: To its north — his words are established, to its south — he did not say anything. And it was taught the opposite: To its south — his words are established, to its north — he did not say anything."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן, בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה. כָּאן, בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, to the summer, there, to the rainy season,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here, in the days of the sun. Here, in the days of the rain.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר גָּבוֹהַּ שְׁתֵּי מַרְדְּעוֹת, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ — עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ, וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר חָמֵשׁ — עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵילָה. אֲבָל מִצְטָרְפִין לְעֵדוּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught one says two plow handles high and one three their testimony is valid, one says three and the one says five their testimony is void, However, join with another testimony,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One says two pillars high, and one says three - their testimony stands. One says three, and one says five - their testimony is nullified. But they can join with another testimony.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רְאִינוּהוּ בְּמַיִם, רְאִינוּהוּ בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית, רְאִינוּהוּ בֶּעָבִים — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו. חֶצְיוֹ בְּמַיִם, חֶצְיוֹ בֶּעָבִים, חֶצְיוֹ בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught we saw it in the water, we saw it in lantern, we saw it through clouds, they not testify about it, half of in the water, half of it through the clouds, half of it in a lantern, they not testify about it.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If we saw it in water, if we saw it in glass, if we saw it in clouds - we do not testify about it. If half of it is in water, half of it is in clouds, half of it is in glass - we do not testify about it.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא כּוּלּוֹ אָמְרַתְּ לָא, חֶצְיוֹ מִבַּעְיָא?! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: חֶצְיוֹ בְּמַיִם חֶצְיוֹ בָּרָקִיעַ, חֶצְיוֹ בֶּעָבִים חֶצְיוֹ בָּרָקִיעַ, חֶצְיוֹ בַּעֲשָׁשִׁית חֶצְיוֹ בָּרָקִיעַ — אֵין מְעִידִין.
human_translation: Now, the entire you said not is it necessary half of it? Rather, this is what is saying: half of in water half of it in the sky, half of it through the clouds half of it in the sky, half of it in a lantern half of it in the sky, they not testify
llm_translation: The Gemara: "This entire thing you said 'no,' does half of it require water?! Rather, this is what it means to say: half in water and half in the firmament, half in the clouds and half in the firmament, half in the atmosphere and half in the firmament - they do not testify."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רְאִינוּהוּ וְשׁוּב לֹא רְאִינוּהוּ — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו. כׇּל הָכִי חָזוּ לֵהּ וְאָזְלִי?!
human_translation: The Sages taught we saw but we did not see it again, they not testify about it. Must they go on watching it to such
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "If we saw him and then he disappeared, we do not testify about him. Did they all see him and then he vanished?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רְאִינוּהוּ מֵאֵלֵינוּ, וְשַׁבְנוּ לִרְאוֹתוֹ מִדַּעְתֵּנוּ, וְלֹא רְאִינוּהוּ — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו, מַאי טַעְמָא — אֵימוֹר כּוֹבִיתָא דְעֵיבָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּחָזֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said this is what is saying: We saw on our own and we returned to look for it on purpose, but we did not see it they not testify about it. What is the reason? say merely a small round cloud that they saw,
llm_translation: Abaye said, thus he said: We saw him from us, and we returned to see him from our knowledge, and we did not see him - we do not testify about him, what is the reason - say, the liver of a bird in the world is what sees.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רֹאשׁ בֵּית דִּין אוֹמֵר: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״, וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״. בֵּין שֶׁנִּרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: the head of the court says: sanctified. And all the people respond after him: sanctified; sanctified. Whether was seen at its time, or whether was not seen at its time, sanctifies it
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The head of the court says, "Sanctified," and all the people respond after him, "Sanctified, Sanctified." Whether it is seen in its proper time or not seen in its proper time, we sanctify it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר קִידְּשׁוּהוּ שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: If was not seen at its time, does not sanctify as Heaven has already sanctified it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: If it does not appear in its time - we do not sanctify it, for the heavens have already sanctified it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רֹאשׁ בֵּית דִּין וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַבִּי: אָמַר קְרָא ״וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה אֶת מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁרֹאשׁ בֵּית דִּין אוֹמֵר ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״.
human_translation: the head of the court From where are these matters, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rabbi said the verse states: “And Moses declared the appointed seasons of the Lord” From here that the head of the court says: sanctified,
llm_translation: Gemara: The head of the court, etc. What are the matters? Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamda said, Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul said, Rabbi said: The verse states, "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord" - from here the head of the court says, "Sanctified."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הָעָם עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אָמַר קְרָא ״אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרְאוּ אוֹתָם״, קְרִי בֵּיהּ אַתֶּם. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: ״אֵלֶּה הֵם מוֹעֲדֵי״, הֵם יֹאמְרוּ מוֹעֲדֵי.
human_translation: all the people respond after him: sanctified; sanctified. From where do we Rav Pappa said the verse states: “Which you shall proclaim them [ otam ] read into You [ atem ], Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said “These are [ hem ] My appointed seasons” they, should say My appointed seasons.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all the people respond after him, "Holy, holy." Where do we derive this from? Rav Papa said: The verse states, "Which you shall call them," read it as referring to yourselves. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "These are the appointed times," they should be said as appointed times.

hebrew_text: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי לְמָה לִי? דִּכְתִיב: ״מִקְרָאֵי קוֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Why do I sanctified; sanctified, twice? that it is written: “Sacred convocations”
llm_translation: "Sanctified, sanctified," two times why for me? As it is written: "Holy convocations."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: אִם לֹא נִרְאָה בִּזְמַנּוֹ — אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ. תַּנְיָא, פְּלֵימוֹ אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַנּוֹ — אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ — מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: If was not seen at its time, does not sanctify It is taught Palaimo says: at its time, does not sanctify not at its time, sanctify
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: If it does not appear in its time - we do not sanctify it. It was taught in a Baraita, Plimo says: If it is in its time - we do not sanctify it, but if it is not in its time - we sanctify it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים״ — שָׁנִים אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְקַדֵּשׁ חֳדָשִׁים. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: In either case, does not sanctify as it is stated: “And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year” You sanctify years but you do not sanctify months, Rabbi Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: "Whether this way or that way, one does not sanctify it, as it is stated: 'And you shall sanctify the year of the fiftieth' - you may sanctify two years, but you may not sanctify new months." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל, נֶחְקְרוּ הָעֵדִים וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקוּ לוֹמַר ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״ עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְעוּבָּר. מְעוּבָּר — אִין, מְקוּדָּשׁ — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: We, too, learn the court and all of the Jewish people saw the witnesses were interrogated, but did not manage to say: Sanctified, before nightfall, is a full, full, yes; sanctified, no;
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: If the court and all of Israel saw him, the witnesses were examined and did not manage to say 'Mekudash' until it became dark - he is considered a bastard. Bastard - no, Mekudash - yes."

hebrew_text: מְעוּבָּר אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִיפַּרְסְמָא וְלָא לִיעְבְּרוּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: it was necessary for a full, enter your mind to say since the court and the entire Jewish people saw it has become public and no to full, teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "M'ubar itztaricha lei, sakla da'tach ameina: Ho'il v'rauhu beit din v'kol Yisrael, iparsema v'lo li'ibruhu, ka mashma lan." Translation: "If it is necessary for him, I say: Since both the court and all of Israel have seen him, they should publicize it and not conceal it, this is what we infer."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ דְּמוּת צוּרוֹת לְבָנָה הָיוּ לוֹ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּטַבְלָא וּבְכוֹתֶל בַּעֲלִיָּיתוֹ, שֶׁבָּהֶן מַרְאֶה אֶת הַהֶדְיוֹטוֹת, וְאוֹמֵר: הֲכָזֶה רָאִיתָ אוֹ כָּזֶה.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel had forms of the moon on a tablet on the wall of his attic, which he would show to the laymen And he say Did you see like this or like this?
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabban Gamliel had images of the constellations in his attic and on the wall of his upper chamber, by which he would show the common people, and say: "Did you see such a thing or such a thing?"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי״ — לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּן כִּדְמוּת שַׁמָּשַׁיי.
human_translation: And is it permitted Isn’t it written: “You shall not make with Me You shall not make images of My attendants,
llm_translation: Gemara: And who is permitted? And it is written: "Do not make with Me" - do not make like the form of My ministers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא שַׁמָּשִׁין שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּמוֹתָן, כִּדְתַנְיָא: לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם בַּיִת תַּבְנִית הֵיכָל, אַכְסַדְרָה תַּבְנִית אוּלָם, חָצֵר כְּנֶגֶד עֲזָרָה, שֻׁלְחָן כְּנֶגֶד שֻׁלְחָן, מְנוֹרָה כְּנֶגֶד מְנוֹרָה. אֲבָל עוֹשֶׂה
human_translation: Abaye said: The Torah prohibited only attendants which it is possible to reproduce their likeness. As it is taught A person not construct a house form of the Sanctuary, a portico in form of the Entrance Hall a courtyard corresponding to courtyard, a table corresponding to the table a candelabrum corresponding to the candelabrum However, one may fashion
llm_translation: Abaye said: The Torah only prohibited the use of services that can be performed like their original intent, as it was taught: "A person should not make a house like the structure of the Temple, a courtyard like the Temple courtyard, a table like the table, a lampstand like the lampstand." But one may make...

hebrew_text: שֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה וְשֶׁל שִׁשָּׁה וְשֶׁל שְׁמוֹנָה. וְשֶׁל שִׁבְעָה — לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה, אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל שְׁאָר מִינֵי מַתָּכוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף שֶׁל עֵץ לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁעָשׂוּ מַלְכֵי בֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי.
human_translation: of five or of six or of eight But one may not fashion seven even from other kinds of metal Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Also, one may not fashion of wood, in the manner that the kings of the Hasmonean monarchy fashioned
llm_translation: Of five and of six and of eight. And of seven—one should not make, even of other types of metals. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: Even of wood one should not make, as the kings of the Hasmonean house made.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָיה?! שַׁפּוּדִין שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל הָיוּ וְחִיפּוּם בְּבַעַץ. הֶעֱשִׁירוּ — עֲשָׂאוּם שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, חָזְרוּ הֶעֱשִׁירוּ — עֲשָׂאוּם שֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: said to From there a proof? were spits [ shippudin ] of iron and they covered them with tin. they grew richer they fashioned them from silver. they grew even richer, they fashioned them from gold.
llm_translation: They said to him: From there, a proof?! Shovels of iron they were, and they covered them with wood. They became rich - they made them of silver, they became rich again - they made them of gold.

hebrew_text: וְשַׁמָּשִׁין שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּמוֹתָן מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי״ — לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּן כִּדְמוּת שַׁמָּשַׁיי הַמְשַׁמְּשִׁין לְפָנַי בַּמָּרוֹם! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא דְּמוּת אַרְבָּעָה פָּנִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: And is it permitted those attendants which it is impossible to reproduce their likeness? Isn’t it taught “You shall not make with Me You shall not make images of My attendants that serve before Me on high. Abaye said: the Torah prohibited only an image of four faces together
llm_translation: And those who serve, that it is impossible to do like them, who is exempt? And it was taught: "Do not make it with me" - do not make it like the likeness of my ministers who serve before Me on high! Abaye said: The Torah only prohibited the likeness of four faces in the presence of Hadadei.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה פַּרְצוּף אָדָם לְחוֹדֵיהּ תִּשְׁתְּרֵי? אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: כׇּל הַפַּרְצוּפוֹת מוּתָּרִין חוּץ מִפַּרְצוּף אָדָם! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי שְׁמִיעָא לִי: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי״ — לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּן אוֹתִי.
human_translation: However, if so, let a human face [ partzuf ] alone be permitted. Why, is it taught All faces are permitted except for the face of a person? Rav Huna, son of Rav Idi, said: From a lecture of Abaye I heard “You shall not make with Me [ iti ]” You shall not make Me [ oti ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from now on, is a person permitted to shave her face? Why is it taught: All shavings are permitted except for a person's shaving! Rav Huna son of Rav Idi said: From the explanations of Abbaye, I heard: "Do not make with Me" - Do not make Me.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר שַׁמָּשִׁין מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי״ — לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּן כִּדְמוּת שַׁמָּשַׁיי הַמְּשַׁמְּשִׁין לְפָנַי בַּמָּרוֹם, כְּגוֹן אוֹפַנִּים וּשְׂרָפִים וְחַיּוֹת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ וּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא שַׁמָּשִׁין שֶׁבַּמָּדוֹר הָעֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: And is it permitted other attendants? Isn’t it taught “You shall not make with Me you shall not make images of My attendants that serve before Me on high, for example, ofanim and seraphim and the sacred ḥayyot and the ministering angels. Abaye said: The Torah prohibited only attendants that are in the upper Heaven,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what are the remaining ministers of the sun? But it was taught: "Do not make it with Me" - do not make it like the likeness of My ministers who serve before Me on high, such as the Ophanim, Seraphim, the Holy Living Creatures, and the Ministering Angels! Abaye said: The Torah only prohibited the ministers in the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁבַּמָּדוֹר הַתַּחְתּוֹן מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר בַּשָּׁמַיִם״ — לְרַבּוֹת חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה כּוֹכָבִים וּמַזָּלוֹת, ״מִמַּעַל״ — לְרַבּוֹת מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — לְעׇבְדָם.
human_translation: And is it permitted those in the lower heaven? Isn’t it taught “that is in heaven” to include sun, moon, stars, and constellations. “above” to include the ministering angels. When that is taught, against worshipping them.
llm_translation: In the lower chamber, who is ministering? And it was taught: "Who is in the heavens" — to include the sun, moon, stars, and constellations, "from above" — to include the ministering angels! For it was taught in that regard — to serve them.

hebrew_text: אִי לְעׇבְדָם, אֲפִילּוּ שִׁלְשׁוּל קָטָן נָמֵי! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר בָּאָרֶץ״ — לְרַבּוֹת הָרִים וּגְבָעוֹת יַמִּים וּנְהָרוֹת אֲפִיקִים וְגֵאָיוֹת, ״מִתַּחַת״ — לְרַבּוֹת שִׁלְשׁוּל קָטָן.
human_translation: If the prohibition against worshipping them, even a tiny worm also Yes, it is indeed so, as it is taught “in the earth” to include mountains and hills, seas and rivers, streams and valleys; “beneath” to include a tiny worm.
llm_translation: If to serve them, even a small pebble is considered! It is indeed so, as it was taught: "Which is in the earth" — to include mountains and hills, seas and rivers, valleys and hills, "beneath" — to include even a small pebble.

hebrew_text: וַעֲשִׂיָּיה גְּרֵידְתָּא מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּן אִתִּי״ — לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּן כִּדְמוּת שַׁמָּשַׁיי הַמְשַׁמְּשִׁין לְפָנַי, כְּגוֹן חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה כּוֹכָבִים וּמַזָּלוֹת.
human_translation: And is the mere fashioning permitted? Isn’t it taught “You shall not make with Me you shall not make images of My attendants that serve before Me, for example sun, moon, stars and constellations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And do you make a geraidta from shrei? And it was taught: 'Do not make with Me' — do not make like the likeness of My attendants who serve before Me, such as the sun, moon, stars, and constellations."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דַּאֲחֵרִים עָשׂוּ לוֹ. וְהָא רַב יְהוּדָה, דַּאֲחֵרִים עָשׂוּ לוֹ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁינָּנָא, סַמִּי עֵינֵיהּ דְּדֵין!
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel is different, as others, fashioned for him, But Rav Yehuda, as others fashioned for him and Shmuel said to Rav Yehuda, Sharp-witted one, blind this one’s eyes,
llm_translation: The matters of Rabban Gamliel, others did for him. And Rav Yehudah, others did for him, and Shmuel said to Rav Yehudah: "Sharp is the eye of the judge!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם, חוֹתָמוֹ בּוֹלֵט הֲוָה, וּמִשּׁוּם חֲשָׁדָא. כִּדְתַנְיָא: טַבַּעַת, חוֹתָמוֹ בּוֹלֵט — אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחָהּ וּמוּתָּר לַחְתּוֹם בָּהּ. חוֹתָמוֹ שׁוֹקֵעַ — מוּתָּר לְהַנִּיחָהּ וְאָסוּר לַחְתּוֹם בָּהּ.
human_translation: There, his was a protruding seal, due to suspicion As it is taught a ring, its seal protrudes it is prohibited to place it but it is permitted to seal with it. its seal is sunken, it is permitted to place it but it is prohibited to seal with it,
llm_translation: There, his signet ring was protruding, due to suspicion. As it was taught: A ring, if its signet is protruding - it is forbidden to wear it, but permissible to seal with it. If its signet is sunken - it is permissible to wear it, but forbidden to seal with it.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן לַחֲשָׁדָא? וְהָא הָהִיא בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא דְּשַׁף וִיתֵיב בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, דַּהֲוָה בֵּיהּ אִנְדְּרָטָא, וַהֲווֹ עָיְילִי רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל וַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלֵוִי וּמְצַלּוּ הָתָם, וְלָא חָיְישִׁי לַחֲשָׁדָא! רַבִּים שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And are we concerned about suspicion But certain synagogue that had been relocated and sat in Neharde’a, there was a statue [ andarta ] in it. And Rav and Shmuel and Shmuel’s father and Levi would enter and pray there and they were not concerned about suspicion. many is different,
llm_translation: We are concerned about suspicion? But that incident in the synagogue of Shaf, where he sat in Nehardea, which had a demon in it, and Rav, Shmuel, the father of Shmuel, Levi, and Metzal went there, and they were not concerned about suspicion! Many differences.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל יָחִיד הוּא? כֵּיוָן דְּנָשִׂיא הוּא — שְׁכִיחִי רַבִּים גַּבֵּיהּ. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דִּפְרָקִים הֲוָה.
human_translation: But isn’t Rabban Gamliel an individual? Since he is the Nasi , many were found with him, If you wish, say were from pieces
llm_translation: And this, Rabban Gamliel is unique? Since he is a prince - his back is familiar to many. If you wish, say: He was of the chapters.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְהִתְלַמֵּד עֲבַד, וּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִּלְמַד לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֲבָל אַתָּה לָמֵד לְהָבִין וּלְהוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: If you wish, say: did to teach himself, it is written: “You shall not learn to do However, you may learn to understand and to teach.
llm_translation: And if you will say: To learn to do, but it is written: "You shall not learn to do" — but you shall learn to understand and to teach.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ: רְאִינוּהוּ שַׁחֲרִית בַּמִּזְרָח,
human_translation: an incident which two came and they said: We saw in the morning in the east,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There was an incident where two individuals came and said: "We saw it at dawn in the east."

hebrew_text: וְעַרְבִית בַּמַּעֲרָב. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: עֵדֵי שֶׁקֶר הֵם. כְּשֶׁבָּאוּ לְיַבְנֶה קִיבְּלָן רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: and in the evening in the west. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: They are false witnesses, when they arrived in Yavne, Rabban Gamliel accepted them
llm_translation: Evening in the west. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: They are false witnesses. When they came to Yavneh, Rabban Gamliel accepted them.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, בָּאוּ שְׁנַיִם וְאָמְרוּ: רְאִינוּהוּ בִּזְמַנּוֹ, וּבְלֵיל עִיבּוּרוֹ לֹא נִרְאָה, וְקִיבְּלָן רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: And another two came and said: We saw at its time, on the night, a full, it was not seen. And Rabban Gamliel accepted their
llm_translation: And furthermore, two came and said: We saw it at its proper time, but on the night of its sighting, it was not seen, and Rabban Gamliel accepted their testimony.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הוֹרְכִּינָס: עֵדֵי שֶׁקֶר הֵן, הֵיאַךְ מְעִידִים עַל הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁיָּלְדָה וּלְמָחָר כְּרֵיסָהּ בֵּין שִׁינֶּיהָ? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דְּבָרֶיךָ. שָׁלַח לוֹ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: גּוֹזְרַנִי עָלֶיךָ שֶׁתָּבֹא אֶצְלִי בְּמַקֶּלְךָ וּבִמְעוֹתֶיךָ בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹנֶךָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas said: They are false witnesses; how can testify that a woman gave birth and the next day her belly is between her teeth, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: I see your statement; Rabban Gamliel sent to him: I decree against you that you appear before me with your staff and with your money on Yom Kippur occurs according to your calculation;
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas said: They are false witnesses, how can they testify about a woman who gave birth and the next day her womb is between her teeth? Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: I see your words. Rabban Gamliel sent to him: I decree upon you that you come to me with your staff and your money on the Day of Atonement, as is your reckoning.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ וּמְצָאוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵיצֵר, אָמַר לוֹ: יֵשׁ לִי לִלְמוֹד שֶׁכׇּל מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל עָשׂוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵלֶּה מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ מִקְרָאֵי קֹדֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תִּקְרְאוּ אֹתָם״, בֵּין בִּזְמַנָּן בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּן — אֵין לִי מוֹעֲדוֹת אֶלָּא אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva went and found distressed said to I can learn that everything that Rabban Gamliel did is done, As it is stated: “These are the appointed seasons of the Lord, sacred convocations, which you shall proclaim whether at their time whether not at their time, I have only these Festivals
llm_translation: He went and found Rabbi Akiva from Yezreel, he said to him: I have to learn that everything that Rabban Gamliel did is done, as it says: "These are the appointed times of the Lord, the holy convocations which you shall proclaim them," whether in their time or not in their time - I have no appointed times except these.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הוֹרְכִּינָס, אָמַר לוֹ: אִם בָּאִין אָנוּ לָדוּן אַחַר בֵּית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, צְרִיכִין אָנוּ לָדוּן אַחַר כׇּל בֵּית דִּין וּבֵית דִּין שֶׁעָמַד מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה וְעַד עַכְשָׁיו. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא וְשִׁבְעִים מִזִּקְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְלָמָּה לֹא נִתְפָּרְשׁוּ שְׁמוֹתָן שֶׁל זְקֵנִים? אֶלָּא לְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל שְׁלֹשָׁה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁעָמְדוּ בֵּית דִּין עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּבֵית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: came to Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas, said to him: If we come to debate the court of Rabban Gamliel, we must debate every court that has stood from the days of Moses until now. As it is stated: “Then Moses went up, and Aaron, Nadav and Avihu, and seventy of the Elders of Israel” But why were the names of these Elders not specified? Rather, to teach that every three that stands a court over the Jewish people as the court of Moses.
llm_translation: He came to Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas, he said to him: If we come to judge after the court of Rabban Gamliel, we must judge after every court and court that stood from the days of Moses until now. As it is said: "And Moses went up, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel." And why were the names of the elders not mentioned? Rather, to teach that any group of three and three that stood as a court over Israel - behold, it is like the court of Moses.

hebrew_text: נָטַל מַקְלוֹ וּמְעוֹתָיו בְּיָדוֹ, וְהָלַךְ לְיַבְנֶה אֵצֶל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בַּיּוֹם שֶׁחָל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לִהְיוֹת בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹ. עָמַד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּנְשָׁקוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: בּוֹא בְּשָׁלוֹם רַבִּי וְתַלְמִידִי! רַבִּי — בְּחׇכְמָה, וְתַלְמִידִי — שֶׁקִּבַּלְתָּ אֶת דְּבָרַי.
human_translation: he took his staff and his money in his hand, and went to Yavne to Rabban Gamliel on the day which Yom Kippur occurred according to his calculation. Rabban Gamliel stood up and kissed him on his head. He said to him: Come in peace, my teacher and my student. my teacher in wisdom, and my student, as you accepted my statement,
llm_translation: He took his staff and his money in his hand, and went to Yavneh to Rabban Gamliel on the day that Yom Kippur fell, to be in his company. Rabban Gamliel stood up and kissed him on his head, and said to him: "Come in peace, my teacher and disciple! My teacher - in wisdom, and my disciple - for you have accepted my words."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לַחֲכָמִים: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית אֲבִי אַבָּא — פְּעָמִים שֶׁבָּא בַּאֲרוּכָּה וּפְעָמִים שֶׁבָּא בִּקְצָרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabban Gamliel said to the Sages, This is I received from the house of my father’s father: Sometimes comes by a long and sometimes it comes by a short
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, amar lahem Rabban Gamliel lachachamim: kach mekubalani mibeit abi Abba - pe'amim sheba ba'arukah u'pe'amim sheba biktzarah." English translation: "Gemara, it was taught, Rabban Gamliel said to the sages: This is what I have received from the house of my father's father - sometimes it comes in length and sometimes it comes in brevity."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, דִּכְתִיב: ״עָשָׂה יָרֵחַ לְמוֹעֲדִים שֶׁמֶשׁ יָדַע מְבוֹאוֹ״ — שֶׁמֶשׁ הוּא דְּיָדַע מְבוֹאוֹ, יָרֵחַ לֹא יָדַע מְבוֹאוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of the house of Rabbi As it is written: “Who appointed the moon for seasons; the sun knows its going down” it is the sun knows its going down, the moon does not know its going down,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason of the house of Rabbi, as it is written: "He made the moon for the appointed times; the sun knows its setting" (Psalms 104:19) — the sun, which knows its setting, the moon does not know its setting.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא חַזְיֵיא לְסֵיהֲרָא דַּהֲוָה קָאֵי בְּצַפְרָא דְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה. שְׁקַל קָלָא פְּתַק בֵּיהּ, אֲמַר: לְאוּרְתָּא בָּעֵינַן לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי בָּךְ, וְאַתְּ קָיְימַתְּ הָכָא?! זִיל אִיכַּסִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: זִיל לְעֵין טָב וְקַדְּשֵׁיהּ לְיַרְחָא, וּשְׁלַח לִי סִימָנָא: ״דָּוִד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל חַי וְקַיָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya saw moon standing on the morning twenty-ninth He took a clump threw at saying: This evening we need to sanctify you, and you are standing here? Go cover yourself Rabbi said to Rabbi Ḥiyya: Go to Ein Tav and sanctify the Moon and send me a sign David, king of Israel, lives and endures.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya saw Sechara who was standing in the marketplace of Tzafra of twenty and nine. He took a basket, broke it, and said: "We need light for those who fear You, and you are standing here?! Go, cover yourself." Rabbi said to Rabbi Chiya: "Go to the good eye and sanctify the month, and send me a sign: 'David, king of Israel, lives and endures.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּעַם אַחַת נִתְקַשְּׁרוּ שָׁמַיִם בְּעָבִים, וְנִרְאֵית דְּמוּת לְבָנָה בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה לַחֹדֶשׁ. כִּסְבוּרִים הָעָם לוֹמַר רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, וּבִקְּשׁוּ בֵּית דִּין לְקַדְּשׁוֹ. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית אֲבִי אַבָּא — אֵין חִדּוּשָׁהּ שֶׁל לְבָנָה פְּחוּתָה מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְתִשְׁעָה יוֹם וּמֶחֱצָה וּשְׁנֵי שְׁלִישֵׁי שָׁעָה וְשִׁבְעִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה חֲלָקִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught Once the sky was covered with clouds, and the form of the moon was visible on the twenty-ninth of the month. The people thought to say the New Moon, and the court sought to sanctify it. Rabban Gamliel said to them: This is I received from the house of my father’s father: renewal of the moon no less than twenty-nine and a half days, plus two-thirds of an hour, plus seventy-three subsections
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Once the heavens were bound in clouds, and the likeness of the moon appeared on the twenty-ninth day of the month. The people thought to declare it the new moon, and the court sought to sanctify it. Rabban Gamliel said to them: This is the tradition I received from the house of my grandfather: The renewal of the moon cannot be less than twenty-nine days, half, two-thirds of an hour, and seventy-three parts.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם מֵתָה אִמּוֹ שֶׁל בֶּן זָזָא, וְהִסְפִּידָהּ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הֶסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרְאוּיָה לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּדְעוּ הָעָם שֶׁלֹּא קִידְּשׁוּ בֵּית דִּין אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And on that day the mother of ben Zaza died, and Rabban Gamliel delivered a great eulogy her not because she was worthy of this rather, so that the people would know that the court had not sanctified the month,
llm_translation: And that day died the mother of Ben Zaza, and Rabban Gamliel eulogized her greatly. Not because she was deserving of this, but in order for the people to know that the court did not sanctify the new moon.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וּמְצָאוֹ מֵיצֵר כּוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִי מֵיצֵר? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵיצֵר, אוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מֵיצֵר? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: הָלַךְ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וּמְצָאוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ כְּשֶׁהוּא מֵיצֵר, אָמַר לוֹ: [רַבִּי] מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה מֵיצֵר? אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, רָאוּי לוֹ שֶׁיִּפּוֹל לַמִּטָּה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְאַל יִגְזוֹר עָלָיו גְּזֵירָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva went and found him distressed A dilemma was raised before Who was distressed? Rabbi Akiva distressed or Rabbi Yehoshua distressed? Come hear, as it is taught Rabbi Akiva went and found Rabbi Yehoshua in a state of distress, he said to him: My teacher, for what are you distressed? said to him: Rabbi Akiva, it is fitting for to fall in bed for twelve months, rather than to have this decree issued against him
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva went and found him in distress. He asked them: Who is in distress? Is it Rabbi Akiva who is in distress, or is it Rabbi Yehoshua who is in distress? Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva went and found Rabbi Yehoshua in distress, when he was in distress, he said to him: Rabbi why are you in distress? He said to him: Rabbi Akiva, it is fitting for him to fall to the ground for twelve months, and this decree should not be imposed upon him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, תַּרְשֵׁינִי לוֹמַר לְפָנֶיךָ דָּבָר אֶחָד שֶׁלִּמַּדְתַּנִי. אָמַר לוֹ: אֱמוֹר. אָמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֹתָם״ ״אֹתָם״ ״אֹתָם״ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: said to him: My teacher, allow me to say before you one matter that you taught me. He said to him: Speak. He said to him: It states them [ otam ] them [ otam ] them [ otam ] Three times
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, permit me to say before you one thing that you taught me. He said to him: Say. He said to him: Behold, it says "them" "them" "them" three times.

hebrew_text: ״אַתֶּם״ — אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹגְגִין, ״אַתֶּם״ — אֲפִילּוּ מְזִידִין, ״אַתֶּם״ — אֲפִילּוּ מוּטְעִין. בַּלָּשׁוֹן הַזֶּה אָמַר לוֹ: עֲקִיבָא נִחַמְתַּנִי, נִחַמְתַּנִי.
human_translation: You atem even unwittingly you, even intentionally; you, even misled said to him in these words: Akiva, you have consoled me; you have consoled me.
llm_translation: "You" - even unintentional, "you" - even intentional, "you" - even coerced. In this language he said to him: Akiva, you have comforted me, you have comforted me.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הוֹרְכִּינָס כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָמָּה לֹא נִתְפָּרְשׁוּ שְׁמוֹתָם שֶׁל זְקֵנִים הַלָּלוּ? שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אָדָם: פְּלוֹנִי כְּמֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן? פְּלוֹנִי כְּנָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא? פְּלוֹנִי כְּאֶלְדָּד וּמֵידָד?
human_translation: came to Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas, The Sages taught Why were the names of these Elders not specified? that a person not say: so-and-so like Moses and Aaron? so-and-so like Nadav and Avihu? so-and-so like Eldad and Medad?
llm_translation: He came to Rabbi Dosa ben Horkinas. The Rabbis taught: Why were the names of these elders not specified? So that a person should not say, "So-and-so is like Moses and Aaron, so-and-so is like Nadab and Abihu, so-and-so is like Eldad and Medad."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶל הָעָם ה׳ אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה אֶת מֹשֶׁה וְאֶת אַהֲרֹן״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח ה׳ אֶת יְרוּבַּעַל וְאֶת בְּדָן וְאֶת יִפְתָּח וְאֶת שְׁמוּאֵל״. ״יְרוּבַּעַל״ — זֶה גִּדְעוֹן, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ יְרוּבַּעַל — שֶׁעָשָׂה מְרִיבָה עִם הַבַּעַל. ״בְּדָן״ — זֶה שִׁמְשׁוֹן, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּדָן — דְּאָתֵי מִדָּן. יִפְתָּח — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ.
human_translation: And it says: “And Samuel said to the people: It is the Lord Who made Moses and Aaron” And it says “And the Lord sent Jerubaal and Bedan and Jephthah and Samuel” Jerubaal, this is Gideon. And why is he called Jerubaal? that he waged a quarrel against Baal. Bedan, this is Samson. And why is he called Bedan? As he came from Dan. Jephthah, in accordance with its meaning,
llm_translation: "And he said: 'Shmuel said to the people, 'The Lord who made Moshe and Aharon.'' And he said: 'The Lord sent Yerubbaal and Bedan and Yiftach and Shmuel.' 'Yerubbaal' - this is Gideon, and why was he called Yerubbaal? Because he contended with Baal. 'Bedan' - this is Shimshon, and why was he called Bedan? Because he came from Dan. Yiftach - as his name implies."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן בְּכֹהֲנָיו וּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּקוֹרְאֵי שְׁמוֹ״, שָׁקַל הַכָּתוּב שְׁלֹשָׁה קַלֵּי עוֹלָם כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה חֲמוּרֵי עוֹלָם,
human_translation: And it says “Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call His name; the verse weighed three light ones of the world, as three significant ones of the world,
llm_translation: And he says: "Moses and Aaron in his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his name," the Scripture equated three light things to three heavy things.

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: יְרוּבַּעַל בְּדוֹרוֹ — כְּמֹשֶׁה בְּדוֹרוֹ, בְּדָן בְּדוֹרוֹ — כְּאַהֲרֹן בְּדוֹרוֹ, יִפְתָּח בְּדוֹרוֹ — כִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּדוֹרוֹ. לְלַמֶּדְךָ: שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ קַל שֶׁבַּקַּלִּין וְנִתְמַנָּה פַּרְנָס עַל הַצִּבּוּר — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאַבִּיר שֶׁבָּאַבִּירִים.
human_translation: to tell you Jerubaal in his generation like Moses in his generation; Bedan in his generation like Aaron in his generation; Jephthah in his generation like Samuel in his generation. to teach you even the lightest of the light, he has been appointed a leader over the community, he like the greatest of the great,
llm_translation: To say to you: Jeroboam in his generation — like Moses in his generation, in Dan in his generation — like Aaron in his generation, Jephthah in his generation — like Samuel in his generation. To teach you: that even if the lightest among the lightweights is appointed as a leader over the community — behold, he is like the mightiest among the mighty.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״וּבָאתָ אֶל הַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם וְאֶל הַשֹּׁפֵט אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם״, וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁאָדָם הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל הַדַּיָּין שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּיָמָיו? הָא אֵין לְךָ לֵילֵךְ אֶלָּא אֵצֶל שׁוֹפֵט שֶׁבְּיָמָיו. וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַל תֹּאמַר מֶה הָיָה שֶׁהַיָּמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הָיוּ טוֹבִים מֵאֵלֶּה״.
human_translation: And it says: “And you shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge who shall be in those days” But enter your mind that a person go to a judge that is not in his days? you to go only to the judge in one’s days, And it says: “Do not say: How was it that the former days were better than these?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And he shall come to the priests, the Levites, and to the judge who will be in those days," and do you think that a person goes to the judge who was not in his days? Rather, you should only go to the judge who is in his days. And it says: "Do not say, 'What was it that the former days were better than these.'"

hebrew_text: נָטַל מַקְלוֹ וּמְעוֹתָיו בְּיָדוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה אוֹתוֹ, עָמַד מִכִּסְּאוֹ וּנְשָׁקוֹ עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: שָׁלוֹם עָלֶיךָ רַבִּי וְתַלְמִידִי! רַבִּי — שֶׁלִּמַּדְתַּנִי תּוֹרָה בָּרַבִּים, וְתַלְמִידִי — שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹזֵר עָלֶיךָ גְּזֵירָה וְאַתָּה מְקַיְּימָהּ כְּתַלְמִיד. אַשְׁרֵי הַדּוֹר שֶׁהַגְּדוֹלִים נִשְׁמָעִים לַקְּטַנִּים, קַל וָחוֹמֶר קְטַנִּים לַגְּדוֹלִים.
human_translation: took his staff and his money in his hand, The Sages taught When saw he rose from his chair and kissed him on his head said to him: Peace be on you, my teacher and my student. My teacher, as you have taught me Torah in public, and my student, as I issue a decree against you and you fulfill it like a student Fortunate is the generation in which the greater heed the lesser, and an a fortiori the lesser the greater
llm_translation: He took his staff and his purse in his hand. The Rabbis taught: Once he saw him, he stood up from his seat and placed his hand on his head, and said to him: Peace be upon you, my teacher and my student! My teacher - for you have taught me Torah in public, and my student - for I have decreed upon you a decree and you have fulfilled it like a student. Fortunate is the generation whose great ones listen to their small ones, all the more so the small ones to the great ones.

hebrew_text: קַל וָחוֹמֶר?! חִיּוּבָא הוּא! אֶלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהַגְּדוֹלִים נִשְׁמָעִים לַקְּטַנִּים — נוֹשְׂאִין קְטַנִּים קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּעַצְמָן.
human_translation: an a fortiori it is an obligation Rather, Since the greater heed the lesser, the lesser apply an a fortiori to themselves
llm_translation: "Kal vachomer?! Chiyuva hu! Ela: Mitoch shehagdolim nishma'im la'ktanim — nos'in ktanim kal vachomer be'atzman." "Light and heavy?! It is an obligation! Rather: Since the great ones listen to the small ones — they accept the small ones' argument a fortiori on its own."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אִם אֵינָן מַכִּירִין
llm_translation: We will return to you if they do not recognize.

hebrew_text: רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל, נֶחְקְרוּ הָעֵדִים וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקוּ לוֹמַר ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״ עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְעוּבָּר.
human_translation: the court and all of Jewish people saw the witnesses were interrogated, but did not manage to say: Sanctified, before nightfall, is a full,
llm_translation: They saw him the court and all Israel, examined the witnesses and did not suffice to say "sanctified" until it became dark - this is a bastard.

hebrew_text: רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין בִּלְבַד — יַעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיָעִידוּ בִּפְנֵיהֶם, וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״. רָאוּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְהֵן בֵּית דִּין — יַעַמְדוּ הַשְּׁנַיִם וְיוֹשִׁיבוּ מֵחֲבֵירֵיהֶם אֵצֶל הַיָּחִיד, וְיָעִידוּ בִּפְנֵיהֶם, וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״, שֶׁאֵין הַיָּחִיד נֶאֱמָן עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: the court alone saw two should stand and testify before the others, and should say: Sanctified, sanctified. three saw and they are a court two should stand and seat of their colleagues next to the individual should testify before say: Sanctified, sanctified. because an individual is not authorized by himself.
llm_translation: They saw him only in the court - two should stand and testify before them, and say: "Sanctified, sanctified." If three saw him, and they are the court - the two should stand and have their colleagues sit next to the individual, and they should testify before them, and say: "Sanctified, sanctified," for an individual is not trusted by himself.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל — אִיפַּרְסְמָא לַהּ וְלָא לִיעַבְּרוּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I to teach: the court and all of Jewish people saw It was necessary it might enter your mind to say since the court and all of Jewish people saw it was publicized and let them intercalate teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why do I need to teach that they saw him, the court and all of Israel? It is necessary, for if you were to say: Since the court and all of Israel saw him — he should be flogged and not stoned, we hear.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דִּתְנָא לֵיהּ רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל — נֶחְקְרוּ הָעֵדִים לְמָה לִי! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי נָמֵי נֶחְקְרוּ הָעֵדִים וְלֹא הִסְפִּיקוּ לוֹמַר ״מְקוּדָּשׁ״ עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְעוּבָּר.
human_translation: But once states: the court and all of Jewish people saw why do I the witnesses were interrogated? this is what is saying: Alternatively, the witnesses were interrogated, but had no time to say: Sanctified, before nightfall, intercalated
llm_translation: And since it was taught to him, the court saw him and all of Israel - the witnesses were examined, what do I need them for! This is what he is saying: If indeed the witnesses were examined and did not manage to say "Mekudash" until it became dark - this is considered a blemish.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דִּתְנָא עַד שֶׁחָשֵׁיכָה הֲרֵי זֶה מְעוּבָּר — לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנְיַיהּ חֲקִירַת הָעֵדִים כְּלָל?
human_translation: But once taught: before nightfall, why do I to teach the interrogation of the witnesses?
llm_translation: And since it was taught, until it becomes dark, this one is considered a viable fetus - why do I need to teach it regarding the examination of the witnesses in general?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֶּיהְוֵי חֲקִירַת עֵדִים כִּתְחִילַּת דִּין, וּ״מְקוּדָּשׁ מְקוּדָּשׁ״ כִּגְמַר דִּין, וּלְקַדְּשֵׁיהּ בְּלֵילְיָא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַדִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, דִּתְנַן: דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דָּנִין בַּיּוֹם וְגוֹמְרִין בַּלַּיְלָה — הָכָא נָמֵי מְקַדְּשִׁין בְּלֵילְיָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
