human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say: Let the interrogation of the witnesses be as the beginning of the judicial and Sanctified, sanctified, as the conclusion of the judicial and let them sanctify at night, just as it is in monetary law, as we learned monetary law, judge during the day, complete at night. Here too, sanctify at night, teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has said: the examination of witnesses should be like the beginning of the judgment, and "mikudash mikudash" should be like the completion of the judgment, and to sanctify it at night, since it involves monetary matters, as we have learned: monetary cases are judged during the day and concluded at night - here too, we sanctify it at night, this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי חֹק לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הוּא מִשְׁפָּט לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״, אֵימַת הָוֵי ״חֹק״ — בִּגְמַר דִּין, וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא ״מִשְׁפָּט״, מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם — אַף הָכָא נָמֵי בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Why not say indeed, The verse states “For this is a statute for Israel, a judgment [ mishpat ] of the God of Jacob” When does become a statute? At the end of the judicial process, and the Merciful One calls it a judgment just as a judgment is during the day, here too, during the day,
llm_translation: And why is this so? The verse says: "For it is a statute for Israel, a judgment of the God of Jacob." When is it considered a "statute"? - When the judgment is finalized, and the Merciful One calls it "judgment." Just as judgment is during the day, so too here it is during the day.

hebrew_text: רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין — יַעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיָעִידוּ בִּפְנֵיהֶם. וְאַמַּאי? לֹא תְּהֵא שְׁמִיעָה גְּדוֹלָה מֵרְאִיָּיה!
human_translation: the court saw two should stand and testify before the others. why Hearing should not be greater than seeing
llm_translation: They saw him in the court - two shall stand and testify before them. And why? So that the hearing shall not be greater than the seeing!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁרָאוּהוּ בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: where saw at night.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: "Like the example that they saw him at night."

hebrew_text: רָאוּהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְהֵן בֵּית דִּין — יַעַמְדוּ שְׁנַיִם וְיוֹשִׁיבוּ מֵחֲבֵירֵיהֶם אֵצֶל הַיָּחִיד. אַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי נֵימָא: לֹא תְּהֵא שְׁמִיעָה גְּדוֹלָה מֵרְאִיָּיה! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי — כְּגוֹן שֶׁרָאוּהוּ בַּלַּיְלָה הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: three saw and they are a court two should stand and seat of their colleagues next to the individual Why Here too, let us say: Hearing should not be greater than seeing And if you say here too, where they saw at night, this is that
llm_translation: They saw him three, and they are a court - two shall stand and sit their colleagues beside the individual. Why? Here too it is stated: "Let not the hearing be greater than the seeing!" And if you say here too it is stated - such as when they saw him at night, that is the case!

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּאֵין הַיָּחִיד נֶאֱמָן עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְאִם הָיָה מוּמְחֶה לְרַבִּים דָּן אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד, הָכָא נָמֵי נִיקַדְּשֵׁיהּ בִּיחִידִי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary the last clause, Because an individual is not deemed credible by himself. For enter your mind to say since we learned monetary law by three but if was a publicly recognized expert, he may judge even individually, then here too, should sanctify individually teaches us
llm_translation: The latter clause is necessary, for an individual is not trusted regarding himself. As your mind concludes: Since we learned that monetary cases require three judges, and if one was disqualified in the presence of many, he may judge even in the presence of one, here too, he is sanctified by an individual — this is what we infer.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכָא נָמֵי? אֵין לְךָ מוּמְחֶה לְרַבִּים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹתֵר מִמֹּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: עַד דְּאִיכָּא אַהֲרֹן בַּהֲדָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה וְאֶל אַהֲרֹן בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם לֵאמֹר. הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: But why not say that here too, there was no publicly recognized expert among Jewish people greater than our teacher Moses, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: until Aaron is with you, as it is written: “And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying, this month shall be for you
llm_translation: And why not say here also? You have no blemish among the many in Israel greater than our teacher Moses, and the Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: Until there is Aaron with you, as it is written: "And the Lord said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt saying, 'This month is for you.'"

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּעֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין? לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: סַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁרָאוּ אֶחָד שֶׁהָרַג אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ —
human_translation: Is this to say that a witness becomes a judge, Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, for it was taught the Sanhedrin saw someone kill person,
llm_translation: In the matter of the witnesses, can they become judges? Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: The Sanhedrin saw one who killed a soul —

hebrew_text: מִקְצָתָן נַעֲשׂוּ עֵדִים וּמִקְצָתָן נַעֲשׂוּ דַּיָּינִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן נַעֲשִׂין עֵדִים, וְאֵין עֵד נַעֲשֶׂה דַּיָּין.
human_translation: some of them are rendered witnesses and some of them become judges this is the statement of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: They are all rendered witnesses, and a witness cannot become a judge.
llm_translation: Some of them became witnesses and some of them became judges, the words of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: all of them became witnesses, and a witness does not become a judge.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הָתָם אֶלָּא בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְשָׁפְטוּ הָעֵדָה״ ״וְהִצִּילוּ הָעֵדָה״, וְכֵיוָן דְחַזְיוּהוּ דִּקְטַל נַפְשָׁא לָא מָצוּ חָזוּ לֵיהּ זְכוּתָא. אֲבָל הָכָא — אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Akiva, Rabbi Akiva states there only with regard to capital law, for the Merciful One says: “And the congregation shall judge…and the congregation shall save” but once they have seen him kill a person, they will be unable to find exonerate But here, even Rabbi Akiva concedes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if you say Rabbi Akiva, until here not said Rabbi Akiva there except in cases of capital law, as the Merciful One said: "And the congregation shall judge," "And the congregation shall deliver," and since they saw that he killed a person, they did not find merit in him. But here - even Rabbi Akiva agrees.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת כְּשֵׁרִים, חוּץ מִשֶּׁל פָּרָה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וַהֲלֹא כׇּל הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת נִקְרְאוּ קֶרֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בִּמְשׁוֹךְ בְּקֶרֶן הַיּוֹבֵל״.
human_translation: All shofarot are fit except for of a cow, because it is a horn [ keren ] Rabbi Yosei said: But aren’t all shofarot called horn, as it is stated: that when they sound a long blast with the horn [ keren ] of a ram [ yovel ]”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: all shofars are valid, except for that of a cow, because it is a horn. Rabbi Yosei said: But aren't all shofars called horns, as it is stated: "With the blast of the horn of the jubilee"?

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת אִקְּרוֹ שׁוֹפָר וְאִקְּרוֹ קֶרֶן. דְּפָרָה — קֶרֶן אִקְּרִי, שׁוֹפָר לָא אִקְּרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכוֹר שׁוֹרוֹ הָדָר לוֹ וְקַרְנֵי רְאֵם קַרְנָיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei is saying well, the Rabbis all shofarot are called shofar and called keren , a cow is called keren , it is not called shofar , as it is written: “His firstborn bull, grandeur is his, and his horns [ karnav ] are the horns of [ karnei ] a wild ox”
llm_translation: Gemara: "Good, thus said Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis: All the shofars they called a shofar, and they called a horn. A cow - they called it a horn, they did not call it a shofar, as it is written: 'His firstborn bull, majesty is his, and his horns are the horns of a wild ox.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר לָךְ: דְּפָרָה נָמֵי אִקְּרִי שׁוֹפָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְתִיטַב לַה׳ מִשּׁוֹר פָּר״, אִם שׁוֹר — לָמָּה פָּר, וְאִם פָּר — לָמָּה שׁוֹר? אֶלָּא: מַאי ״שׁוֹר פָּר״ — מִשּׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei He said to you: of a cow are also called shofar , as it is written: “And it shall please the Lord better than an ox bull [ shor par ] If an ox [ shor ], why a bull [ par ], and if a bull [ par ], why an ox [ shor ]? Rather, what is shor par ? Than a shofar .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to you: Regarding a cow, it is also called a shofar, as it is written: "And it shall be better to the Lord than a bull or a cow." If it is a bull - why a cow, and if it is a cow - why a bull? Rather, what is "a bull or a cow" - from a shofar.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? כִּדְרַב מַתְנָה. דְּאָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: מַאי ״שׁוֹר פָּר״ — שֶׁהוּא גָּדוֹל כְּפַר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis as Rav Mattana, as Rav Mattana said: What is shor par ? An ox [ shor ] that is as large as a bull [ par ],
llm_translation: The Sages? Like Rav Matna. For Rav Matna said: What is "a young bull"? — That it is as large as a village.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן, כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל נִכְנָס בְּבִגְדֵי זָהָב לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים לַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קָטֵיגוֹר נַעֲשָׂה סָנֵיגוֹר.
human_translation: Ulla said: This is the reasoning of the Rabbis, in accordance with the opinion of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: For what reason does the High Priest not enter the innermost sanctum, with golden garments to perform the service because a prosecutor [ kateigor ] cannot become an advocate [ sanneigor ].
llm_translation: Oula said: This is the reason of the Sages, like Rav Ḥisda. For Rav Ḥisda said: Why does the High Priest not enter the Holy of Holies wearing garments of gold, both before and inside to perform the service? Because an accuser cannot become a defender.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא אִיכָּא דָּם פַּר! הוֹאִיל וְאִשְׁתַּנִּי — אִשְׁתַּנִּי.
human_translation: But not But there is the blood of the bull Since it has changed, it has changed,
llm_translation: And not? But there is where there is blood of a bull! Since it has changed - it has changed.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא אָרוֹן וְכַפּוֹרֶת וּכְרוּב! חוֹטֵא בַּל יַקְרִיב קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But there is the Ark, the Ark cover, and the cherub, What we are saying is a sinner should not bring into
llm_translation: And there is the Ark, and the cover, and the cherubim! One who sins should not bring near, we say.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא כַּף וּמַחְתָּה! חוֹטֵא בַּל יִתְנָאֶה קָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But there is the spoon and coal pan What we are saying is a sinner should not adorn
llm_translation: And there is a hand and a mortar! One who sins should not be arrogant, we say.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא בִּגְדֵי זָהָב מִבַּחוּץ! מִבִּפְנִים קָא אָמְרִינַן. שׁוֹפָר נָמֵי מִבַּחוּץ הוּא! כֵּיוָן דִּלְזִכָּרוֹן הוּא — כְּבִפְנִים דָּמֵי.
human_translation: But there are the golden garments outside What we are saying is inside the shofar is also outside, Since is remembrance, it is considered as if inside
llm_translation: And there is a case where garments of gold are worn from the outside! But from the inside they are worn. A horn used for blowing is considered from the outside! Once it is for remembrance — it is considered like it is from the inside.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנָּא ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן״ קָאָמַר! חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא — דְּאֵין קָטֵיגוֹר נַעֲשָׂה סָנֵיגוֹר, וְעוֹד — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן.
human_translation: But taught: because it is a keren . stated one and another One that a prosecutor cannot become an advocate, and another because it is a keren
llm_translation: And here it was taught: "Because he is a horn" is what he said! One and furthermore he said: One - that the prosecutor cannot become the defender, and furthermore - because he is a horn.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אָמַר לָךְ: דְּקָא אָמְרַתְּ אֵין קָטֵיגוֹר נַעֲשָׂה סָנֵיגוֹר — הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִבִּפְנִים, וְהַאי שׁוֹפָר מִבַּחוּץ הוּא. וּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן — כׇּל הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת נָמֵי אִקְּרוֹ קֶרֶן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei He said to you: That which you said, a prosecutor cannot become an advocate, this applies inside and the shofar is outside. And that which you said, because it is a keren , all shofarot are also called keren .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei? He said to you: Because you said, "The prosecutor becomes the defender" - those words are from within, and this shofar is from without. And because you said, "Because it is a horn" - all the shofars are indeed called a horn.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אֲמַר, הַיְינוּ טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן: שׁוֹפָר אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹפָרוֹת. וְהָא דְּפָרָה, כֵּיוָן דְּקָאֵי גִּילְדֵי גִּילְדֵי — מִיתְחֲזֵי כִּשְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹפָרוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is the reasoning of the Rabbis: The Merciful One says shofar , and not two or three shofarot but this of a cow, since it is comprised of layers, looks like two or three shofarot .
llm_translation: Abaye said, the reason of the Sages is: "Shofar" the Merciful One said, and not two or three shofars. And as for the cow, once it starts to circle, it appears like two or three shofars.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנָּא ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן״ קָאָמַר! חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא — דְּשׁוֹפָר אֶחָד אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹפָרוֹת. וְעוֹד — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן.
human_translation: But taught: because it is a keren . stated one and another One that the Merciful One says a shofar , and not two or three shofarot and another because it is a keren .
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: "And didn't we learn in a Baraita: 'Because it is a horn' is what he said!" He said one thing and he also said another thing: One thing - that the Merciful One said one Shofar, and not two or three Shofars. And another thing - because it is a horn.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר לָךְ: דְּקָאָמְרַתְּ ״שׁוֹפָר אֶחָד אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹפָרוֹת״ — כֵּיוָן דִּמְחַבְּרִי אַהֲדָדֵי, חַד הוּא. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא קֶרֶן״ — כׇּל הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת נָמֵי אִקְּרוֹ קֶרֶן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said to you: That which you said, the Merciful One says shofar , and not two or three shofarot , Since are connected to each other, a single And that which you said: Because it is a keren , all shofarot are also called keren .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to you: Since you say, "The Merciful One said one shofar, not two or three shofars" - once they are connected, they are one. And since you say, "Because it is a horn" - all the shofars are indeed called a horn.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי יוֹבֵלָא לִישָּׁנָא דְּדִכְרָא הוּא? דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לַעֲרַבְיָא, הָיוּ קוֹרִין לְדִכְרָא ״יוֹבֵלָא״.
human_translation: From where be inferred that yovel denotes of a ram? As it is taught Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Arabia, they called a ram yovla ,
llm_translation: What is the implication that this Jubilee is for the male? For it was taught, Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Arabia, they would read for the male "Jubilee."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לְגַלְיָא, הָיוּ קוֹרִין לְנִדָּה גַּלְמוּדָה. מַאי גַּלְמוּדָה — גְּמוּלָה דָּא מִבַּעְלָהּ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לְאַפְרִיקִי, הָיוּ קוֹרִין לְמָעָה קְשִׂיטָה. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְפָרוֹשֵׁי ״מֵאָה קְשִׂיטָה״ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מְאָה דַּנְקֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Galia, they called a menstruating woman galmuda , What galmuda She is separated [ gemula da ] from her husband, And Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Africa, they called a ma’a , kesita . What is the significance of this? To explain in the Torah a hundred kesita ” a hundred dankei ,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Galia, they would read the Niddah Gemuda. What is Gemuda? - Her reward from her husband. And Rabbi Akiva said: When I went to Africa, they would read the Ma'ah Kesita. What is the reason for this? - For the interpreters of "a hundred kesitah" from the Torah, a hundred dinars.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לִכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם, הָיוּ קוֹרִין לִמְכִירָה כִּירָה. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְפָרוֹשֵׁי ״אֲשֶׁר כָּרִיתִי לִי״:
human_translation: Rabbi said: When I went to the sea towns, they called a sale kira . What is the significance of this? To explain which I purchased [ kariti ] for myself,
llm_translation: Rabbi said: When I went to the shores of the sea, they would call a pot for sale a "ki'rah." What is derived from this? From the verses "which I have dug for myself."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לִתְחוּם קַן נִשְׁרַיָּיא, הָיוּ קוֹרִין לַכַּלָּה נִינְפִי, וְלַתַּרְנְגוֹל שֶׂכְוִי. לַכַּלָּה נִינְפִי — מַאי קְרָא: ״יְפֵה נוֹף מְשׂוֹשׂ כׇּל הָאָרֶץ״. וְלַתַּרְנְגוֹל שֶׂכְוִי — אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי קְרָא — ״מִי שָׁת בַּטּוּחוֹת חׇכְמָה אוֹ מִי נָתַן לַשֶּׂכְוִי בִינָה״. ״מִי שָׁת בַּטּוּחוֹת חׇכְמָה״ — אֵלּוּ כְּלָיוֹת, ״אוֹ מִי נָתַן לַשֶּׂכְוִי בִינָה״ — זֶה תַּרְנְגוֹל.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: When I went to the district of Kan Nishrayya, they called a bride ninfi and a rooster sekhvi . A bride ninfi ; what is the verse “Beautiful view [ nof ], the joy of the whole earth, And a rooster sekhvi ; Rav Yehuda said Rav said: And if you wish, say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi What is the verse “Who has put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who has given understanding to the sekhvi ” “Who has put wisdom in the inward parts”: These are the kidneys “or who has given understanding to the sekhvi ”: This is a rooster,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: When I went to the border of Kan Nishrayya, they would call out to the bride "Ninfi," and to the rooster "Sekvi." Regarding calling out to the bride "Ninfi" - what is the verse? "Fair of beauty, the joy of all the earth." And regarding the rooster "Sekvi" - Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and if you wish, say it was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: What is the verse? "Who has put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who has given understanding to the rooster?" "Who has put wisdom in the inward parts?" - these are the kidneys. "Or who has given understanding to the rooster?" - this is the rooster.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אִיקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא. אֲתָא גַּבְרָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Levi happened to a certain place, a man came before him said to him:
llm_translation: Levi happened upon that place. A man came before him, he said to him:

hebrew_text: קַבְעַן פְּלָנְיָא. לָא הֲוָה יָדַע מַאי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. אֲתָא שְׁאֵיל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּזְלַן אֲמַר לָךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֲיִקְבַּע אָדָם אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִבַּרְנִישׁ לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי קַבְעָךְ? בְּמַאי קַבְעָךְ? וְאַמַּאי קַבְעָךְ? וּמִמֵּילָא הֲוָה יָדְעִינָא. וְאִיהוּ סָבַר: מִילְּתָא דְאִיסּוּרָא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: So-and-so keva’a from me. did not understand what was saying to him, he went asked in the study hall. They said to him: said to you: He robbed me, as it is written: “Will a man rob [ hayikba ] God?” Rava from Barnish said to Rav Ashi: Had I been there I would have said to him: How did he keva’a you? With what did he keva’a you? And why did he keva’a you? And I would have understood on my own And thought was talking about a matter of prohibition
llm_translation: The fixed time of Ploni. He did not know what he was saying to him. He went to the study hall, and said to him: A thief told you, as it is written: "Will a man rob God?" Rava said from Barnish to Rav Ashi: If he were there, I would have believed him: How did he establish you? With what did he establish you? And why did he establish you? And from the context, we would have known. And he thought: He was speaking about a matter of prohibition.

hebrew_text: לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי ״סֵירוּגִין״. שַׁמְעוּהָ לְאַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי דַּחֲזָתִנְהוּ רַבָּנַן דַּהֲווֹ עָיְילִי פִּסְקֵי פִּסְקֵי, אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: עַד מָתַי אַתֶּם נִכְנָסִין סֵירוּגִין סֵירוּגִין.
human_translation: The Sages did not know the meaning of seirugin , they heard the maidservant in Rabbi house say to the Sages whom she saw entering intermittently: How long shall you enter seirugin seirugin ?
llm_translation: The sages did not know what "seirugin" are. They heard the truth from the house of Rabbi, for the sages saw them going in pairs. She said to them: Until when will you keep entering seirugin seirugin.

hebrew_text: לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי ״חֲלוֹגְלוֹגוֹת״. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁמְעוּהָ לְאַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי דַּחֲזָית לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא מְבַדַּר פַּרְפְּחִינֵיהּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מְפַזֵּר חֲלוֹגְלוֹגְךָ.
human_translation: the Sages did not know the meaning ḥaloglogot , One day they heard the maidservant in Rabbi house say to a certain man whom she saw scattering his purslane How long shall you scatter your ḥaloglogot ?
llm_translation: The sages did not know what "chaluglugot" are. One day, they heard the truth from the house of Rabbi, as they saw that man who was sifting his ashes. She said to him: "How long will you scatter your chaluglug?"

hebrew_text: לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי: ״סַלְסְלֶהָ וּתְרוֹמְמֶךָּ״. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁמְעוּהָ לְאַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי דַּהֲווֹת אָמְרָה לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מְהַפֵּךְ בְּשַׂעְרֵיהּ, אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מְסַלְסֵל בִּשְׂעָרְךָ.
human_translation: The Sages also did not know the meaning “ Salseleha and it will exalt you” One day they heard the maidservant in Rabbi house say to a certain man who was curling his hair: How long shall you mesalsel your hair?
llm_translation: The sages did not know what is meant by: "Salsleha and terommecha." One day they heard the truth from the household of Rabbi, for she used to say to that man who was combing his hair, she said to him: "How long will you keep combing your hair?"

hebrew_text: לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי ״וְטֵאטֵאתִיהָ בְּמַטְאֲטֵא הַשְׁמֵד״. יוֹמָא חַד שַׁמְעוּהָ לְאַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי דַּהֲווֹת אָמְרָה לַחֲבֶירְתַּהּ: שְׁקוּלִי טָאטִיתָא וְטַאטִי בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: the Sages did not know the meaning “And sweep it [ vetetetiha ] with the broom [ matatei ] of destruction” One day they heard the maidservant in Rabbi house saying to her workmate: Take a broom [ tateita ] and sweep ta’ati the house,”
llm_translation: The sages did not know what "and I will destroy it with destruction" means. One day, they heard the maidservant of the house of Rabbi saying to her friend: "Take the mortar and mortar the house."

hebrew_text: לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי רַבָּנַן מַאי ״הַשְׁלֵךְ עַל ה׳ יְהָבְךָ וְהוּא יְכַלְכְּלֶךָ״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה אָזְלִינָא בַּהֲדֵי הָהוּא טַיָּיעָא, הֲוָה דָּרֵינָא טוּנָא וַאֲמַר לִי: שְׁקוֹל יַהְבָּיךְ וּשְׁדִי אַגַּמְלַאי.
human_translation: The Sages did not know the meaning “Cast your load [ yehavkha ] upon the Lord and He will sustain you” Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: One day I was traveling with a certain Arab [ Tayya’a ], I was carrying a load, and he said to me: Take your yehav and cast it on my camel,
llm_translation: The sages did not know what is meant by "Cast your burden upon the Lord, and He will sustain you." Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: One day I was walking on the road, and I was carrying a load. A man met me and said to me: "Put your burden on my camel and let it carry it."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוֹפָר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁל יָעֵל פָּשׁוּט וּפִיו מְצוּפֶּה זָהָב, וּשְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת מִן הַצְּדָדִין. שׁוֹפָר מַאֲרִיךְ וַחֲצוֹצְרוֹת מְקַצְּרוֹת, שֶׁמִּצְוַת הַיּוֹם בְּשׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: The shofar on Rosh HaShana straight of an ibex, and its mouth, was plated with gold. And two trumpets, on the sides The shofar would sound a long whereas the trumpets would sound a short because the mitzva of the day is with the shofar .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The shofar of Rosh Hashanah of a wild goat is straight, and its mouth is plated with gold, and there are two trumpets on its sides. The shofar is long, and the trumpets are short, as the mitzvah of the day is with the shofar.

hebrew_text: וּבְתַעֲנִיּוֹת בְּשֶׁל זְכָרִים כְּפוּפִין, וּפִיהֶן מְצוּפֶּה כֶּסֶף, וּשְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת בָּאֶמְצַע. שׁוֹפָר מְקַצֵּר וַחֲצוֹצְרוֹת מַאֲרִיכוֹת, שֶׁמִּצְוַת הַיּוֹם בַּחֲצוֹצְרוֹת.
human_translation: And on fast days the curved of rams, and their mouths were plated with silver. two trumpets in the middle the shofar would sound a short blast, whereas the trumpets would sound a long for the mitzva of the day is with the trumpets.
llm_translation: In fasts of males, trumpets are bent, and their mouths are covered with silver, and two trumpets in the middle. The shofar is shortened and the trumpets are lengthened, for the mitzvah of the day is with the trumpets.

hebrew_text: שָׁוֶה הַיּוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה תּוֹקְעִין בְּשֶׁל זְכָרִים וּבַיּוֹבְלוֹת בְּשֶׁל יְעֵלִים.
human_translation: the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana with regard to the blasts and the blessings Rabbi Yehuda says: On Rosh HaShana one blows with of rams, whereas in Jubilee Years with of ibexes.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The shofar of the Jubilee is equal to the beginning of the year for blowing and for blessings. Rabbi Yehuda says: On the beginning of the year, we blow with rams' horns and with Jubilee horns made from ibex horns."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: מִצְוָה שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְשֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים בִּכְפוּפִין, וְשֶׁל כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה בִּפְשׁוּטִין. וְהָתְנַן: שׁוֹפָר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁל יָעֵל פָּשׁוּט! הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין בְּשֶׁל זְכָרִים כְּפוּפִין, וּבַיּוֹבְלוֹת בְּשֶׁל יְעֵלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: The mitzva of Rosh HaShana and of Yom Kippur with curved and of the rest of the year, with straight But didn’t we learn The shofar on Rosh HaShana straight of an ibex? said in accordance with that tanna , as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: On Rosh HaShana they would blow with the curved of rams, and on the Jubilee Years with of ibexes.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Levi: Commandment of Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur in curved, and of all the year in straight. And we learned: Shofar of Rosh Hashanah of a ram is straight! He said because this Tanna who teaches, Rabbi Yehuda says: On Rosh Hashanah they used to blow for males curved, and on Jubilee for females.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אִי אָמְרַתְּ הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל יוֹבֵל נָמֵי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: let say the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. If you had said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, I would have said he, holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda even with regard to in the Jubilee Year, teaches us
llm_translation: And say the halakha like Rabbi Yehuda! If you say the halakha like Rabbi Yehuda, I would say: Even regarding the shofar of the Jubilee, he holds like Rabbi Yehuda, for it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — כַּמָּה דְּכָיֵיף אִינִישׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, טְפֵי מְעַלֵּי; וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — כַּמָּה דְּפָשֵׁיט אִינִישׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, טְפֵי מְעַלֵּי. וּמָר סָבַר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — כַּמָּה דְּפָשֵׁיט אִינִישׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, טְפֵי מְעַלֵּי; וּבְתַעֲנִיּוֹת — כַּמָּה דְּכָיֵיף אִינִישׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, טְפֵי מְעַלֵּי.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? One Sage, holds on Rosh HaShana the more a person bends his mind the better. But on Yom Kippur, the more a person straightens his mind the better. The other Sage, maintains On Rosh HaShana, the more a person straightens his mind the better. On fasts, the more a person bends his mind the better.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: On Rosh Hashanah — as much as a person's mind is at ease, he is more meticulous; and on Yom Kippur — as much as a person's mind is unsettled, he is more meticulous. And Master holds: On Rosh Hashanah — as much as a person's mind is unsettled, he is more meticulous; and on fast days — as much as a person's mind is at ease, he is more meticulous.

hebrew_text: וּפִיו מְצוּפֶּה זָהָב. וְהָתַנְיָא: צִיפָּהוּ זָהָב בִּמְקוֹם הַנָּחַת פִּיו — פָּסוּל, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם הַנָּחַת פִּיו — כָּשֵׁר! אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין — שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם הַנָּחַת פֶּה תְּנַן.
human_translation: And mouth was plated with gold. But isn’t it taught was plated with gold at the place where one puts his mouth, unfit not at the place where he puts his mouth, fit Abaye said: When we learned as well, we learned not to the place where one puts his mouth,
llm_translation: His mouth is covered with gold. And it was taught: If he covered it with gold in the place where his mouth rests - it is invalid, but if not in the place where his mouth rests - it is valid! Abaye said: When we learned the Mishnah, we learned that it is not valid if it is not in the place where his mouth rests.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת מִן הַצְּדָדִים. וּתְרֵי קָלֵי מִי מִשְׁתַּמְעִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״זָכוֹר״ וְ״שָׁמוֹר״, בְּדִיבּוּר אֶחָד נֶאֶמְרוּ, מַה שֶּׁאֵין הַפֶּה יְכוֹלָה לְדַבֵּר וְאֵין הָאוֹזֶן יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ! לְכָךְ מַאֲרִיךְ בְּשׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: And two trumpets, on the sides But is it possible to discern two sounds, Isn’t it taught “Remember “Keep were spoken in a single utterance, something that the mouth cannot speak and the ear cannot hear? For this reason would sound a long with the shofar ,
llm_translation: Two trumpets from the sides. And two sounds, who can distinguish between them? And it was taught: "Remember" and "Observe" were spoken in one utterance, that which the mouth cannot speak and the ear cannot hear! Therefore, the shofar is sounded for a longer duration.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּכִי שָׁמַע סוֹף תְּקִיעָה בְּלֹא תְּחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה יָצָא, וּמִמֵּילָא: תְּחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה בְּלֹא סוֹף תְּקִיעָה יָצָא?
human_translation: Is this to say that if one hears the end of a blast without the beginning of the blast he has fulfilled it would follow the beginning of the blast without the end of the blast, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: In the matter of when one hears the end of the blowing without the beginning of the blowing, he has fulfilled his obligation, and from the outset: if the beginning of the blowing is heard without the end of the blowing, has he fulfilled his obligation?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: תָּקַע בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּמָשַׁךְ בַּשְּׁנִיָּה כִּשְׁתַּיִם — אֵין בְּיָדוֹ אֶלָּא אַחַת. אַמַּאי? תִּיסְלַק לֵיהּ בְּתַרְתֵּי! פַּסּוֹקֵי תְּקִיעָתָא מֵהֲדָדֵי לָא פָּסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Come hear one blew the initial and drew out the final two it counts as only one why Let it count for him as two we do not divide into two.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one blows once and prolongs the second like two - he has only fulfilled one. Why? Let him fulfill two! The verses of the blowing do not allow us to interrupt.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַפִּיטָס, אִם קוֹל שׁוֹפָר שָׁמַע — יָצָא, וְאִם קוֹל הֲבָרָה שְׁמַע — לֹא יָצָא. אַמַּאי? לִיפּוֹק בִּתְחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה, מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיעַרְבַּב קָלָא!
human_translation: Come hear one sounds into a pit, or into a cistern, or into jug [ pitas ], if he heard the sound of the shofar , he has fulfilled but if he heard the sound of an echo, he has not fulfilled why let him fulfill with the beginning of the blast, before the sound is confused
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who blows into a pit or into a cistern or into a pipe, if he hears the sound of a shofar - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if he hears the sound of an echo - he has not fulfilled his obligation. Why? To establish the beginning of the blowing, before the echo becomes mixed with the sound!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: תַּרְתֵּי קָלֵי מֵחַד גַּבְרָא — לָא מִשְׁתַּמְעִי, מִתְּרֵי גַבְרֵי — מִשְׁתַּמְעִי.
human_translation: Rather, Two sounds from one person cannot be discerned, from two people can be discerned.
llm_translation: Rather: two voices from one man - not heard, from two men - heard.

hebrew_text: וּמִתְּרֵי גַבְרֵי מִי מִשְׁתַּמְעִי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: בַּתּוֹרָה — אֶחָד קוֹרֵא וְאֶחָד מְתַרְגֵּם, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ שְׁנַיִם קוֹרִין וּשְׁנַיִם מְתַרְגְּמִין!
human_translation: But from two people can be discerned? Isn’t it taught With regard to the Torah, one may read and one may translate, provided that there are not two reading and two translating.
llm_translation: And from two men who is listening? And this was taught: In the Torah — one reads and one translates, but not that two read and two translate!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְסֵיפָא: בְּהַלֵּל וּבִמְגִילָּה — אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה קוֹרִין. אַלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּחַבִּיב — יָהֵיב דַּעְתֵּיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּחַבִּיב — יָהֵיב דַּעְתֵּיהּ וְשָׁמַע.
human_translation: is only similar to the latter clause With regard to hallel and the Scroll even ten may read Apparently, since are dear they direct their attention Here too, since is dear he directs his attention and discerns
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "This is comparable only to the latter part: in Hillel and in Megillah — even ten people read. This implies, once it is beloved — he pays attention, here too: once it is beloved — he pays attention and listens."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָמָּה מַאֲרִיךְ בְּשׁוֹפָר? לֵידַע שֶׁמִּצְוַת הַיּוֹם בְּשׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: But why does he sound a long with the shofar ? know that the mitzva of the day is with the shofar .
llm_translation: Rather, why does one prolong with the shofar? To know that the mitzvah of the day is with the shofar.

hebrew_text: וּבְתַעֲנִיּוֹת בְּשֶׁל זְכָרִים כְּפוּפִין וּפִיו מְצוּפֶּה כֶּסֶף. מַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּזָהָב, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּכֶסֶף? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא כָּל כִּינּוּפְיָא דְּכֶסֶף הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֲשֵׂה לְךָ שְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת כֶּסֶף״? וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הַתּוֹרָה חָסָה עַל מָמוֹנָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: on fast days the curved of rams, and their mouths were plated with silver. What is different there gold, and what is different here silver? If you wish, say: Any gathering people is of silver, as it is written: “Make for yourself two trumpets of silver; And if you wish, say: The Torah spared the money of the Jewish people
llm_translation: In fasts of males, they are curved and their mouth is coated with silver. What is the difference between there, that it is gold, and here, that it is silver? If you wish, say: It is all silver snuffboxes, as it is written: "Make for yourself two silver trumpets." And if you wish, say: The Torah was concerned for the money of Israel.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי נַעֲבֵיד דְּכֶסֶף! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כְּבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב עֲדִיף.
human_translation: there too, should be made with silver Even so, the honoring the Festival is given priority,
llm_translation: There, we will do business with money! Even so, the honor of a festival day is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר לְמִיעְבַּד עוֹבָדָא כְּמַתְנִיתִין. אָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: לָא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֲבָל בִּגְבוּלִין, מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ חֲצוֹצְרוֹת — אֵין שׁוֹפָר, מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שׁוֹפָר — אֵין חֲצוֹצְרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa bar Shmuel thought to act in accordance with the mishna Rava said to him: They said only with regard to the Temple. This is also taught In what is this statement said? in the Temple, but in the provinces, Wherever there are trumpets, there is no shofar , and wherever there is a shofar , there are no trumpets.
llm_translation: Rav Papa bar Shmuel holds that the performance of a mitzvah is effective according to the rules of transactions. Rava said to him: They only said this regarding the Temple. It was also taught similarly: In what case are these words said? — In the Temple. But in the provinces, where there are trumpets, there is no shofar; where there is a shofar, there are no trumpets.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הִנְהִיג רַבִּי חֲלַפְתָּא בְּצִיפּוֹרִי וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן בְּסִיכְנִי, וּכְשֶׁבָּא דָּבָר אֵצֶל חֲכָמִים אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין כֵּן אֶלָּא בְּשַׁעֲרֵי מִזְרָח וּבְהַר הַבַּיִת בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And similarly, Rabbi Ḥalafta established in Tzippori and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon in Sikhni, and when the matter came before the Rabbis they said: They acted in this manner only at the east gates and on the Temple Mount.
llm_translation: And so too, Rabbi Chalaphta conducted himself in Tsippori, and Rabbi Chananya ben Teradyon in Sikhnin. And when a matter came before the sages, they said: They would only conduct themselves thus in the eastern gates and on the Temple Mount alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי קְרָאָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּחֲצוֹצְרוֹת וְקוֹל שׁוֹפָר הָרִיעוּ לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ ה׳״, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ ה׳ הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן חֲצוֹצְרוֹת וְקוֹל שׁוֹפָר, אֲבָל בְּעָלְמָא — לָא.
human_translation: Rava said, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi What is the verse As it is written: “With trumpets and the sound of a shofar make joyful noise before the Lord, the King” before the Lord, the King, do we need trumpets and the sound of a shofar , but in general, not
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say it was Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: What is the verse referring to — as it is written: "With trumpets and the sound of the shofar, raise a shout before the Lord, the King." Before the King, the Lord, we require trumpets and the sound of the shofar, but in general — no.

hebrew_text: שָׁוֶה הַיּוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּמַאן מְצַלֵּינַן הָאִידָּנָא ״זֶה הַיּוֹם תְּחִלַּת מַעֲשֶׂיךָ זִכָּרוֹן לְיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן״, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: בְּתִשְׁרִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana with regard to the blasts and the blessings Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: In accordance with whose do we pray today This day is the beginning of Your works, a commemoration of the first day? In accordance with whom? In accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: The world was created in Tishrei.
llm_translation: The Jubilee is equivalent to the beginning of the year for blowing and for blessings, etc. Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: In accordance with whom do we reckon the current era, "This day marks the beginning of Your deeds, a remembrance for the first day"? In accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, who said: The world was created in Tishrei.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב עֵינָא: שָׁוֶה יוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת, וְהָא אִיכָּא ״זֶה הַיּוֹם תְּחִלַּת מַעֲשֶׂיךָ זִכָּרוֹן לְיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן״, דִּבְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אִיתָא, וּבְיוֹבֵל לֵיתָא! כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Eina raised an objection: the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana with regard to the blasts and the blessings But there are This day is the beginning of Your works, a commemoration of the first day, which can be on Rosh HaShana but cannot on the Jubilee Year, When was taught, with regard to the other
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Eina says: The Jubilee is comparable to Rosh Hashanah for blowing the shofar and reciting blessings. But is there not the verse, "This day marks the beginning of Your deeds, a remembrance for the first day" (Tehillim 118:24), which refers to Rosh Hashanah, and not to the Jubilee! The Gemara answers: It is speaking about other matters.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי מַתְנֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: הָא דִּתְנַן שָׁוֶה הַיּוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת, כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר בְּתִשְׁרִי נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, הָא אִיכָּא ״זֶה הַיּוֹם תְּחִלַּת מַעֲשֶׂיךָ זִכָּרוֹן לְיוֹם רִאשׁוֹן״, דִּבְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אִיתָא, וּבַיּוֹבֵל לֵיתָא! כִּי קָתָנֵי אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, taught as follows: Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: That which we learn the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana with regard to the blasts and the blessings in accordance with whom not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as if Rabbi Eliezer, Since he said that the world was created in Tishrei, there are also This day is the beginning of Your works, a commemoration of the first day, which can be on Rosh HaShana, but cannot on the Jubilee Year. When was taught, with regard to the other
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, teaches thus: Rav Shmuel, son of Yitzchak, said: The Mishnah that teaches that the Jubilee is equal to the New Year for blowing the shofar and for blessings, according to whom is it? It is not like Rabbi Eliezer, for if it were according to Rabbi Eliezer, since he said the world was created in Tishrei, there would be "This day marks the beginning of Your works, a remembrance of the first day," which is found in the New Year, but not in the Jubilee! This is as it is taught in the Baraita.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוֹפָר שֶׁנִּסְדַּק וְדִבְּקוֹ — פָּסוּל. דִּיבֵּק שִׁבְרֵי שׁוֹפָרוֹת — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: A shofar that was cracked and glued together, unfit. one glued together broken fragments of shofarot unfit.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A shofar that has split and been glued together - it is invalid. If one glued together broken pieces of shofars - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: נִיקַּב וּסְתָמוֹ, אִם מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַתְּקִיעָה — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר. הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַפִּיטָס, אִם קוֹל שׁוֹפָר שָׁמַע — יָצָא, וְאִם קוֹל הֲבָרָה שָׁמַע — לָא יָצָא.
human_translation: was punctured and was sealed, if it impedes the blowing, unfit, but if not, fit. one sounds into a pit, or into a cistern, or into jug, if he heard the sound of the shofar , he has fulfilled but if he heard the sound of an echo, he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Pierced and sealed, if it delays the blowing — invalid, and if not — valid. One who blows into a pit or into a cistern or into a barrel, if the sound of the shofar is heard — he has fulfilled his obligation, but if the sound of an echo is heard — he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן מִי שֶׁהָיָה עוֹבֵר אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בֵּיתוֹ סָמוּךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְשָׁמַע קוֹל שׁוֹפָר אוֹ קוֹל מְגִילָּה, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁזֶּה שָׁמַע וְזֶה שָׁמַע, זֶה כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ, וְזֶה לֹא כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ.
human_translation: And similarly, one was passing behind a synagogue, or his house was adjacent to the synagogue, and he heard the sound of the shofar or the sound of the Scroll if he focused his heart, he has fulfilled but if not, he has not fulfilled Even though this one heard and the other one heard, this one focused his heart but the other one did not focus his heart,
llm_translation: And so too, one who was passing behind the synagogue, or whose house was adjacent to the synagogue, and heard the sound of the shofar or the sound of the Megillah, if his heart intended - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if not - he has not fulfilled his obligation. Even though this one heard and that one heard, this one intended his heart, and that one did not intend his heart.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָרוֹךְ וְקִצְּרוֹ — כָּשֵׁר. גֵּרְדוֹ וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ עַל גִּלְדּוֹ — כָּשֵׁר. צִיפָּהוּ זָהָב בִּמְקוֹם הַנָּחַת פֶּה — פָּסוּל. שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם הַנָּחַת פֶּה — כָּשֵׁר. צִיפָּהוּ זָהָב מִבִּפְנִים — פָּסוּל. מִבַּחוּץ, אִם נִשְׁתַּנָּה קוֹלוֹ מִכְּמוֹת שֶׁהָיָה — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: The Sages taught long and it was shortened, is fit. was scraped so that its outer layer remains, is fit. was plated with gold at the place where one puts his mouth, unfit; if not at the place where he puts his mouth, fit. was plated with gold on the inside, unfit, on the outside, If its sound changed from what it was unfit, but if not, it is fit.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one lengthened it and shortened it - it is valid. If one twisted it and placed it on its edge - it is valid. If one plated it with gold in the place where the mouth rests - it is invalid. If not in the place where the mouth rests - it is valid. If one plated it with gold from the inside - it is invalid. If from the outside, if its sound changed from what it was - it is invalid, and if not - it is valid.

hebrew_text: נִיקַּב וּסְתָמוֹ, אִם מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַתְּקִיעָה — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר. נָתַן שׁוֹפָר בְּתוֹךְ שׁוֹפָר, אִם קוֹל פְּנִימִי שָׁמַע — יָצָא, וְאִם קוֹל חִיצוֹן שָׁמַע — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: was punctured and sealed, if it impedes the blowing, unfit, but if not, fit. one placed shofar inside shofar if he heard the sound of the inner he has fulfilled but if he heard the sound of the outer he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Pierced and sealed, if it impedes the blast - invalid, and if not - valid. Placed a shofar within a shofar, if the inner sound is heard - fulfilled the obligation, and if the outer sound is heard - did not fulfill the obligation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּרְדוֹ, בֵּין מִבִּפְנִים בֵּין מִבַּחוּץ — כָּשֵׁר. גֵּרְדוֹ וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ עַל גִּלְדּוֹ — כָּשֵׁר. הִנִּיחַ שׁוֹפָר בְּתוֹךְ שׁוֹפָר, אִם קוֹל פְּנִימִי שָׁמַע — יָצָא, וְאִם קוֹל חִיצוֹן שָׁמַע — לֹא יָצָא. הֲפָכוֹ וְתָקַע בּוֹ — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught was scraped whether on the inside or on the outside, fit. was scraped that its outer layer remains, is fit. one placed shofar inside shofar if he heard the sound of the inner he has fulfilled but if he heard the sound of the outer he has not fulfilled he inverted and blew it, he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one covered the shofar, whether from the inside or from the outside - it is valid. If one covered it and placed it on a barrel - it is valid. If one placed a shofar inside another shofar, if one hears the inner sound - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if one hears the outer sound - he has not fulfilled his obligation. If one turned it over and blew into it - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא דְּהַפְכֵיהּ כְּכִתּוּנָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁהִרְחִיב אֶת הַקָּצָר וְקִיצֵּר אֶת הָרָחָב. מַאי טַעְמָא — כִּדְרַב מַתְנָה. דְּאָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ — דֶּרֶךְ הַעֲבָרָתוֹ בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Do not say that he turned it inside out like a tunic. Rather, that he widened the narrow and narrowed wide What is the reason according of Rav Mattana, as Rav Mattana said “You shall proclaim we need the way that it was carried
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Do not say that he reversed it as it is written, but rather that he widened the narrow part and narrowed the wide part. What is the reason? - Like Rav Matna. For Rav Matna said: "And you shall pass" - we require it to be in the way of his passing.

hebrew_text: דִּיבֵּק שִׁבְרֵי שׁוֹפָרוֹת — פָּסוּל. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוֹסִיף עָלָיו כׇּל שֶׁהוּא, בֵּין בְּמִינוֹ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ — פָּסוּל. נִיקַּב וּסְתָמוֹ, בֵּין בְּמִינוֹ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ — פָּסוּל. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בְּמִינוֹ — כָּשֵׁר, שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: one glued together broken fragments of shofarot unfit. The Sages taught anything was added whether the same substance, or of a foreign substance, unfit. was punctured and sealed, whether with the same substance or with a foreign substance, unfit. Rabbi Natan says: with the same substance, fit; with a foreign substance, unfit.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "If the pieces of the shofar are glued together - it is invalid. The Sages taught: If one added anything to it, whether of its kind or not of its kind - it is invalid. If it was perforated and then sealed, whether of its kind or not of its kind - it is invalid. Rabbi Natan says: If it is of its kind - it is valid, if not of its kind - it is invalid."

hebrew_text: בְּמִינוֹ כָּשֵׁר — אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר רוּבּוֹ. מִכְּלָל דְּשֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּיֵּיר רוּבּוֹ — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: with the same substance, fit. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This applies where most of is intact By inference, with a foreign substance, even if most of is intact, unfit.
llm_translation: In its species it is fit — said Rabbi Yochanan: And this is when the majority remains. From the inference that it is not in its species, even though the majority remains — it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינוֹ — פָּסוּל, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּפְחַת רוּבּוֹ. מִכְּלָל דִּבְמִינוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּפְחַת רוּבּוֹ — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Some teach this with regard to the last clause with a foreign substance, unfit. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is where most of was missing, By inference, with the same substance, even if most of was missing, it is fit.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches in the latter part: "Not of its kind - invalid," Rabbi Yochanan said: "And this is when its majority was diminished." From the inference of 'of its kind,' even though its majority was diminished - it is valid.

hebrew_text: צִיפָּהוּ זָהָב, מִבִּפְנִים — פָּסוּל. מִבַּחוּץ, אִם נִשְׁתַּנָּה קוֹלוֹ מִכְּמוֹת שֶׁהָיָה — פָּסוּל, וְאִם לָאו — כָּשֵׁר. נִסְדַּק לְאוֹרְכּוֹ — פָּסוּל. לְרוֹחְבּוֹ, אִם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר בּוֹ שִׁיעוּר תְּקִיעָה — כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: was plated with gold on the inside, unfit. on the outside, if its sound changed from what it was unfit, but if not, fit. was cracked lengthwise, unfit. along its width, If, there remains a measure to a blast, fit, but if not, unfit.
llm_translation: He overlaid it with gold, from the inside - invalid. From the outside, if its sound changed from what it was - invalid, and if not - valid. If it cracked along its length - invalid. In its width, if it retains the measure of a tekiah blast - valid, and if not - invalid.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר תְּקִיעָה? פֵּירֵשׁ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כְּדֵי שֶׁיֹּאחֲזֶנּוּ בְּיָדוֹ וְיֵרָאֶה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן. הָיָה קוֹלוֹ דַּק אוֹ עָבֶה אוֹ צָרוּר — כָּשֵׁר, שֶׁכׇּל הַקּוֹלוֹת כְּשֵׁירִין [בְּשׁוֹפָר].
human_translation: And how much is a measure to a blast? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel explained: Enough that when he holds it in his hand, it can be seen on one side and on the other side. sound is high or deep or dry, fit as all sounds from a shofar are fit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the measure of the Tekiah blast? Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel explained: Enough that he should hold it in his hand and it should be visible here and there. Whether his voice is thin, thick, or hoarse — it is valid, for all voices are valid for the Shofar."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: קְדָחוֹ וְתָקַע בּוֹ — יָצָא. פְּשִׁיטָא, כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי מִיקְדָּח קָדְחוּ לְהוּ?
human_translation: was sent to Shmuel’s father: one drilled and blew it, he has fulfilled obvious, for all are drilled,
llm_translation: Send it to his father Samuel: pierce it and blow in it - it will come out. Obviously, did they all pierce it to blow in it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁקְּדָחוֹ בְּזַכְרוּתוֹ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִין בְּמִינוֹ — חוֹצֵץ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where he drilled the bone Lest you say of the same substance interposes, teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "He kindled it in his memory." What might you say? If it is of its kind - it is a barrier, as it is inferred for us.

hebrew_text: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְאוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִים עַל שְׂפַת הַבּוֹר, אֲבָל אוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִין בַּבּוֹר — יָצְאוּ.
human_translation: one sounds into a pit or into a cistern, Rav Huna said: They taught only with respect to those standing at the edge of the pit, But those standing in the pit have fulfilled their obligation,
llm_translation: The one who strikes into the pit or into the vat, etc. Rav Huna said: They only taught this regarding those standing on the edge of the pit, but those standing inside the pit - they have fulfilled their obligation.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת — יָצָא. וְהָתְנַן: לֹא יָצָא! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּדְרַב הוּנָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught one sounds into a pit or into a cistern, he has fulfilled But didn’t we learn he has not fulfilled Rather, isn’t it conclude from here in accordance with Rav Huna? learn from here
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one strikes into the pit or into the vat - he has fulfilled his obligation. But we learned in the Mishnah: He has not fulfilled his obligation! Rather, it is not so. Learn from it as Rav Huna said, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּרָמֵי לְהוּ מִירְמֵא. תְּנַן: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת — לֹא יָצָא. וְהָתַנְיָא: יָצָא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן — לְאוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִין עַל שְׂפַת הַבּוֹר, כָּאן — לְאוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִין בַּבּוֹר.
human_translation: There are who raise the as a contradiction: We learned one sounds into a pit or into a cistern, he has not fulfilled But isn’t it taught he has fulfilled Rav Huna said: This not difficult; here, with those standing at the edge of the pit, there, with those standing in the pit.
llm_translation: There is one who says to them from a distance. We learned in a Mishnah: One who strikes into the pit or into the vat - he has not fulfilled his obligation. And it was taught in a Braita: He has fulfilled his obligation! Rav Huna said: It is not difficult - here, it refers to those standing on the edge of the pit, here, it refers to those standing inside the pit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה:
human_translation: Rabba said:
llm_translation: Rabba said:

hebrew_text: שָׁמַע מִקְצָת תְּקִיעָה בַּבּוֹר וּמִקְצָת תְּקִיעָה עַל שְׂפַת הַבּוֹר — יָצָא. מִקְצָת תְּקִיעָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר וּמִקְצָת תְּקִיעָה לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: one heard part of the blast in the pit and part of the blast at the edge of the pit, he has fulfilled part of the blast before dawn, and part of the blast after dawn, he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Heard some of the blowing into the pit and some of the blowing on the edge of the pit - he has fulfilled his obligation. Some of the blowing before the dawn column rises and some of the blowing after the dawn column rises - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם — דְּבָעֵינָא כּוּלַּהּ תְּקִיעָה בְּחִיּוּבָא, וְלֵיכָּא. הָכָא נָמֵי — בָּעֵינָא כּוּלַּהּ תְּקִיעָה בְּחִיּוּבָא, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: What is different there, the entire blast needs to be in obligation, and it is not here too, the entire blast needs to be in obligation, and it is not
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: What is the difference there? — That I require a complete blowing with obligation, and it is not there. Here too — I require a complete blowing with obligation, and it is not there!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם — לַיְלָה לָאו זְמַן חִיּוּבָא הוּא כְּלָל, הָכָא — בּוֹר מְקוֹם חִיּוּבָא הוּא לְאוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִין בַּבּוֹר.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, night is not a time of obligation at all, but here, a pit is a place of obligation for those standing in the pit.
llm_translation: So now?! There — night not time obligation is general, here — pit place obligation is for those standing in the pit.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַבָּה: שָׁמַע סוֹף תְּקִיעָה בְּלֹא תְּחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה — יָצָא, וּמִמֵּילָא: תְּחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה בְּלֹא סוֹף תְּקִיעָה — יָצָא.
human_translation: Is this to say that Rabba maintains one heard the end of a blast without the beginning of the blast, he has fulfilled And it follows the beginning of a blast without the end of the blast, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: In the matter of the opinion of Rabba: "Hear the end of the blowing without the beginning of the blowing" - he has fulfilled his obligation. And from the beginning: "The beginning of the blowing without the end of the blowing" - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: תָּקַע בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וּמָשַׁךְ בַּשְּׁנִיָּה כִּשְׁתַּיִם — אֵין בְּיָדוֹ אֶלָּא אַחַת. וְאַמַּאי? תִּסְלַק לֵהּ בְּתַרְתֵּי! פַּסּוֹקֵי תְּקִיעָתָא מֵהֲדָדֵי לָא פָּסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Come hear one blew the initial and drew out the second two it counts as only one But why let it count as two we do not divide into two.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one blows the shofar in the first blast and prolongs in the second blast like two - he has only fulfilled the obligation with one. And why? Let him remove it in two! The verses of the blowing of the shofar we do not interrupt.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לְתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַדּוּת אוֹ לְתוֹךְ הַפִּיטָס, אִם קוֹל שׁוֹפָר שָׁמַע — יָצָא, וְאִם קוֹל הֲבָרָה שָׁמַע — לֹא יָצָא. וְאַמַּאי? לִיפּוֹק בִּתְחִילַּת תְּקִיעָה מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִיעַרְבַּב קָלָא!
human_translation: Come hear one sounds into a pit, or into a cistern, or into a jug, if he heard the sound of the shofar , he has fulfilled but if he heard the sound of an echo, he has not fulfilled But why let him fulfill with the beginning of the blast, before the sound is confused
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who blows into a pit or into a cistern or into a pipe, if he hears the sound of a shofar - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if he hears the sound of an echo - he has not fulfilled his obligation. And why? To establish the beginning of the blowing before a faint sound is mixed in!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבָּה — בְּתוֹקֵעַ וְעוֹלֶה לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: When Rabba spoke, about sounding for himself and emerged
llm_translation: When Rabba said: "With one who blows and ascends for his own soul."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: זִמְנִין דְּמַפֵּיק רֵישֵׁיהּ וְאַכַּתִּי שׁוֹפָר בְּבוֹר, וְקָא מִיעַרְבַּב קָלָא — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, what statement? Lest you say that his head might sometimes emerge while the shofar is still in the pit, and the sound may become confused teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say? What might you say? Perhaps: at times when one sticks out his head and a ram blows in a pit, and a voice is mixed in — it is heard by us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל עוֹלָה — לֹא יִתְקַע, וְאִם תָּקַע — יָצָא. בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל שְׁלָמִים — לֹא יִתְקַע, וְאִם תָּקַע — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: One should not blow with the shofar of a burnt-offering, but if he blew, he has fulfilled One should not blow with the shofar of a peace-offering, and if he blew, he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: With the shofar of an olah offering - one should not blow, and if one did blow - he has fulfilled his obligation. With the shofar of a shelamim offering - one should not blow, and if one did blow - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? עוֹלָה בַּת מְעִילָה הִיא, כֵּיוָן דְּמָעַל בַּהּ — נָפְקָא לַהּ לְחוּלִּין. שְׁלָמִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי מְעִילָה נִינְהוּ — אִיסּוּרָא הוּא דְּרָכֵיב בְּהוּ, וְלָא נָפְקִי לְחוּלִּין.
human_translation: What is the reason A burnt-offering is subject to misuse once one misuses it it becomes non-sacred, peace-offerings are not subject to misuse the prohibition remains intact and they do not become non-sacred.
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is a burnt offering of a consecrated animal, since when one ascends upon it, it becomes permissible for secular use. Peace offerings that are not sons of a consecrated animal, they are forbidden because one rode upon them, and they did not become permissible for secular use.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אֵימַת מָעַל — לְבָתַר דְּתָקַע, כִּי קָא תָּקַע — בְּאִיסּוּרָא תָּקַע.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this When does he commit misuse? After he has sounded when he sounds he is sounding with something that is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rava objects to it: When does one transgress? - After he has completed the act, for when he completes the act, he transgresses in a forbidden manner.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — לֹא יָצָא. הֲדַר אָמַר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — יָצָא. מִצְוֹת לָאו לֵיהָנוֹת נִיתְּנוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Both this one, and the other one, he has not fulfilled Later, then said Both this one, and the other one, he has fulfilled mitzvot were not given for benefit.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: One this and one this - he has not fulfilled the obligation. He later said: One this and one this - he has fulfilled the obligation. The commandments were not given for enjoyment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — לֹא יִתְקַע, וְאִם תָּקַע — יָצָא. בְּשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת — לֹא יִתְקַע, וְאִם תָּקַע — לֹא יָצָא. מַאי טַעְמָא: עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת כַּתּוֹתֵי מְיכַתַּת שִׁיעוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said One should not sound a shofar idol worship, but if he sounded it, he has fulfilled One should not sound a shofar from a city incited but if he sounded it, he has not fulfilled What is the reason a city incited its size is seen as crushed
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: With the shofar of foreign worship, one should not blow, and if one did blow, he has fulfilled his obligation. With the shofar of a city of idolatry, one should not blow, and if one did blow, he has not fulfilled his obligation. What is the reason? A city of idolatry is like the outskirts of its measurement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — מוּתָּר לִתְקוֹעַ לוֹ תְּקִיעָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה. הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִשּׁוֹפָר — מוּתָּר לִתְקוֹעַ בּוֹ תְּקִיעָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rava said: one is prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from another, is permitted to sound a blast for him mitzva, one is prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from a shofar , he is permitted to sound a blast with it mitzva.
llm_translation: Rava said: One who is pledged to benefit from his fellow - it is permitted to blow for him a blast of the mitzvah. One who is pledged to benefit from a shofar - it is permitted to blow for him a blast of the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — מַזֶּה עָלָיו מֵי חַטָּאת בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, אֲבָל לֹא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה. הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מִמַּעְיָן — טוֹבֵל בּוֹ טְבִילָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, אֲבָל לֹא בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: And Rava said one is prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from another, may sprinkle the waters of purification on him, in the rainy season, But not in the summer season, one is prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from spring, he may immerse in it immersion a mitzva in the rainy season, but not in the summer season,
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who takes a vow to abstain from deriving benefit from his fellow — he must bring a sin offering during the rainy season, but not during the sunny season. One who takes a vow to abstain from deriving benefit from a spring — he may immerse in it for the sake of a mitzvah during the rainy season, but not during the sunny season.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: כְּפָאוֹ וְאָכַל מַצָּה — יָצָא. כְּפָאוֹ מַאן? אִילֵימָא כְּפָאוֹ שֵׁד, וְהָתַנְיָא: עִתִּים חָלִים עִתִּים שׁוֹטֶה, כְּשֶׁהוּא חָלִים — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּפִקֵּחַ לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו, כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹטֶה — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּשׁוֹטֶה לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו!
human_translation: was sent to Shmuel’s father: was compelled to eat matza he has fulfilled Who compelled him If we say a demon forced him, Isn’t it taught someone is at times sane at times insane, at the times when he is sane, he is considered competent for all purposes when he is insane, he is considered insane for all purposes,
llm_translation: Send him to the father of Shmuel: If he covers and eats matzah - he fulfilled his obligation. Who is "covers"? If you say "covers" is a demon, but it was taught: Sometimes he is wise, sometimes he is foolish. When he is wise - he is like an expert in all his matters, when he is foolish - he is like a fool in all his matters!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁכְּפָאוּהוּ פָּרְסִיִּים. אָמַר רָבָא, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לָשִׁיר — יָצָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: where the Persians compelled him Rava said: That is to say one who sounds for the music, fulfills
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: "The Persians have compelled him." Rava said, "This is what it means: 'He who strikes up a song - he has fulfilled his obligation.'"

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הַיְינוּ הָךְ! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם, אֱכוֹל מַצָּה אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — וְהָא אֲכַל,
human_translation: obvious that this is that Lest you say there, the Merciful One says: Eat matza , and he indeed ate
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion is as follows: What might you say? There, the Merciful One said to eat matzah - and here, he ate.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, ״זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״ כְּתִיב, וְהַאי מִתְעַסֵּק בְּעָלְמָא הוּא — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רָבָא: מִצְוֹת אֵין צְרִיכוֹת כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: But here, it is written: “A memorial of blasts” and this one was merely acting unawares, teaches us Apparently, Rava maintains mitzvot does not require intent.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "But here, 'a remembrance of blowing' is written, and this one who is engaged in worldly matters — he informs us. This implies that Rava holds: commandments do not require intent."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הָיָה קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה וְהִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַמִּקְרָא, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא. מַאי לָאו, כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ: לָצֵאת!
human_translation: raised an objection to one was reading in the Torah, and the time of reciting arrived, if he focused his heart, he has fulfilled but if not, he has not fulfilled What, is it not that he focused his heart to fulfill
llm_translation: He raised an objection against it: If one was reading in the Torah and the time for the public reading arrived, if his intention was for it - he fulfilled his obligation, and if not - he did not fulfill his obligation. What is meant by "if not, his intention was for it"? To go out!

hebrew_text: לֹא: לִקְרוֹת. לִקְרוֹת?! הָא קָא קָרֵי! בְּקוֹרֵא לְהַגִּיהַּ.
human_translation: No, to read To read? But he is reading one who was reading to correct
llm_translation: Not: to read. To read?! But he is reading! When he reads, he should read it out loud.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה עוֹבֵר אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בֵּיתוֹ סָמוּךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְשָׁמַע קוֹל שׁוֹפָר אוֹ קוֹל מְגִילָּה, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא. מַאי לָאו, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ לָצֵאת?
human_translation: Come hear one was passing behind a synagogue, or his house was adjacent to the synagogue, and he heard the sound of shofar or the sound of the Scroll if he focused his heart, he has fulfilled but if not, he has not fulfilled What, is it not he focused his heart to fulfill
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one was passing behind the synagogue, or if his house was adjacent to the synagogue, and he heard the sound of the shofar or the sound of the scroll of Esther, if his heart intended - he fulfilled his obligation, but if not - he did not fulfill his obligation. What is meant by "if his heart intended to fulfill his obligation"?

hebrew_text: לֹא — לִשְׁמוֹעַ. לִשְׁמוֹעַ?! וְהָא שָׁמַע! סְבוּר, חֲמוֹר בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: No, to hear To hear? But he hears who thinks it is merely a donkey
llm_translation: Not — to hear. To hear?! But he heard! One might think, it is just an ordinary donkey.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון מַשְׁמִיעַ, מַשְׁמִיעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ — לֹא יָצָא, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ וּמַשְׁמִיעַ. בִּשְׁלָמָא נִתְכַּוֵּון מַשְׁמִיעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ — כְּסָבוּר חֲמוֹר בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, אֶלָּא נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון מַשְׁמִיעַ — הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? לָאו בְּתוֹקֵעַ לָשִׁיר!
human_translation: raised an objection to the hearer had intent, but the sounder did not have intent, the sounder but the hearer did not have he has not fulfilled until the hearer and the sounder have intent. Granted, the sounder had intent, but the hearer did not have intent, thinks it is merely a donkey But the hearer had intent, but the sounder did not have intent, what circumstances be found? Is it not he sounds for music
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: If one intended to hear but did not intend to make others hear, or intended to make others hear but did not intend to hear himself - he has not fulfilled his obligation until he intended both to hear and to make others hear. If, for example, he intended to make others hear but did not intend to hear himself - is it not the case that he is like a donkey, merely a vessel? Rather, if he intended to hear but did not intend to make others hear - how can he fulfill his obligation? Is it not by blowing for a song!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא דְּקָא מְנַבַּח נַבּוֹחֵי.
human_translation: Perhaps where he sounded bark-like blasts
llm_translation: Perhaps he is offering sacrifices of the prophets.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הַיָּשֵׁן בַּשְּׁמִינִי בַּסּוּכָּה — יִלְקֶה!
human_translation: Abaye said to However, if so, one who sleeps in a sukka on the Eighth Day of Assembly should receive lashes
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather from now, one who sleeps in the eighth in the sukkah - shall be lashed!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוֹת אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּן.
human_translation: said to him: because I say mitzvot can be transgressed only in their times.
llm_translation: He said to him, "I say: One only transgresses commandments in their proper time."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא: מִנַּיִן לְכֹהֵן שֶׁעוֹלֶה לַדּוּכָן, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: הוֹאִיל וְנָתְנָה לִי תּוֹרָה רְשׁוּת לְבָרֵךְ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹסִיף בְּרָכָה אַחַת מִשֶּׁלִּי, כְּגוֹן: ״ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתֵיכֶם יוֹסֵף עֲלֵיכֶם״ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוֹסִיפוּ עַל הַדָּבָר״. וְהָא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּבָרֵיךְ לֵיהּ — עָבְרָה לֵיהּ זִמְנֵיהּ, וְקָתָנֵי דְּעָבַר!
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba raised an objection From where that a priest who went up to the platform should not say: Since the Torah granted me permission to bless the Jewish people, I will add a blessing of my own, for example: the Lord God of your fathers make you as many as you are” the verse states: “You shall not add to the word But here, since recited Blessing, the time has passed, it teaches that he has transgressed.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Shemen bar Abba asks: From where do we derive that a priest who ascends to the platform should not say, "Since the Torah has been given to me as permission, I will add one blessing for the Israelites from my own"? For example, "May the Lord, the God of your fathers, increase you a thousandfold" (Deuteronomy 1:11) — the Torah states: "You shall not add to the word." And here, since your words reached him — his time has passed, and the verse states that it has passed!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּדְלָא סַיֵּים.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? With where he did not complete
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With something that has not been concluded.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא סִיֵּים! סִיֵּים בְּרָכָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught he completed he completed one blessing,
llm_translation: "And it was taught: He concluded! He concluded with one blessing."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: סִיֵּים כׇּל בִּרְכוֹתָיו! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִלּוּ מִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ צִבּוּרָא אַחֲרִינָא, הָדַר מְבָרֵךְ — כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא זִמְנֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught he completed all of his blessings. Here, it is different, since if he encounters another congregation, he may recite the blessings again, the entire day is the time
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: He completed all his blessings! This is different here, since if another congregation comes and joins him, he repeats the blessing - the entire day is its proper time.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא — דִּתְנַן: הַנִּיתָּנִין בְּמַתָּנָה אַחַת, שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ בַּנִּיתָּנִין מַתָּנָה אַחַת — יִנָּתְנוּ מַתָּנָה אַחַת. מַתַּן אַרְבַּע בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע — יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: And from where do you say As we learned that require one sprinkling, became mingled with require one sprinkling, is sprinkled once. four sprinklings, with four sprinklings, is sprinkled four times.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Umana Temra — ditnan: hanitanein bematanah achad, shenit'arvu banitanein matanah achad — yinatnu matanah achad. Matan arba bematan arba — yinatnu bematan arba."

hebrew_text: מַתַּן אַרְבַּע בְּמַתַּן אַחַת, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתַּן אַרְבַּע, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: יִנָּתְנוּ בְּמַתַּן אַחַת.
human_translation: four sprinklings with one sprinkling, Rabbi Eliezer says: is sprinkled four times. Rabbi Yehoshua says: It is sprinkled once.
llm_translation: Gift of four in one gift, Rabbi Eliezer says: should be given in gift of four, Rabbi Yehoshua says: should be given in one gift.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר עַל ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״! אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹבֵר עַל ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to he transgresses Do not diminish, Rabbi Yehoshua said to he transgresses Do not add,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: Behold he transgresses "do not diminish"! He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Behold he transgresses "do not add"!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״ אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁהוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said Do not add, is stated only where by itself, Rabbi Yehoshua said Do not diminish, is stated only where by itself.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: Not said "do not add" except when it itself. He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: Not said "do not subtract" except when it itself.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּשֶׁלֹּא נָתַתָּ — עָבַרְתָּ עַל ״בַּל תִּגְרַע״ וְלֹא עָשִׂיתָ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדֶךָ, כְּשֶׁנָּתַתָּ — עָבַרְתָּ עַל ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״ וְעָשִׂיתָ מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדֶךָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said further, When you do not sprinkle you transgress Do not diminish, you do not perform the act with your hand, when you sprinkle you transgress Do not add, and you perform the act with your hand,
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehoshua: when you did not give - you transgressed "do not diminish" and did not perform an action with your hand, when you did give - you transgressed "do not add" and performed an action with your hand.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ מַתָּנָה מִבְּכוֹר — עָבְרָה לֵיהּ לְזִמְנֵיהּ, וְקָתָנֵי דְּעָבַר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תּוֹסִיף״. לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ בּוּכְרָא אַחֲרִינָא — הָדַר מַזֶּה מִינֵּיהּ, כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא זִמְנֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And here, once he has already offered sprinkling of the firstborn its time has passed, it teaches he transgresses Do not add. Is it not because we say Since if he encounters another firstborn he would sprinkle again? the entire day is time
llm_translation: And here, since he gave him a gift from the firstborn — it has passed to him for his time, and it is taught that it has passed because of "do not add." Not because we say: since if he would have redeemed it with another firstborn — he would return it to its kind, all of his time, his time?!

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִצְוֹת עוֹבֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּן.
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Yehoshua maintains mitzvot can be transgressed even outside their times.
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps Rabbi Yehoshua holds that one transgresses commandments even if not in their proper time.

hebrew_text: אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא מַאי טַעְמָא שָׁבֵיק מַתְנִיתִין וּמוֹתֵיב מִבָּרַיְיתָא, לוֹתֵיב מִמַּתְנִיתִין! מַתְנִיתִין מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מוֹתֵיב? כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ בּוּכְרָא אַחֲרִינָא בָּעֵי מַזֶּה מִינֵּיהּ — כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא זִמְנֵיהּ הוּא, בָּרַיְיתָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִי מִתְרְמֵי צִבּוּרָא אַחֲרִינָא הָדַר מְבָרֵךְ — כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא זִמְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: This is we saying What is the reason that Rav Shemen bar Abba set aside the mishna, and raised an objection from a baraita ? He should have raised an objection from the mishna, What is the reason that he does not raise an objection the mishna? Since Because if he encounters another firstborn he will be required to sprinkle the entire day is the time the baraita as well, because if he encounters another congregation, he may recite Blessing again, the whole day is its time.
llm_translation: We thus say: Rav Shemen bar Abba, what is the reason that he leaves the Mishnah and cites a Baraita, let him cite from the Mishnah! What is the reason that he does not cite from the Mishnah? Since if he would leave it for another firstborn to offer it, he would need to disgrace it from its kind — it is all its time, the Baraita also, since if he would leave it for the community to offer it, he would then bless again — it is all its time.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא? הָתָם, לָא סַגִּי דְּלָא יָהֵיב. הָכָא, אִי בָּעֵי — מְבָרֵךְ, אִי בָּעֵי — לָא מְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: And Rav Shemen bar Abba, There, it is not possible to refrain sprinkling here, if he wishes, he may bless if he wishes, he may refrain from blessing
llm_translation: And Rav Shemen bar Abba? There, it is not enough that he did not give. Here, if he wants - he blesses, if he does not want - he does not bless.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, לָצֵאת — לָא בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה, לַעֲבוֹר — בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: Rava said: the fulfillment does not require intent, the transgression requires intent.
llm_translation: Rava said, "For exiting - does not require intention, for passing through - requires intention."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַתַּן דָּמִים לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּלַעֲבוֹר וְלָא בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לָצֵאת — לָא בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה. לַעֲבוֹר, בִּזְמַנּוֹ — לָא בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ — בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה.
