human_translation: But the sprinkling of blood, according to Rabbi Yehoshua, the transgression does not require intent, Rather, Rava said: The fulfillment does not require intent, the transgression during the time does not require intent, not in its time, requires intent
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the giving of blood to Rabbi Yehoshua, for passing over and not requiring intent! Rather, Rava said: For eating — does not require intent. For passing over, in its time — does not require intent, out of its time — requires intent."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to his servant:
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira to hear him:

hebrew_text: אִיכַּוַּון וּתְקַע לִי. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: מַשְׁמִיעַ בָּעֵי כַּוָּונָה.
human_translation: Have intent and sound for me. Apparently, maintains he who sounds is required to have intent
llm_translation: He said to him: "Prepare and blow for me." This implies that he holds: One must hear the sound with intention.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיָה עוֹבֵר אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בֵּיתוֹ סָמוּךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְשָׁמַע קוֹל שׁוֹפָר אוֹ קוֹל מְגִילָּה, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא. וְכִי כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ מַאי הָוֵי? הֵיאַךְ לָא קָא מִיכַּוֵּין אַדַּעְתָּא דִּידֵיהּ!
human_translation: raises an objection one was passing behind a synagogue, or his house was adjacent to the synagogue, and he heard the sound of shofar or the sound of Scroll if he focused his heart he has fulfilled but if not, he has not fulfilled And, if focused his heart, what of it? The other one, did not focus his intent with him in mind?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was asked: If one was passing behind the synagogue, or if his house was adjacent to the synagogue, and he heard the sound of the shofar or the sound of the megillah, if his heart intended – he fulfilled his obligation, and if not – he did not fulfill his obligation. And when his heart intended, what is the case? How could his own mind not be intent!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בִּשְׁלִיחַ צִיבּוּר עָסְקִינַן, דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ אַכּוּלֵּיהּ עָלְמָא.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with the representative of the community, who has everyone in mind.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with the concept of "Shaliach Tzibbur," for his knowledge is upon the entire world.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון מַשְׁמִיעַ, נִתְכַּוֵּון מַשְׁמִיעַ וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ — לֹא יָצָא, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּון שׁוֹמֵעַ וּמַשְׁמִיעַ. קָתָנֵי מַשְׁמִיעַ דּומְיָא דְשׁוֹמֵעַ. מָה שׁוֹמֵעַ — שׁוֹמֵעַ לְעַצְמוֹ, אַף מַשְׁמִיעַ — מַשְׁמִיעַ לְעַצְמוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: Come hear the hearer had intent, but the sounder did not have intent, the sounder had intent, but the hearer did not have intent, he has not fulfilled until the hearer and the sounder have intent. teaches the sounder in similar fashion to the hearer. just as the hearer hears for himself, so too, the sounder sounds for himself, And teaches has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: If one intends to hear but does not intend to make others hear, or intends to make others hear but does not intend to hear himself - he has not fulfilled his obligation until he intends both to hear and to make others hear. The Mishna teaches that making others hear is similar to hearing. Just as one hears for himself, so too, one must make others hear for himself. And the Mishna teaches that he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹמֵעַ — שׁוֹמֵעַ לְעַצְמוֹ, וּמַשְׁמִיעַ — מַשְׁמִיעַ לְפִי דַּרְכּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּשְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר, אֲבָל בְּיָחִיד — לָא יָצָא, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּין שׁוֹמֵעַ וּמַשְׁמִיעַ.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , as it is taught The hearer hears for himself, and the sounder sounds in his way, Rabbi Yosei said: In what is this statement said? representative of the community. But an individual, does not fulfill until the hearer and the sounder have intent
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: "One who hears - he hears for himself, and one who causes to hear - he causes to hear according to his way." Rabbi Yosei said: In what case are these words said? In the context of a messenger of the congregation, but in the case of an individual, he has not fulfilled his obligation until he intends to both hear and cause to hear.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״וְהָיָה כַּאֲשֶׁר יָרִים מֹשֶׁה יָדוֹ וְגָבַר יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״, וְכִי יָדָיו שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה עוֹשׂוֹת מִלְחָמָה אוֹ שׁוֹבְרוֹת מִלְחָמָה? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל מִסְתַּכְּלִין כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה וּמְשַׁעְבְּדִין אֶת לִבָּם לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם — הָיוּ מִתְגַּבְּרִים, וְאִם לָאו — הָיוּ נוֹפְלִים.
human_translation: “And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; Did the hands of Moses make war or break war Rather, to tell you as long as the Jewish people turned their eyes upward and subjected their hearts to their Father in Heaven, they prevailed, but if not, they fell.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed." (Exodus 17:11) Are the hands of Moses engaged in battle or breaking battle? Rather, to tell you: as long as Israel looked upwards and subjugated their hearts to their Father in heaven, they prevailed; but if not, they fell.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״עֲשֵׂה לְךָ שָׂרָף וְשִׂים אוֹתוֹ עַל נֵס וְהָיָה כׇּל הַנָּשׁוּךְ וְרָאָה אוֹתוֹ וָחָי״, וְכִי נָחָשׁ מֵמִית, אוֹ נָחָשׁ מְחַיֶּה? אֶלָּא: בִּזְמַן שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל מִסְתַּכְּלִין כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה וּמְשַׁעְבְּדִין אֶת לִבָּם לַאֲבִיהֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם — הָיוּ מִתְרַפְּאִין, וְאִם לָאו הָיוּ נִימּוֹקִים.
human_translation: Similarly, you can say: “Make for yourself a fiery serpent, and set it upon a pole; and it shall come to pass, that everyone that is bitten, when he sees it, he shall live” Did the serpent kill, or did the serpent preserve life? Rather, when the Jewish people turned their eyes upward and subjected their hearts to their Father in Heaven, they were healed, but if not, they rotted
llm_translation: As an example in the matter, you say: "Make for yourself a fiery serpent and place it on a pole, and it shall be that everyone who is bitten and looks at it shall live." Is a snake one that kills, or is a snake one that gives life? Rather, when the Israelites would look upward and subjugate their hearts to their Father in heaven, they would be healed; but if not, they would deteriorate.

hebrew_text: חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אֶת הָרַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְחוּיָּיב בַּדָּבָר — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן.
human_translation: A deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor cannot discharge the obligation on behalf of the community. This is the principle Whoever is not obligated to a matter cannot discharge the obligation on behalf of the community.
llm_translation: Deaf, imbecile, and minor do not exempt the public from their obligations. This is the principle: anyone who is not obligated in a matter does not exempt the public from their obligations.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר. כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים. גֵּרִים וַעֲבָדִים מְשׁוּחְרָרִים. וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught All are obligated to sound the shofar : Priests, Levites, and Israelites; converts; freed slaves; a tumtum , a hermaphrodite [ androginos ], half-slave, half-freeman.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Everyone is obligated in the blowing of the shofar. Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim. Converts and freed slaves. And those of ambiguous gender. One whose half is a slave and half is a free person.

hebrew_text: טוּמְטוּם — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לֹא אֶת מִינוֹ, וְלֹא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ. אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — מוֹצִיא אֶת מִינוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ. מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לֹא אֶת מִינוֹ, וְלֹא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ.
human_translation: A tumtum cannot discharge one of his kind, nor of one who is not of his kind, A hermaphrodite can discharge one of his kind, but cannot one who is not of his kind. One who is half-slave and half-freeman cannot discharge one of his kind, and cannot one who is not of his kind,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tumtum - does not produce neither its kind, nor what is not its kind. Androgynos - produces its kind, but not what is not its kind. One whose half is a slave and half is free - does not produce neither its kind, nor what is not its kind.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר, כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים. פְּשִׁיטָא! אִי הָנֵי לָא מִיחַיְּיבִי — מַאן מִיחַיְּיבִי?!
human_translation: The Master said All are obligated to sound the shofar : Priests, Levites, and Israelites. obvious? If these are not obligated who is obligated
llm_translation: Master said: Everyone is obligated in the blowing of the shofar, Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim. It is obvious! If these are not obligated - who is obligated?!

hebrew_text: כֹּהֲנִים אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״, מַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ אֶלָּא בִּתְקִיעָה דְּחַד יוֹמָא — הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב, וְהָנֵי כֹּהֲנִים, הוֹאִיל וְאִיתַנְהוּ בִּתְקִיעוֹת דְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם בַּחֲצוֹצְרוֹת עַל עוֹלוֹתֵיכֶם״, אֵימָא לָא לִיחַיְּיבוּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary priests it may enter your mind to say Since it is written: “It is a day of sounding to you” one who to sound only one day, he is obligated But these priests, since they are obligated to sound all year as it is written: “And you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt-offerings, say they are not obligated to teach us
llm_translation: The priests require it, as I would say: Since it is written, "A day of blowing shall be for you," one who does not have except for the blowing of one day - he is obligated. And these priests, since they are included in the blowings throughout the year, as it is written: "And you shall blow with the trumpets over your burnt offerings," say they are not obligated - this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם חֲצוֹצְרוֹת וְהָכָא שׁוֹפָר! אֶלָּא אִצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וּתְנַן: שָׁוֶה הַיּוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת, מַאן דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּמִצְוַת הַיּוֹבֵל — אִיתֵיהּ בְּמִצְוָה דְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְהָנֵי כֹּהֲנִים, הוֹאִיל וְלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּמִצְוָה דְּיוֹבֵל, דִּתְנַן: כֹּהֲנִים וּלְוִיִּם מוֹכְרִין לְעוֹלָם וְגוֹאֲלִין לְעוֹלָם, אֵימָא: בְּמִצְוָה דְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לֹא לִיחַיְּיבוּ — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Are these comparable? There, trumpets, and here, shofar . Rather, it was necessary it may enter your mind to say Since we learned the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana, with regard to the blasts and the blessings One who is in the mitzva of the Jubilee is in the mitzva of Rosh HaShana. But these priests, since they are not in the mitzva of the Jubilee, as we learned Priests and Levites may sell forever and they may redeem forever, say they should not be obligated to fulfill the mitzva of Rosh HaShana. to teach us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is similar? There, trumpets, and here, a shofar! Rather, it is necessary: Your mind should ascend, I would say, since we learned: The Jubilee horn is equal to the New Year for blowing and for blessings. Whoever is obligated in the mitzvah of the Jubilee is obligated in the mitzvah of the New Year. And these priests, since they are not included in the mitzvah of the Jubilee, as we learned: Priests and Levites sell forever and redeem forever, say: If they are not obligated in the mitzvah of the New Year, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לֹא אֶת מִינוֹ וְלֹא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וּלְעַצְמוֹ מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: A half-slave, half-freeman cannot discharge the obligation one of his kind, and cannot on behalf of one who is not of his kind. Rav Huna said: he can discharge the obligation himself.
llm_translation: One whose half is a slave and half is a free man - he does not exempt either his own kind or what is not his kind. Rav Huna said: But he does exempt himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב הוּנָא: מַאי שְׁנָא לַאֲחֵרִים דְּלָא — דְּלָא אָתֵי צַד עַבְדוּת וּמַפֵּיק צַד חֵירוּת, לְעַצְמוֹ נָמֵי — לָא אָתֵי צַד עַבְדוּת דִּידֵיהּ וּמַפֵּיק צַד חֵירוּת דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Rav Huna: What is the difference not on behalf of others? slave component cannot come and discharge the obligation the free component with regard to himself as well, his slave component should not be able to come and discharge the obligation of his free component.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Huna: What is different for others that it does not come - does not come a side of servitude and brings out a side of freedom, for himself also - it does not come a side of servitude of his own and brings out a side of freedom of his own.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף לְעַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין — אַף לְעַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said: Even on behalf of himself he cannot discharge the obligation. This is also taught A half-slave, half-freeman cannot discharge the obligation even for himself.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman: Even for himself he does not exempt. It was taught in a baraita similarly: One whose half is a slave and half is free — even for himself he does not exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי אַהֲבָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הַבְּרָכוֹת כּוּלָּן, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיָּצָא — מוֹצִיא. חוּץ מִבִּרְכַּת הַלֶּחֶם וּבִרְכַּת הַיַּיִן, שֶׁאִם לֹא יָצָא — מוֹצִיא, וְאִם יָצָא — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: Ahava, son of Rabbi Zeira, taught all the blessings, even if one fulfilled he can discharge except for the blessing over bread and the blessing over wine, if he has not fulfilled he can discharge but if he fulfilled he cannot discharge
llm_translation: It was taught in the academy of Rabbi Zeira: All blessings, even if one has finished - he recites. Except for the blessing over bread and the blessing over wine, for if one has not finished - he recites, and if he has finished - he does not recite.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma:
llm_translation: Request of Rava:

hebrew_text: בִּרְכַּת הַלֶּחֶם שֶׁל מַצָּה, וּבִרְכַּת הַיַּיִן שֶׁל קִידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּחוֹבָה הוּא — מַפֵּיק, אוֹ דִלְמָא: בְּרָכָה לָאו חוֹבָה הִיא.
human_translation: the blessing over bread matza and the blessing over wine of the sanctification of the day what is since there is an obligation one can discharge Or perhaps the blessing is not an obligation,
llm_translation: Blessing of the bread of matzah, and blessing of the wine of the sanctification of the day, what is it? Since it is obligatory - one recites, or perhaps: a blessing is not obligatory.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי הֲוֵינַן בֵּי רַב פַּפֵּי, הֲוָה מְקַדֵּשׁ לַן. וְכִי הֲוָה אָתֵי אֲרִיסֵיהּ מִדַּבְרָא, הֲוָה מְקַדֵּשׁ לְהוּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rav Ashi said: When we were in the school of Rav Pappi, he would recite kiddush for us, and when his tenants would arrive from the field he would recite kiddush on their behalf.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Ashe said: When we were in the house of Rav Pappa, he would sanctify us. And when his servant would come from the wilderness, he would sanctify them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לָא יִפְרוֹס אָדָם פְּרוּסָה לָאוֹרְחִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן אוֹכֵל עִמָּהֶם, אֲבָל פּוֹרֵס הוּא לְבָנָיו וְלִבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכָן בְּמִצְוֹת. וּבְהַלֵּל וּבַמְּגִילָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיָּצָא — מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: The Sages taught One should not break bread for guests unless he is eating with them, But he may break for his children and for members of his household in order to educate them to the mitzvot, And with regard to hallel and the Scroll even if he fulfilled he can discharge
llm_translation: The sages taught: A person should not spread a cloth as a canopy for travelers unless he eats with them, but he may spread a canopy for his sons and the members of his household in order to educate them in the commandments. In the cases of Hillel and the Scroll of Esther, even though he has fulfilled his obligation — he fulfills it for others.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ רָאוּהוּ בֵּית דִּין
llm_translation: We will return to you, we will see him in the court.

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמְּדִינָה. מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהוּ תּוֹקְעִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בֵּית דִּין. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי אֶלָּא בְּיַבְנֶה בִּלְבַד. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֶחָד יַבְנֶה, וְאֶחָד כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Festival day of Rosh HaShana that occurs on Shabbat, in the Temple they would sound However, not in the country After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that should sound in every place where there is a court Rabbi Elazar said: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted only in Yavne, They said to him: both Yavne and any place where there is a court.
llm_translation: Good day of Rosh Hashanah that falls on Shabbat - in the Temple they would blow, but not in the provinces. Once the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted that they should blow everywhere there is a court. Rabbi Elazar said: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai only instituted this in Yavneh alone. They said to him: One in Yavneh, and one in every place that has a court.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד זֹאת הָיְתָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יְתֵירָה עַל יַבְנֶה, שֶׁכׇּל עִיר שֶׁהִיא רוֹאָה, וְשׁוֹמַעַת, וּקְרוֹבָה, וִיכוֹלָה לָבוֹא — תּוֹקְעִין. וּבְיַבְנֶה לֹא הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And Jerusalem had this additional superiority over Yavne for any city whose could see and hear and was near and could come they sound But in Yavne they would sound only in the court
llm_translation: And furthermore this was Jerusalem more esteemed than Yavneh, for any city that can see, hear, be near, and able to enter — they sound the shofar. But in Yavneh they would only sound the shofar in the court alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר לַחְמָא אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״. וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, כָּאן — בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּחוֹל.
human_translation: From where these matters; Rabbi Levi bar Laḥma said Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: One verse says, “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts” And another verse says: “It is a day of blowing for you” not difficult: Here, to a Festival that occurs on Shabbat; there, to a Festival that occurs on a weekday.
llm_translation: Gemara: What do these words mean? Rabbi Levi son of Lahma said in the name of Rabbi Hama son of Hanina: It is written, one verse says, "A Sabbath of remembrance, a blast of trumpets." And another verse says, "A day of blowing the horn shall be unto you!" There is no difficulty: here - on a festival that falls on a Sabbath, here - on a festival that falls on a weekday.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ הֵיכִי תָּקְעִינַן? וְעוֹד: הָא לָאו מְלָאכָה הִיא, דְּאִצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: if by Torah law, how does one sound in the Temple? And furthermore, is not a prohibited labor that a verse is necessary to exclude
llm_translation: Rava said: If it is from the Torah, how could we blow in the Temple? And furthermore, is it not a prohibited labor, for which a verse is needed for its exclusions.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: ״כׇּל מְלֶאכֶת עֲבוֹדָה לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּ״, יָצְתָה תְּקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר וּרְדִיַּית הַפַּת, שֶׁהִיא חָכְמָה וְאֵינָהּ מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: As of the school of Shmuel taught “Any prohibited labor of work you shall not perform” to exclude the sounding of the shofar and the removal of bread which is a skill and not a labor,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tana d'bei Shmuel: 'kol melachet avodah lo ta'asu', yatza tekiaat shofar u'rediyat hapat, shehi chokhmah v'einah melachah." English translation: "It was taught in the school of Shmuel: 'Any labor of work you shall not do,' the blowing of the shofar and dyeing the dough have emerged, for they are wisdom and not labor."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִישְׁרֵא שְׁרֵי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזוּר בֵּיהּ כִּדְרַבָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר, וְאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בִּתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלֶנּוּ בְּיָדוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל הַבָּקִי לִלְמוֹד, וְיַעֲבִירֶנּוּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: By Torah law one is permitted and it was the Sages who decreed it in accordance with Rabba, as Rabba said: All are obligated to sound the shofar but not all are experts in sounding the shofar . a decree lest one take in his hand and go to an expert to learn and he carry it four cubits in the public domain,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: From the Torah, one may blow the shofar in a straight manner, and it is the Rabbis who decreed like Rabba. For Rabba said: Everyone is obligated in the blowing of the shofar, and not everyone is proficient in the blowing of the shofar, a decree lest one take it in his hand and go to an expert to learn, and he will carry it four cubits in a public domain.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְלוּלָב, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִמְגִילָּה.
human_translation: And this is the reason for the palm branch lulav and this is the reason for the Megilla
llm_translation: And this is the reason of Lulav, and this is the reason of Megillah.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּעַם אַחַת חָל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהָיוּ כׇל הֶעָרִים מִתְכַּנְּסִין. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי לִבְנֵי בְּתִירָה: נִתְקַע! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: נָדוּן.
human_translation: After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the Sages taught: Once Rosh HaShana occurred on Shabbat, and all the cities gathered Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said to the sons of Beteira, Let us sound They said to him: Let us discuss
llm_translation: From when the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai established, etc. The Rabbis taught: Once Rosh Hashanah fell on Shabbat, and all the cities would gather. Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai said to the people of Beitar: Blow! They said to him: It is fitting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: נִתְקַע, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָדוּן. לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּקְעוּ, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: נָדוּן! אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּבָר נִשְׁמְעָה קֶרֶן בְּיַבְנֶה, וְאֵין מְשִׁיבִין לְאַחַר מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: He said to them: let us sound and afterward, let us discuss After they sounded said to Let us discuss He said to them: The horn has already been heard in Yavne, and one does not refute after action
llm_translation: He said to them: "Sound the shofar, and afterwards we will deliberate." After they sounded it, they said to him: "Deliberate!" He said to them: "The horn has already been heard in Yavneh, and we do not respond after the deed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי אֶלָּא בְּיַבְנֶה בִּלְבַד. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֶחָד יַבְנֶה וְאֶחָד כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בֵּית דִּין. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted only in Yavne. They said to him: both Yavne and any place where there is a court. They said to him, is the first tanna
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai only established the Sanhedrin in Yavneh alone. They said to him: Establish it in Yavneh and in any place that has a court. They said to him: This is what the first Tanna taught!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ בֵּי דִינָא דְּאַקְרַאי.
human_translation: between a temporary court,
llm_translation: There is a difference between them in the house of judgment of the Scriptures.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֶחָד יַבְנֶה וְאֶחָד כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בֵּית דִּין. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: they said to him: both Yavne and any place where there is a court. Rav Huna said:
llm_translation: They said to him: One should establish both a Yavneh and a Beit Din in every place. Rav Huna said:

hebrew_text: וְעִם בֵּית דִּין. מַאי וְעִם בֵּית דִּין? בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, לְאַפּוֹקֵי שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין — דְּלָא.
human_translation: And with the court. What is With the court? In the presence of the court, to exclude not in the presence of the court, as not
llm_translation: And with the court. What is "and with the court"? In front of the court, to go out not in front of the court - no.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: וְעוֹד זֹאת הָיְתָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יְתֵירָה עַל יַבְנֶה וְכוּ׳. מַאי וְעוֹד זֹאת? אִילֵּימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי — ״זֹאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא: דְּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם תּוֹקְעִין יְחִידִין, וּבְיַבְנֶה אֵין תּוֹקְעִין יְחִידִין.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection And Jerusalem had this additional superiority over Yavne. What is And this additional? If we say that which it teaches it should have This, Rather, that in Jerusalem individuals sound in Yavne individuals do not sound
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And yet this was Jerusalem more than Yavneh and so on." What is meant by "and yet this"? If you wish, I can say: as it is taught - "this" is needed for it. Rather, in Jerusalem they blow the shofar individually, but in Yavneh they do not blow the shofar individually.

hebrew_text: וּבְיַבְנֶה אֵין תּוֹקְעִין יְחִידִין? וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף, אָמַר: כִּי מְסַיֵּים שְׁלִיחָא דְצִיבּוּרָא תְּקִיעָה בְּיַבְנֶה — לָא שָׁמַע אִינִישׁ קָל אוּנֵּיה מִקָּל תָּקוֹעַיָּא דִּיחִידָאֵי.
human_translation: And Don’t individuals sound in Yavne? But when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said: When the prayer leader completed the sounding in Yavne, nobody could hear the sound of his ears due to the noise of the sounding of individuals.
llm_translation: In Yavneh, do they not blow the shofar individually? But when Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef came, he said: When concluding the prayer of the congregation with a shofar blast in Yavneh, no one distinguishes between the sound of the congregation's shofar blasts and the sound of individual shofar blasts.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: דְּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם תּוֹקְעִין בֵּין בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, וּבְיַבְנֶה, בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין — לָא. הָא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין מִיהָא תּוֹקְעִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Rather, not that in Jerusalem they sound both when the court and when the court not And in Yavne, when the court yes, when the court not no, when the court they would in any case sound even not in the presence of the court.
llm_translation: Rather, no: In Jerusalem they blow, whether it is during the time of the court or not during the time of the court, and in Yavneh, during the time of the court — yes, not during the time of the court — no. But in the time of the court, they blow from there, even not in the presence of the court!

hebrew_text: לָא: דְּאִילּוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם תּוֹקְעִין בֵּין בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, וּבְיַבְנֶה, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין — לָא.
human_translation: No, that whereas in Jerusalem they sound both in the presence of the court and not in the presence of the court, to Yavne, in the presence of the court, yes, not in the presence of the court, no,
llm_translation: Not: for if in Jerusalem they blow, whether in front of the court or not in front of the court, and in Yavneh, in front of the court — yes, not in front of the court — no.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב הוּנָא אַהָא דִּכְתִיב ״בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים תַּעֲבִירוּ שׁוֹפָר בְּכׇל אַרְצְכֶם״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד חַיָּיב לִתְקוֹעַ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְעִם בֵּית דִּין. מַאי וְעִם בֵּית דִּין — בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין. לְאַפּוֹקֵי שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, דְּלָא.
human_translation: Some teach this of Rav Huna with regard to this As it is written: “On Yom Kippur you shall proclaim with the shofar throughout all your land” teaches that each and every individual is obligated to sound Rav Huna said: And with the court. What is With the court? When the court to exclude when the court not that not
llm_translation: There is one who teaches regarding that which Rav Huna said: "It is written, 'On the day of Yom Kippur, you shall sound the shofar throughout your land' — this teaches that every individual is obligated to blow the shofar." Rav Huna said: "And with the court." What is meant by 'and with the court'? In the time of the court. To exclude when not in the time of the court, for not.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: תְּקִיעַת רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹבֵל דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת בִּגְבוּלִין, אִישׁ וּבֵיתוֹ. מַאי ״אִישׁ וּבֵיתוֹ״? אִילֵּימָא אִישׁ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ — אִיתְּתָא מִי מִיחַיְּיבָא? וְהָא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא הִיא, וְכׇל מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁהַזְּמַן גְּרָמָא — נָשִׁים פְּטוּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection The sounding on Rosh HaShana and the Jubilee Year overrides Shabbat in the outlying areas every man and his house. What is Every man and his house? If we say man and his wife, is a woman obligated Isn’t a positive, time-bound mitzva, And any positive, time-bound mitzva, women are exempt.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: The blowing of the shofar on Rosh Hashanah and the Jubilee year override the Sabbath in the borders, for an individual and his household. What is meant by "an individual and his household"? If you say an individual and his wife - is a woman obligated? But the obligation of a positive commandment dependent on a specific time exempts women.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: אִישׁ בְּבֵיתוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין! לָא, לְעוֹלָם בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Rather, is it not Every man in his house, and even when the court not No; actually at a time when the court
llm_translation: Rather, no: a man in his own home, and even not in the time of the court! No, rather, always in the time of the court.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שָׁוֶה הַיּוֹבֵל לְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לַתְּקִיעָה וְלַבְּרָכוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁבַּיּוֹבֵל תּוֹקְעִין בֵּין בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּ בּוֹ אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ, וּבֵין בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁלֹּא קִידְּשׁוּ בּוֹ אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ, וְכׇל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד חַיָּיב לִתְקוֹעַ. בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לֹא הָיוּ תּוֹקְעִין אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּ בּוֹ אֶת הַחֹדֶשׁ, וְאֵין כׇּל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד חַיָּיב לִתְקוֹעַ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection the Jubilee Year is the same as Rosh HaShana with regard to sounding and the blessings However, that on the Jubilee Year they sound both in the court where they sanctified the month and in a court where they did not sanctify the month, and each and every individual is obligated to sound on Rosh HaShana they sound only in the court where they sanctified the month, and each and every individual is not obligated to sound
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raised an objection: The Jubilee is equivalent to Rosh Hashanah for blowing the shofar and reciting blessings. Rather, in the Jubilee, they blow the shofar both by the court that sanctified the month and by the court that did not sanctify the month, and every individual is obligated to blow. On Rosh Hashanah, they only blow by the court that sanctified the month, and not every individual is obligated to blow.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵין כׇּל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד חַיָּיב לִתְקוֹעַ? אִילֵּימָא דְּבַיּוֹבֵל תּוֹקְעִין יְחִידִין וּבְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אֵין תּוֹקְעִין יְחִידִין — וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף, אָמַר: כִּי הֲוָה מְסַיֵּים שְׁלִיחָא דְצִיבּוּרָא תְּקִיעָתָא בְּיַבְנֶה — לָא שָׁמַע אִינִישׁ קָל אוּנֵּיה מִקָּל תָּקוֹעַיָּא דִּיחִידָאֵי.
human_translation: What is Each and every individual is not obligated to sound If we say that on the Jubilee Year individuals sound whereas on Rosh HaShana individuals do not sound But when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said: When the prayer leader completed the sounding in Yavne, nobody could hear the sound of his ears due to the noise of the sounding of individuals.
llm_translation: What is the reason that every individual is obligated to blow the shofar? If you say it is because regarding the Jubilee year, individuals blow the shofar, but on Rosh Hashanah, individuals do not blow the shofar — and when Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef came, he said: When the emissary of the community would finish blowing in Yavneh, no one could discern the sound of the blasts of the individuals.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: דְּאִילּוּ בַּיּוֹבֵל תּוֹקְעִין בֵּין בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, וּבְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין — אֵין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין — לָא. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: בַּיּוֹבֵל בֵּין בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Rather, is it not whereas on the Jubilee Year they sound both when the court and when the court not on Rosh HaShana, when the court yes, at a time when the court not no, In any event, is teaching on the Jubilee Year both when the court and when the court not
llm_translation: Rather, no: that even in the Jubilee year, one may sound the shofar whether it is during the time of the court or not during the time of the court, and on Rosh Hashanah, during the time of the court — no, not during the time of the court. It is taught in a Baraita: In the Jubilee year, whether it is during the time of the court or not during the time of the court!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בַּיּוֹבֵל, בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין — תּוֹקְעִין בֵּין בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין. בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, תּוֹקְעִין בִּזְמַן בֵּית דִּין, וּבִפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַבִּי: אֵין תּוֹקְעִין אֶלָּא כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבֵּית דִּין יוֹשְׁבִין.
human_translation: No; actually when the court and this is what is teaching: On the Jubilee Year, when the court they sound both in the presence of the court and not in the presence of the court; on Rosh HaShana they sound when the court and in the presence of the court. It was also stated Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said Rabbi said: They sound only throughout when the court is sitting
llm_translation: Not, forever in the time of the court, and thus it was taught: In the Jubilee, in the time of the court - they blow whether in front of the court, or not in front of the court. On Rosh Hashanah, they blow in the time of the court, and in front of the court. It was stated similarly: Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamada said Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul said Rabbi: They only blow as long as the court is seated.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: נִנְעֲרוּ לַעֲמוֹד וְלֹא עָמְדוּ, מַהוּ? בֵּית דִּין יוֹשְׁבִין בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: זְמַן בֵּית דִּין בָּעֵינַן — וְלֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised a dilemma: stirred to rise and they did not rise, what is we require the court seated, and that is Or perhaps we require when court and that is not shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: They were summoned to stand but did not stand, what is the ruling? We require the presence of the court - but perhaps there is a case where there is a fixed time for the court to convene - and it is not applicable? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד זֹאת הָיְתָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם יְתֵירָה עַל יַבְנֶה וְכוּ׳. רוֹאָה — פְּרָט לְיוֹשֶׁבֶת בַּנַּחַל.
human_translation: And Jerusalem had this additional superiority over Yavne. see exclude that sits in valley,
llm_translation: And furthermore this was Jerusalem more than Yavneh and so on. "Seeing" - a detail for a resident of the valley.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמַעַת — פְּרָט לְיוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּרֹאשׁ הָהָר. קְרוֹבָה — פְּרָט לְיוֹשֶׁבֶת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. וִיכוֹלָה לָבוֹא — פְּרָט לְמַפְסֵיק לַהּ נַהֲרָא.
human_translation: hear, exclude sitting on a mountaintop, near, exclude sitting beyond limit And can come, exclude that is separated by a river,
llm_translation: Hearing — a detail for one who dwells at the top of the mountain. Close — a detail for one who dwells outside the boundary. And she is able to enter — a detail for one who interrupts the river.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיָה הַלּוּלָב נִיטָּל בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ שִׁבְעָה, וּבַמְּדִינָה יוֹם אֶחָד. מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהֵא לוּלָב נִיטָּל בַּמְּדִינָה שִׁבְעָה, זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: At first, the lulav was taken in the Temple seven and in the country one day, After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the lulav should be taken in the country seven commemoration of the Temple.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Initially, the taking of the lulav was done for seven days in the Temple, and in the provinces for one day. When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted that the lulav should be taken for seven days in the provinces as a remembrance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר.
human_translation: And that the entire day of waving is prohibited.
llm_translation: And that the day of the waving is entirely forbidden.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמְנָלַן דְּעָבְדִינַן זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי אַעֲלֶה אֲרוּכָה לָךְ וּמִמַּכּוֹתַיִךְ אֶרְפָּאֵךְ נְאֻם ה׳ כִּי נִדָּחָה קָרְאוּ לָךְ צִיּוֹן הִיא דּוֹרֵשׁ אֵין לָהּ״, מִכְּלַל דְּבָעֲיָא דְּרִישָׁה.
human_translation: And from where do we that one performs commemoration of the Temple? As the verse states: “For I will restore health to you, and I will heal you of your wounds, said the Lord; because they have called you an outcast: She is Zion, there is none who care for her” by inference that requires caring
llm_translation: Gemara: And from where do we derive that we should make a remembrance for the Temple? As the verse states: "For I will bring you health and heal you of your wounds, declares the Lord, for they have called you an outcast, 'Zion, no one seeks her.'" This is included in what is sought for interpretation.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — מְהֵרָה יִבָּנֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְיֹאמְרוּ: אֶשְׁתָּקַד מִי לֹא אָכַלְנוּ בְּהֵאִיר מִזְרָח — עַכְשָׁיו נָמֵי נֵיכוֹל.
human_translation: that the entire day of waving is prohibited. What is the reason soon the Temple will be rebuilt and will say: Last year, didn’t we eat as soon as the eastern was illuminated Now too, let us eat
llm_translation: And that the day of the waving is entirely forbidden. What is the reason? — The Temple will be rebuilt quickly, and they will say: "Who did not eat when the light shone from the east — now we will also eat."

hebrew_text: וְלָא יָדְעִי דְּאֶשְׁתָּקַד לָא הֲוָה עוֹמֶר, הֵאִיר מִזְרָח — הִתִּיר. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיכָּא עוֹמֶר — עוֹמֶר מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And they do not know that last year, there was no omer , the eastern illuminating, permit now that there is an omer the omer permits
llm_translation: And not knew that it was not an omer, he illuminated from the east - permitted. Now that there is an omer - the omer permits.

hebrew_text: דְּמִיבְּנֵי אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא דְּאִיבְּנִי בְּשִׁיתְּסַר, הֲרֵי הֵאִיר מִזְרָח — הִתִּיר.
human_translation: when that built? If we say that it was rebuilt on the sixteenth the eastern illuminating permitted,
llm_translation: From when was it built? If you say it was built in the twelfth, behold, He illuminated from the east - He permitted.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאִיבְּנִי בַּחֲמֵיסַר. מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וּלְהַלָּן לִשְׁתְּרֵי, דְּהָא תְּנַן: הָרְחוֹקִין — מוּתָּרִין מֵחֲצוֹת הַיּוֹם וּלְהַלָּן, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מִתְעַצְּלִים בּוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, that it was rebuilt on the fifteenth from midday onward let it be permitted as didn’t we learn distant are permitted from midday onward, because the court are not indolent with regard to
llm_translation: Rather, he built me in Hamaisar. From midday and onwards, for two, for we learned: those who are far away - are permitted from midday and onwards, for the court does not delay with it!

hebrew_text: לֹא נִצְרְכָא, דְּאִיבְּנִי בַּחֲמֵיסַר סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. אִי נָמֵי, דְּאִיבְּנִי בְּלֵילְיָא.
human_translation: was necessary only where was rebuilt on the fifteenth adjacent to sunset. Alternatively, where was rebuilt at night,
llm_translation: Not needed, as it was built during the twelfth hour close to sunset. Alternatively, it was built at night.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai

hebrew_text: בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַמְרַהּ, דְּאָמַר: ״עַד עֶצֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״, עַד עַצְמוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם. וְקָסָבַר: עַד, וְעַד בַּכְּלָל.
human_translation: stated in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: until this selfsame [ etzem ] day, until the essence [ atzmo ] of the day. And he holds Until until and including
llm_translation: In the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda she said, as he said: "Until the very bone of this day," until the bone itself of the day. And he holds: until, and including.

hebrew_text: וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ? וְהָא מְפַלֵּיג פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהֵא יוֹם הֶנֶף כּוּלּוֹ אָסוּר. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא מִן הַתּוֹרָה הוּא אָסוּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד עֶצֶם הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״!
human_translation: And does hold in accordance with But he disagrees with him, as we learned After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the entire day of waving is prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda said: But isn’t it prohibited by Torah law, as it is written: “Until this selfsame day”?
llm_translation: And who holds like her? And this one disputes against her, as we learned: From when the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai decreed that the entire day of Yom Kippur should be forbidden. Rabbi Yehuda said: Isn't it already forbidden by the Torah, as it is written: "Until the end of this day"!

hebrew_text: הָתָם — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הוּא דְּקָא טָעֵי. אִיהוּ סָבַר רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי מִדְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר, וְלָא הִיא, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא קָאָמַר.
human_translation: There, it was Rabbi Yehuda who erred He thought Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai was saying by rabbinic law. But that is not so; he was saying by Torah law.
llm_translation: There — Rabbi Yehuda, he is the one who is mistaken. He holds that Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai is speaking from the perspective of the Rabbis, but it is not so; he is speaking from the perspective of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הִתְקִין קָתָנֵי! מַאי הִתְקִין — דָּרַשׁ וְהִתְקִין.
human_translation: But it is taught Instituted. What is instituted? interpreted and instituted
llm_translation: And this, the small ones established! What did he establish - he expounded and established.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Initially, they would accept testimony of the month the entire day
llm_translation: The Mishnah: In the beginning, they would accept testimony regarding the new moon all day.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת נִשְׁתַּהוּ הָעֵדִים מִלָּבוֹא, וְנִתְקַלְקְלוּ הַלְוִיִּם בַּשִּׁיר. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְקַבְּלִין אֶלָּא עַד הַמִּנְחָה.
human_translation: Once, the witnesses tarried coming and the Levites erred with regard to the song, instituted that they would accept only until minḥa
llm_translation: Once the witnesses were delayed in arriving, and the Levites became disorganized in their singing. They established that they should not accept the sacrifices except until the afternoon offering.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּאוּ עֵדִים מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה — נוֹהֲגִין אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם קוֹדֶשׁ, וּלְמָחָר קוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And if witnesses came from minḥa onward, observe that day, sacred, And the following day sacred.
llm_translation: "And if witnesses came from the Mincha offering and above - we treat that day as holy, and the next day as holy."

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי שֶׁיְּהוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: After the Temple was destroyed Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that they would accept testimony of the month the entire day.
llm_translation: From when the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai instituted that they should accept testimony regarding the new moon all day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מָה קִלְקוּל קִלְקְלוּ הַלְוִיִּם בַּשִּׁיר? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: שֶׁלֹּא אָמְרוּ שִׁירָה כׇּל עִיקָּר. רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר: שֶׁאָמְרוּ שִׁירָה שֶׁל חוֹל עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: What error did the Levites make with regard to the song Here, they interpreted that they did not recite any song at all, Rabbi Zeira said: that they recited the song of weekday with the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the disgrace that the Levites disgraced in the song? Here they interpreted: that they did not say the song at all. Rabbi Zeira said: that they said a weekday song with the constant song between the evenings.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְאַהֲבָה בְּרֵיהּ, פּוֹק תְּנִי לְהוּ: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְקַבְּלִין עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא שְׁהוּת בַּיּוֹם לְהַקְרִיב תְּמִידִין וּמוּסָפִין וְנִסְכֵּיהֶם, וְלוֹמַר שִׁירָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּשִׁיבּוּשׁ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲמוּר שִׁירָה דְחוֹל — הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא שִׁיבּוּשׁ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲמוּר כְּלָל — מַאי שִׁיבּוּשׁ אִיכָּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to his son Ahava: Go out teach to They instituted that would accept testimony of the month only if there was time left in the day to sacrifice the daily offerings and the additional offerings and their libations, and to recite the song without a mistake. Granted, if you say they recited the song of weekday, this is which there is a mistake. However, if you say they did not recite at all, what mistake is there?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Zeira to Ahava his son, go teach them: they established that they should not accept testimony of the new moon except in order that there should be delay in the day to offer the continual and additional offerings and their libations, and to recite the song without embarrassment. If you say that the song of the weekday is meant — that is the embarrassment. But if you say it is not said at all — what embarrassment is there!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֲמוּר כְּלָל — אֵין לְךָ שִׁיבּוּשׁ גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Since they did not recite at all, you do not have a mistake greater than this.
llm_translation: Since it was not said in general - you have no greater embarrassment than this.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא: תָּמִיד שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה שַׁחֲרִית קָרֵב כְּהִלְכָתוֹ, בְּמוּסָף מַהוּ אוֹמֵר — ״הַרְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ הָרִיעוּ לֵאלֹהֵי יַעֲקֹב״, בְּמִנְחָה מַהוּ אוֹמֵר — ״קוֹל ה׳ יָחִיל מִדְבָּר״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Huna raised an objection the daily offering on Rosh HaShana, the morning it is sacrificed in accordance with its halakhot , to the additional offering what does one recite? “Sing aloud to God our strength; shout to the God of Jacob” to the afternoon what does one recite? “The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ahah bar Huna asked: The daily morning offering of Rosh Hashanah is sacrificed according to its prescribed manner, but with the additional offering, what does one say? "Sing aloud to God our strength; shout for joy to the God of Jacob." And with the afternoon offering, what does one say? "The voice of the Lord is heard in the wilderness."

hebrew_text: וּבִזְמַן שֶׁחָל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לִהְיוֹת בַּחֲמִישִׁי בַּשַּׁבָּת, שֶׁהַשִּׁירָה שֶׁלּוֹ ״הַרְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ״ — לֹא הָיָה אוֹמֵר בְּשַׁחֲרִית ״הַרְנִינוּ״, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחוֹזֵר וְכוֹפֵל אֶת הַפֶּרֶק.
human_translation: And when Rosh HaShana occurs on a Thursday, whose psalm is: “Sing aloud to God our strength,” one would not recite: “Sing aloud with the morning because one goes back and repeats that section
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in a time when Rosh Hashanah falls on a Thursday, whose song is "Sing to God, our strength" - he does not say "Sing" in the morning prayer, because he repeats and duplicates the paragraph.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַהוּ אוֹמֵר — ״הֲסִירוֹתִי מִסֵּבֶל שִׁכְמוֹ״. וְאִם בָּאוּ עֵדִים אַחַר תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, אוֹמֵר ״הַרְנִינוּ״ אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחוֹזֵר וְכוֹפֵל אֶת הַפֶּרֶק.
human_translation: Rather, what does one recite? “I removed his shoulder from the burden” And if the witnesses came after the daily morning offering one recites: “Sing aloud even though that one goes back and repeats that section
llm_translation: Rather, what does he say — "I have removed his burden from his shoulder." And if additional witnesses came after the daily morning offering, he says, "Sing aloud" even though he repeats and recites the section.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא, כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּמִסְתַּפְּקָא אָמְרִינַן שִׁירָה דְחוֹל — הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר: אוֹמְרוֹ וְכוֹפְלוֹ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אֲמוּר כְּלָל — מַאי אוֹמְרוֹ וְכוֹפְלוֹ?
human_translation: Granted, if you say anywhere there is a doubt one recites the song of weekday, this is that which states: One recites and repeats it. However, if you say no is recited at all, what is One recites it and repeats it?
llm_translation: If you say, "In truth, wherever there is a doubt, we say the song of the sand," that is to say, he said: "Repeat it and double it." But if you say, "It is not said at all," what does "repeat it and double it" mean?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּשִׁירָה דְּיוֹמֵיהּ הִיא.
human_translation: It is different there, as is the psalm of the day,
llm_translation: The difference there is that it is a song of his days.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹן מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים — ״לַה׳ הָאָרֶץ וּמְלוֹאָהּ״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁקָּנָה וְהִקְנָה וְשַׁלִּיט בְּעוֹלָמוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Akiva: On the first what would recite? “The earth is the Lord’s, and its fullness” because He acquired and transferred and was ruler in His world,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: In the beginning, what were they saying? "The earth is the Lord's, and the fullness thereof," in reference to the fact that He acquired it, possesses it, and rules over His world.

hebrew_text: בַּשֵּׁנִי מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים — ״גָּדוֹל ה׳ וּמְהוּלָּל מְאֹד״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁחִילֵּק מַעֲשָׂיו וּמָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: On the second what would recite? “Great is the Lord, and highly to be praised because He separated His works, and ruled over them
llm_translation: In the second Temple, what were they saying? "Great is the Lord and greatly praised," in reference to the fact that He divided His works and reigned over them.

hebrew_text: בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״אֱלֹהִים נִצָּב בַּעֲדַת אֵל״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁגִּילָּה אֶרֶץ בְּחׇכְמָתוֹ, וְהֵכִין תֵּבֵל לַעֲדָתוֹ. בָּרְבִיעִי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״אֵל נְקָמוֹת ה׳״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁבָּרָא חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה, וְעָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵעוֹבְדֵיהֶן.
human_translation: On the third they would recite “God stands in the congregation of God” because He revealed the land in His wisdom and prepared the world for His assembly On the fourth they would recite “O Lord God, to Whom vengeance belongs” because He created the sun and the moon, and in the future He will punish those who worship them.
llm_translation: In the third day they would say: "God stands in the congregation of God," in reference to when He revealed the earth in His wisdom, and prepared the world for His congregation. In the fourth day they would say: "God of vengeance, Lord," in reference to when He created the sun and the moon, and is destined to avenge Himself from their worshippers.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲמִישִׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״הַרְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִים עוּזֵּנוּ״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁבָּרָא עוֹפוֹת וְדָגִים לְשַׁבֵּחַ לִשְׁמוֹ. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״ה׳ מָלָךְ גֵּאוּת לָבֵשׁ״, עַל שֵׁם שֶׁגָּמַר מְלַאכְתּוֹ וּמָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן. בַּשְּׁבִיעִי הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: ״מִזְמוֹר שִׁיר לְיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת״, לְיוֹם שֶׁכּוּלּוֹ שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: On the fifth would recite “Sing aloud to God our strength” because He created birds and fish to praise His name. On the sixth they would recite “The Lord reigns, He is clothed with majesty” because He completed His labor and ruled over On the seventh they would recite “A psalm, a song for the day of Shabbat” as a day that is all Shabbat.
llm_translation: In the fifth day they would say: "Sing to God our strength," in reference to the fact that He created birds and fish to praise His name. In the sixth day they would say: "The Lord reigns, He is clothed with majesty," in reference to the fact that He completed His work and reigned over them. In the seventh day they would say: "A psalm, a song for the Sabbath day," for the day that is entirely Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: מָה רָאוּ חֲכָמִים לְחַלֵּק בֵּין הַפְּרָקִים הַלָּלוּ? אֶלָּא: בָּרִאשׁוֹן — שֶׁקָּנָה וְהִקְנָה וְשַׁלִּיט בְּעוֹלָמוֹ. בַּשֵּׁנִי — שֶׁחִילֵּק מַעֲשָׂיו וּמָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶם. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי — שֶׁגִּילָּה אֶרֶץ בְּחׇכְמָתוֹ וְהֵכִין תֵּבֵל לַעֲדָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya said: What did the Sages see to distinguish between these chapters, Rather, On the first that He acquired and transferred and was ruler in His world; on the second that He separated His works and ruled over them on the third that He revealed the land in His wisdom and prepared the world for His assembly.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah said: What did the sages see to differentiate between these chapters? Rather, in the first - that he acquired and acquired and ruled in his world. In the second - that he divided his actions and ruled over them. In the third - that he revealed the earth in his wisdom and prepared the world for his congregation.

hebrew_text: בָּרְבִיעִי — שֶׁבָּרָא חַמָּה וּלְבָנָה וְעָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מֵעוֹבְדֵיהֶן. בַּחֲמִישִׁי — שֶׁבָּרָא עוֹפוֹת וְדָגִים לְשַׁבֵּחַ לִשְׁמוֹ. בַּשִּׁשִּׁי — שֶׁגָּמַר מְלַאכְתּוֹ וּמָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶם. בַּשְּׁבִיעִי — עַל שֵׁם שֶׁשָּׁבַת.
human_translation: On the fourth that He created the sun and the moon, and in the future He will punish those who worship them; on the fifth that He created birds and fish to praise His name; on the sixth that He completed His labor and ruled over on the seventh that He rested
llm_translation: On the fourth day - when He created the sun and the moon, and is destined to exact punishment from their worshippers. On the fifth day - when He created birds and fish to praise His name. On the sixth day - when He completed His work and ruled over them. On the seventh day - in honor of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַב קַטִּינָא, דְּאָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי שְׁנֵי הָוֵה עָלְמָא וְחַד חָרוּב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִשְׂגַּב ה׳ לְבַדּוֹ בְּיוֹם הַהוּא״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּרֵי חָרוּב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְחַיֵּינוּ מִיּוֹמָיִם״.
human_translation: And disagree with of Rav Ketina, as Rav Ketina said: The world will exist for six thousand years, and one destroyed, as it is stated: “And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day” Abaye said: destroyed two as it is stated: “After two days He will revive us”
llm_translation: And they disputed in the academy of Rav Katina, for Rav Katina said: The world was created with two thousand years of chaos, and one thousand years of desolation, as it is stated: "And the Lord alone shall be exalted on that day." Abaye said: Two desolations, as it is stated: "He will revive us after two days."

hebrew_text: בְּמוּסְפֵי דְשַׁבְּתָא מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים? אָמַר רַב עָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: ״הַזִּיו לָךְ״.
human_translation: to the additional offerings of Shabbat, what would recite? Rav Anan bar Rava said Rav said: hei , zayin , yod , vav , lamed , kaf .
llm_translation: In the gatherings of Shabbat, what would they say? Rav Anan son of Rava said in the name of Rav: "Prepare yourself."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁחֲלוּקִים כָּאן — כָּךְ חֲלוּקִין בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said Rav said: In the manner that are divided here so too are they divided in the synagogue
llm_translation: And Rav Hanan son of Rava said in the name of Rav: Just as they are divided here, so too are they divided in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: בְּמִנְחֲתָא דְשַׁבְּתָא מָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״אָז יָשִׁיר״, וּ״מִי כָמוֹךָ״, וְ״אָז יָשִׁיר״.
human_translation: to the afternoon offering on Shabbat, what would recite? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “Then sang and: “Who is like You” and: “Then Israel sang
llm_translation: In the offering of the Sabbath, what would they say? Rabbi Yochanan said: "Then Moses and the children of Israel sang," and "Who is like You," and "Then Moses and the children of Israel sang."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָנֵי כּוּלְּהוּ בְּחַד שַׁבְּתָא אָמְרִי לְהוּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֹּל שַׁבְּתָא וְשַׁבְּתָא אָמְרִי חַד? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עַד שֶׁהָרִאשׁוֹנָה אוֹמֶרֶת אַחַת — שְׁנִיָּה חוֹזֶרֶת שְׁתַּיִם. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כׇּל שַׁבְּתָא וְשַׁבְּתָא אָמְרִי חַד, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one recite all these on each Shabbat, or perhaps on each and every Shabbat recite one Come hear, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: By that the first recite once, the second repeat twice, Learn from here each and every Shabbat they would recite one learn from here
llm_translation: He asked them: "All of these on one Sabbath they say, or perhaps every Sabbath they say one?" Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: "Until the first one says one - the second one repeats two." Learn from it that every Sabbath they say one, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֶשֶׂר מַסָּעוֹת נָסְעָה שְׁכִינָה, מִקְּרָאֵי, וּכְנֶגְדָּן גָּלְתָה סַנְהֶדְרִין, מִגְּמָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Idi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Divine Presence traveled ten journeys, from verses. And corresponding to them the Sanhedrin was exiled from tradition.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Idi said, Rabbi Yochanan said: The Divine Presence traveled ten journeys, as it is written, and corresponding to them the Sanhedrin was exiled from the Gemara.

hebrew_text: עֶשֶׂר מַסָּעוֹת נָסְעָה שְׁכִינָה, מִקְּרָאֵי: מִכַּפֹּרֶת לִכְרוּב, וּמִכְּרוּב לִכְרוּב, וּמִכְּרוּב לְמִפְתָּן, וּמִמִּפְתָּן לְחָצֵר, וּמֵחָצֵר לְמִזְבֵּחַ, וּמִמִּזְבֵּחַ לְגַג, וּמִגַּג לְחוֹמָה, וּמֵחוֹמָה לָעִיר, וּמֵעִיר לְהַר, וּמֵהַר לְמִדְבָּר, וּמִמִּדְבָּר עָלְתָה וְיָשְׁבָה בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵלֵךְ אָשׁוּבָה אֶל מְקוֹמִי״.
human_translation: The Divine Presence traveled ten journeys, from verses. From the Ark cover to the cherub; and from cherub to cherub; and from cherub to the threshold and from the threshold to the courtyard; and from the courtyard to the altar; and from the altar to the roof; and from the roof to the wall and from the wall to the city; and from the city to a mountain and from mountain to the wilderness; and from the wilderness it ascended and rested in its place as it is stated: “I will go and return to My place”
llm_translation: Ten journeys the Divine Presence traveled, as it is written: from the cover to the cherub, and from the cherub to the cherub, and from the cherub to the threshold, and from the threshold to the courtyard, and from the courtyard to the altar, and from the altar to the roof, and from the roof to the wall, and from the wall to the city, and from the city to the mountain, and from the mountain to the wilderness, and from the wilderness she ascended and settled in her place — as it is said: "I will return to My place."

hebrew_text: מִכַּפּוֹרֶת לִכְרוּב, מִכְּרוּב לִכְרוּב, וּמִכְּרוּב לְמִפְתָּן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנוֹעַדְתִּי לְךָ שָׁם וְדִבַּרְתִּי אִתְּךָ מֵעַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּרְכַּב עַל כְּרוּב וַיָּעֹף״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּכְבוֹד אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נַעֲלָה מֵעַל הַכְּרוּב אֲשֶׁר הָיָה עָלָיו אֶל מִפְתַּן הַבָּיִת״.
human_translation: From the Ark cover to the cherub, from cherub to cherub, and from the cherub to the threshold, as it is written “And there I will meet with you, and I will speak to you from above the Ark cover, And it is written: “And He rode upon a cherub, and flew” And it is written: “And the glory of the God of Israel had ascended from the cherub, on which it was, to the threshold of the House”
llm_translation: From the cover to the cherub, from the cherub to the cherub, and from the cherub to the threshold - as it is written: "And there I will meet with you, and I will speak with you from above the cover," and it is written: "And He rode upon a cherub and flew," and it is written: "And the glory of the God of Israel ascended from upon the cherub that was over it to the threshold of the house."

hebrew_text: וּמִמִּפְתָּן לְחָצֵר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּמָּלֵא הַבַּיִת אֶת הֶעָנָן וְהֶחָצֵר מָלְאָה אֶת נֹגַהּ כְּבוֹד ה׳״. מֵחָצֵר לְמִזְבֵּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״רָאִיתִי אֶת ה׳ נִצָּב עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. וּמִמִּזְבֵּחַ לְגַג, דִּכְתִיב: ״טוֹב לָשֶׁבֶת עַל פִּנַּת גָּג״. מִגַּג לְחוֹמָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִנֵּה ה׳ נִצָּב עַל חוֹמַת אֲנָךְ״. מֵחוֹמָה לָעִיר, דִּכְתִיב: ״קוֹל ה׳ לָעִיר יִקְרָא״.
human_translation: And from the threshold to the courtyard, as it is written: “And the House was filled with the cloud and the courtyard was full of the brightness of the Lord’s glory” From the courtyard to the altar, as it is written: “I saw the Lord standing on the altar” And from the altar to the roof, as it is written: “It is better to dwell in a corner of the roof From the roof to the wall, as it is written: “And behold, the Lord stood upon a wall made by a plumb line” From the wall to the city, as it is written: “The Lord’s voice cries to the city”
llm_translation: From the threshold to the courtyard, as it is written: "And the house was filled with the cloud, and the courtyard was filled with the radiance of the Lord." From the courtyard to the altar, as it is written: "I saw the Lord standing upon the altar." And from the altar to the roof, as it is written: "It is good to sit on the corner of the roof." From the roof to the wall, as it is written: "And behold, the Lord stood upon a wall of plumb-line." From the wall to the city, as it is written: "The voice of the Lord calls to the city."

hebrew_text: וּמֵעִיר לְהַר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַל כְּבוֹד ה׳ מֵעַל תּוֹךְ הָעִיר וַיַּעֲמֹד עַל הָהָר אֲשֶׁר מִקֶּדֶם לָעִיר״. וּמֵהַר לְמִדְבָּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״טוֹב שֶׁבֶת בְּאֶרֶץ מִדְבָּר״. וּמִמִּדְבָּר עָלְתָה וְיָשְׁבָה בִּמְקוֹמָהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵלֵךְ אָשׁוּבָה אֶל מְקוֹמִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And from the city to the mountain as it is written: “And the glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city, and stood upon the mountain, which is on the east side of the city” And from the mountain to the wilderness, as it is written: “It is better to live in the wilderness And from the wilderness it ascended and rested in its place as it is written: “I will go and return to My place
llm_translation: From city to mountain, as it is written: "And the glory of the Lord ascended from within the city and stood upon the mountain which is to the east of the city." And from mountain to desert, as it is written: "It is good to dwell in the land of the desert." And from the desert she arose and returned to her place, as it is written: "I will go back to my place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים נִתְעַכְּבָה שְׁכִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁמָּא יַחְזְרוּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁלֹּא חָזְרוּ — אָמַר: תִּיפַּח עַצְמָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעֵינֵי רְשָׁעִים תִּכְלֶינָה וּמָנוֹס אָבַד מִנְהֶם וְתִקְוָתָם מַפַּח נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: six months the Divine Presence lingered in the wilderness, for the Jewish people, perhaps they would repent When they did not repent, said: Let them be lost, as it is stated: “But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall have no way to flee, and their hope shall be the drooping of the soul”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Six months the Divine Presence tarried for Israel in the wilderness, lest they return in repentance. Once they did not return, He said: Let their bones be scattered, as it is stated: "The eyes of the wicked shall fail, and their escape shall be cut off, and their hope shall be the expiration of the soul" (Job 11:20).

hebrew_text: וּכְנֶגְדָּן גָּלְתָה סַנְהֶדְרִין, מִגְּמָרָא: מִלִּשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית לַחֲנוּת, וּמֵחֲנוּת לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, וּמִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְיַבְנֶה,
human_translation: And corresponding to the Sanhedrin was exiled from tradition: From the Chamber of Hewn Stone, to Ḥanut , and from Ḥanut to Jerusalem; and from Jerusalem to Yavne;
llm_translation: And opposite them the Sanhedrin was exiled. From the Gemara: From the Chamber of Hewn Stone to the Chamber of the Hearth, and from the Chamber of the Hearth to Jerusalem, and from Jerusalem to Yavneh.

hebrew_text: וּמִיַּבְנֶה לְאוּשָׁא, וּמֵאוּשָׁא לְיַבְנֶה, וּמִיַּבְנֶה לְאוּשָׁא, וּמֵאוּשָׁא לִשְׁפַרְעָם, וּמִשְּׁפַרְעָם לְבֵית שְׁעָרִים, וּמִבֵּית שְׁעָרִים לְצִפּוֹרִי, וּמִצִּפּוֹרִי לִטְבֶרְיָא. וּטְבֶרְיָא עֲמוּקָּה מִכּוּלָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁפַלְתְּ מֵאֶרֶץ תְּדַבֵּרִי״.
human_translation: and from Yavne to Usha; and from Usha to Yavne; and from Yavne to Usha; and from Usha to Shefaram; and from Shefaram to Beit She’arim; and from Beit She’arim to Tzippori; and from Tzippori to Tiberias. And Tiberias is lower than all of them, as it is stated: “And brought down, you shall speak out of the ground”
llm_translation: And from Yavneh to Usha, and from Usha to Yavneh, and from Yavneh to Usha, and from Usha to Shefaram, and from Shefaram to Beit She'arim, and from Beit She'arim to Tzipori, and from Tzipori to Tverya. And Tverya is deeper than all of them, as it is said: "And you shall speak humbly from the ground."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: שֵׁשׁ גָּלוּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הֵשַׁח יוֹשְׁבֵי מָרוֹם קִרְיָה נִשְׂגָּבָה יַשְׁפִּילֶנָּה יַשְׁפִּילָהּ עַד אֶרֶץ יַגִּיעֶנָּה עַד עָפָר״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּמִשָּׁם עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְנַעֲרִי מֵעָפָר קוּמִי שְּׁבִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: six exiles, as it is stated: “For He has brought down those who dwell high, the lofty city laying it low, laying it low, to the ground, bringing it to the dust” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And from there, they are destined to be redeemed as it is stated: “Shake yourself from the dust, arise, sit,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Six exiles, as it is stated: "For He brings down the inhabitants of the height, the lofty city; He brings it down, He brings it down to the ground, He casts it to the dust." Rabbi Yochanan said: And from there they are destined to be redeemed, as it is stated: "Shake yourself from the dust, arise, sit down."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: וְעוֹד זֹאת הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רֹאשׁ בֵּית דִּין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ הָעֵדִים הוֹלְכִין אֶלָּא לִמְקוֹם הַוַּעַד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said: And this, too, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted, that even the head of the court is in any place, the witnesses should go only to the place gathers
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: Furthermore, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai enacted that even the head of the court in any place, the witnesses should only go to the location of the testimony.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּאַזְמְנוּהָ לְדִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. אֲזַל אַמֵּימָר לְמָחוֹזָא, וְלָא אֲזַלָה בָּתְרֵיהּ. כְּתַב פְּתִיחָא עִילָּוַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר, וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: אֲפִילּוּ רֹאשׁ בֵּית דִּין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ הָעֵדִים הוֹלְכִין אֶלָּא לִמְקוֹם הַוַּעַד!
human_translation: a certain woman who was called to judgment before Ameimar in Neharde’a. Ameimar went to Meḥoza, and she did not follow him He wrote a document of excommunication [ petiḥa ] concerning her, Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: Didn’t we learn Even the head of the court is in any place, the witnesses should go only to the place gathers?
llm_translation: The woman that they appointed for the judgment stood before Amemar in Nehardea. Amemar went to Mahoza, but she did not follow him. He wrote the opening statement. Rav Ashi said to Amemar, "But we have learned: Even the head of the court in any place, the witnesses should only go to the place of testimony!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן עֵדוּת הַחֹדֶשׁ, דְּאִם כֵּן נִמְצֵאתָ מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. אֲבָל הָכָא — ״עֶבֶד לֹוֶה לְאִישׁ מַלְוֶה״.
human_translation: said to him: This applies only to testimony of the month, that if so, consequently you will be obstructing them for future However, here, “The borrower is servant to the lender”
llm_translation: He said to him: These matters are relevant to the testimony of the new moon, for if so, you are causing us to stumble in the future. But here - "A borrower is a servant to the lender."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין כֹּהֲנִים רַשָּׁאִין לַעֲלוֹת בְּסַנְדְּלֵיהֶן לַדּוּכָן, וְזוֹ אֶחָד מִתֵּשַׁע תַּקָּנוֹת שֶׁהִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי. שֵׁית דְּהַאי פִּירְקָא, וַחֲדָא דְּפִירְקָא קַמָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught Priests are not allowed to ascend with their sandals to the platform And this is one of the nine ordinances that Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted. Six in this chapter: And one in the first chapter,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Kohanim are not permitted to ascend the platform in their sandals to the dukhan, and this is one of the nine enactments that Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted. Six of these enactments concern this platform, and one of the six is the first enactment.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּפְרִישׁ רוֹבַע לְקִינּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כְּבָר נִמְנָה עָלֶיהָ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן וּבִיטְּלָהּ, מִפְּנֵי הַתַּקָּלָה.
human_translation: And the other, as it is taught A convert who converts nowadays is required to set aside a quarter for his nest, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabban Yoḥanan already voted and rescinded due to mishap.
llm_translation: The other opinion is taught: A convert who converted in this time, he must separate a quarter for his nest. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai already counted her and annulled her, because of the difficulty.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב פָּפָּא וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי, רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית.
human_translation: And the other is a dispute between Rav Pappa and Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak. Rav Pappa said: fourth-year grapevine. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: the strip of crimson
llm_translation: And the other opinion is the dispute of Rav Papa and Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak. Rav Papa said: a vineyard of a quarter of a log, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: the language of Zehorit.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי, דְּתַנְיָא: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי הָיָה עוֹלֶה לִירוּשָׁלַיִם מַהֲלַךְ יוֹם לְכׇל צַד, וְזוֹ הִיא תְּחוּמָהּ: אֵילַת מִן הַצָּפוֹן, וְעַקְרַבַּת מִן הַדָּרוֹם, לוֹד מִן הַמַּעֲרָב, וְיַרְדֵּן מִן הַמִּזְרָח.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said a fourth-year grapevine, as it is taught a fourth-year grapevine would ascend to Jerusalem a day’s walk in each direction. And this is its boundary: Eilat to the north, Akrabat to the south, Lod to the west, and the Jordan to the east.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A vineyard of a quarter of a Beis Kor, as it was taught: A vineyard of a quarter of a Beis Kor that was going up to Jerusalem, a day's journey in every direction, and this is its boundary: Ayelet from the north, and Akkrabat from the south, Lod from the west, and the Jordan from the east.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָה טַעַם — כְּדֵי לְעַטֵּר שׁוּקֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בְּפֵירוֹת.
human_translation: And Ulla said, and some say Rabba bar Ulla Rabbi Yoḥanan said: what reason In order to adorn the markets of Jerusalem with fruit,
llm_translation: And Ula said, and it was stated: Rabba bar Ula said, Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason — in order to adorn the markets of Jerusalem with fruits.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כֶּרֶם רְבָעִי הָיָה לוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּמִזְרַח לוֹד בְּצַד כְּפַר טָבִי, וּבִיקֵּשׁ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְהַפְקִירוֹ לַעֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi Eliezer had a fourth-year grapevine to the east Lod alongside the village of Tavi. and Rabbi Eliezer sought to render ownerless of the poor,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer had a vineyard in the east of Lod, next to the village of Tavi, and Rabbi Eliezer sought to declare it ownerless for the poor.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידָיו: רַבִּי, כְּבָר נִמְנוּ חֲבֵרֶיךָ עָלָיו וְהִתִּירוּהוּ. מַאן חֲבֵרֶיךָ — רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי.
human_translation: His students said to him: teacher, your colleagues have already voted on and permitted it, Who are: Your colleagues? Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai.
llm_translation: They said to him his students: Rabbi, already counted your colleagues against him and permitted him. Who are your colleagues - Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית, דְּתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ קוֹשְׁרִין לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית עַל פֶּתַח אוּלָם מִבַּחוּץ, הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ שְׂמֵחִין, לֹא הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ עֲצֵבִין, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ קוֹשְׁרִין אוֹתוֹ עַל פֶּתַח אוּלָם מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: the strip of crimson As it is taught At first they would tie a strip of crimson to the opening of the Entrance Hall on the outside. turned white, would rejoice, it did not turn white they would be sad. they instituted that they should tie to the opening of the Entrance Hall on the inside,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The language of Zehorit, as it was taught: Initially, they would tie the language of Zehorit on the entrance of the hall from the outside, if it clarified - they were happy, if it did not clarify - they were sad. They established that it should be tied on the entrance of the hall from the inside.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ מְצִיצִין וְרוֹאִין, הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ שְׂמֵחִין, לֹא הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ עֲצֵבִין, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ קוֹשְׁרִין אוֹתוֹ חֶצְיוֹ בַּסֶּלַע וְחֶצְיוֹ בֵּין קַרְנָיו שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ.
human_translation: But would still peek and see it turned white they would rejoice, it did not turn white they would be sad. instituted that they should tie half of to a rock and half of it between the horns of the scapegoat,
llm_translation: And still they were nursing and seeing, they were happy; if not, they were sad. They established that they should tie its half to a rock and its half between the horns of the scapegoat that is sent away.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב פָּפָּא? אָמַר לָךְ: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי, חֲבֵרָיו דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִי הֲוָה? רַבּוֹ הֲוָה. וְאִידַּךְ? כֵּיוָן דְּתַלְמִידִים הֲווֹ — לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵימְרָא לֵיהּ לְרַבֵּיהּ ״רַבָּךְ״.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak did not state in accordance with Rav Pappa? He said to you: If it enters your mind Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai was he Rabbi Eliezer’s colleagues, He was his teacher. And the other, since they were students not proper conduct to say to his teacher: Your teacher.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak: What is the reason he did not say like Rav Papa? He said to you: If your opinion were that Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, the colleagues of Rabbi Eliezer, was his teacher, was he his teacher? He was his master. And the other? Since they were disciples — it is not proper for a student to say to his teacher, "Your master."

hebrew_text: וְרַב פָּפָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק? אָמַר לָךְ: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי — בִּימֵי רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי מִי הֲוָה לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית? וְהָתַנְיָא: כׇּל שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי מֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה. אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה — עָסַק בִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא, אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה — לָמַד, אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה — לִימֵּד.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav Pappa did not state in accordance with Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak? said to you: If it enters your mind Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai, in the days of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai was there a strip of crimson Isn’t it taught All the years of Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai’s 120 years: Forty years he was involved in business forty years he studied forty years he taught
llm_translation: Rav Papa, what is the reason he did not say like Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak? He said to you: If your mind had been in the days of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai, was the language of Zehorit? And it was taught: All the years of Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai were one hundred and twenty years. Forty years - he engaged in business, forty years - he learned, forty years - he taught.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁנֶּחֱרַב הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיָה לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית מַלְבִּין אֶלָּא מַאֲדִים. וּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁחָרַב הַבַּיִת הִתְקִין רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי! וְאִידַּךְ: אוֹתָם אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה דְּלָמַד — תַּלְמִיד יוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ הֲוָה, וַאֲמַר מִילְּתָא וְאִסְתַּבַּר טַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: And it is taught the forty years before the Temple was destroyed the strip of crimson would not turn white; rather, turn red. And we learned When the Temple was destroyed Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted And the other those forty years that he studied was a student sitting before his teacher, and he said a matter, and his reasoning made sense
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: Forty years before the destruction of the Temple, the language of the Divine Presence ceased and was only spoken in Aramaic. And we learned in a Mishnah: After the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai established! And the other opinion: Those forty years, when he was learning — a disciple sat before his teacher, and he would say the matter and his reasoning was established.

hebrew_text: וְקַבְעֵיהּ רַבֵּיהּ בִּשְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: and his teacher established it in his name.
llm_translation: And his teacher established it in his name.
