hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סֵדֶר בְּרָכוֹת: אוֹמֵר אָבוֹת וּגְבוּרוֹת וּקְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם, וְכוֹלֵל מַלְכִיּוֹת עִמָּהֶן, וְאֵינוֹ תּוֹקֵעַ.
human_translation: The order of the blessings One recites the Patriarchs, Mighty Deeds, and the Sanctification of Name, And one includes Kingship, with them, and he does not sound
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The order of blessings: one recites "Avot u'gevurot u'kedushat Hashem," and includes the mention of God's sovereignty within them, and does not conclude with a blast.

hebrew_text: קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם וְתוֹקֵעַ, זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְתוֹקֵעַ, שׁוֹפָרוֹת וְתוֹקֵעַ, וְאוֹמֵר עֲבוֹדָה וְהוֹדָאָה וּבִרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: the Sanctification of the Day, and sounds Remembrances, and sounds Shofarot , and sounds And recites Service and Thanksgiving and the Priestly Blessing. the statement of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri.
llm_translation: The holiness of the day and the one who blows, remembrances and the one who blows, shofars and the one who blows, and says service and thanksgiving and the priestly blessing, the words of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִם אֵינוֹ תּוֹקֵעַ לְמַלְכִיּוֹת — לָמָה הוּא מַזְכִּיר? אֶלָּא: אוֹמֵר אָבוֹת וּגְבוּרוֹת וּקְדוּשַּׁת הַשֵּׁם, וְכוֹלֵל מַלְכִיּוֹת עִם קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם וְתוֹקֵעַ, זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְתוֹקֵעַ, שׁוֹפָרוֹת וְתוֹקֵעַ, וְאוֹמֵר עֲבוֹדָה וְהוֹדָאָה וּבִרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: If one does not sound for Kingship, why does he mention Rather, recites the Patriarchs and Mighty Deeds and the Sanctification of Name. He includes Kingship in the Sanctification of the Day, and sounds Remembrances, and sounds Shofarot and sounds He recites Service and Thanksgiving and the Priestly Blessing.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: If one does not blow for the kingship - why does he mention it? Rather, he says: Fathers and heroes and the sanctity of the Name, and includes kingship with the sanctity of the day and blowing, remembrances and blowing, shofars and blowing, and says service and thanksgiving and the blessing of the priests.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִם אֵינוֹ תּוֹקֵעַ לְמַלְכִיּוֹת — לָמָה הוּא מַזְכִּיר? לָמָה הוּא מַזְכִּיר?! רַחֲמָנָא אָמַר אַידְכַּר! אֶלָּא: לָמָה עֶשֶׂר? לֵימָא תֵּשַׁע, דְּהוֹאִיל וְאִשְׁתַּנִּי אִשְׁתַּנִּי!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: If one does not sound for the Kingship, why does he mention Why does he mention The Merciful One states mention Rather, Why ten Let him recite nine Since is different let it be different
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Akiva said to him: If he does not mention the Kingdoms, why does he mention it? Why does he mention it?! The Merciful One said to mention it! Rather, why ten? Let him say nine, for it has changed, it has changed!

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים אָבוֹת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבוּ לַה׳ בְּנֵי אֵלִים״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים גְּבוּרוֹת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבוּ לַה׳ כָּבוֹד וָעוֹז״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים קְדוּשּׁוֹת — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבוּ לַה׳ כְּבוֹד שְׁמוֹ הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַה׳ בְּהַדְרַת קֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that one recites Patriarchs? As it is stated: “Ascribe to the Lord, O you sons of the mighty” And from where that one recites Mighty Deeds? As it is stated: “Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength” And from where that one recites Sanctification As it is stated: “Ascribe to the Lord the glory due to His name; worship the Lord in the beauty of sanctity”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that we recite the Avot (Patriarchs)? — As it is stated: "Ascribe to the Lord, O sons of mighty ones." And from where do we derive that we recite the Gevurot (mighty acts)? — As it is stated: "Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength." And from where do we derive that we recite the Kedushot (holiness)? — As it is stated: "Ascribe to the Lord the glory due His name; worship the Lord in the splendor of holiness."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים מַלְכִיּוֹת זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: דִּכְתִיב ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״. ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״ — זֶה קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם; ״זִכְרוֹן״ — אֵלּוּ זִכְרוֹנוֹת; ״תְּרוּעָה״ — אֵלּוּ שׁוֹפָרוֹת; ״מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״ — קַדְּשֵׁהוּ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: And from where that one recites Kingship, Remembrances, and Shofarot ? Rabbi Eliezer says: As it is written: a solemn rest, a memorial of blasts, a sacred convocation” “A solemn rest,” this the Sanctification of the Day; “a memorial,” this is Remembrances; “blasts,” this is Shofarot ; “a sacred convocation” sanctify it by performing labor.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that we say "Kingship, Remembrance, and Shofarot"? Rabbi Eliezer says: As it is written, "A Sabbath of remembrance, a holy convocation" (Leviticus 23:24). "A Sabbath" - this is the sanctity of the day; "remembrance" - these are remembrances; "a holy convocation" - these are shofarot; "a holy convocation" - sanctify it through refraining from work.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֹאמַר ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״ — שְׁבוּת, שֶׁבּוֹ פָּתַח הַכָּתוּב תְּחִילָּה! אֶלָּא: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״ — קַדְּשֵׁהוּ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה; ״זִכְרוֹן״ — אֵלּוּ זִכְרוֹנוֹת; ״תְּרוּעָה״ — אֵלּוּ שׁוֹפָרוֹת; ״מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״ — זוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to For what isn’t it stated “solemn rest” rest with which the verse opened first. Rather, “A solemn rest,” sanctify it by performing labor; “a memorial,” this is Remembrances; “blasts,” this is Shofarot ; “a sacred convocation,” this is the Sanctification of the Day.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: Why is it not said "Shabbaton" - cessation, which the Scripture opened with initially! Rather: "Shabbaton" - sanctify it by refraining from work; "Zichron" - these are remembrances; "Teruah" - these are shofars; "Mikra Kodesh" - this is the sanctity of the day.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים מַלְכִיּוֹת? תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״, וּ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ — זוֹ מַלְכוּת.
human_translation: From where that one recites Kingship? It is taught Rabbi says: “I am the Lord your God” and “In the seventh month” This Kingship
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive the saying of kingship? It was taught: Rabbi says, "I am the Lord your God," and "In the seventh month" - this is kingship.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיוּ לָכֶם לְזִכָּרוֹן לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ — זֶה בָּנָה אָב לְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ זִכְרוֹנוֹת — יִהְיוּ מַלְכִיּוֹת עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: not necessary, as states: that they may be to you for a remembrance before your God: As no the verse to state: “I am the Lord your God,” and what when the verse states: “I am the Lord your God”? This is a paradigm in all places where Remembrances are stated, Kingship should be with them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: It is not necessary, as it says: "And they shall be for a reminder between your eyes before your God," for the Torah did not say, "I am the Lord your God." And what is the Torah teaching by saying, "I am the Lord your God"? — This is a structure for every place that mentions His remembrances — let crowns be with them.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָן אוֹמְרָהּ לִקְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם? תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עִם הַמַּלְכִיּוֹת אוֹמְרָהּ. מָה מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם בָּרְבִיעִית — אַף כָּאן בָּרְבִיעִית.
human_translation: And where does one recite the Sanctification of the Day? It is taught Rabbi says: One recites it with the Kingship, Just as we find in all places in the fourth so too here, in the fourth
llm_translation: And where does one say it for the sanctity of the day? It was taught: Rabbi says, "With the kingdoms she says it." Just as we find everywhere in the fourth part, so too here in the fourth part.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עִם הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת אוֹמְרָהּ. מַה מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם בָּאֶמְצַע — אַף כָּאן בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One recites it with Remembrances, Just as we find in all places in the middle so too here, in the middle
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: With regard to the remembrances, she says it. Just as we find in every place, it comes in the middle here as well.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּ בֵּית דִּין אֶת הַשָּׁנָה בְּאוּשָׁא, יָרַד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא לִפְנֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְעָשָׂה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי. אָמַר לוֹ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן: לֹא הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין כֵּן בְּיַבְנֶה. לַיּוֹם הַשֵּׁנִי יָרַד רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְעָשָׂה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כָּךְ הָיוּ נוֹהֲגִין בְּיַבְנֶה.
human_translation: And when the court sanctified the year in Usha, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka descended in the presence of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he acted in accordance with Rabban Yoḥanan ben Nuri Rabban Shimon said to him: They were not accustomed this in Yavne. On the second day, Rabbi Ḥanina, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, descended and he acted in accordance with Rabbi Akiva Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: This is they were accustomed in Yavne.
llm_translation: And when the court sanctified the year in Usha, Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka went before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he acted like Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri. Rabban Shimon said to him: They did not customarily do so in Yavne. On the second day, Rabbi Chanina, the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, went down and acted like Rabbi Akiva. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: This is how they used to do in Yavne.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מַלְכִיּוֹת עִם קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם אָמַר לְהוּ, וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: קְדוּשַּׁת הַיּוֹם עִם הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת אָמַר לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁתּוֹקְעִין לְמַלְכִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? But didn’t Rabbi Akiva say one recites Kingship with the Sanctification of the Day, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says that one recites the Sanctification of the Day with Remembrances? Rabbi Zeira said: to say that one sounds with Kingship,
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, does he hold like Rabbi Akiva? But Rabbi Akiva said: "With the kingship and the sanctity of the day he said to them," and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "With the sanctity of the day and the remembrances he said to them?" Rabbi Zeira said: To say that we recite for the kingship.

hebrew_text: לַיּוֹם הַשֵּׁנִי יָרַד רַבִּי חֲנִינָא. מַאי שֵׁנִי? אִילֵּימָא יוֹם טוֹב שֵׁנִי — לְמֵימְרָא דְּעַבְּרוּהּ לֶאֱלוּל?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: מִימוֹת עֶזְרָא וְאֵילָךְ לֹא מָצִינוּ אֱלוּל מְעוּבָּר! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי שֵׁנִי — לְיוֹם שֵׁנִי, לַשָּׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: on the second day Rabbi Ḥanina descended What is The second If we say the second day of the Festival day is that to say that they rendered Elul a full But didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina bar Kahana say: From the days of Ezra onward we have not found that Elul was rendered full. Rav Ḥisda said: What is The second on the second day, of the following year.
llm_translation: On the second day, Rabbi Chanina descended. What is meant by "second"? If you say the second day of a festival - to imply that Elul has passed?! But didn't Rabbi Chanina bar Kahana say: From the days of Ezra and onwards, we have not found Elul to be pregnant! Rav Chisda said: What is meant by "second" - for the second day, for the coming year.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵעֲשָׂרָה מַלְכִיּוֹת, מֵעֲשָׂרָה זִכְרוֹנוֹת, מֵעֲשָׂרָה שׁוֹפָרוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אִם אָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ מִכּוּלָּן — יָצָא.
human_translation: not fewer than ten Kingship, than ten Remembrances, than ten Shofarot . Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: If one recited three from each of them, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not blow less than ten blasts, nor less than ten mentions, nor less than ten shofar blasts. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: If he said three, three out of all of them - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָנֵי עֲשָׂרָה מַלְכִיּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַבִּי: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה הִלּוּלִים שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים. הִלּוּלִים טוּבָא הָווּ! הָנָךְ דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״הַלְלוּהוּ בְּתֵקַע שׁוֹפָר״.
human_translation: These ten Kingship, to what do they correspond? Rabbi said: correspond to the ten praises that David said in the book of Psalms. There are many praises those which it is written by them: “Praise Him with the blast of the shofar ”
llm_translation: Gemara: These ten praises correspond to whom? Rabbi said: They correspond to the ten praises that David said in the Book of Psalms. The praises were good! Where is it written? "Praise Him with the blast of the horn."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרוּ לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה בְּסִינַי. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה מַאֲמָרוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם. הֵי נִינְהוּ? ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ —
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: correspond to the Ten Commandments, which were said to Moses at Sinai. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: correspond to the ten utterances through which the world was created. Which are these “And He said”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Corresponding to the Ten Commandments that were spoken to Moses at Sinai. Rabbi Yochanan said: Corresponding to the Ten Utterances through which the world was created. What are they? "And He said" —

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ דִּבְרֵאשִׁית תִּשְׁעָה הָווּ! ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ נָמֵי מַאֲמָר הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּדְבַר ה׳ שָׁמַיִם נַעֲשׂוּ״.
human_translation: “And He said” in Genesis? There are nine “In the beginning” is also an utterance, as it is written: “By the word of the Lord were the heavens made”
llm_translation: "And he said," in the beginning there were nine! "In the beginning" is also a statement, as it is written: "By the word of the Lord the heavens were made."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אוֹמֵר: אִם אָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ מִכּוּלָּן — יָצָא. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, הֵיכִי קָתָנֵי: שָׁלֹשׁ מִן הַתּוֹרָה, שָׁלֹשׁ מִן הַנְּבִיאִים, וְשָׁלֹשׁ מִן הַכְּתוּבִים — דְּהָווּ תֵּשַׁע, וְאִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ חֲדָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: אֶחָד מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וְאֶחָד מִן הַנְּבִיאִים, וְאֶחָד מִן הַכְּתוּבִים — דְּהָוְיָין לְהוּ שָׁלֹשׁ, וְאִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ טוּבָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: If one recited three from each of them, he has fulfilled A dilemma was raised before What is teaching three from the Torah, three from the Prophets, and three from the Writings, which are nine and the between one Or perhaps one from the Torah and one from the Prophets and one from the Writings, which are three and the between them is a large
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: If he said three, three of all - he has fulfilled his obligation. They asked him: How should it be taught? Three from the Torah, three from the Prophets, and three from the Writings - making a total of nine. And is there a difference between them, whether: one from the Torah, one from the Prophets, and one from the Writings - making a total of three, and is there a significant difference between them?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵעֲשָׂרָה מַלְכִיּוֹת, מֵעֲשָׂרָה זִכְרוֹנוֹת, מֵעֲשָׂרָה שׁוֹפָרוֹת, וְאִם אָמַר שֶׁבַע מִכּוּלָּן — יָצָא, כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעָה רְקִיעִים.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught not fewer than ten Kingship, than ten Remembrances, than ten Shofarot . And if one recited seven from each of them, he has fulfilled correspond to the seven firmaments
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Not less than ten crowns, ten remembrances, ten shofars. And if one said seven out of all of them - he has fulfilled his obligation, corresponding to seven heavens.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי אָמַר: הַפּוֹחֵת — לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשֶּׁבַע, וְאִם אָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ מִכּוּלָּן — יָצָא, כְּנֶגֶד תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: כְּנֶגֶד כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: One who fewer not fewer than seven, but if he recited three from each of them he has fulfilled correspond to the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings. And some say: correspond to the priests, the Levites, and the Israelites. Rav Huna said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: One may not decrease from seven, and if he said three out of all of them, he has fulfilled his obligation, corresponding to the Torah, Prophets, and Writings. And some say: corresponding to Kohanim, Levites, and Israelites. Rav Huna said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מַזְכִּירִין זִכָּרוֹן מַלְכוּת וְשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל פּוּרְעָנוּת. מַתְחִיל בַּתּוֹרָה, וּמַשְׁלִים בַּנָּבִיא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם הִשְׁלִים בַּתּוֹרָה — יָצָא.
human_translation: One does not mention Remembrance, Kingship, and Shofar of punishment. one begins with Torah and concludes with the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: If he concluded with the Torah, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not mention the remembrance of the monarchy and the horn of affliction. One begins with the Torah and concludes with the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: If one concluded with the Torah, he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַלְכִיּוֹת, כְּגוֹן: ״חַי אָנִי נְאֻם ה׳ [אֱלֹהִים] אִם לֹא בְּיָד חֲזָקָה וּבִזְרוֹעַ נְטוּיָה וּבְחֵמָה שְׁפוּכָה אֶמְלוֹךְ עֲלֵיכֶם״, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כֹּל כִּי הַאי רִיתְחָא לִירְתַּח קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא עֲלַן וְלִיפְרוֹקִינַן, כֵּיוָן דִּבְרִיתְחָא אֲמוּר — אַדְכּוֹרֵי רִיתְחָא בְּרֵישׁ שַׁתָּא לָא מַדְכְּרִינַן.
human_translation: Kingship, for example: “As I live, says the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with fury poured out, will I be King over you” And although Rav Naḥman said any anger like this, let the Holy One, blessed be He, express anger upon us and let Him redeem us, since was said with anger one does not mention anger on Rosh HaShana.
llm_translation: Gemara of Kings, such as: "As I live, says the Lord God, surely with a strong hand, an outstretched arm, and with poured-out wrath, I will reign over you." And even though Rav Nahman said: "Whenever this wrath is mentioned, the Holy One, blessed be He, is angry and ready to destroy us, but once the wrath is mentioned, we do not mention it again."

hebrew_text: זִכָּרוֹן — כְּגוֹן: ״וַיִּזְכּוֹר כִּי בָשָׂר הֵמָּה וְגוֹ׳״ שׁוֹפָר — כְּגוֹן: ״תִּקְעוּ שׁוֹפָר בַּגִּבְעָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: remembrance for example: “So He remembered that they were but flesh, shofar , for example: “Sound the shofar in Giva,
llm_translation: Memorial — for example: "And they remembered that they were but flesh, etc." Shofar — for example: "Blow the shofar in Gibeah, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם בָּא לוֹמַר מַלְכוּת זִכָּרוֹן וְשׁוֹפָר שֶׁל פּוּרְעָנוּת שֶׁל נׇכְרִים, אוֹמֵר. מַלְכוּת — כְּגוֹן: ״ה׳ מָלָךְ יִרְגְּזוּ עַמִּים, וּכְגוֹן: ״ה׳ מֶלֶךְ עוֹלָם וָעֶד אָבְדוּ גוֹיִם מֵאַרְצוֹ״. זִכָּרוֹן — כְּגוֹן: ״זְכוֹר ה׳ לִבְנֵי אֱדוֹם וְגוֹ׳״. שׁוֹפָר — כְּגוֹן: ״וַה׳ אֱלֹהִים בַּשּׁוֹפָר יִתְקָע וְהָלַךְ בְּסַעֲרוֹת תֵּימָן״, וּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ צְבָאוֹת יָגֵן עֲלֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: However, if one comes to recite Kingship, remembrance, and shofar of the punishment of gentiles, one may recite Kingship, for example: “The Lord reigns, let the peoples tremble” and, for example: “The Lord is King for ever and ever; the nations are perished out of His land” remembrance, for example: “Remember, O Lord, against the children of Edom shofar , for example: “And the Lord God will sound the and will go with whirlwinds of the south” and it is written: “The Lord of hosts will defend them”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: However, if he comes to say "the kingdom of remembrance" and the horn of the chaos of the nations, he says: "kingdom" - for example: "The Lord reigns; let the peoples tremble," and for example: "The Lord is king forever and ever; the nations have perished from His land." "Remembrance" - for example: "Remember, O Lord, against the sons of Edom," and so forth. "Horn" - for example: "And the Lord God will sound the horn, and will go with whirlwinds of the south," and it is written: "The Lord of hosts will shield them."

hebrew_text: אֵין מַזְכִּירִין זִכָּרוֹן שֶׁל יָחִיד, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְטוֹבָה, כְּגוֹן: ״זׇכְרֵנִי ה׳ בִּרְצוֹן עַמֶּךָ״, וּכְגוֹן: ״זׇכְרָה לִּי אֱלֹהַי לְטוֹבָה״.
human_translation: One does not recite the remembrance of an individual, even for good, for example: “Remember me, O Lord, when You show favor to Your people” and, for example: “Remember me, my God, for good”
llm_translation: We do not mention the remembrance of an individual, even for good, such as: "Remember me, O Lord, with the favor of Your people," and such as: "Remember me, my God, for good."

hebrew_text: פִּקְדוֹנוֹת — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּזִכְרוֹנוֹת, כְּגוֹן: ״וַה׳ פָּקַד אֶת שָׂרָה״, וּכְגוֹן: ״פָּקוֹד פָּקַדְתִּי אֶתְכֶם״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָן כְּזִכְרוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: revisitings [ pikdonot ] are to remembrances [ zikhronot ], For example: “And the Lord revisited [ pakad ] Sarah” and, for example: “I have surely revisited [ pakadeti ] you” the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are not to remembrances.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Pekidunot — henei hen kezikaronot, kegon: "VaHashem pakad et Sarah," ukegon: "Pakod pakadti etkhem," divrei Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda omer: Einan kezikaronot. English translation: Pekidunot — behold, they are like remembrances, for example: "And Hashem remembered Sarah," and for example: "I have surely remembered you," the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: They are not like remembrances.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי נְהִי נָמֵי דְּפִקְדוֹנוֹת הֲרֵי הֵן כְּזִכְרוֹנוֹת, ״וַה׳ פָּקַד אֶת שָׂרָה״ — פִּקָּדוֹן דְּיָחִיד הוּא! כֵּיוָן דְּאָתוּ רַבִּים מִינַּהּ — כְּרַבִּים דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yosei, although of revisiting are to remembrances, “And the Lord revisited Sarah,” is a revisiting of an individual. since many came from her, she is like many.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yosei, it appears as though the Pekidunot are like Zichronot, "And Hashem remembered Sarah" - this is a unique Pekidun for an individual! Once many came from it - it is considered as if many.

hebrew_text: ״שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְהִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבוֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד. מִי זֶה מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד ה׳ עִזּוּז וְגִבּוֹר ה׳ גִּבּוֹר מִלְחָמָה. שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵי עוֹלָם וְיָבֹא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד. מִי הוּא זֶה מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד ה׳ צְבָאוֹת הוּא מֶלֶךְ הַכָּבוֹד סֶלָה״. רִאשׁוֹנָה — שְׁתַּיִם, שְׁנִיָּה — שָׁלֹשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: “Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors, that the King of glory may come in. Who is the King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord mighty in battle” “Lift up your heads, O you gates, and lift them up, you everlasting doors; that the King of glory may come in. Who then is the King of glory? The Lord of hosts, He is the King of glory, Selah” The first two the second is three the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: "Raise gates your heads, and be lifted up doors everlasting, and may enter King the glory. Who is this King the glory the Lord strong and mighty the Lord mighty battle. Raise gates your heads, and raise doors everlasting, and may come King the glory. Who is this King the glory the Lord of hosts He is King the glory Selah." First - two, second - three, words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹנָה — אַחַת, שְׁנִיָּה — שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The first one the second two
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "First one, second two."

hebrew_text: ״זַמְּרוּ אֱלֹהִים זַמֵּרוּ זַמְּרוּ לְמַלְכֵּנוּ זַמֵּרוּ. כִּי מֶלֶךְ כׇּל הָאָרֶץ אֱלֹהִים״ — שְׁתַּיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת. וְשָׁוִין בְּ״מָלַךְ אֱלֹהִים עַל גּוֹיִם אֱלֹהִים יָשַׁב עַל כִּסֵּא קׇדְשׁוֹ״, שֶׁהִיא אַחַת.
human_translation: “Sing praises to God, sing praises, sing praises to our King, sing praises. For God is the King of all the earth; two the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: one And they agree “God reigns over the nations, God sits upon His sacred throne” that it is one
llm_translation: "Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises. For God is the King of all the earth." - Two, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: One. And they are equal in "God reigns over the nations; God sits upon His holy throne," which is one.

hebrew_text: זִכְרוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ תְּרוּעָה — כְּגוֹן: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה מִקְרָא קֹדֶשׁ״ — אוֹמְרָהּ עִם הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת וְאוֹמְרָהּ עִם הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹמְרָהּ אֶלָּא עִם הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: remembrance that has sounding for example: “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts, a sacred convocation” one may recite it with the remembrances, and may recite it with the shofarot ; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may recite it only with the remembrances alone,
llm_translation: Memorial that has in it a blast — such as: "Sabbath memorial of a blast, a holy convocation" — one recites it with the remembrances and one recites it with the trumpets, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: One recites it only with the remembrances alone.

hebrew_text: מַלְכוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ תְּרוּעָה — כְּגוֹן: ״ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו עִמּוֹ וּתְרוּעַת מֶלֶךְ בּוֹ״ — אוֹמְרָהּ עִם הַמַּלְכִיּוֹת וְאוֹמְרָהּ עִם הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹמְרָהּ אֶלָּא עִם הַמַּלְכִיּוֹת בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Kingship that has sounding for example: “The Lord his God is with him, and the sounding of a king is among them” one may recite it with Kingship and recite it with shofarot ; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may recite it only with of Kingship.
llm_translation: The kingdom that has with it a shout - for example: "The Lord his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them" - Rabbi Yosei says: It refers to both the kingdoms and the trumpets. Rabbi Yehuda says: It only refers to the kingdoms alone.

hebrew_text: תְּרוּעָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ לֹא כְּלוּם — כְּגוֹן: ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״ — אוֹמְרָהּ עִם הַשּׁוֹפָרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אוֹמְרָהּ כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: sounding that has nothing with it, for example: “It is a day of sounding the to you” one may recite it with shofarot ; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not recite it at all,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A teruah that is not accompanied by anything - for example: "A day of teruah shall be for you" - Rabbi Yosei says it is said with the shofars. Rabbi Yehuda says: It does not say anything essential.

hebrew_text: מַתְחִיל בַּתּוֹרָה וּמַשְׁלִים בְּנָבִיא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אִם הִשְׁלִים בַּתּוֹרָה — יָצָא. ״אִם הִשְׁלִים״, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִילָּה — לָא. וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַמַּשְׁלִים בַּתּוֹרָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח! אֵימָא: ״מַשְׁלִים״.
human_translation: one begins with the Torah and concludes with the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: If he concluded with the Torah, he has fulfilled If he concluded, after the fact, yes, ab initio , no, But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says: One who concludes with the Torah is praiseworthy? Say He concludes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He begins with the Torah and concludes with the Prophets, Rabbi Yosei says: If he concluded with the Torah - he has fulfilled his obligation. "If he concluded," - retroactively - yes, initially - no. And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: One who concludes with the Torah - this one is praiseworthy! I say: "concludes." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אִם הִשְׁלִים״ קָתָנֵי, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִילָּה — לָא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַתְחִיל בַּתּוֹרָה וּמַשְׁלִים בְּנָבִיא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מַשְׁלִים בַּתּוֹרָה, וְאִם הִשְׁלִים בְּנָבִיא — יָצָא. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: ווֹתִיקִין הָיוּ מַשְׁלִימִין אוֹתָהּ בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Doesn’t teach: If he concluded? after the fact, yes, ab initio , no, this is what is saying: One begins with the Torah and concludes with the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: One concludes with the Torah, and if he concluded with the Prophets he has fulfilled This is also taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Pious individuals [ vatikin ], would conclude with the Torah.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: "And if it says 'if he completed,' it means - if it happened, but not initially!" This is what it means to say: One begins with the Torah and completes with the Prophets. Rabbi Yosei says: One completes with the Torah, and if he completed with the Prophets - he has fulfilled his obligation. It was also taught similarly: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: The elders used to complete it with the Torah.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת אִיכָּא טוּבָא, אֶלָּא מַלְכִיּוֹת — תְּלָת הוּא דְּהָוְיָין: ״ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו עִמּוֹ וּתְרוּעַת מֶלֶךְ בּוֹ״, ״וַיְהִי בִּישׁוּרוּן מֶלֶךְ״, ״ה׳ יִמְלוֹךְ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״, וַאֲנַן בָּעֵינַן עֶשֶׂר, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: Granted, Remembrances and Shofarot there are many However, Kingship, there are three: “The Lord his God is with him, and the sounding of a king is among them” “And he was king in Jeshurun” and: “The Lord shall reign for ever and ever” And we require ten and there are not
llm_translation: In truth, remembrances and shofars are good, but kingships - there are three that exist: "The Lord his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them," "And it was in Jeshurun, a king," "The Lord shall reign forever and ever." And we require ten, but there are none!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״ — מַלְכוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מַלְכוּת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Come hear “Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one” Kingship; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not Kingship.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, come and hear: "Hear, O Israel: the Lord our God, the Lord is one" — the kingdom, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not the kingdom.

hebrew_text: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ הַיּוֹם וַהֲשֵׁבוֹתָ אֶל לְבָבֶךָ כִּי ה׳ הוּא הָאֱלֹהִים אֵין עוֹד״ — מַלְכוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מַלְכוּת. ״אַתָּה הׇרְאֵתָ לָדַעַת כִּי ה׳ הוּא הָאֱלֹהִים אֵין עוֹד מִלְבַדּוֹ״ — מַלְכוּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מַלְכוּת.
human_translation: “Know this day, and lay it to your heart, that the Lord, He is God there is none else” Kingship; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: not Kingship. “To you it was shown, that you might know that the Lord, He is God; there is none else beside Him” Kingship; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not Kingship.
llm_translation: "And you shall know this day and consider it in your heart that the Lord, He is God in the heavens above and on the earth below; there is none else." - Kingdom, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not a kingdom. "You have been shown, to know that the Lord, He is God; there is none else besides Him." - Kingdom, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not a kingdom.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, הַשֵּׁנִי מַתְקִיעַ. וּבִשְׁעַת הַהַלֵּל, הָרִאשׁוֹן מַקְרֵא אֶת הַהַלֵּל.
human_translation: one who is passing before the ark, on the festival of Rosh HaShana, the second sounds And when the hallel the first recites the hallel
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who passes before the Ark on the first day of Rosh Hashanah, the second one blows the shofar. And during Hallel, the first one recites the Hallel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא שֵׁנִי מַתְקִיעַ — מִשּׁוּם דִּ״בְרוֹב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״, אִי הָכִי הַלֵּל נָמֵי — נֵימָא בַּשֵּׁנִי מִשּׁוּם דִּ״בְרוֹב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״!
human_translation: What is different second sounds due to that: “The splendor of the King is in the multitude of the people” If so, hallel too, let us say by the second due to that “The splendor of the King is in the multitude of the people.”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between the first and second blasts? - Because "in the multitude of people is the king's glory." If so, Hillel also agrees - it should be said that in the second blast because "in the multitude of people is the king's glory"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי שְׁנָא הַלֵּל דְּבָרִאשׁוֹן — מִשּׁוּם דִּזְרִיזִין מַקְדִּימִין לְמִצְוֹת, תְּקִיעָה נָמֵי נַעֲבֵיד בָּרִאשׁוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דִּזְרִיזִין מַקְדִּימִין לְמִצְוֹת!
human_translation: Rather, what is different hallel that by the first due to that the vigilant are early mitzvot. sounding too, let us perform of the first due to that the vigilant are early mitzvot.
llm_translation: Rather: What is the difference between Hillel of the first statement? — Because they are diligent in performing mitzvot, the blowing of the shofar is indeed done at the outset, because they are diligent in performing mitzvot!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּשְׁעַת הַשְּׁמָד שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught in a time of persecution.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "At the time of destruction they repeated."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר ״בִּשְׁעַת הַלֵּל״, מִכְּלַל דִּבְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לֵיכָּא הַלֵּל. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין יִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה לְפָנֶיךָ בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: אֶפְשָׁר מֶלֶךְ יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא דִין, וְסִפְרֵי חַיִּים וְסִפְרֵי מֵתִים פְּתוּחִין לְפָנָיו — וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה?!
human_translation: From states: When hallel by inference that on Rosh HaShana there is no hallel . What is the reason Rabbi Abbahu said: The ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, for what don’t the Jewish people recite songs before You on Rosh HaShana and on Yom Kippur? He said to them: possible that the King is sitting on the throne of judgment and the books of life and the books of death are open before Him, the Jewish people are reciting songs
llm_translation: From where it was said "at night," from the general principle that Hillel is not included in the beginning of the year. What is the reason? Rabbi Avahu said: The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe! Why do the Israelites not sing a song before You on Rosh Hashanah and on Yom Kippur? He said to them: Is it possible for a king to sit on the throne of judgment, with the books of the living and the books of the dead open before Him - and the Israelites sing a song?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוֹפָר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה אֵין מַעֲבִירִין עָלָיו אֶת הַתְּחוּם, וְאֵין מְפַקְּחִין עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל. לֹא עוֹלִין בָּאִילָן, וְלֹא רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְהֵמָה, וְלֹא שָׁטִין עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין אוֹתוֹ — בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת, וּבֵין בְּדָבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. אֲבָל אִם רָצָה לִיתֵּן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם אוֹ יַיִן — יִתֵּן.
human_translation: the shofar of Rosh HaShana, one may not pass limit for it, nor may one clear a pile One may not climb a tree, nor may one ride on an animal, nor may one swim in water,  And one may not cut neither with an object that is prohibited due to a rabbinic decree nor with an object that due to a prohibition However, if one wishes to place water or wine into he may place it,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The shofar of Rosh Hashanah, one may not pass beyond its boundary, and one may not inspect it with a vessel. One may not ascend a tree, nor ride on an animal, nor swim on the surface of the water, and one may not cut it—whether for a matter of Rabbinic decree or for a matter of a negative commandment. However, if one wishes to place water or wine inside it, one may do so.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַתִּנוֹקוֹת מִלִּתְקוֹעַ, אֲבָל מִתְעַסְּקִין עִמָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ. וְהַמִּתְעַסֵּק — לֹא יָצָא, וְהַשּׁוֹמֵעַ מִן הַמִּתְעַסֵּק — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: One not prevent children from sounding Rather, one occupies with them, until they learn One who acts unawares has not fulfilled And, one who hears from one who acts unawares has not fulfilled
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "We do not prevent the children from blowing the shofar, but we engage with them until they learn. And one who engages with them - he has not fulfilled the obligation, and one who hears from the one who engages - he has not fulfilled the obligation."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? שׁוֹפָר עֲשֵׂה הוּא, וְיוֹם טוֹב עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: what is the reason shofar is a positive mitzva, but a Festival the positive mitzva and the prohibition and a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition and a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? It is a shofar, an action it is, and a festival, an action it is, and do not do - and an action overrides a do not do and do.

hebrew_text: לֹא עוֹלִין בָּאִילָן וְלֹא רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְכוּ׳. הַשְׁתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן אָמְרַתְּ לָא, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִיבַּעְיָא?! זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: One may not climb a tree, nor may one ride on an animal Now you have said may not by rabbinic law, is necessary by Torah law, teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that.
llm_translation: They do not ascend the tree and do not ride on the back of an animal, etc. Now, when the sages said "no," is it necessary from the Torah?! This, and needless to say, this is what it teaches.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין חוֹתְכִין אוֹתוֹ, בֵּין בְּדָבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת וּבֵין בְּדָבָר שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת — מַגָּלָא. לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — סַכִּינָא.
human_translation: One may not cut neither with an object that is prohibited due to a rabbinic decree nor with an object due to prohibition. due to a rabbinic decree a sickle, a prohibition a knife.
llm_translation: And one does not cut it, whether in a matter that is due to a Rabbinic prohibition or in a matter that is due to a negative commandment. Due to a Rabbinic prohibition - a scythe. Negative commandment - a knife.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּת אָמְרַתְּ לָא — לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מִיבַּעְיָא? זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Now you have said one may not due to rabbinic law, is necessary a prohibition teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Because of the prohibition of carrying on Shabbat, you say 'no' - is it not a case of a question? This is what it means, and there is no need to say this is what it teaches."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם רָצָה לִיתֵּן לְתוֹכוֹ מַיִם אוֹ יַיִן — יִתֵּן. מַיִם אוֹ יַיִן — אֵין, מֵי רַגְלַיִם — לָא.
human_translation: However, if one wishes to place water or wine into he may place it. Water or wine, yes, urine, no.
llm_translation: But if he wants to put water or wine into it - he may put. Water or wine - no, water of the feet - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי — אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מַיִם אוֹ יַיִן — מוּתָּר, כְּדֵי לְצַחְצְחוֹ. מֵי רַגְלַיִם — אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד.
human_translation: Who is the mishna? It is Abba Shaul, as it is taught Abba Shaul says: water or wine, permitted in order to make clear. urine, prohibited due to the respect
llm_translation: Mishnah: Matnitin Mani - Abba Shaul Hi. Detanya, Abba Shaul Omer: Mayim O Yayin - Mutar, Kedei LeTzachTzecho. Mei Raglayim - Asur, Mipnei HaKavod. Translation: Mishnah: "Matnitin Mani" - It is Abba Shaul. As it was taught: Abba Shaul says: Water or wine - permitted, for the purpose of rinsing. Water of the feet - forbidden, due to honor.

hebrew_text: אֵין מְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַתִּינוֹקוֹת מִלִּתְקוֹעַ. הָא נָשִׁים — מְעַכְּבִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין מְעַכְּבִין לֹא אֶת הַנָּשִׁים וְלֹא אֶת הַתִּינוֹקוֹת מִלִּתְקוֹעַ בְּיוֹם טוֹב! אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: One not prevent children from sounding women one prevents Isn’t it taught one does not prevent women or children from sounding on a Festival? Abaye said: not difficult: This Rabbi Yehuda, that Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: We do not prevent the children from blowing. As for women - we do prevent, and it was taught: We do not prevent neither women nor children from blowing on a festival! Abaye said, it is not difficult: this is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and this is according to Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכִין, וְאֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל סוֹמְכוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: נָשִׁים סוֹמְכוֹת — רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: As it is taught “Speak to the children of Israel… the sons of Israel place but the daughters of Israel do not place the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: optional women place
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Speak to the children of Israel." The sons of Israel rely, but the daughters of Israel do not rely, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Women rely - permission.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִתְעַסְּקִין בָּהֶם עַד שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מִתְעַסְּקִין בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ, אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת. וְאֵין מְעַכְּבִין הַתִּינוֹקוֹת מִלִּתְקוֹעַ בְּשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Rather, one occupies with them, until they learn Rabbi Elazar said: even on Shabbat. This is also taught One occupies with until they learn even on Shabbat. And one does not prevent the children from sounding on Shabbat, and needless to say on festival
llm_translation: But they engage in them until they learn. Rabbi Elazar said: Even on Shabbat. It was taught similarly: They engage in them until they learn, even on Shabbat. And we do not prevent children from blowing the shofar on Shabbat, needless to say on a festival day.

hebrew_text: הָא גוּפָא קַשְׁיָא, אָמְרַתְּ: מִתְעַסְּקִין בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיִּלְמְדוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת — אַלְמָא לְכַתְּחִלָּה אָמְרִינַן תִּקְעוּ. וַהֲדַר תָּנָא: אֵין מְעַכְּבִין — עִכּוּבָא הוּא דְּלָא מְעַכְּבִין, הָא לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא אָמְרִינַן תִּקְעוּ!
human_translation: This matter itself is difficult, You said one occupies with until they learn and even on Shabbat. Apparently, we say to them ab initio : Sound And then taught: One does not prevent one does not prevent them we do not say ab initio : Sound
llm_translation: The matter is difficult. It was said: One may engage in them until they learn, even on Shabbat — this implies that initially we say to blow. And then the Mishna teaches: We do not delay — it is a delay that we do not delay, but initially we do not say to blow!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן
human_translation: not difficult. Here,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here

hebrew_text: בְּקָטָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְחִינּוּךְ, כָּאן בְּקָטָן שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְחִינּוּךְ.
human_translation: with a minor who has reached training here, with a minor who has not reached training.
llm_translation: In a minor who has reached the age of education, here in a minor who has not reached the age of education.

hebrew_text: וְהַמִּתְעַסֵּק לֹא יָצָא. הָא תּוֹקֵעַ לָשִׁיר — יָצָא. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַתּוֹקֵעַ לָשִׁיר — יָצָא. דִּלְמָא תּוֹקֵעַ לָשִׁיר — נָמֵי מִתְעַסֵּק קָרֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: One who acts unawares has not fulfilled One who sounds for music, has fulfilled Let us say supports Rava, as Rava said: One who sounds for music has fulfilled perhaps one who sounds for music is also called acts unawares.
llm_translation: The one who is engaged has not fulfilled his obligation. Now, one who claps to the tune - has fulfilled his obligation. Let us say that he is assisting Rava, for Rava said: One who claps to the tune - has fulfilled his obligation. Perhaps clapping to the tune is also considered engaging.

hebrew_text: וְהַשּׁוֹמֵעַ מִן הַמִּתְעַסֵּק — לֹא יָצָא. אֲבָל הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ מִן הַמַּשְׁמִיעַ לְעַצְמוֹ, מַאי? יָצָא. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: אִיכַּוַּון וּתְקַע לִי!
human_translation: And one who hears from one who acts unawares has not fulfilled However, one who hears from one who is sounding for himself, what is he has fulfilled Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira said to his attendant: Have the intention and sound for me.
llm_translation: The one who hears from the one who is engaged - has not fulfilled his obligation. But one who hears from the one who is transmitting to himself, what is the law? He has fulfilled his obligation. Let us say it should be the merit of Rabbi Zeira, for Rabbi Zeira said to his attendant: "Prepare and blow for me!"

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא מִתְעַסֵּק, תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי מִתְעַסֵּק.
human_translation: Perhaps since first clause taught one who acts unawares, the latter clause also taught one who acts unawares.
llm_translation: Perhaps since the first Tanna is occupied, the latter Tanna is also occupied.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סֵדֶר תְּקִיעוֹת: שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ. שִׁיעוּר תְּקִיעָה כְּשָׁלֹשׁ תְּרוּעוֹת, שִׁיעוּר תְּרוּעָה כְּשָׁלֹשׁ יְבָבוֹת. תָּקַע בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּמָשַׁךְ בַּשְּׁנִיָּה כִּשְׁתַּיִם — אֵין בְּיָדוֹ אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: The order of the blasts three of three each, The length of a tekia equal to three teruot , the length of a terua equal to three whimpers. one sounded the first and extended the second to two he has in his hand only one
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The order of the blasts: three sets of three blasts each. The measure of a blast is like that of three teru'ot, and the measure of a teru'ah is like that of three yevavot. If one sounded the first blast and prolonged the second blast like two - he has only fulfilled one.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁבֵּירַךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַנָּה לוֹ שׁוֹפָר — תּוֹקֵעַ וּמֵרִיעַ וְתוֹקֵעַ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: one who recited the blessings and afterward a shofar became available to him, he sounds sounds and sounds three times.
llm_translation: One who first blessed and then a shofar was designated for him - he blows, and he gives a long blast, and he blows three times.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁשְּׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר חַיָּיב, כָּךְ כׇּל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד חַיָּיב. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר מוֹצִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים יְדֵי חוֹבָתָן.
human_translation: Just as the prayer leader is obligated so too, each and every individual is obligated Rabban Gamliel says: the prayer leader fulfills the obligation on behalf of the many.
llm_translation: As the messenger of the congregation is obligated, so too every individual is obligated. Rabban Gamliel says: The messenger of the congregation exempts the many from their obligation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָתַנְיָא: שִׁיעוּר תְּקִיעָה כִּתְרוּעָה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּנָּא דִּידַן קָא חָשֵׁיב תְּקִיעָה דְּכוּלְּהוּ בָּבֵי וּתְרוּעוֹת דְּכוּלְּהוּ בָּבֵי. תַּנָּא בָּרָא קָא חָשֵׁיב חַד בָּבָא וְתוּ לָא.
human_translation: isn’t it taught the length of a tekia is equal to terua , Abaye said: The tanna our counts the tekia of all the sets and the teruot of all the sets. the tanna the baraita counts one set, and no more,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara and it was taught: The measurement of a Tekiah is like that of a Teruah! Abaye said: Our Mishna considers the Tekiah as inclusive of both the Tekiot and the Teruot. Bara taught: One in, and not two.

hebrew_text: שִׁיעוּר תְּרוּעָה כִּשְׁלֹשׁ יְבָבוֹת. וְהָתַנְיָא: שִׁיעוּר תְּרוּעָה כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים!
human_translation: The length of a terua equal to three whimpers. Isn’t it taught the length of a terua to three shevarim ,
llm_translation: Measurement of the shofar blast is like three yevavot. And it was taught: Measurement of the shofar blast is like three shvarim!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּהָא וַדַּאי פְּלִיגִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״, וּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן: ״יוֹם יַבָּבָא יְהֵא לְכוֹן״. וּכְתִיב בְּאִימֵּיהּ דְּסִיסְרָא: ״בְּעַד הַחַלּוֹן נִשְׁקְפָה וַתְּיַבֵּב אֵם סִיסְרָא״. מָר סָבַר גַּנּוֹחֵי גַּנַּח. וּמָר סָבַר יַלּוֹלֵי יַלֵּיל.
human_translation: Abaye said: In this certainly disagree. As it is written: “It is a day of sounding [ terua ] to you” and we translate It is a day of yevava to you. And is written about the mother of Sisera: “Through the window she looked forth and wailed [ vateyabev ], the mother of Sisera” Sage, holds moanings, And Sage, holds whimpers,
llm_translation: Abaye said: In this case they certainly disagree, as it is written: "A day of blowing shall be for you," and we interpret it as: "A day of babbling shall be for you." And it is written in the days of Sisera's mother: "At the window she looked out and wailed, the mother of Sisera." One Master thought the word ganuḥei means "gardeners," and one Master thought the word yalolei means "howlers."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּשׁוֹפָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that with a shofar ? The verse states: “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive the use of a shofar? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall cause the shofar blast to be heard."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹבֵל, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל תְּרוּעוֹת שֶׁל חֹדֶשׁ שְׁבִיעִי זֶה כָּזֶה.
human_translation: I have only of the Jubilee Year. From where Rosh HaShana The verse states: “Of the seventh month.” Since no the verse to state: “Of the seventh month,” what the verse states: “Of the seventh month”? that all soundings of the seventh month must be similar to one another.
llm_translation: I have only the Jubilee, from where on Rosh Hashanah? Scripture says: "In the seventh month," as Scripture does not say "In the seventh month," and what does Scripture say "In the seventh month" for? - that all the shofar blasts of the seventh month should be equal.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁפְּשׁוּטָה לְפָנֶיהָ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁפְּשׁוּטָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תַּעֲבִירוּ שׁוֹפָר״.
human_translation: And from where that is preceded by a straight blast, The verse states: “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar [ shofar terua ]” And from where that is followed by a straight blast? The verse states “You shall make proclamation with the shofar ,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that it should be straightforward before her? - The Talmud teaches: "And you shall cause the shofar blast to pass." And from where do we derive that it should be curved behind her? - The Talmud teaches: "You shall cause the shofar to pass."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹבֵל, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״.
human_translation: I have only of the Jubilee Year. From where on Rosh HaShana The verse states: “Of the seventh month.”
llm_translation: "And I have only the Jubilee, on Rosh Hashanah from where? It is derived to say: 'In the seventh month.'"

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ כׇּל תְּרוּעוֹת הַחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי זֶה כָּזֶה.
human_translation: Since no the verse to state: “Of the seventh month,” what the verse states: “Of the seventh month”? that all of the seventh month must be similar to one another.
llm_translation: The Talmud does not say "in the seventh month," so what does the Talmud say "in the seventh month"? - that all the shofar blasts of the seventh month are equal to one another.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לְשָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״, ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״, ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: And from where three of three each? The verse states: “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar shofar terua “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts [ terua ]” “It is a day of sounding [ terua ] the to you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive the concept of three sets of three blasts each? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall cause the shofar blast to be heard," "A remembrance of shofar blasts," "A day of shofar blasts shall be unto you." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְשֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שְׁבִיעִי״ ״שְׁבִיעִי״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: From where to apply what is said about that to this and about this to that the verse states: seventh seventh by verbal analogy
llm_translation: And from where do we know to give the statement of this with this and the statement of this with this? - The Talmud teaches: "Seventh," "Seventh" for an equal decree.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁהֵן תֵּשַׁע. שִׁיעוּר תְּקִיעָה כִּתְרוּעָה, שִׁיעוּר תְּרוּעָה כִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים.
human_translation: How so? three which are nine The length of a tekia is equal to a terua , the length of a terua to three shevarim .
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "How so? Three that are nine. The measure of Tekiah is like Teruah, the measure of Teruah is like three broken sounds."

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא, מֵעִיקָּרָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ בְּהֶיקֵּישָׁא, וְהַשְׁתָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ בִּגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי לָאו גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, הֲוָה מַיְיתִינָא לַהּ בְּהֶיקֵּישָׁא. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתְיָא בִּגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה — הֶיקֵּישָׁא לָא צְרִיךְ.
human_translation: This tanna initially derives from juxtaposition, And now he derives by verbal analogy this is what is saying: If no verbal analogy, I would have derived by juxtaposition. Now that it is derived through a verbal analogy, the juxtaposition is not necessary.
llm_translation: This Mishna, initially it comes to it with a comparison, and now it comes to it with an equal decree? This is what it is saying: If it is not an equal decree, I would have brought it to it with a comparison. Now that it comes with an equal decree, a comparison is not necessary.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ בִּגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה מִמִּדְבָּר, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם תְּרוּעָה״ — תְּקִיעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וּתְרוּעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר תְּקִיעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וּתְרוּעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא תְּקִיעָה וּתְרוּעָה אַחַת הִיא — כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּבְהַקְהִיל אֶת הַקָּהָל תִּתְקְעוּ וְלֹא תָרִיעוּ״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: תְּקִיעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וּתְרוּעָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: And tanna derives this by verbal analogy from the wilderness, as it is taught “And you shall sound [ utekatem ] a terua ” a tekia is its own and a terua is its own you say a tekia is its own and a terua is its own Or is it only that a tekia and a terua are one When it says: “But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall sound a tekia [ titke’u ], but you shall not sound a terua [ tari’u ]” you must say a tekia is its own and a terua is its own
llm_translation: The Tanna brings a proof to it from a decree that is similar to the desert, as it was taught: "And you shall sound a blast" - a blast by itself and a shout by itself. You may say a blast by itself and a shout by itself, or perhaps it is only one blast and one shout - when it says: "And when you gather the assembly, you shall sound, but you shall not shout," you must say: a blast by itself and a shout by itself.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁפְּשׁוּטָה לְפָנֶיהָ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם תְּרוּעָה״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁפְּשׁוּטָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּרוּעָה יִתְקְעוּ״.
human_translation: And from where that is preceded by a straight blast, The verse states: “And you shall sound [ utekatem ] a terua ” And from where that followed by a straight blast? The verse states: “A terua you shall sound [ titke’u ]”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive that it should be straightforward before it? - The Talmud teaches: "And you shall sound a blast." And from where do we derive that it should be straightforward behind it? - The Talmud teaches: "A blast they shall sound."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּתְקַעְתֶּם תְּרוּעָה שֵׁנִית״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שֵׁנִית״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שֵׁנִית״ — זֶה בָּנָה אָב, שֶׁכׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״תְּרוּעָה״ — תְּהֵא תְּקִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה לָהּ. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בַּמִּדְבָּר, בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּרוּעָה״ ״תְּרוּעָה״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: is not necessary, states: “And you shall sound [ utekatem ] a terua a second time” As no the verse to state: “A second time,” what the verse states: “A second time?” This is a paradigm that all places where it is stated terua , a tekia should be second to it. I have only in the wilderness. From where to Rosh HaShana? The verse states “ terua ” “ terua ” by verbal analogy
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka, says: He is not needed, for behold he says, "And you shall sound a second blast," as the Talmud does not need to say "a second." And why does the Talmud need to say "a second"? — This is to build a father, that wherever it says "a blast," there should be a second blowing for it. I only have a source in the wilderness, but for Rosh Hashanah, where is the source? The Talmud says: "A blast," "a blast" for an equal decree.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁלֹשׁ תְּרוּעוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״, ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה״, ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״, וּשְׁתֵּי תְּקִיעוֹת לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: And three teruot are stated to Rosh HaShana: “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts [ terua ]” a day of sounding the shofar [ terua ] “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar [ terua ]” And two tekiot for each and every one
llm_translation: And three blasts were stated in the beginning of the year: "a Sabbath of remembrance, a blast," "a day of blasting," "and the passing of the horn is a blast," and two blasts for each one.

hebrew_text: מָצִינוּ לְמֵדִין: שָׁלֹשׁ תְּרוּעוֹת וְשֵׁשׁ תְּקִיעוֹת נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, שְׁתַּיִם מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְאַחַת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים. ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״, ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״ — מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״ — לְתַלְמוּדוֹ הוּא בָּא.
human_translation: we are found to have learned three teruot and six tekiot are stated to Rosh HaShana. Two by the statement of the Torah and one by the statement of the Sages, “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts [ terua ]” “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar terua by Torah law. “It is a day of sounding the shofar terua to you” comes for its statement,
llm_translation: We have learned: Three teru'ot and six tekiaot were stated in Rosh Hashanah, two from the words of the Torah, and one from the words of the Scribes. "A Sabbath of remembrance, a teru'ah," "And you shall cause a blast of the shofar, a teru'ah" — from the words of the Torah. "A day of teru'ah shall it be for you" — this is for study, it has come.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: אַחַת מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וּשְׁתַּיִם מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים. ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״ — מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. ״שַׁבָּתוֹן זִכְרוֹן תְּרוּעָה״, וְ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״ — לְתַלְמוּדוֹ הוּא בָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani Rabbi Yonatan said: One by Torah law, and two by rabbinic law: “Then you shall make proclamation with the blast of the shofar terua by Torah law. “A solemn rest, a memorial of blasts terua and “It is a day of sounding the shofar terua to you”; come for their statement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: One from the words of the Torah, and two from the words of the Scribes. "And you shall cause the shofar to sound a blast" - from the words of the Torah. "A Sabbath of remembrance, a blast" and "a day of blasting shall be unto you" - this is for his learning that he comes.

hebrew_text: מַאי לְתַלְמוּדוֹ הוּא בָּא? מִיבְּעֵי: בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: What comes for its statement? It is required during the day and not at night,
llm_translation: What is "letalmudo" that he comes? It is asked: In the day and not in the night.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״.
human_translation: And the other from where during the day and not at night? He derives it from “On the Day of Atonement”
llm_translation: And the other, during the day and not at night, how do we establish it? It is derived for him from "on the day of Atonement."

hebrew_text: אִי ״בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״ יָלֵיף, נִגְמוֹר נָמֵי מִינֵּיהּ לִפְשׁוּטָה לְפָנֶיהָ וּפְשׁוּטָה לְאַחֲרֶיהָ! ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ ״תַּעֲבִירוּ״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: If derives from “On the Day of Atonement,” let us also derive from it a straight before and a straight one after it. “Then you shall make proclamation veha’avarta “You shall make proclamation ta’aviru do not indicate according to him,
llm_translation: On Yom Kippur, he should recite, "Let it be inferred," his heretical views are clear before it and clear after it! "And you shall cause to pass" does not imply to them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי דָּרְשִׁי בְּהוּ? ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ כִּדְרַב מַתְנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב מַתְנָא: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ״ — דֶּרֶךְ הַעֲבָרָתוֹ, ״תַּעֲבִירוּ״ — דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא נְעַבְּרֵיהּ בְּיָד.
human_translation: Rather, what does he learn from “ Veha’avarta ,” in accordance with Rav Mattana, as Rav Mattana said: “ Veha’avarta ,” in the way that carries “ ta’aviru ” that the Merciful One states Let us carry by hand
llm_translation: Rather, what did he expound in them? "And you shall pass over" as Rav Matna said. For Rav Matna said: "And you shall pass over" — in the manner of His passing over, "you shall cause to pass over" — for the Merciful One said, we shall cause it to pass over by hand.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? דְּרַב מַתְנָא — מִדְּשַׁנִּי בְּדִיבּוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the other of Rav Mattana from that changed its normal language.
llm_translation: And the other opinion? That of Rav Matna - from the fact that he changed his wording.

hebrew_text: ״תַּעֲבִירוּ״ בְּיָד — לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דְּגָמַר ״עֲבָרָה״ ״עֲבָרָה״ מִמֹּשֶׁה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְהַעֲבַרְתָּ שׁוֹפַר תְּרוּעָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְצַו מֹשֶׁה וַיַּעֲבִירוּ קוֹל בַּמַּחֲנֶה״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּקוֹל — אַף כָּאן בְּקוֹל.
human_translation: You shall carry by hand you cannot say derives avara avara with Moses. It is written here: “Then you shall make proclamation veha’avarta with the blast of the shofar ,” and it is written elsewhere: “And Moses commanded, and they caused to be proclaimed [ vaya’aviru ] throughout the camp” Just as there, with a sound, so too here, with a sound.
llm_translation: "Pass" by hand - not found you said, that he learned "transgression" "transgression" from Moses. Written here: "And you shall pass the shofar for a blast," and written there: "And Moses commanded and they passed the voice in the camp," just as there with a voice - so too here with a voice.

hebrew_text: וּלְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ מִמִּדְבָּר, אִי מָה לְהַלָּן חֲצוֹצְרוֹת, אַף כָּאן חֲצוֹצְרוֹת?
human_translation: And this tanna , who derives from the wilderness If just as there, trumpets, so too, here, trumpets.
llm_translation: And for this Tanna who brings proof to it from the wilderness, if there, trumpets, so too here, trumpets?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּקְעוּ בַחֹדֶשׁ שׁוֹפָר בַּכֵּסֶה לְיוֹם חַגֵּנוּ״, אֵי זֶהוּ חַג שֶׁהַחֹדֶשׁ מִתְכַּסֶּה בּוֹ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״שׁוֹפָר״.
human_translation: the verse states: “Sound the shofar at the New Moon, at the full moon keseh for our feast day” Which is the Festival on which the month, is covered mitkaseh You must say this is Rosh HaShana, And the Merciful One states: the shofar
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Blow the shofar on the new moon, at the concealment for the day of our festival." Which festival is the new moon concealed in? One must say this is Rosh Hashanah, and the Merciful One says, "Shofar."

hebrew_text: אַתְקֵין רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בְּקֵסָרִי: תְּקִיעָה, שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים, תְּרוּעָה, תְּקִיעָה. מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי יַלּוֹלֵי יַלֵּיל — לֶעְבֵּיד תְּקִיעָה תְּרוּעָה וּתְקִיעָה, וְאִי גַּנּוֹחֵי גַּנַּח — לֶעְבֵּיד תְּקִיעָה שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים וּתְקִיעָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu instituted in Caesarea a tekia , three shevarim , a terua , tekia . Whichever way you look at it, If, a whimpering, one perform a tekia - terua - tekia And if moaning, he sound Tekia , three shevarim , tekia .
llm_translation: Established Rabbi Avahu in Caesarea: Tekiah, three shvarim, Teruah, Tekiah. What is your preference? If you prefer to prolong, prolong — perform Tekiah, Teruah, and Tekiah. And if you prefer short blasts, perform Tekiah three shvarim and Tekiah!

hebrew_text: מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי גַּנּוֹחֵי גַּנַּח אִי יַלּוֹלֵי יַלֵּיל. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב עַוִּירָא: וְדִלְמָא יַלּוֹלֵי הֲוָה, וְקָא מַפְסֵיק שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים בֵּין תְּרוּעָה לִתְקִיעָה! דַּהֲדַר עָבֵיד תְּקִיעָה תְּרוּעָה וּתְקִיעָה. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: וְדִלְמָא גַּנּוֹחֵי הֲוָה, וְקָא מַפְסְקָא תְּרוּעָה בֵּין שְׁבָרִים לִתְקִיעָה! דַּהֲדַר עָבֵיד תְּקִיעָה שְׁבָרִים תְּקִיעָה.
human_translation: was uncertain whether moaning or whimpering, Rav Avira strongly objects to this: But perhaps is whimpering, and the three shevarim interrupts between the terua and tekia , That then performs a tekia - terua - tekia Ravina strongly objects to this: But perhaps is moaning, and the terua interrupts between the shevarim and tekia , That then performs a tekia - shevarim - tekia
llm_translation: He is in doubt whether he should sigh or cry. Rav Avira objects: Perhaps he was crying, and he interrupted with three broken sounds between the teruah and the tekiah! He then performs a tekiah, teruah, and tekiah. Ravina objects: Perhaps he was sighing, and he interrupted the teruah with broken sounds before the tekiah! He then performs a tekiah, broken sounds, and tekiah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מַאי אַתְקֵין? אִי גַּנּוֹחֵי גַּנַּח — הָא עַבְדֵיהּ, אִי יַלּוֹלֵי יַלֵּיל — הָא עַבְדֵיהּ! מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ דִּלְמָא גַּנַּח וְיַלֵּיל.
human_translation: But what did Rabbi Abbahu institute If is moaning, one did it; if it is whimpering, one did was uncertain, perhaps moaning whimpering.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Avahu, what are you arguing? If he has rested, he has rested - it is his servant. If he has howled, he has howled - it is his servant! He is in doubt, perhaps he has rested and howled.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לֶיעְבַּד נָמֵי אִיפְּכָא: תְּקִיעָה, תְּרוּעָה, שְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁבָרִים, וּתְקִיעָה — דִּלְמָא יַלֵּיל וְגַנַּח! סְתָמָא דְמִילְּתָא, כִּי מִתְּרַע בְּאִינִישׁ מִילְּתָא — בְּרֵישָׁא גָּנַח וַהֲדַר יָלֵיל.
human_translation: If so, let one perform the opposite as well: Tekia , terua , three shevarim , tekia , perhaps whimpering and moaning. The normal of things when a person experiences a bad event, he first moans and then whimpers,
llm_translation: If so, let us say the following: Tekiah, Teruah, three broken sounds, and Tekiah - perhaps he will become confused and sigh! A simple matter, for when a person is confused about a matter - initially he sighs and then becomes confused.

hebrew_text: תָּקַע בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּמָשַׁךְ בַּשְּׁנִיָּה כִּשְׁתַּיִם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁמַע
human_translation: one sounded the first and extended the second to two Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one heard
llm_translation: He blew the first and prolonged the second like two. Rabbi Yochanan said: Listen.

hebrew_text: תֵּשַׁע תְּקִיעוֹת בְּתֵשַׁע שָׁעוֹת בַּיּוֹם — יָצָא.
human_translation: nine blasts at nine times of the day, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: Nine blasts in nine hours during the day - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שָׁמַע תֵּשַׁע תְּקִיעוֹת בְּתֵשַׁע שָׁעוֹת בַּיּוֹם — יָצָא. מִתִּשְׁעָה בְּנֵי אָדָם כְּאֶחָד — לֹא יָצָא. תְּקִיעָה מִזֶּה וּתְרוּעָה מִזֶּה — יָצָא. וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּסֵירוּגִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: This is also taught heard nine blasts at nine times of the day, he has fulfilled from nine people simultaneously, he has not fulfilled a tekia from this and a terua from this he has fulfilled And even at intervals, and even the entire day.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Shammai says: If one hears nine blasts in nine hours during the day - he has fulfilled his obligation. If nine people blow the shofar simultaneously - he has not fulfilled his obligation. If one blows a Tekiah here and a Teruah there - he has fulfilled his obligation. Even with interruptions, and even the entire day altogether.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: בְּהַלֵּל וּבִמְגִילָּה, אִם שָׁהָה כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חוֹזֵר לָרֹאשׁ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִידֵיהּ, הָא דְרַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: During hallel or the Megilla if one paused enough to complete all of it, he must return to the beginning, not difficult, this is his and that is his teacher’s
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said it, Rabbi Yochanan like this? And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: In Hillel and in Megillah, if one delayed to finish all of it - he goes back to the beginning! It is not difficult: this one is his, this one is his teacher."

hebrew_text: וְדִידֵיהּ לָא? וְהָא רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וַהֲוָה קָרֵי קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, כִּי מְטָא לִמְבוֹאוֹת מְטוּנָּפוֹת, אִישְׁתִּיק, בָּתַר דַּחֲלֵיף אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לִגְמוֹר? אָמַר לוֹ: אִם שָׁהִיתָ כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חֲזוֹר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: And is not his Wasn’t Rabbi Abbahu walking after Rabbi Yoḥanan, and was reciting Shema When he reached alleyways filthy he fell silent After he passed said to What is to completing said to him: If you remained sufficient to complete the entire return to the beginning
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And his friends not? But didn't Rabbi Abbahu take and go after Rabbi Yohanan, and he was reading the Shema, when he reached the words "mevo'ot metunafot," he paused. After he finished, he said to him: What is the reason for pausing? He said to him: If you were able to finish it all at once, go back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי — לָא סְבִירָא לִי, לְדִידָךְ, דִּסְבִירָא לָךְ: אִם שָׁהִיתָ כְּדֵי לִגְמוֹר אֶת כּוּלָּהּ — חֲזוֹר לָרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: this is what said: I myself do not hold according to you, as you hold if you paused sufficient to complete the entire return to the beginning.
llm_translation: So he said to him: According to me - I do not think, according to you, because you think: If you have spent enough time to finish all of it - go back to the beginning.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תְּקִיעוֹת — אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ. בְּרָכוֹת — אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ. תְּקִיעוֹת וּבְרָכוֹת שֶׁל רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְשֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מְעַכְּבוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught blasts do not invalidate one another, blessings do not invalidate one another. blasts and blessings of Rosh HaShana and of Yom Kippur do invalidate
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Teki'ot - they do not prevent one another. Berakhot - they do not prevent one another. Teki'ot and Berakhot of Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur - they do prevent one another.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אִמְרוּ לְפָנַי בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה מַלְכִיּוֹת זִכְרוֹנוֹת וְשׁוֹפָרוֹת, מַלְכִיּוֹת — כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּמְלִיכוּנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, זִכְרוֹנוֹת — כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּבֹא לְפָנַי זִכְרוֹנֵיכֶם לְטוֹבָה, וּבַמֶּה — בְּשׁוֹפָר.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabba said the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Recite before Me on Rosh HaShana Kingship, Remembrances, and Shofarot . Kingship, so that you will crown Me as King over you; Remembrances, so that your remembrance will rise before Me for good. And with what? With the shofar .
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabah said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "Say before Me on Rosh Hashanah, 'Sovereignty, remembrance, and shofar blasts.' Sovereignty - so that you may coronate Me over you, remembrance - so that your remembrance may come before Me for good, and with what? - with the shofar."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁבֵּירַךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְמַנָּה לוֹ שׁוֹפָר — תּוֹקֵעַ וּמֵרִיעַ וְתוֹקֵעַ. טַעְמָא דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ שׁוֹפָר מֵעִיקָּרָא, הָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ שׁוֹפָר מֵעִיקָּרָא, כִּי שָׁמַע לְהוּ — אַסֵּדֶר בְּרָכוֹת שָׁמַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: one who recited the blessings and afterward a shofar became available to him, he sounds sounds and sounds The reason that he did not have a shofar at the outset. he had a shofar at the outset, when he hears he must hear them by the order of the blessings,
llm_translation: One who first blessed and then a shofar was designated for him - he blows, and he gives a series of blasts, and then he blows. The reason that he did not have a shofar initially, but now he has a shofar, is because he listened to them - he arranged his blessings, he listened to them.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל קָם לְצַלּוֹיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: כִּי נָהַירְנָא לָךְ תְּקַע לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa bar Shmuel rose to pray He said to his attendant: When I signal to you sound for me. Rava said to him: They said only where there is a quorum of ten [ ḥever ir ],
llm_translation: Rav Papa son of Shmuel arose for his needs, he said to him to his attendant: "When we reach the place, knock for me." Rava said to him: "They only said this in a walled city."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹמְעָן — שׁוֹמְעָן עַל הַסֵּדֶר, וְעַל סֵדֶר בְּרָכוֹת. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּחֶבֶר עִיר, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּחֶבֶר עִיר — שׁוֹמְעָן עַל הַסֵּדֶר וְשֶׁלֹּא עַל סֵדֶר בְּרָכוֹת. וְיָחִיד שֶׁלֹּא תָּקַע — חֲבֵירוֹ תּוֹקֵעַ לוֹ, וְיָחִיד שֶׁלֹּא בֵּירַךְ — אֵין חֲבֵירוֹ מְבָרֵךְ עָלָיו.
human_translation: This is also taught When one hears he hear them in order, and upon the order of the blessings. In what is this statement said? Where a quorum of ten [ ḥever ir ]. However, where not a ḥever ir , one hear them in order, but not upon the order of the blessings. And an individual who has not sounded another may sound for him. But an individual who has not recited the blessings, another may not recite the blessings for him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: When he is listening, he listens in order, and in the order of blessings. In what case are these matters said? In a group of city residents, but if not in a group of city residents, he listens in order but not in the order of blessings. And an individual who did not blow the shofar - his friend blows for him, and an individual who did not recite the blessing - his friend does not recite it for him.

hebrew_text: וּמִצְוָה בְּתוֹקְעִין יוֹתֵר מִן הַמְבָרְכִין. כֵּיצַד? שְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת, בְּאַחַת תּוֹקְעִין, וּבְאַחַת מְבָרְכִין — הוֹלְכִין לִמְקוֹם שֶׁתּוֹקְעִין, וְאֵין הוֹלְכִין לִמְקוֹם שֶׁמְּבָרְכִין.
human_translation: And mitzva those who sound more than those who recite the blessings. How so? two towns, in one sound and in the other recite the blessings, one go to the place where they sound and not go to the place where they recite the blessings.
llm_translation: Mitzvah in blowing more than in blessing. How so? Two cities, in one they blow, and in one they bless - they go to the place where they blow, and they do not go to the place where they bless.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא — הָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָא דְּרַבָּנַן! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּהָא וַדַּאי וְהָא סָפֵק.
human_translation: obvious. is by Torah law, by rabbinic law. No; is necessary although this certain and this uncertain
llm_translation: Interpretation: This that is from the Torah, this that is from the Rabbis! Not necessary, for even though this is certain and that is doubtful.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁשְּׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר חַיָּיב, כָּךְ כׇּל יָחִיד וְיָחִיד וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, לָמָּה צִבּוּר מִתְפַּלְּלִין! אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּדֵי לְהַסְדִּיר שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר תְּפִלָּתוֹ,
human_translation: Just as the prayer leader is obligated so too, every individual It is taught said to Rabban Gamliel: According to your statement, why does the congregation recite prayer He said to them: In order that the prayer leader arrange his prayer.
llm_translation: As a Talmud scholar, I will now provide the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "As the messenger of the congregation is obligated, so too every individual and individual, etc. It was taught: They said to Rabban Gamliel: According to your words, why do the congregation pray? He said to them: In order to establish the prayer of the messenger of the congregation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, לָמָּה שְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר יוֹרֵד לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּדֵי לְהוֹצִיא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי. אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמּוֹצִיא אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי, כָּךְ מוֹצִיא אֶת הַבָּקִי.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel said to According to your statement, why does the prayer leader descend before the ark They said to him: to fulfill of one who is not an expert said to them: Just as he can fulfill of one who is not an expert so too, he can fulfill of the expert.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabban Gamliel: According to your words, why does the messenger of the congregation go down before the ark? They said to him: In order to bring out one who is not knowledgeable. He said to them: Just as he brings out one who is not knowledgeable, so too he brings out the knowledgeable.
